This option may be useful if: You accidentally checked the "Process as UI changes" option and you need to fix the affected data. You forgot to remove the ability for users to rename themselves, course names, or remove the institutional email and you want to clear the stickiness of the UI changes that have occurred.

input: How do I use the Smart Search feature in Canvas? Specifically, how do I click the Smart Search link, enter keywords, filter results by assignments, announcements, and pages, and submit feedback?
expected_output:
1. In Course Navigation, click Smart Search.  
2. In the Search field, type your keyword(s) (for example, an assignment title or announcement topic).  
3. Press Enter or click the magnifying-glass icon. A list of matching assignments, announcements, discussions, and pages appears.  
4. To narrow results, click Filters.  
5. Check Assignments, Announcements, Pages (and any other content types you want).  
6. Click Apply – the list updates to show only your selected types.  
7. To rate a result, click the Like (👍) or Dislike (👎) icon next to it.  
8. If you clicked Dislike, enter optional comments in the pop-up, then click Submit.  

That’s it—Smart Search will use your query and feedback to surface the most relevant Canvas content.
context:
Document Title: What is Smart Search

What is Smart Search? This guide applies to institutions who have opted in to the Smart Search feature preview. If your user interface displays differently, the feature has not been enabled at your institution. To learn more about the feature preview, ask questions, or comment on functionality, navigate to the Smart Search user group . Leveraging semantic algorithms and AI, Smart Search allows users to search Canvas course content by understanding the context of queries and finding relevant results based on that context. Admins can enable Smart Search setting at the account or sub-account level. This setting can also be locked for sub-accounts. If enabled and locked, Smart Search is enabled in all courses in the account. If enabled and unlocked, teachers can manage the feature preview from the course level. To learn more about Feature Options, refer to the Canvas Feature Option Summary resource document.  Search Keywords In Course Navigation, click the Smart Search link . To find an assignment, announcement, discussion, or page, enter a keyword in the Search field . A list of relevant results display. To filter the search results, click the Filters button . To provide feedback, click the Like or Dislike icon . Filter Search Results Select the type of content you want to display in search results . Then, click the Apply button . Provide Feedback If you clicked the Dislike button, a pop-up window displays where you can add additional feedback . To save your response, click the Submit button .

input: How can teachers filter search results by content type after Smart Search is enabled at the account level?
expected_output:
1. In Course Navigation, click the Smart Search link.  
2. Enter your search term in the search field and press Enter.  
3. Click the Filters button above the results.  
4. Select one or more content types (e.g., Assignments, Announcements, Pages).  
5. Click Apply to view only the selected content types.
context:
Document Title: What is Smart Search

What is Smart Search? This guide applies to institutions who have opted in to the Smart Search feature preview. If your user interface displays differently, the feature has not been enabled at your institution. To learn more about the feature preview, ask questions, or comment on functionality, navigate to the Smart Search user group . Leveraging semantic algorithms and AI, Smart Search allows users to search Canvas course content by understanding the context of queries and finding relevant results based on that context. Admins can enable Smart Search setting at the account or sub-account level. This setting can also be locked for sub-accounts. If enabled and locked, Smart Search is enabled in all courses in the account. If enabled and unlocked, teachers can manage the feature preview from the course level. To learn more about Feature Options, refer to the Canvas Feature Option Summary resource document.  Search Keywords In Course Navigation, click the Smart Search link . To find an assignment, announcement, discussion, or page, enter a keyword in the Search field . A list of relevant results display. To filter the search results, click the Filters button . To provide feedback, click the Like or Dislike icon . Filter Search Results Select the type of content you want to display in search results . Then, click the Apply button . Provide Feedback If you clicked the Dislike button, a pop-up window displays where you can add additional feedback . To save your response, click the Submit button .

input: Which simultaneous keystrokes (Shift+?) open SpeedGrader's keyboard navigation shortcuts window?
expected_output:
1. In SpeedGrader, hold down the Shift key.  
2. While holding Shift, press the question-mark (?) key.  
→ The keyboard navigation shortcuts window will open.
context:
Document Title: What is SpeedGrader

What is SpeedGrader? As an instructor, SpeedGrader allows you to view and grade student assignment submissions in one place using a simple point scale or complex rubric. Canvas accepts a variety of document formats and even URLs as assignment submissions. Some document assignments can be marked up for feedback directly within the submission. You can also provide feedback to your students with text or media comments. Note: You can control when students submission comments become visible by selecting a grade posting policy .  When Would I Use SpeedGrader? You can use SpeedGrader to: Sort submissions by student and hide student names for anonymous grading View submission details for each student, including resubmitted assignments Use rubrics to assign grades Leave feedback comments for your students Track your grading progress and hide assignments while grading View submissions in moderated assignments View SpeedGrader For each student, you can use the areas in SpeedGrader to do the following: View student submissions (text entries, website URLs, media recordings, and/or file uploads); preview supported file types in Canvas DocViewer; review other file format submissions using the document previewer or Google Preview. Assign a grade based on your preferred assessment method (points or percentage). View the Rubric to assist with grading (if one is added to the assignment). View comments created by you or the student about the assignment. Leave feedback comments by entering text, selecting emojis, selecting pre-made comments from the comment library, attaching files, recording or uploading media, recording screen captures, or adding audio commentary. Reassign the assignment. Download or print submission comments . Note: You can use keyboard shortcuts to navigate SpeedGrader. To view a window with a list of keyboard navigation shortcuts, press the Shift+Question Mark keys simultaneously on your keyboard. Access Modernized SpeedGrader Platform If the Modernized SpeedGrader Platform is enabled at your institution and in the course, you can view and use an updated SpeedGrader interface. This feature enhances performance for a faster, smoother experience for users handling larger courses or complex assignments. SpeedGrader interface updates include: A streamlined interface for the Section drop-down menu A clearer and more prominent No Submission alert An improved interface for courses without content The Submission Status is updated to a drop-down menu Rubrics are automatically displayed in the traditional view Media attachments and submission comments are moved and the delete icon is changed Note: When the Enhanced Rubric feature option is enabled, instructors can choose additional rubric views.

input: In SpeedGrader, what menu options or shortcuts can I use to add audio, video, or screen recording feedback, and ensure my comments are visible to students?
expected_output:
1. Open SpeedGrader for a student submission.  
2. In the right-hand Comments sidebar, click the Media Comment icon (camera).  
3. From the dropdown choose:  
   • Microphone – record an audio comment  
   • Video camera – record a webcam video  
   • Screen – capture your screen (with or without webcam)  
4. Click Record, then Stop when finished, and Attach to insert the recording.  
5. (Optional) Add text or emoji comments alongside your media.  
6. To review or learn shortcuts, press Shift + ?  

Ensuring comments are visible:  
• In your assignment’s settings, set the Grade Posting Policy to “Automatic” so feedback appears immediately.  
• If you use Manual posting, click Post Grades in SpeedGrader after you finish commenting to publish all feedback.

input: How can I open my Account Settings from the Global Navigation menu to view my profile, notifications, and files, and edit my email or password?
expected_output:
1. In Canvas’s Global Navigation, click the Account icon.  
2. From the Account menu, choose:  
   • Profile to view your name, picture, and pronouns  
   • Notifications to manage alerts for courses and activity  
   • Files to browse your personal and course files  
   • Settings to change email, password, language, time zone, and feature options  
3. On the Settings page, click the Edit Settings button.  
4. Update your Default Email or Password fields as needed.  
5. Click Update Settings to save your changes.
context:
Document Title: What are User Settings

What are User Settings?
In Canvas, you can manage your personal user settings to customize how you interact with and appear within Canvas. The settings area allows you to modify personal details like your profile picture and name. You can also adjust localization and account settings such as language, time zone, and login credentials, as well as enable optional features related to accessibility and interface preferences.
Note:
The ability to modify certain settings is dependent on what your institution has enabled.
Open User Settings
In Global Navigation, click the
Account
link [1], then click the
Settings
link [2].
Personal User Settings
You can view all of your personal user settings such as your profile picture, name preferences, pronouns, default email, language, and time zone.
Note:
Personal pronouns are displayed only if enabled by your institution.
Web Services, Approved Integrations, and Feature Options
You can also view your
Web Services
[1],
Approved Integrations
[2], and
Feature Options
[3].
Open Profile Picture
If your institution has enabled profile pictures, you can add or modify your profile picture by hovering over your current image and clicking the
Edit
icon.
Note:
For more information on adding or editing a profile picture, visit
How do I add a profile picture in my user account?
Select Profile Picture
You can upload a picture from your computer, take a picture using your computer's camera, or import an image from an existing Gravatar account [1]. When you're finished, click the
Save
button [2].
Open Edit Settings
If allowed by your institution, you may edit your user settings by clicking the
Edit Settings
button in the sidebar.
Edit Settings
You can edit your
Full Name
[1],
Display Name
[2],
Sortable
Name
[3],
Pronouns
[4],
Default
Email
[5],
Language
[6],
Time
Zone
[7], and
Password
[8].
To save your changes, click the
Update
Settings
button [9].
Note(s):
Some settings may not be available to you. If you are not able to edit your user settings, you will need to contact your institution to change this information.
For more information on changing user account settings, visit
How do I change the settings in my user account?
Edit Feature Options
You can edit your Feature Options, which controls Canvas features related to accessibility, spreadsheet exports, and celebration animations. To enable or disable a feature, click the
State
icon for the feature.
Note:
For more information on managing feature options, visit
How do I manage feature options in my user account?

input: In the Canvas Global Navigation menu, within Account > Settings, where is the Files tab located in relation to the Dashboard and the Apps page?
expected_output:
1. From your Dashboard, open Global Navigation and click Account, then select Settings.  
2. Across the top of the Settings page you’ll see a row of tabs:  
   • Profile | Settings | Notifications | Files | ePortfolios | Observing…  
3. The Files tab is the fourth tab from the left—immediately after Notifications and before ePortfolios.  
4. If you open the Account menu again, the separate Apps link appears below Files in that same menu.

input: Which Canvas post-login button labeled "Start Tour" initiates the Welcome Tour?
expected_output:
1. Log in to Canvas.  
2. In the post-login banner (short message about the Welcome Tour), click the button labeled “Start Tour.”  
3. The Canvas Welcome Tour will begin.
context:
Document Title: How do I use the Canvas Welcome Tour

How do I use the Canvas Welcome Tour? Canvas provides an optional welcome tour that provides quick tips to get started with a Canvas course. The content of the welcome tour depends on your user role: If you are a student, the Canvas Welcome Tour shows you how to find your courses, contact your instructor, download the Canvas Student app, and get help with Canvas. If you are an instructor, the Canvas Welcome Tour shows you how to set up your notifications, get your content online, and learn about video conferencing with Zoom, Google Meet, and Microsoft Teams. If you are an admin, the Canvas Welcome Tour shows you how to add people and courses to Canvas, share course content and templates with teachers, set up video conferencing and other tools, and find training resources and more help. Notes: The Canvas Welcome Tour for admins only displays for users with account admin permissions. It does not display for sub-account admins. If you are new to Canvas, you can also get started by reviewing the Instructor Getting Started Resources , Student Getting Started Resources , or Observer/Parent Getting Started Resources . You can also view videos on a variety of topics.  Start Canvas Welcome Tour After logging in to Canvas , you can view a short message about the Canvas Welcome Tour. To start the Canvas Welcome Tour, click the Start Tour button . To dismiss the Canvas Welcome Tour, click the Not Now button  or the Exit icon . Note: Dismissing the tour disables the tour for your account. Reopen Canvas Welcome Tour If you previously dismissed the Canvas Welcome Tour, you can reopen the tour by clicking the Help link in Global Navigation  and clicking the Show Welcome Tour link . Note: Depending on your institution, the Help menu and links within the Help menu may not display or may display differently. Proceed Through Tour To view details on linked text during the tour, click the link . To proceed to the next item on the tour, click the Next button . To go to a previous item on the tour, click the Previous button . Complete Welcome Tour After viewing the last tour item, you can complete the tour. To complete the tour, click the Done button. Note: Depending on your institution, the Help menu and links within the Help menu may not display or may display differently.

input: How can a Canvas account administrator use the Help menu in the global navigation to reopen a dismissed to-do item and complete it?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click the Help link.  
2. From the menu, select Show Welcome Tour to reopen the dismissed tour.  
3. Click Next to move through each tour item (or Previous to go back).  
4. After reviewing all items, click Done to complete the tour.

input: Which regions and user roles in Canvas can see the Help link, and what steps do I take to open and authorize Canvas?
expected_output:
Regions & Roles  
- Available Regions: United States; Europe, Middle East & Africa (EMEA); Asia-Pacific (APAC); and select Canadian institutions.  
- Eligible Roles: Admins, Instructors, Designers, and users without an assigned Canvas role.  

Steps to Open & Authorize the Training Services Portal  
1. Open the Help Menu  
   a. In Canvas Global Navigation, click the Help link (name/icon may vary).  
2. Launch the Portal  
   a. Click Training Services Portal.  
3. Authorize Your Account  
   a. On first access, two authorization modals appear—click Authorize on each.  
   b. On subsequent visits, click Authorize in the Canvas Training Portal Authorization modal.  
   c. If prompted, enter your Canvas URL and sign in to complete authorization.
context:
Document Title: How do I use the Training Services Portal

How do I use the Training Services Portal? As an instructor or an admin, you may be able to access the Training Services Portal, also known as the On-Demand Training Portal, to complete self-paced training resources on a variety of Canvas topics. If your institution has a paid training subscription, you may also have access to live trainings and webinars. Notes: The Training Services Portal is available to the following: United States institutions; Europe, the Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) institutions; Asia-Pacific (APAC) region institutions; and select Canadian institutions that have chosen to participate. If you cannot access the Training Services Portal, your institution may have hidden the Help Menu link. If you are an admin, you can enable it for the account . The Training Services Portal is only available to admin-, instructor-, and designer-based roles or users without an assigned role.  Open Help Menu In the Canvas Global Navigation menu, click the Help link. Note: Depending on your institution, the Help link name and icon may vary. Open Training Services Portal Click the Training Services Portal link. Notes: The Training Services Portal is available to the following: United States institutions; Europe, the Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) institutions; Asia-Pacific (APAC) region institutions; and select Canadian institutions that have chosen to participate. If you cannot access the Training Services Portal, your Canvas admin may have hidden the Help Menu link. Authorize Account To use the Training Services Portal, you must authorize the Training Portal to access your Canvas account. Two modals display when accessing the Training Portal the first time. To authorize use of your account, click the Authorize buttons. In the future, only the Canvas Training Portal Authorization modal will display. Note: If you are not authenticated in your Canvas Instance, you will be prompted to enter your Canvas URL before accessing the Training Portal. View Completion Report as Admin If you are an admin, the Data and Analytics page displays by default. On the Completion Report tab , you can view completion data such as the enrolled user , the offering , type , and completion status . To generate a new report, click the New Report button . View Training Portal as Learner If you are an admin, the Training Portal displays contents to you by default as an Admin . To view the Training Portal as a learner, click the User drop-down  and select the Learner option . View Courses & Webinars If you are an instructor or an admin learner, the Courses & Webinars page displays by default . Available training material displays based on your institution's subscription training package. Depending on your institution's subscription training package, you may see On Demand offerings. On Demand offerings are asynchronous learning pathways or courses comprising written content and videos. If purchased by your institution, you may also view Product Training courses, which include detailed training on a specific product. Offerings may be filtered using the section tabs : The All tab displays all courses and webinars. The K12 tab displays offerings specific to K12 institutions. The Higher Education tab displays offerings specific to higher education institutions. The Products tab displays offerings for Instructure products. The Partner Integrations tab displays partner offerings that are non-Instructure education solutions that integrate with Canvas. To locate a specific offering, enter a keyword in the Search field  and click the Search button . To filter offerings by type, duration, or tag, click the Filter button . Each content section has categories that separate the offerings into themes . To view course or webinar details, click the course or webinar title . To view more information about the offering, click the Details icon . To enroll in a course, click the Enroll Now link . Note: To enroll in a pathway, click the Pathways tab, locate the pathway, and click the Enroll In Pathway link. Enroll in Offering Click the Enroll button. Open Course Courses you have enrolled in display in the In Progress section . To open a course in which you are enrolled,|Document Title: How do I use the Training Services Portal

click the Enroll In Pathway link. Enroll in Offering Click the Enroll button. Open Course Courses you have enrolled in display in the In Progress section . To open a course in which you are enrolled, click the Continue link . The course opens in a new tab. To open a course in the Global Navigation menu, click the Dashboard icon , and then click on the course . Unenroll in Offering To unenroll from an offering, click the Details icon  and then click the Unenroll button . To confirm your unenrollment, click the Unenroll button. View Live Training Calendar To view the training calendar, click the Live Training Calendar tab . The Training Calendar displays pre-scheduled live webinars delivered by Canvas trainers. To view information about a live training, click the session title . To view live training details, click the Details option . To register for the training, click the Enroll Now option . After registering, you will receive a Canvas Inbox message with the session invite and details. You can invite other Premium subscription members to join the training by sharing the link included in the message. You can also access the session from the Training Calendar 15 minutes prior to the start of the webinar. Note: Live trainings are only available to Premium subscription clients. View History & Transcripts To view your training history and transcriptions, click the History & Transcriptions tab . You can view past enrolled offerings , the offering type , and completion status . To generate a transcript, click the Generate Transcript button .

input: How can Canvas admins or instructors access the Help menu, authorize the institution portal, apply filters, and enroll users on demand in Canvas?
expected_output:
1. Access the Help menu  
   a. In Canvas Global Navigation, click Help (the label or icon may vary).  
   b. Select Training Services Portal.  

2. Authorize your institution portal  
   a. On first access, two authorization modals appear.  
   b. Click Authorize on each modal to allow the portal to connect to your Canvas account.  
   c. (If prompted, enter your Canvas URL and log in.)  

3. Locate On-Demand offerings  
   a. In the Training Portal, go to the Courses & Webinars tab (default view).  
   b. Use the section tabs to narrow by audience: All, K-12, Higher Ed, Products, or Partner Integrations.  
   c. To refine results further:  
      • Enter keywords in the Search field and click Search.  
      • Click Filter and select filters by type, duration, or tag.  

4. Enroll users on‐demand  
   a. Browse the list of On-Demand courses or pathways.  
   b. To enroll yourself, click Enroll Now (or Enroll In Pathway for multi-course pathways).  
   c. Enrolled courses appear under In Progress. Click Continue to open.  

(Optional for admins)  
5. View reporting or learner view  
   a. Admins default to the Data & Analytics page; see the Completion Report tab for enrollment statuses.  
   b. To preview as a learner, switch the user role via the User dropdown and select Learner.

input: How do I locate the 'Report a Problem' link in the Help menu, open the ticket form, and fill in the subject, description, and attachments?
expected_output:
1. Open the Help menu  
   – In Global Navigation (the left-hand menu), click the Help link at the bottom.  

2. Select “Report a Problem”  
   – From the list of default help links, click Report a Problem to open the ticket form.  

3. Fill in the Subject  
   – In the Subject field, enter a brief summary of your issue (e.g., “Assignment upload error in BIO101”).  

4. Describe the problem  
   – In the Description field, include:  
     • A link to the page where the error occurs (or the course name and location)  
     • What you expected to happen vs. what actually happened  
     • Steps to reproduce the issue  
     • Any troubleshooting you’ve already tried (clearing cache, different browser, etc.)  

5. Add attachments  
   – Click the paper-clip icon (or Attachments section) to upload screenshots, screencasts, log files, or sample files that illustrate the problem.  

6. Submit your ticket  
   – Review your entries and click Submit Ticket. You’ll receive a confirmation email and can reply with additional attachments if needed.
context:
Document Title: How do I get help with Canvas

How do I get help with Canvas? You can get help with Canvas by using the Help menu. The Help menu generates a list of resources to help you with Canvas. Canvas displays links according to roles in all enrollments; for instance, if you are a student who had one courses with an instructor-based role, the Help menu will show you links available to students and instructors. This lesson outlines the default help links that may be included in the Help menu for your institution. However, your institution may customize the Canvas Help menu to hide default links and create custom links as resources. Notes: Depending on your institution, the Help menu may not be available. If you are an admin, you can customize links in the Help menu . To learn more about support tiers available to Canvas customers, please view the Support Terms webpage.  Open Help At the bottom of Global Navigation, click the Help link. Note: Depending on your institution, the Help link name and icon may vary. View Default Links Depending on your user role, there are several default links for help or feedback: Search the Canvas Guides : Search the Canvas Guides for information about features inside of Canvas COVID-19 Canvas Resources : Users can view resources for teaching and learning online Conference Guides for Remote Classrooms : Users can view and search guides and resources for using Conferences in remote classrooms and online learning Report a Problem : Submit problems with Canvas to our support team Ask your Instructor a Question : Ask your instructor questions about course material or send them a message Ask the Community : Exchange ideas and solutions regarding Canvas functionality with Canvas experts and your Canvas peers in the Community Submit a Feature Idea : Submit ideas about how to make Canvas better Show Welcome Tour : Learn more about Canvas by viewing the Welcome Tour If you are an instructor, click the Training Services Portal link to access the Training Services Portal , which contains self-paced training resources on a variety of Canvas topics. View Custom Links Your institution may reorder or remove the default links. Your institution may remove or modify which link displays as the featured link  and which link displays the New label . Lastly, your institution can include custom links in the Help menu . Custom links may include pages to phone numbers, support information, and other resources. Search Canvas Guides The Search the Canvas Guides link helps you search Canvas documentation for information about features in Canvas. Report a Problem The Report a Problem link helps you report problems in Canvas. You may find a faster response to your question by searching the Canvas Guides. But if you can't find an answer, you can submit a ticket and get support help. Submit Ticket In the Subject field , create a subject for your ticket. In the Description field , describe the problem you are experiencing in Canvas. Please be as detailed as possible to help troubleshoot the problem. The following information helps the Canvas support team more quickly resolve your question(s): A link to the user or name and email of the user. A link to the location where the error is occurring. A summary of what is occurring. A screencast or screenshot of what is occurring. The steps you have taken for the Canvas support team to replicate what you are experiencing. What resolutions you have already tried (i.e. cleared cache and cookies). If you submit tickets frequently, you may prefer to use a screencasting program to create an online link to an image or create a video walkthrough. However, if you're not comfortable using online links, you can submit attachments later if necessary; once you submit the ticket, you'll receive an email from the support team. You can reply to the email with any attachment as needed. Additional information to help the Canvas support team: If any files are involved, please provide a copy of the file. If it is a custom tool issue, please provide the name of the tool. If there are any previous cases that may pertain to your question, please provide those case numbers. In the How is this affecting you? drop-down menu , select the statement|Document Title: How do I get help with Canvas

the name of the tool. If there are any previous cases that may pertain to your question, please provide those case numbers. In the How is this affecting you? drop-down menu , select the statement that best describes how the problem is affecting you: Just a casual question, comment, idea, suggestion I need some help but it's not urgent Something's broken but I can work around it for now I can't get things done until I hear back from you EXTREMELY CRITICAL EMERGENCY When you're done, click the Submit Ticket button . Depending on your institution's support schedule, you'll receive a reply as soon as possible. Ask Your Instructor a Question The Ask Your Instructor a Question link allows you to contact an instructor or TA in any of your active courses directly from the help page. Send Message In the courses drop-down menu , select the course that relates to your question. In the Message field , enter the message for your instructor(s). When you're done, click the Send Message button . Replies will be sent to your Conversations Inbox . If your course includes more than one instructor or TA, your message will be sent as a group message to all instructors/TAs in the course. View Release Notes If Release Notes are enabled by your institution, you can view release note links from the Help Menu. Release notes describe new and updated features added to the Canvas interface. The Help Menu displays the last ten release notes posted. To view a release note document, click the link for the release . This link leads you directly to the release and deploy notes in the Community. The Help Menu displays a New badge for any release/deploy notes that have not been viewed . To hide the numbered badge, click the Show badges for new release notes button. Note: You can also view Release Notes in the Community.

input: How do student and instructor roles, and customizations to the institution’s Help menu, change which links are displayed and which fields appear on support tickets?
expected_output:
Here’s how roles and Help‐menu customizations affect which links you see and what fields appear on the “Report a Problem” form:

1. Role-Based Link Display  
   - Students see the standard student links (e.g., Search the Canvas Guides, COVID-19 Resources, Report a Problem, Ask Your Instructor, Ask the Community, Submit a Feature Idea, Show Welcome Tour).  
   - Instructors see all student links plus instructor-only links (e.g., Training Services Portal).  

2. Institution Customizations  
   - Admins can reorder, hide, or remove any default link (including “Report a Problem”) and designate which link is featured or labeled “New.”  
   - Admins can add custom links (for example, phone numbers, institutional support pages, or specialized resources).  
   - If “Report a Problem” is hidden, users must use an alternate link or contact method to submit tickets.  

3. “Report a Problem” Ticket Fields  
   Regardless of role or menu customizations, the ticket form itself includes:  
   • Subject – brief summary of the issue  
   • Description – detailed information (user name/email, URL where the error occurs, steps to reproduce, screenshots/screencasts, and what you’ve tried so far)  
   • How is this affecting you? – drop-down with options from “Just a casual question” to “EXTREMELY CRITICAL EMERGENCY”  

Note: Customizing the Help menu does not alter the fields on the “Report a Problem” form—it only controls whether and where that link appears.

input: Which GN Help option "How do I get help with Canvas?" lets instructors contact Support?
expected_output:
1. In Canvas Web, click the Help icon in Global Navigation.  
2. From the Help menu, choose “How do I get help with Canvas?”  
3. On that page, instructors can then contact Canvas Support via chat, phone, or email.
context:
Document Title: How do I contact Canvas Support

How do I contact Canvas Support?
Depending on the institution, Canvas users can contact Canvas Support through the Help menu in Canvas Global Navigation on the web or the Help option in the User menu from one of the Canvas mobile apps. Canvas Support agents are trained to assist all Canvas user roles, including students, instructors, and observers/parents/caregivers. However, K12 students and observers are not supported directly by Canvas Support and should reach out to their school for assistance.
Note:
Institutions can customize their Help menu with the help resources they want their users to access. Canvas documentation displays the default menu options, but your institution can choose to customize options in the Help menu or remove the Help menu altogether. The options that display in Canvas for you may therefore be different from the screenshots shown in the reference lessons below.
Canvas Web
Students, Instructors, and Observers:
How do I get help with Canvas?
Admins:
To report any problems with Canvas, contact Canvas Support. For assistance with managing your institution's Canvas account, contact your Customer Success Manager (CSM).
Canvas Mobile Apps
Instructors/Teachers/Course Facilitators:
How do I get help with the Teacher app on my Android device?
How do I get help with the Teacher app on my iOS device?
Students:
How do I get help with the Student app on my Android device?
How do I get help with the Student app on my iOS device?
Parents/Observers:
How do I get help with the Canvas Parent app on my Android device?
How do I get help with the Canvas Parent app on my iOS device?
What if there is no Help button in my Global Navigation?
In some cases, the Help Menu may be disabled altogether. If you do not see a Help menu in Canvas, use the support resources provided by your institution or contact your institution's IT department. If your question can be shared publicly, you may consider
asking the Canvas Community
.
You can also use the
Instructure Community
resources to access the
Canvas user guides
,
release notes
,
known issues
,
Canvas questions and answers
,
resource documents
, and more.
Learn more about using the Instructure Community in the
Community Guides
.
How do I learn more about Canvas support tiers?
Learn more about available support tiers by viewing the
Canvas Support Terms
webpage.

input: How can students, instructors, observers, or admins access IT support, CSM support, Canvas support, and the Instructure Community without using the Help menu?
expected_output:
• IT support (all roles)  
  1. Visit your institution’s IT or help-desk website (intranet portal) for email, phone, or ticket options.  
  2. Call or submit a request via your school’s IT service system.

• CSM support (admins only)  
  1. Email your assigned Customer Success Manager directly (contact info provided during onboarding).  
  2. If you’ve lost their details, ask your institution’s Canvas account admin to share the CSM contact.

• Canvas Support (students, instructors, observers, admins)  
  1. Go to the Canvas Support Terms page (https://www.instructure.com/policies/canvas-support-terms) for global phone numbers and online case submission links.  
  2. Use the “Submit a Case” form on the support-terms page to open a ticket.

• Instructure Community (all roles)  
  1. Open your browser and go to https://community.canvaslms.com  
  2. Browse user guides, release notes, known issues, and Q&A without signing in or create a free account to post questions.

input: How do Android users install and navigate the Canvas Student native app instead of using a mobile browser?
expected_output:
1. Install the Canvas Student app  
   a. Open Google Play Store on your Android device  
   b. Search for “Canvas Student” (by Instructure)  
   c. Tap Install and wait for the download to complete  

2. Log in to your account  
   a. Open the Canvas Student app  
   b. Tap Find my school and enter your institution name or Canvas URL  
   c. Sign in with your usual Canvas credentials  

3. Navigate within the app  
   • Dashboard: view your favorite and recent courses  
   • Courses tab: tap a course to access Modules, Syllabus, Announcements, Assignments, and Grades  
   • To-do list and Calendar: track upcoming assignments and events  
   • Inbox: send and receive course messages  
   • Notifications (bell icon): review alerts and adjust settings in Account > Notifications  

4. Get help or view feature details  
   • For a complete list of supported features by device and version, see the Canvas Student mobile features document in the Canvas Mobile Guides.  
   • If you encounter issues, ensure your app is up to date or contact your institution’s Canvas support.
context:
Document Title: How can I use Canvas on my mobile device

How can I use Canvas on my mobile device?
Canvas is built on open web standards, so most features are supported on mobile devices.
You can learn more about mobile applications in the
Canvas Mobile Guides
.
Mobile Browsers
You can access Canvas from any
supported browsers
on your Android/iOS device. However, mobile browsers are not fully supported, and features may not function as expected compared to when viewing Canvas in a fully supported desktop browser.
On mobile devices, Canvas is optimized for use within Canvas mobile applications. Canvas pages within a mobile browser are only supported when an action in the app links directly to the browser, such as when a student takes certain types of quizzes. Support is not extended to pages that cannot currently be used in the app, such as Conferences or Collaborations.
Additionally, Canvas offers limited support for native mobile browsers on tablet devices. For details, please reference the
limited-support mobile browser guidelines
.
Mobile Applications
We are actively improving our native mobile applications to support as many Canvas features as possible. Instructure has a native mobile application for students free for download on both phones and tablets.
Canvas Student:
The
Canvas Student app
provides access to Canvas while on the go. Depending on the device, not all Canvas features may be available on the app at this time. View the
Canvas Student mobile features document
by version and device.
Canvas Parent:
The
Canvas Parent app
is designed for observers, parents, and guardians to engage in their students' education and view assignments, events, and grades. Access to Canvas Parent is managed by a student's institution. View the
Canvas Parent mobile features document
by version and device.
Canvas Teacher:
The
Canvas Teacher app
allows instructors to manage course content and grade student submissions on the go. Syncs with SpeedGrader and the Gradebook. With the growing use of mobile devices, instructors should develop their courses with best practices for mobile in mind. View the
Canvas Teacher mobile features document
document
by version and device.

input: Why can’t I load the Conferences or Collaborations pages in Canvas on my mobile browser, and how can I access them using the Canvas mobile app?
expected_output:
1. Why Conferences/Collaborations won’t load in a mobile browser  
   • Mobile browsers only support pages that the Canvas app explicitly links out to.  
   • Features like Conferences and Collaborations currently aren’t supported in mobile browsers.  

2. How to access Conferences/Collaborations in the Canvas mobile app  
   a. Install the appropriate Canvas app (Student or Teacher) from Google Play or the iOS App Store.  
   b. Sign in with your institution credentials.  
   c. Open the course where you need Conferences or Collaborations.  
   d. Tap the Course Navigation menu and select “Conferences” or “Collaborations.”  
   e. Join or start your session directly in the app.  

For more details on mobile feature support, see the Canvas Mobile Guides.

input: When can I use app-linked Canvas quizzes in my Android mobile browser, even though support is limited?
expected_output:
You can only take app-linked Canvas quizzes in your Android mobile browser when the Canvas app itself hands the quiz off to the browser. In other words:

1. Open the Canvas app on your Android device.  
2. Navigate to a quiz that isn’t fully supported in the app (e.g., certain quiz types).  
3. Tap the quiz link—Canvas will launch it in your default mobile browser.  
4. Complete the quiz in the browser window as prompted.
context:
Document Title: How do I access Canvas using a mobile browser on my Android

How do I access Canvas using a mobile browser on my Android device? You can access Canvas from any browser on your Android device. However, for the best user experience, you should view Canvas via the mobile app for Android devices. Please note that mobile browsers are not supported by Canvas, and features may not function as expected compared to viewing Canvas in a fully supported desktop browser. Canvas pages within a mobile browser are only supported when an action in the app links directly to the browser, such as when a student takes certain types of quizzes. Support is not extended to pages that cannot currently be used in the app, such as Conferences or Collaborations. Additionally, Canvas offers limited support for native mobile browsers on tablet devices. For details, please reference the limited-support mobile browser guidelines . The images in this lesson are shown for a phone display, but unless otherwise noted, tablet displays mirror the same steps.  Open Mobile Browser Tap the icon for your preferred mobile browser. Note: Mobile browser options will vary per Android device. Enter Canvas URL Enter your institution's Canvas URL in the URL field. Open Using Internet If you already have the Canvas app installed on your device, a pop-up window will appear asking you whether you want to open Canvas using the Canvas app or the Internet. Then you will need to tell your device how often to ask for this action: To have your device never ask again and always open to your browser, select the Always button . If you regularly use the Canvas app and only want to use your browser sparingly, tap the Just once button . Log In to Canvas Enter your Canvas login credentials in the email  and password  fields. Tap the Log In button . View Canvas You can interact with Canvas as you would on the regular web version of Canvas.

input: Why can't I use Canvas Conferences or Collaborations on an Android mobile browser, and how can I access them?
expected_output:
1. Why Conferences and Collaborations aren’t available on Android mobile browsers  
   • Canvas does not support mobile browsers for certain tools—Conferences and Collaborations require desktop‐only functionality and aren’t fully coded for mobile web or the Canvas Android app.  

2. How to access Conferences and Collaborations  
   a. On a computer, open a fully supported desktop browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, or Edge)  
   b. Go to your institution’s Canvas URL and log in  
   c. Navigate to your course and select Conferences or Collaborations from the course menu  

If you must use a tablet, you still need to switch your browser to “desktop mode” (if supported) or use a laptop/desktop for full functionality.

input: Why should I use the Canvas mobile app on my iPhone? How do I access Canvas through my iPhone’s web browser and are there any limitations I should know about?
expected_output:
1. Why use the Canvas iOS app?  
   • Fully supported on iPhone—optimized interface, push notifications, offline access.  
   • All Canvas features work as intended (unlike in-browser versions).  

2. How to access Canvas in your iPhone’s web browser  
   a. Open your preferred browser (Safari, Chrome, etc.).  
   b. In the address bar, enter your institution’s Canvas URL.  
   c. Sign in with your Canvas email and password.  
   d. Tap Log In to view Canvas pages.  

3. Browser limitations  
   • Mobile browsers aren’t officially supported—some features may break or display incorrectly.  
   • Only certain in-app links (e.g., specific quizzes) open in browser; pages like Conferences or Collaborations won’t work.  
   • For full functionality, use the Canvas Student app.  

For more details on supported browsers, see the Limited-Support Mobile Browser Guidelines.

input: How can I use Safari on my iPhone to access Canvas pages instead of the Canvas app, and what limitations should I know about?
expected_output:
1. Open Safari on your iPhone.  
2. In the address bar, enter your institution’s Canvas URL (for example, yourschool.instructure.com).  
3. Log in with your Canvas email/username and password.  
4. Tap Log In to access your Canvas dashboard in the browser.  

Limitations to be aware of:  
• Mobile browsers (including Safari) are not officially supported, so some features may break or display incorrectly.  
• Canvas pages opened only from in-app links (e.g., certain quizzes) will work; most other tools—like Conferences or Collaborations—won’t load.  
• For a full, reliable experience, use the iOS Canvas app or a supported desktop browser.
context:
Document Title: How do I access Canvas using a mobile browser on my iOS device

How do I access Canvas using a mobile browser on my iOS device? You can access Canvas from any browser on your iOS device. However, for the best user experience, you should view Canvas via the mobile app for iOS devices. Please note that mobile browsers are not supported by Canvas, and features may not function as expected compared to viewing Canvas in a fully supported desktop browser. Canvas pages within a mobile browser are only supported when an action in the app links directly to the browser, such as when a student takes certain types of quizzes. Support is not extended to pages that cannot currently be used in the app, such as Conferences or Collaborations. Additionally, Canvas offers limited support for native mobile browsers on tablet devices. For details, please reference the limited-support mobile browser guidelines .  Open Mobile Browser Tap the icon for your preferred mobile browser. Enter Canvas URL In the URL field, enter your institution's Canvas URL. Log In to Canvas Enter your Canvas login credentials in the email  and password  fields. Tap the Log In button . View Mobile Browser View Canvas in your mobile browser.

input: How do the different parts of the Canvas Student dashboard navigation bar work? Specifically, what do the Courses/Groups, Calendar, To Do list, Notifications, Inbox, Assignments, and Grades icons do?
expected_output:
1. Courses/Groups  
   - Tap the icon to open your Dashboard.  
   - View and switch between all your enrolled courses and groups.  

2. Calendar  
   - Tap to see a consolidated course calendar.  
   - View upcoming events, assignment due dates, and filter by course.  

3. To Do  
   - Tap to display your outstanding tasks.  
   - See upcoming quizzes, discussions, and assignments sorted by due date.  

4. Notifications  
   - Tap to view alerts (new grades, announcements, discussion replies).  
   - Mark notifications as read or clear them to stay organized.  

5. Inbox  
   - Tap to access Canvas Conversations.  
   - Send and receive messages with instructors and classmates.  

6. Assignments  
   - Tap to list every assignment across your courses.  
   - View details (instructions, due dates) and submit work directly.  

7. Grades  
   - Tap to review your current scores and grading breakdowns.  
   - Drill into each course to see item-level feedback and grade history.
context:
Document Title: What is the Canvas Student app

What is the Canvas Student app? The Canvas Student app allows students to access their courses and groups using a mobile device. Students can submit assignments, participate in discussions, view grades, and access course materials. The app also provides access to course calendars, To Do items, notifications, and Inbox messages. Canvas Student requires a Canvas account and is available for both Android and iOS devices. Before downloading the Canvas Student app, you may want to review the Canvas mobile device requirements . Notes: Not all Canvas features are supported on the Canvas Student app at this time. For more details, refer to the Canvas Student Mobile Features resource document. Depending on your institution, you may need to log in to additional apps to view certain course content (e.g., Google Drive). Other mobile apps are available for parents/observers as well as instructors . If you do not want to use the Canvas Student app or are not on a mobile device, you can use a browser to access Canvas through your institution's URL .  View Courses and Groups Students can access their courses  and groups  from the Dashboard. View Course or Group Navigation Courses and groups include the same navigation items that can be viewed in the browser version of Canvas. View Assignments Students can view details on assignments, quizzes, and discussions and submit these items from the app. Navigate App Students can use the Navigation Bar to access their dashboard, calendar, To Do list, notifications, or Inbox. Manage Account Students can manage their Canvas account using the Student app. Students can manage their files, display course grades, get help from Canvas Support, change users, and log out of the app.

input: Which icons on the bottom navigation bar of the Canvas Student mobile app open the To Do list and the Inbox?
expected_output:
1. To open your To Do list, tap the “checklist” icon (✓) in the bottom navigation bar.  
2. To open your Inbox, tap the “envelope” icon (✉) in the bottom navigation bar.

input: In the Canvas Teacher app for Android/iOS, how can instructors use SpeedGrader to browse submissions and provide feedback?
expected_output:
1. Open the Canvas Teacher app and tap the course you want to grade.  
2. Tap the Assignments (or Quizzes/Discussions) tab.  
3. Find the assignment and tap the SpeedGrader icon.  
4. Swipe left or use the student menu to browse each student’s submission.  
5. Enter a grade, add comments or annotations directly on the student’s work.  
6. Tap “Save” (or “Submit”) to send the feedback to the student.
context:
Document Title: What is the Canvas Teacher app

What is the Canvas Teacher app? Canvas Teacher is a mobile app that allows instructors to facilitate their courses on the go, both inside and outside the classroom. This app provides quick access to grading, communicating, and updating—three of the most frequent course facilitation tasks for instructors through Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, and Quizzes. You can learn more about Canvas Teacher mobile features . Canvas Teacher requires a Canvas account. If you are an instructor and your institution does not use Canvas, sign up for a Free for Teacher account . Canvas Teacher is available for both Android and iOS devices. Notes: Depending on your institution, you may need to log in to additional apps to view certain course content. If you are unable to access a desktop device and need to add course content using a mobile device, you can access Canvas and add or modify course content through your device's web browser.  Grading Instructors can browse submissions and provide feedback to their students with a new and improved mobile SpeedGrader embedded in the app. Communicating Instructors can post announcements, send messages, and participate in course discussions. Canvas Teacher includes the Message Students Who feature from the web version of Canvas and allows instructors to easily send messages to students about specific course assignments. Updating Instructors can easily update course content such as due dates and spelling errors. They can also publish assignments, manage discussion settings, and adjust quiz options.

input: How do I use the Canvas Teacher app to grade with SpeedGrader, send messages, update due dates, and publish assignments?
expected_output:
Here’s how to do each task in Canvas Teacher:

1. Grade with SpeedGrader  
   a. Open the Canvas Teacher app and tap your course.  
   b. Tap Assignments, then select the assignment you want to grade.  
   c. Tap the SpeedGrader icon (circle with a checkmark).  
   d. Swipe left/right to navigate students.  
   e. Review submissions, add annotations or comments, enter a score, then tap Submit.

2. Send messages  
   a. In your course, tap the Inbox icon.  
   b. Tap the compose (+) button, select your course, then choose “Message Students Who.”  
   c. Pick your criteria (e.g., “haven’t submitted”) or select individual students.  
   d. Write your message and tap Send.

3. Update due dates  
   a. Tap your course, then tap Assignments.  
   b. Find the assignment and tap the Edit (pencil) icon.  
   c. Tap the Due Date field, choose a new date/time, then tap Save.

4. Publish assignments  
   a. In Assignments, unpublished items show a gray cloud icon.  
   b. Tap that cloud (or open the assignment and toggle Publish on).  
   c. Confirm by tapping Save or Publish.

input: In the Canvas Parent app on Android or iOS, as an observer, which tabs show weekly assignments, grades, and reminders?
expected_output:
1. Open the Canvas Parent app and tap the Courses tab.  
   - Switch to the Week view under Assignments & Events to see all weekly assignments.  
   - Within each course card you’ll also see current grades (per the course grading scheme).  

2. Tap the Alerts tab.  
   - Here you can turn on and view reminders (push notifications) for specific assignment and grade activity.
context:
Document Title: What is the Canvas Parent app

What is the Canvas Parent app? Canvas Parent enhances the potential for parents to engage in their children's education. Parents can review upcoming or past assignments, check on grades, and receive alerts for student activity. Canvas Parent can be used by any Canvas user with an observer account and is available for both Android and iOS devices. Note: Depending on your institution, you may need to log in to additional apps to view certain course content.  View Student Courses and Grades The Courses tab displays the list of courses that their students are enrolled in. For each course, parents can see course grades, syllabus, assignments, and events. Grades display according to the course grading scheme. View Student Assignments and Events Assignments and events can be viewed by course or week. Parents can set reminders for a specific assignment or event, which are sent to mobile devices as push notifications. Set Alerts for Student Activity Parents can set alerts for specific assignment and grade activity. Alerts are displayed in the Alerts page in the app.

input: How do parents configure Canvas Parent push notifications and alerts for assignment and grade activity?
expected_output:
1. Open the Canvas Parent app and sign in with your observer account.  
2. To set general activity alerts:  
   a. Tap the Alerts (bell) icon at the bottom.  
   b. Tap the plus (+) in the top-right corner.  
   c. Select your student and course.  
   d. Choose the alert type (e.g., “New Grade Posted,” “Assignment Submitted,” etc.) and toggle it on.  
   e. Tap Save.  
3. To set assignment- or event-specific reminders:  
   a. Tap the Courses tab and select a course.  
   b. Switch to the Assignments or Events view.  
   c. Tap the desired assignment or event.  
   d. Tap Set Reminder, choose when you’d like to be notified, and confirm.  
4. Push notifications for both alerts and reminders will now appear on your Android or iOS device.

input: After opening the Calendar from the Global Navigation menu, which button do I click to switch from Month view to Agenda view?
expected_output:
1. Open the Calendar from the Global Navigation menu.  
2. In the calendar’s view selector (above the main calendar window), click the Agenda button to switch to Agenda view.
context:
Document Title: How do I use the Calendar

How do I use the Calendar? The Calendar is a great way to view everything you have to do for all your courses in one place. You can view calendar events by day, week, month, or agenda list. The calendar also includes access to the Scheduler , which is an optional scheduling tool in Canvas. Notes: If you change your language or locale preferences, the Calendar week start date may also change. Certain languages or locales change the Calendar week start date to Monday. Observers cannot reserve Scheduler appointments on behalf of a student. Observers cannot view events in a student's personal calendar or appointments reserved through the Scheduler. However, an observer can view a student's reserved appointment(s) in the Canvas Parent app .  Open Calendar In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link. View Calendar The Calendar spans all courses and displays information for each of your enrolled courses and groups. In the navigation bar, you can choose to view the calendar in Week, Month, or Agenda view . The view you choose dictates the style of the calendar window . By default, the calendar appears in Month view. The sidebar shows a quick-view calendar, your list of courses and groups, and undated items for your courses and groups . To view the iCal feed link for exporting your Canvas calendar to other calendar apps, click the Calendar Feed link . Add Calendar Items Each calendar view shows any assignments or events that have been added to the calendar. To add to the calendar, click the Add button. As a student, you can add events , including recurring events , and to-do items to your personal calendar at any time in the navigation bar. As an instructor, you can add assignments and add course events , including recurring events and duplicate events for course sections . If your institution is using the Scheduler tool, you can also create Scheduler appointment groups . All users can add add personal events. View Calendar List Each personal, course, and group calendar is identified by a separate color that populates the calendar view. Associated calendar items for each course or group display when selected in the calendar view . By default, the first 10 course and group calendars will be selected and appear in the calendar view. To hide a calendar, click the box next to the name of the calendar . Calendars that are not active within the calendar view display as faded text . Note: Canvas will assign an arbitrary color for each calendar unless a custom color is chosen. Each calendar contains 15 default colors, but you can insert a Hex code to create any color of your choice. Colors set in Dashboard course cards also update in the calendar. View Undated Events List Expanding the Undated items link displays a list of events and assignments that are not dated. The assignments and events are differentiated by icons and by the personal, course, or group calendar color. To assign due dates to undated items as an instructor, drag and drop them into the Calendar. Note: The drag-and-drop functionality is available in the Week and Month calendar view, but not in the Agenda view. View Calendar by Month In the Month view, click the arrow buttons  to move from month to month. To view events for the current date, click the Today button . To view a specific date, click the month link  and enter a date in the date field  or select a date from the calendar . View Assignments and Events Calendar items display an icon next to the titles. The icon reflects the calendar item type: Discussion  Assignment  Quiz  Event  Non-graded items with a to-do date may display in the calendar for a course. Each item on the calendar is color-coded to match the courses or calendars in the sidebar. To view full details for an assignment or event, hover over the item . Calendar assignments can also be crossed out , which is a simple way to keep track of assignments. Assignments are crossed out once the assignment has been submitted. In an instructor's calendar, assignments are crossed out when the due date has passed and all submissions have been graded. Note: Assignments that have been awarded a grade but do not contain an actual submission are not crossed out. View|Document Title: How do I use the Calendar

are crossed out when the due date has passed and all submissions have been graded. Note: Assignments that have been awarded a grade but do not contain an actual submission are not crossed out. View All-Day Events All-day events display the Events icon and do not include a specific event time. If you want to extend an all-day event across multiple days, hover over the edge of the event until you see a black arrow. Drag your event across all required dates in the current month. View Varied Due Dates If a course has sections or individual students with varied assignment due dates, you will see the same assignment shown multiple times. Depending on the assignment setup, the assignment may appear on the same date or on multiple dates. Students will only see their specific assignment due date. View Calendar by Week To view the calendar by week, click the Week button. The Week view shows all calendar items by date and time. Note: Some assignments may be due at 11:59 pm; these display at the bottom of the calendar view. View All-Day Events All-day events appear at the top of the calendar week. These events do not include a specific event time. Like in the Month view, if you want to extend an all-day event across multiple days, hover over the edge of the event until you see a black arrow. Drag your event across all required dates. In Week view, you can only drag your event to the end of the week that you are viewing. View Calendar Agenda To view all your calendar items in an agenda format, click the Agenda button. Find Appointments If you are a student and your institution has enabled Scheduler appointment groups, you can sign up for an appointment in the Calendar sidebar . Click the Find Appointment button. View Scheduler If you are an instructor and your institution has enabled Scheduler, you can manage Scheduler events directly in each course calendar. To add an appointment group, click the Add button  and select the Appointment Group tab . Once created, the appointment group will display in your calendar. You can view or edit groups and remove students directly from the course calendar as well.

input: After opening the Calendar in the Global Navigation, where can I find the Calendar Feed link in the sidebar?
expected_output:
1. Open the Calendar via Global Navigation.  
2. In the left sidebar you’ll see:  
   - A mini‐calendar  
   - Your Courses & Groups list  
   - The Undated Items section  
3. Directly below Undated Items you’ll find the **Calendar Feed** link.

input: What are the steps to create a recurring event in the Canvas Calendar, including filling in the From/To fields, choosing the recurrence frequency, and adding the title, location, and description?
expected_output:
1. Open Calendar  
   In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link.  

2. Initiate a new event  
   • Click the date cell where you want the event to start, or click the “+” (Add) icon.  

3. Add basic details  
   • Title – Enter your event title in the Title field.  
   • Date – If not already populated, enter or select the date.  

4. Set start/end times  
   • From/To – Use the drop-downs or type in your start and end times. (Leave both blank for an all-day event.)  

5. Choose recurrence  
   • Frequency – Click the Frequency drop-down and select how often the event repeats (e.g., daily, weekly).  

6. Specify location  
   • Location – Enter a location or address for your event.  

7. Add a description (optional)  
   • Click More Options to open the Rich Content Editor, then type any event details or paste resource links.  

8. Verify calendar selection  
   • Calendar – Ensure your personal calendar is selected in the Calendar drop-down.  

9. Submit  
   • Click Submit to save your recurring event.
context:
Document Title: How do I add an event to my personal calendar

How do I add an event to my personal calendar? You can add a personal reminder to your own Calendar for an upcoming event. Note: As a student, you can also add a to-do item to your Calendar.  Open Calendar In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link. Add Event Click any date on the calendar to add an event . Or, click the arrows next to the month name to navigate to a different month  and select a date. If you don't want to manually locate the date, you can click the Add icon . Add Event Details Enter a title for the event in the Title field . Depending on how you added your event, the date may be populated for you. If not, enter a date in the Date field . The calendar times may also be populated for you in the From and To fields . To edit, use the drop-down menus or enter the start and end time for your event. To create an all-day event, leave the From and To fields blank so there is no start or end time for your event. To select repeating options for creating recurring events , click the Frequency drop-down menu . If a location is required, enter a location for the event . To make sure you are adding the event to your personal calendar, view or click the Calendar drop-down menu . More Options To add a detailed description, location, or address to your event, click the More Options button. Use the Rich Content Editor to add content or resource links. Submit Event Click the Submit button.

input: In Canvas Calendar, how do I title an event 'Study Sessions', set its start and end times, and schedule it to repeat weekly?
expected_output:
1. Open Calendar  
   – In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link.  
2. Add a new event  
   – Click the date you want or click the Add (＋) icon.  
3. Title your event  
   – In the Title field, type “Study Sessions.”  
4. Set start and end times  
   – Use the From and To drop-down menus to select your session’s start and end times.  
5. Schedule weekly repeats  
   – Click the Frequency drop-down menu and select Weekly.  
6. (Optional) Verify calendar  
   – Ensure your personal calendar is selected in the Calendar drop-down.  
7. Submit  
   – Click Submit to save your recurring Study Sessions.

input: How can an instructor schedule single or recurring events in the Canvas Calendar with a date, time, and description?
expected_output:
Step-by-Step: Scheduling Single or Recurring Events in Canvas Calendar

1. Open Calendar  
   – In Global Navigation, click Calendar.

2. Select Course Calendar  
   – In the left sidebar, make sure the checkbox next to your course is checked.

3. Choose Date  
   – Click the desired date on the calendar  
   – Or click the “+” (Add) icon, then pick a date.

4. Enter Event Details  
   – Title: Type your event name.  
   – Date & Time:  
     • By default, “From” fields may auto-populate.  
     • To set times, use the dropdowns or type start/end times.  
     • To make it all day, leave “From” fields blank.  
   – Location (optional): Type a location or conferencing link.

5. Set Recurrence (if needed)  
   – In Frequency, choose None (single) or a recurring pattern (daily, weekly, etc.).

6. Choose Calendar  
   – In the Calendar dropdown, select your course calendar.

7. Add Description  
   – Click More Options to open the Rich Content Editor.  
   – Enter event details, links, or attachments.

8. Submit  
   – Click Submit to save your single or recurring event.  
   – To edit later, click the event on the calendar and choose Edit.
context:
Document Title: How do I add an event to a course calendar

How do I add an event to a course calendar? As an instructor, you can add a Canvas event to a course calendar. A Canvas event is a non-graded Canvas activity . Events you create on the Calendar will not appear in the Assignments page or in the Gradebook. But they will show up on the Syllabus page and student calendars. You can create events with due date times as well as all-day events. For example, you may create a course event with a link to the readings that you want students to do in preparation for a class discussion in the Calendar. You will not grade students on whether or not they have done the reading, but you are providing the readings on a specific day to help them organize their time more efficiently. You can also create a recurring event . Note: Events that include a conferencing link in the description or location field display a Join button on students' List View Dashboard. Both instructors and students can add personal events to their own calendars.  Open Calendar In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link. Add Event Make sure  the checkbox of the course in which you're making an event is selected . Click any date on the calendar to add an event . Or, click the arrows next to the month name to navigate to a different month  and select a date. If you don't want to manually locate the date, you can click the Add icon . Add Event Details Enter a title for the event . Depending on how you added your event, the date may be populated for you. If not, enter a date in the date field . The calendar times may also be populated for you in the From fields . To edit, use the dropdown or enter the start and end time for your event. To create an all-day event, leave the From fields blank so there is no start and end time for your event. In the Frequency drop-down menu, you can set recurring calendar events . You can enter a location . In the Calendar drop-down menu , select the course calendar . Submit Event To add additional details to your event, click the More Options button . You can use the Rich Content Editor to add a description or resource links. If you only want to create the event as a placeholder and add details later, click the Submit button . You can edit your event at any time.

input: After selecting a calendar date and checking my course box in Canvas, how can I leave the start and end time fields blank when creating a non-graded syllabus event?
expected_output:
1. In Calendar, click the date for your event (ensure your course checkbox is selected).  
2. In the Add Event dialog, enter your event title (and confirm the date).  
3. In the “From” fields, simply leave both start- and end-time boxes empty.  
4. Click Submit.  
   
Leaving the time fields blank creates an all-day, non-graded syllabus event.

input: Can you outline the steps to add a calendar event in Canvas LMS? I need to open the Calendar, click the Add icon, enter a title and due date, select a course or group, sync with SIS, and then publish and submit it.
expected_output:
1. Open Calendar  
   - In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link.  

2. Click the Add icon  
   - The “+” icon appears in the upper-right corner of the calendar view.  

3. Enter title and due date  
   - Type your assignment or event title.  
   - Choose the due date from the date picker.  

4. Select course and group  
   - In the Calendar drop-down menu, pick the course.  
   - In the Group drop-down menu, choose the assignment group.  

5. (Optional) Sync to SIS  
   - If available, enable the Sync to SIS checkbox to push the assignment to your student information system.  

6. Publish the assignment  
   - Toggle the Publish icon on to make the assignment immediately visible to students (leave off to keep it unpublished).  

7. Submit or edit  
   - Click Submit to create the calendar event.  
   - Or click More Options to open the full assignment page and adjust additional details.
context:
Document Title: How do I add an assignment from the Calendar

How do I add an assignment from the Calendar? As an instructor, you can create assignment shells from the Calendar . Assignment shells are placeholders for the assignment until you fill in the assignment details. You can also create assignments with differing due dates for specific students. Note : Currently assignments added from the calendar are not validated against course or term start and end dates.  Open Calendar In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link. Add Assignment Click the Add icon. Enter Assignment Details Enter a title  and due date  for the new assignment. In the Calendar drop-down menu , select the course for the assignment. In the Group drop-down menu , select the assignment group. If your institution has enabled a student information system (SIS) integration, you can enable the assignment to sync to the SIS by selecting the Sync to SIS checkbox . To publish the assignment, toggle the Publish icon . If you choose not to publish, the assignment will still be created and remain unpublished. Submit Assignment To view the assignment page and edit the assignment details, click the More Options button . Otherwise, click the Submit button .

input: How do I create a calendar event in Canvas? Specifically, in the Global Navigation Calendar, after clicking "Add," how do I set the title, due date, course, group, enable SIS sync, and publish the event?
expected_output:
1. Open Calendar  
   In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link.  

2. Click Add  
   Click the “Add” (plus) icon in the upper-right corner of the calendar.  

3. Enter Title  
   Type your assignment or event title in the Title field.  

4. Set Due Date  
   Click the date selector and choose the desired due date (and time, if needed).  

5. Select Course  
   From the Calendar drop-down menu, choose the course where the assignment belongs.  

6. Select Assignment Group  
   From the Group drop-down, pick the appropriate assignment group for grading.  

7. Enable SIS Sync (optional)  
   If your institution’s SIS integration is enabled, select the Sync to SIS checkbox to push the assignment to the SIS.  

8. Publish Assignment  
   Toggle the Publish icon ON to make the assignment immediately available. If left OFF, the assignment will be created but remain unpublished.  

9. Save  
   • To finish quickly, click Submit.  
   • To open the full assignment editor (add instructions, points, attachments, etc.), click More Options.

input: After selecting the date and details in My To Do, how do I choose the course calendar from the drop-down menu?
expected_output:
1. In the My To Do tab, locate the “Calendar” drop-down menu (it’s below the Time field).  
2. Click the drop-down and scroll through the list of calendars.  
3. Select the name of the course calendar you want to associate with your to-do item.  
4. Finish adding any other details and click Submit.
context:
Document Title: How do I add a to do item in the Calendar

How do I add a to-do item in the Calendar? As a student, you can add a to-do item to your Calendar . You can also create to-do items from the Dashboard List View. Notes: To Do items are not included in the Calendar iCal feed . Your personal calendar must be selected before you can add a to-do item in the Calendar.  Open Calendar In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link. Add Event Click any date on the calendar to add an event . Or, click the arrows next to the month name to navigate to a different month  and select a date. If you don't want to manually locate the date, you can click the Add icon . Add To Do Details Click the My To Do tab . In the Title field , enter a title for the To Do . The Date field defaults to the current date . To change the date when you want to complete the item, type the new date or select a date by selecting the Calendar icon. If you want to set a specific time for the item, enter the time in the Time field . If no time is entered, the Time field defaults to 11:59 p.m. The To Do will associate with your personal calendar by default if your calendar is selected in the sidebar. You can also associate a To Do with a specific course. To select a course calendar for your To-Do item, click the Calendar drop-down menu . In the Details field , add any other details about your to-do item. Submit To Do Click the Submit button. View To Do View your to-do item in the calendar. You can also view your to-do item in the List View Dashboard . Manage To Do To edit or delete a to-do item, click the name of the item  and click the Edit button  or Delete button .

input: In Canvas Calendar's My To Do view, how can I set a specific completion time using the time field?
expected_output:
1. Open Calendar and click the date (or the Add icon) to open the event dialog.  
2. Select the My To Do tab.  
3. In the Time field, type your desired completion time (e.g., 2:00 PM).  
4. Complete any other fields and click Submit.
