input: How do I set up weekly recurring events in my Canvas calendar using the custom frequency option and specify how many times the event should occur?
expected_output:
1. Open Calendar  
   – In Global Navigation, click Calendar.  

2. Start a new event  
   – Click a date on the calendar (or click the Add icon and choose a date).  

3. Enter basic details  
   – Add Event Title, Start/End date & time, and Location.  

4. Choose custom frequency  
   – Click the Frequency drop-down and select Custom.  

5. Set up weekly recurrence  
   – In the Custom dialog, set “Repeats” to Weekly.  
   – Check the day(s) of the week you want the event to recur.  

6. Specify number of occurrences  
   – Under “Ends,” choose After and enter how many times the event should occur (up to 400).  
   – Click Done.  

7. (Optional) Add more details  
   – Click More Options to add a description, conferencing link, or attachments via the Rich Content Editor.  

8. Submit the event  
   – Click Submit.  

9. Verify on your calendar  
   – Confirm the event appears on each weekly date you specified.
context:
Document Title: How do I add a recurring event in a calendar

How do I add a recurring event in a calendar? When creating a new event, if you want to create the same event multiple times for yourself or for a group, you can create a recurring (or repeating) event. Repeating events creates multiple copies of the event every day, week, or month. For example, you may create a recurring group event for a weekly study group. This may help keep you organized and prepared for your course. If you are an instructor, you can also create duplicate calendar events for course sections . Tips for recurring events: Weekly events are repeated on the day of the week of the first event. For example, if an event is created on a Monday and repeats weekly, the next instance of the event will appear on the following Monday, regardless of the actual date.‬ ‪Monthly events are repeated on the day of the month of the first event. For example, if an event is created on July 6 and repeats monthly, the next instance of the event will appear on August 6. ‬ Note: Events that include a conferencing link in the description or location field display a Join button on each student's List View Dashboard.  Open Calendar In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link. Add Event Click any date on the calendar to add an event . Or, click the arrows next to the month name to navigate to a different month  and select a date. If you don't want to manually locate the date, you can click the Add icon . Select Frequency Enter a title, date, times, and location to create the event. To make the event repeat, click the Frequency drop-down menu. Note: For details on event options, learn about creating an event in your calendar or in a course calendar . Add Event Frequency In the Frequency drop-down menu, select from multiple repeating options, including no repeat , daily , weekly , monthly , annually , every weekday , or a custom frequency . Notes: Each frequency selection has an occurrence default: daily = 365 (days in a year) weekly = 52 (weeks in a year) monthly = 12 (months in a year) annually = 5 (The event will occur for five years) every weekday = 52 * 5 (weeks in a year * weekdays) Additionally, users can have a maximum of 400 occurrences. Add Event Custom Frequency To create a custom recurring event, select how often the event repeats , which day(s) it repeats on , and when it ends . Click the Done button . More Options To add event details such as a description, location, or address, click the More Options button. Use the Rich Content Editor to add content or resource links. Submit Event Click the Submit button. View Events View the events in your calendar. You can edit your event at any time.

input: How do I configure a recurring monthly 'Study Group' event on the Canvas Calendar to repeat on the same date each month?
expected_output:
1. Open Calendar  
   In Global Navigation, click Calendar.

2. Create the first event  
   Click the date you want your first “Study Group” meeting to occur.

3. Enter event details  
   – Title: Study Group  
   – Date & time  
   – Location (optional)

4. Set recurrence  
   Click Frequency and choose Monthly.  
   Canvas will repeat the event on the same day of the month as your first instance.

5. Define end criteria (optional)  
   – Leave default (12 occurrences) or choose Custom to set a specific end date or number of repeats.

6. Save  
   Click Submit.  
   Your “Study Group” will now appear on that date each month.

input: As an instructor in Canvas, how do I update an assignment’s due date and time in the Calendar—either by editing the assignment or by dragging and dropping?
expected_output:
1. Open Calendar  
   - In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link.  

2. Edit the assignment directly  
   a. Click the assignment event on the calendar.  
   b. In the pop-up, click Edit.  
   c. In the Edit Assignment window, update the Due Date and Time fields.  
   d. Click Submit.  

3. Or drag and drop to change the date  
   a. In Month View (or the mini-calendar), click and drag the assignment to your new date.  
   b. Release the mouse—Canvas updates the due date (the original time remains).  
   c. To change the due time, click the assignment and follow steps 2b–2d.
context:
Document Title: How do I edit or delete an event or assignment in the Calendar

How do I edit or delete an event or assignment in the Calendar? Using the Calendar , you can change the date of an Event or Assignment by clicking on the event or assignment or by dragging and dropping the event or assignment to a different date. You can also delete items from the Calendar. Please be aware that deleting a Calendar entry also deletes the associated content elsewhere in Canvas. Note: To edit an assignment from the Calendar, you must be an instructor.  Open Calendar In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link. Edit Event To edit or delete an event, click the event link . Then, to edit, click the Edit button . Alternatively, to delete the event, click the Delete button . Edit Event Details In the Edit Event window, you can edit the event title , date , specify a time range , change the frequency  and location . You can move the event to a different calendar using the Calendar drop-down menu . To add a location address or use the Rich Content Editor to add additional event details or links, click the More Options button . Otherwise, click the Submit button . Note: Events that include a conferencing link in the description or location field display a Join button on students' List View Dashboard. Confirm Repeating Events If you edited a repeating event, choose which event instances you want to change by selecting one of the following radio buttons: This event : change only the selected instance All events : change all the instances This and all following events : change the selected instance and all instances thereafter Then click the Confirm button . Edit To-do Item Details If you assign student to-do dates to a page or ungraded discussion, the item displays in the course calendar. You can edit the to-do item Title  and Date , and specify a time . To edit the discussion or page , click the More Options button . Otherwise, click the Submit button . Edit Assignment View assignment details by clicking the event you want to view  and clicking the Edit button . Edit Assignment Details You can edit the assignment title , due date , and assignment group . To edit assignment details , click the More Options button . Otherwise, click the Submit button . Note: If your institution has enabled a student information system (SIS) integration, you can manage the assignment to sync to the SIS by selecting the Sync to SIS checkbox. Edit Appointment Details When editing an appointment created in the Scheduler , the Edit Appointment menu displays. You can edit the description  or limit the amount of users for this appointment . To submit your changes, click the Update button . Drag and Drop Event or Assignment You can also change the date of an event or assignment in the same calendar by dragging and dropping the event or assignment to a different date on the month view or mini calendar . Click the event or assignment, drag to the new date, and release your mouse. You can add items from the Undated list to the course calendar by dragging and dropping the item to a desired calendar date . Adding items from the Undated item list to the calendar assigns them a due date and removes the item from the Undated list. The item displays on the student-specific List View dashboard and in the global and course home page to-do lists. Note: You cannot drag and drop appointments created in the scheduler. Manage Undated Items Undated events or assignments are listed in the Undated section. To view undated items, click the Undated Expand/Collapse icon . To assign a date to an undated itme, drag and drop undated assignments  to and from a day on the month view of the calendar . When undated assignments move to the calendar, the due date of the assignment changes to 11:59pm on that day. Moving events or assignments to the Undated section removes the due dates.

input: What default time does Canvas set when I drag an undated calendar assignment onto a date?
expected_output: Canvas automatically sets the due time to 11:59 PM on the day you drag an undated assignment onto the calendar.

input: How do I filter the Canvas Calendar by toggling course calendar color boxes to show only selected courses?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Calendar.  
2. On the Calendar page, locate the list of calendars on the left.  
3. Click a course’s colored box to toggle its events on or off.  
4. Only calendars with a filled color box will display on the main calendar.  
5. Repeat steps 3–4 to show only the courses you want (up to 10 at once).  
6. (Optional) To change a calendar’s color, click its More icon and enter a Hex code.
context:
Document Title: How do I filter the Calendar view by course

How do I filter the Calendar view by course? By default, the Calendar displays your personal calendar and course calendars for each class in which you are enrolled. However, you can filter which calendars display, including group and course calendars as well as your personal calendar.  Open Calendar In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link. View Calendar After clicking the Calendar link, you see the Calendar for all your enrolled courses and groups. Choose Courses to View To filter your Calendar by courses or groups, click the color box next to the Calendar . The calendar can display up to 10 courses and/or groups at a time. In this example, not all of the calendars are being shown. Note: Canvas assigns an arbitrary color for each calendar unless a custom color is chosen. Each calendar contains 15 default colors, but you can create any color of your choice by clicking the More icon  and inserting a Hex code .

input: How can I use the default color boxes or enter hex codes in the Canvas Calendar to display up to 10 course or group calendars?
expected_output:
1. Open Calendar  
   - In Global Navigation, click Calendar.  

2. Toggle course or group calendars  
   - In the left sidebar, locate each course or group name.  
   - Click its colored box to show (filled) or hide (outlined) that calendar.  

3. Choose a default color  
   - Click the colored box once to open the color picker.  
   - Select one of the 15 default swatches.  

4. Enter a custom Hex code  
   - In the color picker, click the More icon (•••).  
   - In the Hex field, type your six-digit code (e.g., #1A73E8) and press Enter.  

5. Note calendar limit  
   - Canvas displays up to 10 course and/or group calendars at a time.
context:

View Calendar After clicking the Calendar link, you see the Calendar for all your enrolled courses and groups. Choose Courses to View To filter your Calendar by courses or groups, click the color box next to the Calendar . The calendar can display up to 10 courses and/or groups at a time. In this example, not all of the calendars are being shown. Note: Canvas assigns an arbitrary color for each calendar unless a custom color is chosen. Each calendar contains 15 default colors, but you can create any color of your choice by clicking the More icon  and inserting a Hex code .

input: After adding sections, how do I create an event in the course calendar with specific dates and times for each section?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Calendar.  
2. Click the Add (+) icon, then click More Options.  
3. Enter an event title and location. In the Calendar menu, select your course.  
4. Check Use a different date for each section.  
5. For each section, click the Calendar icon (or type) to set its date and start/end time. Leave fields blank for sections that shouldn’t see the event.  
6. Click Create Event.  

Each section will now display its own event on the course calendar.
context:
Document Title: How do I set a different event date for each section in a course

How do I set a different event date for each section in a course calendar? If you are an instructor and your course has sections, you can set different event dates for each section in the Calendar . Notes: You need to add sections to your course before you can set a different date for an event for each section. You can also add duplicate calendar events for course sections .  Open Calendar In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link. Add Event Click the Add icon. View More Options Add a title  and location for the event . The date and time fields are automatically populated based on the current date but do not need to be removed. In the Calendar drop-down menu , select the course calendar for the event. To add different dates for each section, click the More Options button . Use Different Date Click the Use a different date for each section checkbox. Set Section Dates The default date is removed and replaced with all the sections in your course. For each section, type in a date, or select a date by clicking the Calendar icon , and specify the start and end time . If you don't want one section to see the event, leave the date and time fields blank. Create Event Click the Create Event button. View Events View the events in your course calendar. Each section will have a separate Calendar event. Notes: Events that include a conferencing link in the description or location field display a Join button on students' List View Dashboard. You cannot edit the Location field when editing separate events. The Location field can only be edited by editing the main calendar event.

input: How do I add a course event in the Canvas Calendar, enable per-section dates, and assign times to each section?
expected_output:
1. Open Calendar  
   In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link.  

2. Add a new event  
   Click the “+” (Add) icon in the top-right corner of the Calendar.  

3. Open full event options  
   In the event pop-up, click More Options.  

4. Enter basic details  
   – Title: Type your event name  
   – Location: (Optional) Type a location  
   – Calendar: From the Calendar drop-down, select your course  

5. Enable per-section dates  
   Check Use a different date for each section. The default date/time fields will be replaced by a list of your course sections.  

6. Assign dates and times  
   For each section:  
   – Click the calendar icon or type in a date  
   – Specify start and end times  
   (If you don’t want a section to see the event, leave its fields blank.)  

7. Create the event  
   Click Create Event.  

8. Verify in calendar  
   Each section now has its own event on the course calendar under the dates/times you assigned.

input: How can I add calendar events in my Canvas course with different dates for each section and set them to repeat or duplicate?
expected_output:
1. Open Calendar  
   – In Global Navigation, click Calendar.  
   – Ensure your course’s checkbox is selected in the calendar list.  

2. Create a new event  
   – Click the date you want or click the Add icon (+).  
   – In the Add Event pop-up, choose your course calendar.  
   – Click More Options.  

3. Set different dates per section  
   – Check “Use a different date for each section.”  
   – For each section, enter or pick a date and start/end time.  
   – Leave any section blank to hide the event from that section.  

4. Enable duplication (recurrence)  
   – Check “Duplicate.”  
   – In the Frequency menu, choose Daily, Weekly, or Monthly.  
   – Adjust the number of additional occurrences (up to 200).  
   – (Optional) Check “Count” to append numbering to each title.  

5. Finalize  
   – Review all dates and duplication settings.  
   – Click Create Event.  

All events will appear independently in the course calendar. To modify any occurrence, edit it separately.
context:
Document Title: How do I add and duplicate an event for course sections in the

How do I add and duplicate an event for course sections in the Calendar? When creating a calendar event as an instructor, if you want to create the same event multiple times for a course, you can create a duplicate event. Duplicating events creates multiple copies of the event every day, week, or month. For example, you may create a duplicate course event for student study groups every week. You will not grade students on whether or not they have participated in the study group, but you are providing a resource activity on a specific day to help them organize their time and prepare for your course more efficiently. Once created in a course calendar, duplicate events are not linked together and are independent events. Therefore, if users need to modify an event, each event has to be modified individually. Additionally, duplicate events can only be created when creating a new event; editing an existing event does not display the duplicate option. You can also create recurring calendar events . Tips for duplicate events: Weekly events are duplicated on the day of the week of the first event. For instance, if an event is created on a Monday and repeats weekly, the next instance of the event will appear on the following Monday, regardless of the actual date.‬ ‪Monthly events are duplicated on the day of the month of the first event. For instance, if an event is created on July 6 and repeats monthly, the next instance of the event will appear on August 6. ‬ Note: Events that include a conferencing link in the description or location field display a Join button on students' List View Dashboard.  Open Calendar In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link. Add Event Make sure the checkbox of the course in which you're making an event is selected . Click any date on the calendar to add an event . Or, click the arrows next to the month name to navigate to a different month  and select a date. If you don't want to manually locate the date, you can click the Add icon . View More Options Add a title  and location for the event . The date and time fields are automatically populated based on the current date but do not need to be removed. In the Calendar drop-down menu , select the course calendar for the event. To add different dates for each section, click the More Options button . Use a Different Date Click the Use a different date for each section checkbox. Set Section Dates The default date is removed and replaced with all the sections in your course. For each section, type in a date, or select a date by clicking the Calendar icon , and specify the start and end time . If you don't want one section to see the event, leave the date and time fields blank. Note: When the Use a different date for each section checkbox is selected, the Frequency drop-down menu is removed. Duplicate Event Click the Duplicate checkbox. Note: If you cannot see the checkbox, you selected the wrong course calendar when creating the new event. Add Duplicate Details By default, events are set to repeat every week . If you want to change the repeating event to daily or monthly, click the Week(s) drop-down menu and select your preferred time range. You may also have to change the number that precedes the time period. By default, events are set to create one occurrence , meaning it will create the initial event plus one additional (two total events). If you want to change the number of additional occurrences, enter the number in the text field. The calendar event supports up to 200 additional occurrences. If you want to automatically add a number to the end of each event title (such as Event 1, Event 2, etc.), click the Count checkbox . Create Event Click the Create Event button. View Events View the events in your course calendar. Remember, once created, duplicate events are not linked together and are independent events. Therefore, if you need to modify an event, each event has to be edited individually.

input: How can I create weekly duplicate events in Canvas Calendar, set different dates for each section with specific occurrence numbers and counts, and manage separate edits for each event?
expected_output:
1. Open Calendar  
   – In Global Navigation, click Calendar.

2. Add a new event  
   – Select the correct course calendar.  
   – Click any date (or the Add icon) and choose More Options.

3. Set section-specific dates  
   – Check Use a different date for each section.  
   – Enter or pick dates/times for each section.

4. Enable weekly duplicates  
   – Check Duplicate.  
   – In the drop-down next to “Week(s),” select 1 week.

5. Specify occurrence count  
   – Enter how many additional occurrences you want (up to 200).  
   – Optionally check Count to append numbers to each title.

6. Create the event  
   – Click Create Event.

7. Manage edits  
   – Each duplicate is independent—edit or delete each event separately.

input: How do I subscribe to my Canvas calendar in Google Calendar using the ICS feed, and what should I know about syncing updates, unsubscribing, re-importing, and any limits or delays?
expected_output:
Step-by-step: Subscribe via ICS feed in Google Calendar  
1. In Canvas  
   a. Click Calendar in Global Navigation.  
   b. Click Calendar Feed.  
   c. Copy the URL in the Calendar Feed field—or click “Click to view Calendar Feed” and save the .ics file.  

2. In Google Calendar  
   a. Log in to your Google (or Google Apps for Education) account.  
   b. On the left, click the “+” next to Other calendars.  
   c. To subscribe dynamically, choose From URL, paste the Canvas feed URL, and click Add calendar.  
   d. To import once, choose Import, select your saved .ics file, pick a calendar, and click Import.  

Key notes and troubleshooting  
• Sync timing: Google Calendar polls the feed roughly every 24 hours—Canvas updates may not appear immediately.  
• Event range: Only past 30 days and up to 366 days in the future are included.  
• Item limit: The feed holds a maximum of 1,000 events/assignments.  
• No To-Do items: Tasks aren’t included in the iCal feed.  
• Re-importing: If you join a new course, you must re-copy the feed URL (or re-download and re-import the .ics) to include its calendar.  
• Unsubscribing: In Google Calendar’s Other calendars, click the three-dot menu beside the Canvas calendar and choose Unsubscribe or Remove.
context:
Document Title: How do I subscribe to the Calendar feed using Google Calendar

How do I subscribe to the Calendar feed using Google Calendar? You can import your Canvas calendar to Google Calendar. The calendar feed contains events and assignments from all of your Canvas calendars. The steps in this lesson are also relevant for those using Gmail via Google Apps for Education. Google Apps for Education provides an Institution Email Account to those institutions participating in the program. To learn more, visit the Google Edu website . Once you have subscribed to the calendar feed, you can remove or unsubscribe from the calendar feed at any time. Notes: Future events up to 366 days in the future, and past events within 30 days, are included when exporting a Canvas calendar to Google Calendar. The calendar feed includes up to 1,000 items. Google Calendar periodically updates but may take up to 24 hours to sync with the Canvas Calendar. Canvas update may not be immediately visible in Google Calendar. To Do items are not included in the Calendar iCal feed. After you import your calendar feed and are enrolled in a new course, you must re-import your calendar feed to include the new course calendar.  Open Calendar In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link. Open Calendar Feed Click the Calendar Feed link. Copy Calendar Feed To copy the link, copy the text in the URL field . To download the feed as an ICS file, click the Click to view Calendar Feed link . Log in to Google Account In a new browser, log in to your Google Account. Note: If you are participating in Google Apps for Education, log in to your Institution Email Account to subscribe to the Calendar Feed. Locate Calendar Click the Calendar link. View Calendar Your calendar displays your calendars  and other calendars . Add Other Calendars Click the Other Calendars Add icon . To paste a copied calendar feed, click the From URL link . To import a downloaded ICS file, click the Import link . Add Calendar by URL Take the copied URL from Canvas and paste it into the URL of calendar field . Click the Add Calendar button . Add Calendar by File To import a downloaded ICS file, click to select the file . Then click the Import button .

input: How can I copy my Canvas calendar feed and add it to my Google Calendar using a URL or an ICS file?
expected_output:
1. In Canvas, open your Calendar  
2. Click the “Calendar Feed” link (upper-right)  
3. To use a URL:  
   a. Copy the URL in the “Calendar Feed” field  
4. To use an ICS file:  
   a. Click “Click to view Calendar Feed”  
   b. Save the .ics file to your computer  
5. Open Google Calendar and sign in  
6. Under “Other Calendars,” click the plus (+) icon  
7. To add by URL:  
   a. Select “From URL”  
   b. Paste the Canvas feed URL into the field  
   c. Click “Add Calendar”  
8. To add by file:  
   a. Select “Import”  
   b. Choose the downloaded .ics file  
   c. Select the target calendar and click “Import”  
9. Allow up to 24 hours for Canvas updates to sync in Google Calendar

input: How do I enable the Scheduler in my Canvas calendar and set up appointment groups so students or observers can sign up?
expected_output:
1. Verify Scheduler availability  
   • In Global Navigation, go to Account > Settings > Feature Options.  
   • If Scheduler isn’t enabled, ask your Canvas administrator to turn on the Scheduler tool.

2. Open Calendar and start a new appointment group  
   1. Click the Calendar link in Global Navigation.  
   2. In the Calendars list, check the calendar(s) where you want the group to appear.  
   3. Click a date on the calendar (or click the “+” icon) and select the Appointment Group tab.

3. Configure basic details  
   • Name: enter an appointment title.  
   • Location: enter where the appointment will occur.

4. Select calendars  
   • Click Select Calendars, check the course(s) or section(s), then click Done.  
   • (To add more later, reopen the appointment group and click Select Calendars again.)

5. Enable sign-up options  
   • For student groups: check Have students sign up in groups and choose a group category (course-wide only).  
   • For observers: check Allow observers to sign-up (if enabled by your admin).

6. Set date, time range, and slots  
   1. Enter or pick the appointment Date.  
   2. Enter a Time Range (e.g., 2:00 pm–5:00 pm).  
   3. In Slots, type the slot length in minutes (e.g., 15) and click Go.  
   4. (Optional) Remove or adjust individual slots before publishing.

7. Adjust appointment options  
   • Limit each time slot: check and set max attendees or groups.  
   • Allow students to see who’s signed up: check to make sign-ups public.  
   • Limit total appointments per user: check and enter a number if desired.

8. Add details and publish  
   • Enter any instructions or notes in the Details field.  
   • Click Publish.  

Result: Your appointment times display on the course calendar. Students (and observers, if allowed) can now sign up for available slots.
context:
Document Title: How do I add an appointment group in a course calendar

How do I add an appointment group in a course calendar? For the Canvas for Elementary feature, if Scheduler is enabled for your institution and you are an instructor, you can create appointment groups in the Scheduler. Appointment groups create a block of time where students can meet with you. Students can sign up for appointment times in their own calendars. You can also allow observers to sign up. Appointments display in your calendar after a student or group has reserved a time slot. Appointment details are also included when you export the calendar using the Calendar feed. Notes: If user participation is limited to dates between the course start and end dates , Scheduler events cannot be edited or deleted after the date the course ends. The Scheduler tool is optional. If it is not already enabled for your account, please contact your Canvas administrator. When an instructor or TA creates an appointment group for an entire course, all course section users can view the appointment group. However, if an appointment group is made for a specific section or is added by a section-restricted instructor or TA, only users in that section can view the appointment group.  Open Calendar In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link. Add Event In the Calendars list, click the checkbox for the calendar in which you want to add the appointment group . Appointment groups can be added to multiple calendars. Click any date on the calendar to add an event . Or, click the arrows next to the month name to navigate to a different month  and select a date. If you don't want to manually locate the date, you can click the Add icon . Open Appointment Group Click the Appointment Group tab. Create Name and Location Type the name of the appointment in the name field . Type the location of the appointment in the location field . Select Calendars Click the Select Calendars button . To select the course(s) or section(s) where you want to show the appointment group, click the checkbox next to the course name or section name . To close the Calendar list, click the Done button . If you want to select certain sections from your course, click the arrow icon . Notes: The calendar cannot be modified once the appointment group is saved. However, additional calendars can be added to the original appointment group. If the course or section you want to select does not display in the Select Calendars list, return to the calendar and click the checkbox for the course or section in the Calendars list. Allow Group Signup If you have created at least one group set in your course, you can have students sign up in groups by clicking the Have students sign up in groups checkbox . Then select the name of the group category you want to use for the group signup . Note: The groups option is only available if you previously selected the calendar for the entire course. You cannot select a calendar for a specific section because Canvas does not currently support sections in groups. Allow Observer Signup To allow observers to sign-up for appointments, click the Allow observers to sign-up checkbox. Note: You can only allow observers to sign up if your admin has enabled the Allow observers to sign-up for appointments when enabled by the teacher option in account Settings. Set Appointment Time Range Enter the date of the appointment in the Date field . You can also select a date by clicking the Calendar icon. Set the time range for the appointment by typing in the Time Range field . You must include at least one time slot. You can split the time range into multiple time slots by entering the division length into the slots field . For instance, if you want to create 15-minute meeting times from 2:00 pm until 5:00 pm, enter the number 15. To create the time slots, click the Go button . Modify Appointment Times You can manually change any appointment time created by the division. If you want to remove an appointment time, click the Remove icon. Notes: The appointment date, time range, and appointment slots cannot be modified after the appointment group is saved. However, additional dates, time ranges, and appointment slots can be added to the original appointment group. You must|Document Title: How do I add an appointment group in a course calendar

and appointment slots cannot be modified after the appointment group is saved. However, additional dates, time ranges, and appointment slots can be added to the original appointment group. You must create at least one time slot for each appointment group. Set Appointment Options You can limit the number of users who can sign up for a time slot by clicking the Limit each time slot checkbox and typing the number of time slots in the limit field . If you selected the option to have students sign up in groups, this field reads as Limit each time slot for x groups . To make the appointment slots public to students in the course, click the Allow students to see who has signed up for time slots that are still available checkbox . Selecting this option also allows students to see comments other students add to their appointments. If you want to limit the number of appointments available, click the Limit participants to attend [number] appointment(s) checkbox . Note: When using the group sign-up option, only one group member needs to sign up for a time slot on behalf of their group. Each member in the group will see the appointment on their own group calendar. Add Appointment Details If you want to add details about the appointment group, enter them in the Details field. Publish Appointment Group Click Publish button. View Calendar View the appointment dates and times in your course calendar. Students can reserve time slots . Observers, if allowed, can also reserve time slots. Time slots that have been reserved by users display as a solid color. Note: If you added an appointment group to more than one course, appointment slots only display in the calendar for the first course shown in the appointment group.

input: How do I configure the Scheduler appointment group in Canvas to set the date and time range, slot length, and auto-generate slots?
expected_output:
1. Open Calendar  
   – In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link.  
2. Add an Appointment Group  
   – In the Calendars list, check the calendar(s) you want.  
   – Click any date (or the + icon) and select the Appointment Group tab.  
3. Set Date and Time Range  
   – In the Date field, pick your appointment date.  
   – In the Time Range field, type the start and end times (e.g., 2:00 pm – 5:00 pm).  
4. Define Slot Length and Auto-Generate Slots  
   – In the Slots field, enter the division length in minutes (for 15-minute slots, enter 15).  
   – Click Go to auto-generate all time-block slots.  
5. Publish  
   – Review your slots, click Publish.  

Students (and observers, if enabled) can now sign up for available slots in their own calendars.

Note: You can only allow observers to sign up if your admin has enabled the Allow observers to sign-up for appointments when enabled by the teacher option in account Settings. Set Appointment Time Range Enter the date of the appointment in the Date field . You can also select a date by clicking the Calendar icon. Set the time range for the appointment by typing in the Time Range field . You must include at least one time slot. You can split the time range into multiple time slots by entering the division length into the slots field . For instance, if you want to create 15-minute meeting times from 2:00 pm until 5:00 pm, enter the number 15. To create the time slots, click the Go button . Modify Appointment Times You can manually change any appointment time created by the division. If you want to remove an appointment time, click the Remove icon. Notes: The appointment date, time range, and appointment slots cannot be modified after the appointment group is saved. However, additional dates, time ranges, and appointment slots can be added to the original appointment group. You must|Document Title: How do I add an appointment group in a course calendar

and appointment slots cannot be modified after the appointment group is saved. However, additional dates, time ranges, and appointment slots can be added to the original appointment group. You must create at least one time slot for each appointment group. Set Appointment Options You can limit the number of users who can sign up for a time slot by clicking the Limit each time slot checkbox and typing the number of time slots in the limit field . If you selected the option to have students sign up in groups, this field reads as Limit each time slot for x groups . To make the appointment slots public to students in the course, click the Allow students to see who has signed up for time slots that are still available checkbox . Selecting this option also allows students to see comments other students add to their appointments. If you want to limit the number of appointments available, click the Limit participants to attend [number] appointment(s) checkbox . Note: When using the group sign-up option, only one group member needs to sign up for a time slot on behalf of their group. Each member in the group will see the appointment on their own group calendar. Add Appointment Details If you want to add details about the appointment group, enter them in the Details field. Publish Appointment Group Click Publish button. View Calendar View the appointment dates and times in your course calendar. Students can reserve time slots . Observers, if allowed, can also reserve time slots. Time slots that have been reserved by users display as a solid color. Note: If you added an appointment group to more than one course, appointment slots only display in the calendar for the first course shown in the appointment group.

input: How do I open Canvas Calendar appointment group details to edit the title, time slots, and location?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Calendar.  
2. Locate your appointment group and click any of its time slots.  
3. In the pop-up appointment window, click Group Details.  
4. On the Appointment Group page, edit:  
   • Title – change the group name in the Title field  
   • Time slots – click Time Block to add new blocks or slots (existing dates/times can’t be changed)  
   • Location – update the Location field  
5. (Optional) Adjust other group options or details as needed.  
6. Click Save to apply your changes.
context:
Document Title: How do I view or edit an appointment group in a course calendar

How do I view or edit an appointment group in a course calendar? If you are an instructor who previously created an appointment group in the Scheduler , you can view and edit existing appointment group descriptions or the number of people that can use the slot. You can also send messages to students in a group or to individual students who have signed up for a time slot. Notes: Dates and times cannot be edited on individual appointment slots. The Scheduler tool is optional. If it is not already enabled for your account, please contact your Canvas administrator. When an instructor or TA creates an appointment group for an entire course, all course section users can view the appointment group. However, if an appointment group is made for a specific section or is added by a section-restricted instructor or TA, only users in that section can view the appointment group. If user participation is limited to dates between the course start and end dates , appointments cannot be edited or deleted after the date the course ends.  Open Calendar In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link. View Appointment Group Locate the appointment group in your calendar. Appointment slots that have been reserved are shown in a solid color. Open Appointment Group To open the appointment group, click any time slot in the appointment group . In the appointment window, click the Group Details button . Edit Appointment Group Details In the appointment group page, you can view the course associated with the appointment group , and you can edit the group details. For each appointment group, you can edit the name of the group in the Title field . You can add new appointment group sets and additional time slots to the entire group in the Time Block field , and you can add or modify the assignment group location , group details , and group options . Learn more about creating an appointment group . Notes: You cannot edit or delete existing time slots. The option to have students sign up in groups can only be selected when an appointment group is created. View Appointment Slots At the bottom of the Appointment Group details page, you can view all appointments in the group . Each time slot shows the date and time and whether or not the time slot is available or reserved . You can also view the name of each student who signed up for the time slot . If a time slot has been reserved by a student but also includes the word Available , the time slot includes an additional slot that can be filled by another student. Message Students If you want to send a message to students in the appointment group, click the Message Students button. Enter Message Details In the Message Students window, click the Sent a message to drop-down menu and select a group of students to message . You can send a message to the following students: all users in the appointment group users who haven't signed up for a time slot users who have signed up Enter a message in the Message field . Click the Send button . Note: Messages are sent as individual messages. Manage Appointment Group To delete the appointment group, click the Delete Group button . To cancel changes in the assignment group, click the Cancel button . To save changes in the assignment group, click the Save button . Note: Deleting a group does not provide a warning and cannot be undone. This action also deletes any appointments that have been reserved by students. Manage Appointment Slot In the calendar, you can manage time slots individually. To view details about a time slot, including who signed up in the time slot, click the appointment link . If you want to edit a specific time slot, click the Edit button . Editing a time slot allows you to edit the description of the appointment. You can also limit the slot to a specific number of users. Changing either of these values in an individual time slot does not affect the description or user signup limit for the entire group. For instance, if the assignment group limited each slot to one user, and you individually edit a specific time slot to allow three users, only that time slot is affected by the user limit change. In time slots that have been reserved, you can send a message|Document Title: How do I view or edit an appointment group in a course calendar

one user, and you individually edit a specific time slot to allow three users, only that time slot is affected by the user limit change. In time slots that have been reserved, you can send a message to the user(s) in the time slot . Note: Dates and times cannot be edited on individual appointment slots Remove Attendees If you want to retain the appointment time slot but need to cancel with the specific student, click the Remove icon. Confirm Removal Type the reason for cancellation in the Reason for deletion field . Click the Delete button . Delete Time Slot If you need to remove the entire time slot, click the Delete button. Confirm Deletion Click the Delete button.

input: How can I open an appointment group in the Canvas Calendar and send individual messages to the students who have signed up?
expected_output:
1. Open the Calendar  
   – In Global Navigation, click Calendar.  

2. Locate and open the appointment group  
   – Find any time slot in the group and click it.  
   – In the pop-up, click Group Details.  

3. Message all signed-up students  
   – Click Message Students.  
   – From the “Sent a message to” menu, choose Users who have signed up for a time slot.  
   – Enter your message and click Send.  

4. (Optional) Message an individual student  
   – In the Calendar, click the specific reserved time slot.  
   – In the appointment details, click Message Student.  
   – Enter your message and click Send.

input: How do I find and manage appointments in Canvas Calendar? For example, how can I click Calendar > Find Appointment, choose a course, reserve or comment, then confirm, reschedule, or un-reserve?
expected_output:
1. Open Calendar  
   – In Global Navigation, click Calendar.  

2. Find Appointment  
   – In the Calendar sidebar, click Find Appointment (only appears if Scheduler is enabled).  

3. Select Course  
   – Choose your course from the Course drop-down, then click Submit.  

4. View Available Slots  
   – Available times are solid; faded times are already reserved.  

5. Reserve a Slot  
   – Click your preferred time slot.  
   – (Optional) Enter comments for the instructor.  
   – Click Reserve. The slot will fade to show it’s yours.  

6. Reschedule (if needed)  
   – Click a different time slot.  
   – In the confirmation window, click Reschedule to switch your reservation.  

7. Cancel (Un-reserve)  
   – On your course calendar, click your reserved appointment.  
   – Click Un-reserve or Delete to cancel.
context:
Document Title: How do I sign up for an appointment in the Calendar

How do I sign up for an appointment in the Calendar? If your institution has enabled the Scheduler tool and you are a student, you can sign up for any appointments that are created for your course using the Calendar sidebar. Appointments can include office hours, group presentation time slots, and lunch with an alumnus. If you are an observer, you may also sign up for appointments if allowed by the instructor. If necessary, you can cancel appointments or change appointments. Note: Scheduler is an optional feature that may not be available to you.  Open Calendar In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link. Find Appointment In the Calendar sidebar, click the Find Appointment button. Notes: The Scheduler tool is an optional feature that must be enabled by your institution. If you do not see the Find Appointment button, your institution has not enabled this feature. When an instructor or TA creates an appointment group for an entire course, all course section users can view the appointment group. However, if an appointment group is made for a specific section or is added by a section-restricted instructor or TA, only users in that section can view the appointment group. Select Course If a course includes an appointment, the name of the course displays in the Course drop-down menu. Select the course where you want to look for an appointment , then click the Submit button . View Appointments View the appointments available for the course. Faded time slots indicate the time slot has been reserved. Reserve Appointment In the calendar, click the time slot you want to reserve . In the appointment window, you can view the appointment time, calendar, and details. If you want to leave any comments for your instructor, you can enter them in the Comments field . To sign up for the time slot, click the Reserve link . View Updated Appointments Once you have reserved a time slot, the time slot fades in the calendar. If you want to choose another time slot instead, click the new time slot and repeat the reservation process. Confirm New Appointment If you choose another time slot, the Calendar will confirm you already have a reserved appointment. If you want to reschedule with the new appointment time, click the Reschedule button . However, if you want to keep your original appointment, click the Do Nothing button . Close Appointments When you are finished with course reservations, click the Close button. View Calendar View the appointment added to your course calendar. Change Appointment To change your appointment, click the appointment on your course calendar. Unreserve Appointment To completely cancel your appointment, click the appointment time  and click the Un-reserve link . Delete Reservation Click the Delete button.

input: How can I gain Scheduler access and book section-specific appointments in Canvas when the Find Appointment button is missing?
expected_output:
1. Confirm Scheduler is enabled  
   – The Scheduler (Appointments) feature is optional and must be turned on at the account or sub-account level.  
   – If you don’t see the Find Appointment button in Calendar, contact your Canvas administrator or institutional support to enable the Scheduler tool.

2. Verify section-restricted appointments exist  
   – Instructors or TAs must create an appointment group and restrict it to your course section.  
   – If no section-specific group exists, ask your instructor/TA to set one up for your section.

3. Access and book your appointment  
   1. Open Calendar (Global Navigation → Calendar).  
   2. Click Find Appointment.  
   3. Select your course (and section, if prompted) and Submit.  
   4. Click an available time slot (non-faded).  
   5. (Optional) Enter comments, then click Reserve.  

4. Troubleshooting  
   – If Find Appointment remains hidden after Scheduler is enabled, clear your browser cache or try another browser.  
   – Ensure you’re enrolled in the section for which the appointment group was created.

input: How do I subscribe to my Canvas iCal in Outlook.com or the desktop app? Can you outline the steps and explain sync delays, item limits, exclusions, re-importing, and how to remove the subscription?
expected_output:
Here’s how to subscribe to your Canvas iCal feed in Outlook.com or the Outlook desktop app—and what you need to know about sync timing, limits, exclusions, re-imports, and removal.

1. Get your Canvas Calendar Feed  
  a. In Canvas Global Navigation, click Calendar.  
  b. Click the Calendar Feed link.  
  c. Copy the URL in the Calendar Feed field—or click “Click to view Calendar Feed” to download an .ics file.

2. Subscribe in Outlook.com  
  a. Sign in at Outlook.com and click the Calendar icon.  
  b. In the left sidebar, click Add calendar → Subscribe from web.  
  c. Paste your Canvas feed URL.  
  d. Name it, pick a color & icon, choose a calendar group, then click Import.

3. Import into Outlook desktop  
  a. Download the .ics file from Canvas (step 1c).  
  b. In Outlook’s File menu, choose Open & Export → Import/Export → “Import an iCalendar (.ics) or vCalendar file.”  
  c. Select the downloaded .ics file and choose whether to open as a new calendar or import into your existing one.

4. What to expect  
  • Sync delay: Outlook.com may take up to 24 hours to pick up Canvas updates—changes aren’t instantaneous.  
  • Item limits: Up to 1,000 items; includes events/assignments out to 366 days ahead and 30 days past.  
  • Exclusions: Student To-Do items are not included; appointment slot details require viewing in Canvas.  

5. Re-import after enrolling in new courses  
  Canvas doesn’t auto-add newly enrolled courses—repeat step 1 and re-subscribe or re-import to include them.

6. Remove the subscription  
  In Outlook.com, open your subscribed calendar in the sidebar, click the More Options (•••) icon, and choose Remove.  
  In Outlook desktop, right-click the calendar in the list and select Delete or Remove Calendar.
context:
Document Title: How do I subscribe to the Calendar feed using Outlook com

How do I subscribe to the Calendar feed using Outlook.com? You can subscribe to the Canvas Calendar Feed using the Outlook.com website. The calendar iCal feed contains events and assignments from all of your Canvas calendars, including reserved Scheduler appointment slots. Once you have subscribed to the calendar feed, you can remove the calendar feed at any time from Outlook.com by clicking the More Options icon and selecting the Remove option from the menu. You can also add and import calendars into the Outlook desktop program . Notes: Future events up to 366 days in the future, and past events within 30 days, are included when exporting a Canvas calendar to Outlook.com. The calendar feed includes up to 1,000 items. Outlook.com may take up to 24 hours to sync with the Canvas Calendar. Canvas updates may not be immediately visible in the Outlook.com calendar. If your institution/organization uses a Microsoft Exchange Server account, you can also subscribe to the calendar feed using the Outlook Web App in Exchange Server. This allows you to access your Outlook calendar online if you are away from your desktop. Please contact your IT administrator at your organization/institution for more information. For scheduler items, appointments must be viewed in the Canvas calendar for full appointment details. Student To Do items are not included in the Calendar iCal feed. After you import the calendar feed and you are enrolled in a new course, you must re-import the calendar feed to include the new course calendar.  Open Calendar In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link. Open Calendar Feed Click the Calendar Feed link. Copy Calendar Feed To copy the calendar feed link, copy the text in the URL field . To download the feed as an ICS file, click the Click to view Calendar Feed link . Open Outlook.com Calendar Open Outlook.com. In the sidebar, click the Calendar icon. Add Calendar In the sidebar, click the Add calendar link. Subscribe to Calendar from Web To subscribe to a calendar from the web, click the Subscribe from web link . To import a downloaded ICS file, click the Upload from file link . Paste Calendar Feed Link Paste the calendar feed link from Canvas in the calendar url field. Import Calendar Customize your calendar subscription with a calendar name , calendar color , and calendar charm (icon) . Select an option from the Add to drop-down menu . To import the calendar, click the Import button .

input: How do I subscribe to my Canvas calendar in Outlook.com and customize its name, color, and icon?
expected_output:
1. In Canvas, click Calendar in Global Navigation.  
2. Click Calendar Feed.  
3. Copy the URL in the field (or click “Click to view Calendar Feed” to download the ICS file).  
4. Go to Outlook.com and click the Calendar icon in the sidebar.  
5. Click Add calendar in the sidebar.  
6. Choose Subscribe from web  (or Upload from file if you downloaded the ICS).  
7. Paste your Canvas calendar URL into the Calendar URL field.  
8. Enter your desired Calendar name, pick a Color, and select a Charm (icon).  
9. Choose where to add the calendar from the Add to drop-down.  
10. Click Import.

input: How can I use the Canvas navigation links and the group sidebar option to view only my group calendar?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Groups.  
2. Select your group by clicking its name.  
3. In the group sidebar, click View Calendar.  

Only your group’s calendar will display. You can then add events or reminders as needed.
context:
Document Title: How do I view a group calendar

How do I view a group calendar? If you have been added to a student group, you can view the group calendar. Note: As an instructor, you can also view a student group calendar by navigating to the group homepage. Learn more about viewing group content as an instructor.  Open Groups In Global Navigation, click the Groups link , then click the name of the group . View Calendar In the Group sidebar, click the View Calendar link. Only your group calendar is visible in the list of Canvas calendars. Feel free to add events or reminders to your group calendar.

input: How do I add events or reminders to a group calendar using the View Calendar option in the Global Navigation menu or from the Canvas homepage?
expected_output:
1. Access your Calendar  
   - From Global Navigation, click the Calendar icon.  
   - Or from the Canvas Dashboard/Homepage, click the Calendar link.  

2. Select your Group Calendar  
   - In the left-hand Calendars list, expand Group Calendars and check your group’s name to display it.  

3. Create a new event or reminder  
   - Click the date (or click the “+” Event button in the top right).  
   - In the “Add Event” window, open the Calendar dropdown and select your group calendar.  

4. Enter event details  
   - Give the event a title.  
   - Set the date and time (or mark as an all-day event).  
   - (Optional) Add a description, location, or set it as a reminder.  

5. Save  
   - Click Save.  
   - Your event or reminder now appears on the group calendar for all members.
context:
Document Title: How do I view a group calendar

How do I view a group calendar? If you have been added to a student group, you can view the group calendar. Note: As an instructor, you can also view a student group calendar by navigating to the group homepage. Learn more about viewing group content as an instructor.  Open Groups In Global Navigation, click the Groups link , then click the name of the group . View Calendar In the Group sidebar, click the View Calendar link. Only your group calendar is visible in the list of Canvas calendars. Feel free to add events or reminders to your group calendar.

input: How do I open the Calendar in Canvas, subscribe or remove accounts from it, select dates using search or checkboxes, save my changes, set the header color, and apply the options?
expected_output:
1. Open the Calendar  
   • In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link.  

2. Subscribe to an Account Calendar  
   • In the Other Calendars section, click the Add icon.  
   • Use the Search Calendars field or click the checkbox next to each calendar name.  
   • Click Save Changes.  

3. Change a calendar’s color  
   • Next to the calendar name, click the Options icon.  
   • Choose one of the 15 default colors or enter a Hex code.  
   • Click Apply.  

4. Unsubscribe from an Account Calendar  
   • In Other Calendars, click the Remove icon next to the calendar you no longer want.
context:
Document Title: How do I view and manage Account Calendars

How do I view and manage Account Calendars?
In Canvas Calendars, you have the option to subscribe to Account Calendars in the Other Calendars section.
Open Calendar
In Global Navigation, click the
Calendar
link.
View Account Calendars
In the Other Calendars section, the Account Calendars you have subscribed to are displayed.
Notes:
You are not automatically added to Account Calendars and must subscribe to the Account Calendars to view important dates.
If your admin automatically subscribes you to an account calendar, it displays in the Other Calendars list.
Subscribe to Account Calendars
To subscribe to a new calendar, click the
Add
icon.
Add Additional Calendars
To subscribe to calendars, you can find calendars by using the
Search Calendars
field [1] or by clicking the checkbox next to the calendar's name [2]. Click the
Save Changes
button [3].
Manage Account Calendar Color
To change the color of the Account Calendar, click the
Options
icon next to the calendar name [1].
Note:
Each calendar contains 15 default colors, but you can create any color of your choice by inserting a Hex code [2]. To save your changes, click the
Apply
button [3].
Unsubscribe to Account Calendars
To unsubscribe from an Account Calendar, click the
Remove
icon.

input: After subscribing to a calendar using the 'Other Calendars' section in Canvas Calendar, how do I use the Options menu to insert and apply a hex color code?
expected_output:
1. Open Calendar  
   – In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link.  

2. Locate Your Calendar  
   – In the Other Calendars section, find the calendar you subscribed to.  

3. Open Options  
   – Click the Options (three-dot) icon next to the calendar name.  

4. Insert Hex Code  
   – In the color picker, enter your desired HEX code in the hex field.  

5. Apply Changes  
   – Click the Apply button to save your new calendar color.
context:
Document Title: How do I view and manage Account Calendars

How do I view and manage Account Calendars?
In Canvas Calendars, you have the option to subscribe to Account Calendars in the Other Calendars section.
Open Calendar
In Global Navigation, click the
Calendar
link.
View Account Calendars
In the Other Calendars section, the Account Calendars you have subscribed to are displayed.
Notes:
You are not automatically added to Account Calendars and must subscribe to the Account Calendars to view important dates.
If your admin automatically subscribes you to an account calendar, it displays in the Other Calendars list.
Subscribe to Account Calendars
To subscribe to a new calendar, click the
Add
icon.
Add Additional Calendars
To subscribe to calendars, you can find calendars by using the
Search Calendars
field [1] or by clicking the checkbox next to the calendar's name [2]. Click the
Save Changes
button [3].
Manage Account Calendar Color
To change the color of the Account Calendar, click the
Options
icon next to the calendar name [1].
Note:
Each calendar contains 15 default colors, but you can create any color of your choice by inserting a Hex code [2]. To save your changes, click the
Apply
button [3].
Unsubscribe to Account Calendars
To unsubscribe from an Account Calendar, click the
Remove
icon.

input: How can I get the iCal (ICS) URL from my Canvas course sidebar to subscribe to my Canvas calendar in Google Calendar? Are there any limits on how many days or events are displayed, and what should I know about re-importing the calendar?
expected_output:
1. Open your Canvas Calendar  
   - In Global Navigation, click Calendar.  
2. Access the iCal feed  
   - In the Calendar sidebar, click Calendar Feed.  
3. Copy or download the feed  
   - To copy the URL: highlight and copy the link in the URL field.  
   - To download an ICS file: click Click to view Calendar Feed and save the .ics file.  
4. Subscribe in Google Calendar  
   - Go to Google Calendar Settings → Add calendar → From URL, then paste the Canvas iCal URL.  
   - (Or use Settings → Import & export to import the .ics file.)  

Limits & notes  
- Exports include future events up to 366 days and past events within 30 days (maximum 1,000 items).  
- “To-Do” items are not included.  
- Whenever you enroll in a new course, re-import or re-subscribe to update your feed with new course events.
context:
Document Title: How do I view the Calendar iCal feed to subscribe to an external

How do I view the Calendar iCal feed to subscribe to an external calendar? The Calendar iCal feed is located in the sidebar of your Calendar. You can import the iCal feed URL into any calendar app that accepts the iCal format, such as Google Calendar , Apple Calendar, Outlook , and Yahoo Calendar. You can also download the calendar feed as an ICS file and import it into an external calendar. The calendar feed contains events and assignments from all of your Canvas calendars. Notes: Future events up to 366 days in the future, and past events within 30 days, are included when exporting a Canvas calendar to another calendar program. The calendar feed includes up to 1,000 items. To Do items are not included in the Calendar iCal feed. After you import your calendar feed and are enrolled in a new course, you must re-import your calendar feed to include the new course calendar.  Open Calendar In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link. Open Calendar Feed Click the Calendar Feed link. Copy Calendar Feed To copy the link, copy the text in the URL field . To download the feed as an ICS file, click the Click to view Calendar Feed link . To subscribe to an external calendar, paste the URL or import the ICS file.

input: How do I find the iCal feed URL for the Canvas Calendar in the sidebar and subscribe to it in Outlook to sync my events?
expected_output:
1. Open your Canvas Calendar  
   - In Global Navigation, click Calendar.  

2. Locate and copy the iCal feed URL  
   - In the Calendar sidebar, click Calendar Feed.  
   - In the URL field, select and copy the feed link.  

3. Subscribe in Outlook Desktop  
   a. In Outlook, go to File > Account Settings > Account Settings.  
   b. Select the Internet Calendars tab and click New.  
   c. Paste the Canvas iCal URL and click Add.  
   d. Optionally set a folder name and update frequency, then click OK.  

4. (Alternative) Subscribe in Outlook Web  
   a. Sign in at outlook.office.com.  
   b. In the Calendar pane, click Add calendar > Subscribe from web.  
   c. Paste the Canvas iCal URL, name the calendar, and click Import.  

Your Canvas events and assignments (up to 366 days ahead, 30 days back, max 1,000 items) will now sync to Outlook. Remember to re-import the feed if you enroll in new courses.

input: After selecting a date via the global navigation Calendar, how do I duplicate an event using More Options?
expected_output:
1. In Canvas, click the Calendar link in Global Navigation.  
2. Select the date where your original event appears.  
3. In the event detail pop-up, click the More Options button at the bottom.  
4. On the full-page event editor, click Duplicate Event.  
5. Configure how many copies to make and adjust dates/times as needed.  
6. Click Duplicate to save your duplicated event(s).
context:
Document Title: How do I add an event to the schedule in Canvas for Elementary

How do I add an event to the schedule in Canvas for Elementary? This lesson applies to users at institutions that have enabled the Canvas for Elementary user interface. A Canvas event is a non-graded Canvas activity . Events created on the Calendar appear in the Homeroom and subject Schedule tabs and student calendars. You can create events with due date times as well as all-day events. You can also duplicate an event . You can include Zoom, Microsoft Teams, WebEx, or Google Meet conferencing links in the event description or location. If a conferencing link is added to the event description or location, students can join the meeting from the Homeroom Schedule tab or subject's Schedule tab.  Open Calendar In Global Navigation, click the Calendar link. Add Event Click any date on the calendar to add an event . Or, click the arrows next to the month name to navigate to a different month  and select a date. If you do not want to manually locate the date, you can click the Add icon . Add Event Details Enter a title for the event . Depending on how you added your event, the date may be populated for you. If not, enter a date in the date field  or select a date from the calendar by clicking the Calendar icon . The calendar times may also be populated for you in the From fields . Edit or enter the start and end time for your event. To create an all-day event, leave the From fields blank so there is no start and end time for your event. To add a physical event location or conferencing link, use the Location field . In the Calendar drop-down menu , select the subject calendar for the event. Events added to your personal Calendar or the Homeroom Calendar do not display for students in the Schedule tab. To mark the event as an important date , click the Mark as Important Date checkbox . You can add more details to your event, such as an event description, address or duplicate the event by clicking the More Options button . Note: If a Zoom, Microsoft Teams, WebEx, or Google Meet conferencing link is added to the event description or location, students can join the meeting from the Homeroom Schedule tab or subject's Schedule tab. Submit Event To save your event, click the Submit button.

input: How can I mark an existing calendar event as an Important Date in my Canvas course schedule?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Calendar.  
2. Locate and click the event you want to edit.  
3. In the event pop-up, click More Options.  
4. In the event details page, select the Mark as Important Date checkbox.  
5. Click Submit to save your changes.

input: How can I mark module items and calendar event due dates as important in C4E Homeroom?
expected_output:
Step‐by‐Step: Mark Module Items as Important Dates  
1. In your Canvas for Elementary course, click Modules.  
2. Select the assignment, graded discussion, or quiz you want to mark.  
3. Click Edit.  
4. Add or confirm a due date.  
5. Check “Mark as important date and show on Homeroom sidebar.”  
6. Click Save.  

Step‐by‐Step: Mark Calendar Events as Important Dates  
1. Click the Calendar icon in Global Navigation.  
2. In the Calendar sidebar, choose your C4E course calendar.  
3. To edit an existing event, click the event and choose Edit; or click Create New Event.  
4. Check “Mark as Important Date.”  
5. Click Submit.  

Result  
• Important dates appear in date order in the Homeroom sidebar (up to 100 items).  
• Items remain visible until 24 hours after the date.
context:
Document Title: How do I mark an assignment or calendar event with an important

How do I mark an assignment or calendar event with an important date in Canvas for Elementary as an instructor? This lesson applies to users at institutions that have enabled the Canvas for Elementary user interface. As an instructor, you can mark assignments, graded discussions, quizzes, and calendar events with an important date. Important date items display in the Homeroom sidebar. Notes: User calendar events do not support important dates. Differentiated assignments marked with an important date display the due date assigned to the student in the Homeroom sidebar.  Open Assignment, Graded Discussion, or Quiz From the subject's Modules tab , click the title of the assignment, graded discussion, or quiz you'd like to mark with an important date . Edit Item Click the Edit button. Add Important Date Add a due date . To mark the due date as an important date and display the item in the Homeroom sidebar, click the Mark as important date and show on homeroom sidebar checkbox . To save your changes, click the Save button . Notes: Important dates can only be marked for assignments, graded discussions, quizzes, and calendar events. A due date must be added to mark an assignment, graded discussion, or quiz with an important date. Differentiated assignments marked with an important date display the due date assigned to the student in the Homeroom sidebar. Open Calendar You can mark a calendar event with an important date. To open the Calendar, click the Calendar icon in Global Navigation . In the Calendar sidebar, select the Canvas for Elementary course calendar in which you'd like to mark an event with an important date . Notes: User calendar events do not support important dates. Important dates are hidden 24 hours past the specified date. Open Calendar Item To mark an existing calendar event, assignment, or graded discussion with an important date, click the calendar item  and click the Edit button . Alternatively, you can add a new event by clicking the Create New Event button . Manage Calendar Event To mark the event date as an important date and show the event in the Homeroom sidebar, click the Mark as Important Date checkbox . To save your changes, click the Submit button . Manage Assignment or Graded Discussion To mark an assignment or graded discussion as an important date and show the event in the Homeroom sidebar, click the Mark as Important Date checkbox . To save your changes, click the Submit button . View Important Date Items Important date items display in date order in the Homeroom sidebar. Notes: The important date displays immediately after saving. The Homeroom sidebar displays up to 100 items.

input: How do I open the calendar in Canvas from the Global Navigation menu to edit an event, mark it as an 'Important Date', and submit my changes?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click the Calendar icon.  
2. In the Calendar sidebar, select your Canvas for Elementary course calendar.  
3. Click the event you want to edit, then click Edit.  
4. Check the Mark as Important Date checkbox.  
5. Click Submit to save your changes.

input: On Canvas LMS, how can I view my upcoming action items in the Homeroom Schedule from the Home → Schedule tab?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click the Home link.  
2. Click the Schedule tab.  
3. Your Homeroom Schedule for the current week displays all upcoming action items (assignments, discussions, quizzes, events) with subject names and icons.  
4. Use the Previous and Next buttons to view other weeks.  
5. Click an item name to see details.  
6. Online assignments auto-mark as completed; to mark other items done, click the checkbox.  
7. To filter, use the Show completed items or Show missing items dropdowns.
context:
Document Title: How do I view my schedule as a student in Canvas for Elementary

How do I view my schedule as a student in Canvas for Elementary? You can view upcoming assignments, discussions, quizzes, and events for each of your subjects in the Homeroom Schedule. You can view upcoming assignments, discussions, quizzes, and events for a subject in the Subject Schedule. Note: If the Schedule tab does not display in your homeroom or subject, it has been hidden by your instructor.  Open Homeroom Schedule You can view various action items scheduled for all of your subjects this week in the Homeroom Schedule. To view the Homeroom Schedule, click the Home link in Global Navigation , then click the Schedule tab . View Homeroom Schedule To view previous or future week schedules, use the Previous or Next buttons . Each item displays the subject name , an icon to indicate the item type , and the item name . If assigned, items may display the number of points , due date  or To Do date . Labels display for graded assignments or assignments that include instructor feedback . If your instructor included a Zoom, Microsoft Teams, WebEx, or Google Meet conferencing link in an event's description or location, you can join the meeting by clicking the Join button . If an event is within its set time, the Join button displays in green. A grey Join button displays if the event is outside of the set time. To view item details, click the name of the item . When an online assignment is submitted, the item is automatically marked as completed. You can manually mark non-submission items as complete by clicking the item's checkbox . To view completed assignments, click the Show completed item dropdown . To view past tasks you have not completed, click the Show missing items dropdown . Open Subject You can view upcoming tasks for an individual subject in the subject. To open your subject, click the Subjects link in Global Navigation . Then click the subject name link . View Subject Schedule In the Schedule tab , you can view various action items for your subject this week. To view previous or future week schedules, use the Previous or Next buttons . Each item displays an icon to indicate the item type  and the item name . If assigned, items may display the number of points , due date  or To Do date . Labels display for graded assignments or assignments that include instructor feedback . If your instructor included a Zoom, Microsoft Teams, WebEx, or Google Meet conferencing link in an event's description or location, you can join the meeting by clicking the Join button . If an event is within its set time, the Join button displays in green. A grey Join button displays if the event is outside of the set time. To view item details, click the name of the item . When an online assignment is submitted, the item is automatically marked as completed. You can manually mark non-submission items as complete by clicking the item's checkbox . To view completed assignments, click the Show completed item dropdown . To view past tasks you have not completed, click the Show missing items dropdown .

input: How do I open the Homeroom Schedule using the Home link and Schedule tab in Canvas Elementary global navigation?
expected_output:
1. In the Canvas Elementary global navigation menu, click the Home link.  
2. On the Home page, click the Schedule tab to open your Homeroom Schedule.

input: Which dropdown menu allows observers to switch between students in the Homeroom Schedule?
expected_output: Use the Observing drop-down menu in the Homeroom Schedule to switch between students.

Document Title: How do I view the schedule for a student as an observer in

To view completed assignments, click the Show completed item dropdown . To view item details, click the name of the item .

input: How can observers view weekly tasks in the Homeroom Schedule if the student's Schedule tab is hidden?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Home.  
2. If the Schedule tab is visible, click Schedule to open your Homeroom Schedule.  
3. Use the Observing drop-down to select the student and the Previous/Next buttons to view each week’s tasks.  
4. If the Schedule tab doesn’t appear, it’s been hidden by the instructor—you’ll need to ask them to unhide that tab before you can view weekly tasks.
