input: In Canvas Dashboard’s Options menu, how do you switch the display to List View?
expected_output:
1. From your Canvas Dashboard, click the Options menu (usually in the upper-right corner of the page).  
2. In the dropdown, select List View. Your Dashboard will immediately switch to the agenda-style List View.
context:
Document Title: How do I use the Dashboard as a student

How do I use the Dashboard as a student? The Dashboard is the first thing you will see when you log into Canvas. The Dashboard helps you see what is happening in all your current courses. You can return to your User Dashboard at any time by clicking the Dashboard link in Global Navigation.  Open Dashboard In Global Navigation, click the Dashboard link. View Dashboard The Dashboard is your landing page in Canvas. Depending on your institution, your Dashboard may default to one of three views: Card View, List View, or Recent Activity View. Card View : displays course cards for quick access to all your favorite courses (the same courses display in the Courses link from the Global Navigation Menu) List View: displays all course to-do items in an agenda view Recent Activity View : displays all recent activity for all courses View Global Announcement The Dashboard may also include global announcements, which are announcements created by your institution. To remove the announcement from your dashboard, click the Remove icon. View Dismissed Announcement If you dismiss a global announcement, you can view dismissed announcements on the Global Announcements page . Change Dashboard View To change your Dashboard view, click the Options menu and select your preferred viewing option. View Dashboard Sidebar When set to Card View or Recent Activity View, the Dashboard also includes a sidebar. The sidebar includes a To Do list, upcoming assignments, links to recent feedback, and buttons for creating a course or viewing grades. Learn more about using the sidebar.

input: How can I view the course announcements I’ve dismissed on my Canvas Dashboard when I switch between Card view and Recent view?
expected_output:
1. Open your Dashboard  
   • In Global Navigation, click Dashboard.  
   • If you’re not already in Card View or Recent Activity View, click the Options menu (upper right) and select Card View or Recent Activity View.  

2. View dismissed global announcements  
   • In Global Navigation, click Announcements.  
   • On the Global Announcements page, any announcements you previously dismissed will be listed.  

3. View course-level announcements  
   • From Global Navigation, click Courses and select your course.  
   • In the course sidebar, click Announcements.  
   • All course announcements—dismissed or not—are visible here; they do not appear on your Dashboard.

input: How do instructors use Global Nav Dashboard Options to toggle between Card and Recent views?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click the Dashboard link.  
2. On your Dashboard page, locate and click the Options menu (three-dot or “Options” icon).  
3. From the menu, select either:  
   • Card View – displays course cards for quick access  
   • Recent Activity View – lists all recent course activity  
4. (If enabled) you may also select Homeroom View for Canvas for Elementary.

input: In Canvas LMS, how can instructors open the Dashboard to view the to-do list and upcoming events?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click the Dashboard link.  
2. Once the Dashboard loads (in either Card View or Recent Activity View), locate the right-hand sidebar.  
3. In the sidebar, review your To Do list and upcoming events for all your courses.

input: How do I filter by student in the Canvas Observer Dashboard to view a single student’s activity?

input: How do I add or remove a course nickname using the course card Options in Canvas, and how can I display the original course name tooltip?
expected_output:
1. Open your Dashboard in Card View and locate the course card you want to nickname.  
2. Click the card’s Options icon (three dots).  
3. To add a nickname:  
   a. In the Nickname field, type your custom name.  
   b. Click Apply.  
4. To remove a nickname:  
   a. Open the Options icon again.  
   b. Delete all text from the Nickname field (it reverts to the original name).  
   c. Click Apply.  
5. To see the original course name (after adding a nickname), hover your cursor over the nickname on the card—the tooltip will display the original name.
context:
Document Title: How do I view my courses in the Card View Dashboard

How do I view my courses in the Card View Dashboard? The Card View Dashboard displays course cards for all your customized favorite or active courses. Course Cards can help you organize your courses by allowing you to add a nickname or customize the color, which is synced with the color shown for the course in the Calendar . The Card View Dashboard also includes the Dashboard sidebar , which includes items in your To-Do list and includes a link to the global Grades page. Favorited courses are removed from the Card View Dashboard when the courses are concluded. Concluded courses that were previously favorited are still shown as favorited in the Courses list . By default, active course cards are automatically added to your Dashboard. When you are enrolled in more than 20 courses, newer enrollments will replace older ones. This means the Dashboard prioritizes the 20 most recently added active courses, all listed in alphabetical order. Additionally, if you hold multiple roles in a course, the course with a higher-priority role will be listed. Note: Depending on your institution's preference, the Card View may be your default Dashboard. If it is not, you can change your Dashboard view to Card View. Learn about changing the Dashboard view as a student , as an instructor , or as an observer/parent .  View Course Cards By default, the dashboard displays up to 20 course cards. These are prioritized based on the 20 recent courses you were added to, along with any courses you have marked as favorites. You can also choose to customize the course card display by adding or removing courses as favorite courses. Dashboard courses are ordered alphabetically by course name and your role in the course; nicknames and course codes do not apply to course ordering. Courses with instructor roles are listed first, followed by TA roles and student roles. If you are an instructor, course cards may be organized by published courses and unpublished courses. Note: If you customize the course list and manually select at least one course as a favorite, the Dashboard will only display favorite courses. Canvas will also continue to automatically favorite new published course enrollments. View Card Details Course cards show an overview of course information including the course name (or nickname), course code, and term . Each card can include up to four tabs , which represent the four main Canvas features for student course activity: Assignments, Announcements, Discussions, and Files. These tabs mimic visibility and order in Course Navigation, so for instance, if an instructor hides the Announcements link, the Announcements tab will not display on the course card. An unread icon on the Discussions or Announcements tab indicates that there is a new discussion or announcement in the course . The number in the icon indicates the number of new items. Create Nickname If a course has a long or confusing name, you can create a nickname for your course. Most courses are created using Student Information Systems (SIS) that generate course names based on terms, departments, and section numbers, and courses with similar names may be hard to distinguish. To add a nickname, click the Options icon , then enter the name in the Nickname field . Click the Apply button . To remove a nickname, open the card options and delete the nickname. The Nickname field will display the original name of the course. Then, click the Apply button. Notes: A course nickname does not affect the course code, which always displays on the course card for course reference. A course nickname does not affect the course name at the account or course level; it only changes the name of the course for the individual user who created the nickname. Course nicknames appear in the Dashboard, Course Navigation Menu, course breadcrumbs, and notification emails. Nicknames do not display in the global Grades page and Dashboard sidebar elements such as the To Do list. Course nicknames are limited to 59 characters. View Original Name If you added a nickname but need to know the original name of the course, hover the cursor over the nickname ; view the original course name in the tooltip hover text . Change Course|Document Title: How do I view my courses in the Card View Dashboard

Original Name If you added a nickname but need to know the original name of the course, hover the cursor over the nickname ; view the original course name in the tooltip hover text . Change Course Color You can customize the color of course cards, which is synced with the color shown for the course in the Calendar . To change the color of a course card, click the card's Options icon , then select a new color. The check mark indicates the selected color , and the associated hex color code displays in the Hex Code field . To use a color not shown in the window, enter the color's hex code directly in the Hex Code field. Click the Apply button . Notes: Any variation of white is not accepted as a course color. If you enter an invalid hex code, a warning icon displays. If you change the color for a course in the Calendar , the color also updates in the Dashboard. Move Course Cards You can also move a course card to another location in the Dashboard or remove a card from the Dashboard. Click the Options icon  and select the Move tab . Depending on the placement of the existing card, you can move the card to the top of the Dashboard, ahead or behind a specific card, or to the bottom of the Dashboard . Once a dashboard card has been reordered, new courses added to the Dashboard always display at the end of all existing courses. To remove the course card from the Dashboard, click the Unfavorite option . Note: The Unfavorite option only displays if you previously selected favorite courses. Drag and Drop Course Cards You can also manually drag and drop a course card to another location in the Dashboard. Click a course card and drag it to the desired location. View Color Overlay Some courses may include an image for the course behind the course color . By default, course cards with an image include a color overlay. Remove Color Overlay To remove the color overlay from all course cards that contain an image, click the Options icon  and then deselect the Color Overlay option . When the Color Overlay is removed, the course color will display as a circle behind the card's Options icon.

input: In Card View, how can I use the Options icon to enter a custom hex code (not white) to sync my Calendar color?
expected_output:
1. In Card View, hover over the target course card and click its Options icon.  
2. In the menu, open the Color tab.  
3. In the Hex Code field, type your custom color’s six-digit hex code (any valid code except white).  
4. Click Apply.  
5. Canvas will update the card color and sync the same color to your Calendar.

input: In the Card View Dashboard, how do students, instructors, and observers view current overall course grades?
expected_output:
Students, instructors, and observers open the Card View Dashboard sidebar and click View Grades. Then:

• Students (Courses I’m Taking)  
  – See each course’s name and current overall grade (or “no grade”).  
  – Click a course name to view detailed grades.  

• Instructors (Courses I’m Teaching)  
  – See each course’s name and current overall grade average (with student count) or “no grade.”  
  – Click a course name to open its Gradebook.  
  – Click Student Interactions Report to view student activity.  

• Observers/Parents (Linked Student Accounts)  
  – See each linked student, their courses, and each course’s current overall grade or “no grade.”  
  – Click the student-course link to view detailed grades.  

If your course uses grading periods, select a different period from the grading-period dropdown.
context:
Document Title: How do I view grades for all courses in the Card View Dashboard

How do I view grades for all courses in the Card View Dashboard? You can view overall course grades in the Card View Dashboard. All users may view grades for both courses being taken and courses being taught, if any. Note: You may not be able to view grade totals.  Open Grades In the Dashboard sidebar, click the View Grades button. View Courses as Student If you are a student, the Courses I'm Taking section displays the name of each course and a current overall grade, if available . If no grades have been assigned, the grade appears as no grade . To view grading details, click the name of the course . Notes: Your instructor may restrict you from viewing grade totals. If enabled by your institution, you may only have the ability to view qualitative data, such as letter grades and grading comments. View Courses as Instructor If you are an instructor, the Courses I'm Teaching section shows the name of each course and the current overall grade average , which displays the number of students who are part of the average score. If no grades have been assigned, the grade appears as no grade . To view grading details in the Gradebook, click the name of the course . To view interactions with your students and student activity in the course, click the Student Interactions Report link . Note: You can also access the Student Interactions Report from the People page in a specific course. View Courses as Observer/Parent The Linked Student Accounts heading displays the name of each student and their linked courses , as well as their current overall grade. . If no grades have been assigned, the grade appears as no grade . To view grading details for a student in a course, click the student name and course link . Notes: Your student's instructor may restrict you from viewing grade totals. If enabled by your student's institution, you may only have the ability to view qualitative data, such as letter grades and grading comments. View Grading Periods If a course is using multiple grading periods, the course displays the name and grade of the current grading period . To view grades for another grading period, click the grading period drop-down menu . Note: Your instructor may restrict you from viewing grade totals.

input: How can instructors view the course grade average and access Gradebook details in the Canvas Dashboard?
expected_output:
1. In your Canvas Dashboard sidebar, click the View Grades button.  
2. Scroll to the Courses I’m Teaching section. Each course tile shows its current overall grade average (or “no grade” if no scores exist).  
3. Click the course name to open its Gradebook and view detailed grading information.  
4. (Optional) To review student activity, click the Student Interactions Report link.

input: In the Global Navigation menu, which actions open the Recent Activity Dashboard to show the Global Activity Stream?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click the Dashboard link.  
2. On your Dashboard, click the Options (⋮) icon.  
3. Select Recent Activity to open the Recent Activity Dashboard and view the Global Activity Stream.
context:
Document Title: How do I view global activity for all courses in the Recent

How do I view global activity for all courses in the Recent Activity Dashboard? The Recent Activity Dashboard shows you important recent activities from all of your courses including announcements, discussions, assignments, and conversations. The activity notification list is similar to the Course Activity Stream for an individual course. The following activities cause notifications for each course to appear in the Recent Activity Dashboard: New Announcements Replies to Announcements New Discussions New Discussion Posts New Assignments Assignments, Quizzes, or Discussions Changed from Ungraded to Graded Due Date Changes to Assignments, Quizzes, and Discussions New Graded Assignments New Peer Review Assignments New Conversation Messages The Recent Activity Dashboard also displays the Dashboard sidebar , which includes items in your To-Do list and includes a link to the global Grades page. Notes: Notifications do not display in the Recent Activity Dashboard for activity in Files, Collaborations, Grades, Pages, or Conferences; ungraded quizzes and surveys; or edits to Discussions. Edits to Quizzes and Assignments will only display in the Recent Activity Dashboard when the Notify users that this content has changed button has been selected in a course. To receive notifications for Discussions, you must actively post in the discussions at least once every two weeks. If you stop participating in a discussion after two weeks, Canvas will no longer display discussion notifications.  Open Dashboard In Global Navigation, click the Dashboard link. Open Recent Activity Dashboard View Click the Options icon  and then click the Recent Activity link . Note: If you are an observer/parent, you may need to view your student's Dashboard . View Global Activity The Global Activity Stream contains recent notifications from all of your courses, including announcements, discussions, assignments, and conversations. Activities are indicated by activity type and display an icon for the activity . Each activity also includes the name of its associated course . New activity in your account is indicated by an unread icon . Discussions and Announcements indicate new activity items published in a course, and Conversation Messages indicate new messages received in your Inbox. Notes: Recent Activity items remain for four weeks. Unlike course cards in the Card View Dashboard, the activity stream does not reflect the visibility of Course Navigation links. Expand and Collapse Notifications You can view the details of each activity by hovering in the notification area and clicking the Show More link . To collapse recent activity, click the Show Less link . Manage Recent Activity To directly access your recent activities, click the course link . To remove a notification, click the remove icon .

input: On the Canvas dashboard, after I click Options and then Recent Activity, which link do I use to collapse notifications?
expected_output:
1. On the Dashboard, click the Options icon and select Recent Activity.  
2. In the activity stream, click the Show Less link to collapse notifications.

input: How can I remove Canvas Dashboard To-Do items using the icon or List View, and which items are removed automatically?
expected_output:
1. To remove individual To-Do items in the Dashboard sidebar  
   a. In your Card or Recent Activity Dashboard, hover over the To-Do item.  
   b. Click the remove (×) icon that appears to the right of the item.  

2. To remove multiple items via List View  
   a. In the sidebar’s To-Do section, click Show All.  
   b. In the List View Dashboard, locate each item and click its remove (×) icon.  

3. Items removed automatically  
   • Any assignment submitted online through Canvas disappears from your To-Do list as soon as you submit.  

4. Items requiring manual removal  
   • Assignments that do not require an online submission (paper/in-class) remain until you manually remove them.
context:
Document Title: How do I use the To Do list and sidebar in the Dashboard as a

How do I use the To Do list and sidebar in the Dashboard as a student? In the Card View Dashboard and the Recent Activity Dashboard, the sidebar contains a To Do list and other sections that help you know what assignments and events are coming up in all of your courses. The sidebar includes specific items for instructor and student roles. If you are enrolled in Canvas courses with more than one user role, your sidebar may show items for both roles. The sidebar is similar to the sidebar that displays in your Course Home Page, but the course sidebar only includes items for the specific course. Depending on the setup of your Course Home Page, the sidebar in a course may contain additional sections than shown in the sidebar. Note: You can also view items on the To Do list from the List View Dashboard .  Open Dashboard In Global Navigation, click the Dashboard link. View Sidebar Course Items The sidebar shows various action items in all your courses. Each item is associated with a specific course. All items from all your active courses display in the sidebar—not just favorited courses in the Dashboard. For course identification, each sidebar item displays the course name or nickname . To open a To Do item, click the link . Note: If you create a nickname for a course, the nickname displays in the sidebar instead of the course name. However, the original course name and code are available in the course card in the Card View Dashboard . View Student Sections The sidebar helps you see what you need to do next and what feedback you've received across all your courses. However, assignments that are not graded or do not require an online submission only display until the due date. The To Do section shows up to seven items with due dates or event dates in the upcoming weeks, including ungraded quizzes, assignments that do not require a Canvas submission, and course announcements . Each item in the To Do list displays the assignment name, the course name, the number of points, and the due date for the assignment. Once the due date has passed, items remain in this section for four weeks. The Recent Feedback section shows assignments with feedback from your instructor or a peer during the last four weeks . Manage Sidebar Items Each section item displays an icon to differentiate between different assignment types and other items in the To Do list . If a section contains more items than can be shown, you can view all to-do items using the Show All link . This link directs you to the List View Dashboard . To remove a To Do item, click the remove icon . The item(s) remain removed from the list. Note: Assignments submitted through Canvas disappear automatically from the To Do list; no-submission assignments (submitted on paper/in class) can only be removed from the list manually. Create New Course If allowed by your institution, you may also be able to create a new course from the Dashboard . View Grades To view your grades for all active courses on the Dashboard Grades page, click the View Grades button.

input: How do I open the Dashboard from the Global Navigation menu, view all my To Do items, and hide items that don’t require submissions?
expected_output:
1. Open the Dashboard  
   • In Global Navigation, click Dashboard.  

2. View all your To Do items  
   • In the right-hand sidebar, under To Do, click Show All to open the List View Dashboard (this displays every upcoming item across your courses).  

3. Hide items that don’t require submissions  
   • In either the sidebar or the List View, locate the no-submission assignment.  
   • Click the remove (×) icon next to that item—items submitted on paper or in class will stay hidden until you manually remove them.

input: How do I navigate through Options to switch to List View, display my course To-Dos, events, and announcements, join conferences, mark items complete, open Alerts and Grades, and click Add Item in Canvas LMS?
expected_output:
1. Open List View  
   - In the Dashboard, click the Options icon (three-dot menu) and choose List View.  

2. Display To-Dos, Events & Announcements  
   - Scroll up/down to see items by date (assignments, calendar events, announcements).  
   - Click Today to jump to today’s items or New Activity to view recently updated items.  

3. Join a Conference  
   - Locate the calendar event with a conferencing link and click the green Join button (grey if inactive).  

4. Mark Items Complete  
   - Graded items auto-complete on submission.  
   - For non-graded items, click the checkbox next to the item (refresh the page to update).  

5. Open Alerts  
   - Click the Alert Menu button to view graded, past-due, or new alert items.  
   - Use the New and Dismissed tabs to filter alerts; remove alerts with the x icon.  

6. View Grades  
   - Click the Gradebook icon to open My Grades.  
   - Select a course name to go to its full Grades page.  

7. Add a To-Do Item  
   - Click the Add Item icon in the List View Dashboard.  
   - Enter details and save (your new item appears under General To-Dos).
context:
Document Title: How do I use the To Do list for all my courses in the List View

How do I use the To Do list for all my courses in the List View Dashboard as a student? The List View Dashboard displays all course To Do items in an agenda view to help you easily manage tasks across all of your courses. The To Do list contains graded as well as any non-graded To Do items your instructor designates for a course To Do list. You can also add and view your own To-Do items in the Dashboard. The List View Dashboard also displays calendar events and course announcements. Notes: The List View Dashboard does not account for course favorites and displays all items based on date, course ID, due date, and due time. To-do items can also be viewed in the Card View Dashboard and the Recent Activity Dashboard.  Open List View To open Dashboard List View, click the Options icon  and select the List View option . Note: Depending on your institution's settings, your dashboard may default to List View. View List View The List View Dashboard defaults to the current date . To view previous and future dates, scroll up and down the page . To quickly return to the current day's To Dos, click the Today button . To quickly access prior items with new activity, click the New Activity button . View Item Details When multiple courses include To Do items on a single date, courses are listed by Course Name and items are are listed by due time . Graded items display the point value for the graded item . To Do items include icons that represent the item type: Peer Review  Calendar Event  Announcement  Assignment  Page  Discussion  Quiz  Open Item To access a To Do item, click the item name . To view the home page for a course, click the name of the course . Join Conference Event If your instructor added a conferencing link to a calendar event, you can join the conference from the List View Dashboard. Conferences which have passed or have not began display a grey Join button . To join an active conference, click the green Join button . View Item Status and Activity List View includes labels and icons to quickly communicate an item's status and activity. Items with new activity display an Unread indicator  and include an activity label. New activity can include one or all of the following labels: Graded : a submission is graded Replies : an announcement or discussion has new replies Feedback : a graded item has new instructor feedback via submission comments (does not display if feedback is only via DocViewer annotations) Once a graded item is past the due date, the item displays a Missing indicator  and a Missing label . Missing items submitted after the due date display a Late label . If your instructor has reassigned an assignment to you, the item displays a Redo label . You must resubmit your assignment . Mark Item as Complete Graded items are automatically marked as completed once they are submitted. Non-graded items must be manually marked as completed. To manually mark an item as complete, click the checkbox for the item . When you manually mark an item, the item's status will update when you refresh the page. Completed To Do items remain in the To Do list for you to view at any time. To view information about completed To Do items, click the Show completed item link . The completed items display a completed checkbox . To view completed item information, click the item name . The next time you refresh the page, the completed items will once again be hidden within the completed link. View Alerts Menu To view a list of graded past-due items across all your courses, click the Alert Menu button . The Alert menu helps you see what opportunities are available to you to improve your course grades. To view new alert items, click the New link . You can dismiss new alert items by clicking the Remove icon . Dismissing a new alert item does not affect its status or mark it as completed. To view dismissed alert items, click the Dismissed link . View Grades To view your current course grades, click the Gradebook icon . The My Grades menu displays your current course grades . Click the course name link to view the Grades page for your course . Note : If one of your courses uses grading periods, the grade displayed is the grade for the current|Document Title: How do I use the To Do list for all my courses in the List View

your current course grades . Click the course name link to view the Grades page for your course . Note : If one of your courses uses grading periods, the grade displayed is the grade for the current grading period. View To Do Items You can add your own To-Do items to the Dashboard. Items associated with a course display as part of the course items and arranged by due date . General to-do items always display below all courses . To-do items can be edited at any time by clicking the Edit icon . To add a To-Do item , click the Add Item icon . Note : You can also use the Calendar to add to-do items , which will also display in the List View Dashboard. Change Dashboard To change the Dashboard view at any time, click the Options menu.

input: In List View, how do I manually mark non-graded To-Dos as complete and refresh their status?
expected_output:
1. In the List View Dashboard, locate the non-graded To-Do item you want to complete.  
2. Click the checkbox to the left of the item name—this manually marks it as complete.  
3. Refresh the page; the item’s status will update to “completed.”

input: How do I use the Add To Do feature in the Student Dashboard to set the title, date, time, and course?
expected_output:
1. In your Canvas Student Dashboard’s List View, click the Add To Do button.  
2. In the To Do sidebar, under Title, type the name of your task.  
3. Click the Date field to pick when you want to complete it (it defaults to today).  
4. Click the Time field to set your preferred deadline (it defaults to 11:59 PM).  
5. Use the Course drop-down menu to associate the item with a specific course (or leave it unassigned for a general to-do).  
6. (Optional) Add any extra notes in Details.  
7. Click Save to add the item to your Dashboard agenda.
context:
Document Title: How do I add a To Do item in the List View Dashboard as a

How do I add a To Do item in the List View Dashboard as a student? You can create to-do items that display in the List View Dashboard agenda. When you create a to-do item, the new item displays your profile picture to differentiate it from other to-do list items. Any to-do item you create also displays in the Course Card Dashboard View sidebar and Global Activity Stream Dashboard sidebar. You can also create to-do items from the calendar.  Add To-do Item Click the Add To Do button. Add To-do Details In the To Do sidebar Title field , type a name for the to-do item. The Date field defaults to the current date , and the Time field defaults to 11:59pm . To change the date and/or time when you want to complete the item, modify the date or time appropriately. Items default as general to-do items, but you can associate the item with a course by selecting a course from the Course drop-down menu . In the Details field , any other details about your to-do item. Save To-do Click the Save button. View To-do Item View your to-do item. Items that you associate with a course display on the to-do list with other course to-do items . Items that are not associated with a specific course display at the bottom of the day's to-do list . Manage To-do Item To edit or delete a To-Do item, click the Edit icon . To edit the item, edit the information in the To Do details sidebar . To save your edits, click the Save button . To delete the item, click the Delete button . When the delete confirmation window displays, click the OK button.

input: In the Canvas Dashboard list view, what steps do I need to follow to remove a to-do item? Do I click the edit icon, then the delete button, and then OK?
expected_output:
1. In the List View Dashboard, locate the to-do item you want to remove.  
2. Click the Edit (pencil) icon next to that item.  
3. In the To Do details sidebar, click Delete.  
4. When the confirmation dialog appears, click OK.

input: How can instructors view more than seven To Do items in the Canvas sidebar?
expected_output:
1. Open your Canvas Dashboard and locate the sidebar’s To Do section.  
2. If you have more than seven items, Canvas will display a “View all to-do items” link beneath the list—click it to see the full list.  
3. If no link appears, free up slots by removing items you’ve already handled:  
   - Hover over the To Do entry you want to clear.  
   - Click the remove (×) icon.  
4. Once you’ve removed old items, additional upcoming items will automatically appear in the To Do list (up to seven at a time).
context:
Document Title: How do I use the To Do list and sidebar in the Dashboard as an

How do I use the To Do list and sidebar in the Dashboard as an instructor? In the Card View Dashboard and the Recent Activity Dashboard, the sidebar contains a To Do list and other sections that help you know what assignments and events are coming up in all of your courses. The sidebar includes specific items for instructor and student roles. If you are enrolled in Canvas courses with more than one user role, your sidebar may show items for both roles. The sidebar is similar to the sidebar that displays in your Course Home Page , but the course sidebar only includes items for the specific course. Depending on the setup of your Course Home Page, the sidebar in a course may contain additional sections than shown in the sidebar.  Open Dashboard In Global Navigation, click the Dashboard link. View Sidebar Course Items The sidebar shows various action items in all your courses. Each item is associated with a specific course. All items from all your active courses display in the sidebar—not just favorited courses in the Dashboard. For course identification, each sidebar item displays the course code, or short name, for the course . The course code is located directly below the full course name. Course nicknames can be set in place of sidebar course codes that are long or otherwise confusing to remember which courses they represent. If you have created a nickname for a course, the nickname displays in the sidebar instead of the course code . However, the original course code always displays in the course card. View Instructor Sections The sidebar helps you manage grading in all of your courses. However, assignments that are not graded or do not require an online submission only display until the due date. The To Do section shows all items that require grading in Canvas, regardless of due date . Each item in the To Do list displays the assignment name, the course name, the number of points, and the due date for the assignment. Some assignments may display multiple due dates. The Coming Up section shows assignments and events coming due in the next seven days . Items can include ungraded quizzes and assignments that do not require a submission, though these assignment types do not display in the To Do grading list for instructors. Some items may display multiple due dates. The Coming Up section displays up to 20 items ordered according to date. If your Canvas admin has granted you permission to create courses, you may see the Start a New Course button , which would allow you to create a new Canvas Course. The View Grades button links to the Dashboard Grades page and displays the overall grade average for all your active courses . Manage Sidebar Items Each section item indicates how many items need to be graded . By default, Grade Assignment links open to SpeedGrader in a new browser tab . You can prevent Grade Assignment links from opening in a new tab in your User Account Feature Option Settings . If a section contains more items than are listed, a link will appear under the list that you can use to view all to-do items . The To Do section shows up to seven items with due dates in the upcoming weeks. To view more items, you must manually remove items from the list. To remove a To Do item, click the remove icon . Note: When an item is removed, the item can only be restored to the To Do section if a new submission is received for that assignment.

input: How do I access the Dashboard from the global navigation, set course code nicknames in the sidebar, and remove or view all items in my To Do list in Canvas?
expected_output:
1. Access the Dashboard  
   • In Global Navigation, click the Dashboard link.  

2. Set or edit a course code nickname  
   • In the Dashboard sidebar, locate the course’s code (displayed under its full name).  
   • Click the nickname icon next to the code (or go to Account > Settings > Course Nicknames), type your custom label, and press Enter.  

3. Remove or view all To Do items  
   • To remove a To Do item: click the remove (×) icon next to the assignment.  
   • To view every item: if a section has more than the displayed items, click the “view all to-do items” link below the list.

input: How do I open the NPS feedback widget in Canvas LMS, select a rating, add follow-up comments, and submit my feedback?
expected_output:
1. Open the NPS widget  
   - In your Canvas Dashboard, find the Net Promoter Score survey widget.  
   - Click “Take me to survey.”  

2. Select your rating  
   - Click the number (0–10) that best reflects your Canvas experience.  

3. Add follow-up comments  
   - When prompted, type your feedback in the text field.  

4. Submit your feedback  
   - Click “Submit.”  

5. Close confirmation  
   - In the submission confirmation pop-up, click the Close (×) icon.
context:
Document Title: How do I share feedback using Instructure s Net Promoter Score

How do I share feedback using Instructure's Net Promoter Score (NPS) survey from the Dashboard?
Eligible users with Instructor or Admin roles can provide feedback for Canvas once a year through the Instructure Net Promoter Score (NPS) survey.
Currently, only Canvas instances linked to a billing address within the United States are eligible for surveys. Additionally, users with multiple roles will receive a survey as long as one of their roles is not Student. Users with only the Student role will not receive a survey.
To learn more about using the in-app NPS survey in Canvas, you can visit the
In-App Canvas NPS Survey FAQ
resource document.
View Survey Window
If you are selected to take the survey, in your Dashboard [1], the survey window displays as a widget [2].
To launch the survey, click the
Take me to survey
button [3].
To skip the current survey, click the
Dismiss
button [4] or the
Close
icon [5].
To
opt out of the survey
, click the
Opt-out
link [6].
Note:
If you opt out of the survey, you will be permanently removed from all future in-app surveys.
Take Survey
To respond to the survey questions, select the number on the scale that best reflects your opinion [1].
Depending on the score you selected, a follow-up question displays. You can add your answer in the text field [2].
To complete the survey, click the
Submit
button [3].
View Submission Confirmation Window
A submission confirmation window displays [1]. To dismiss the pop-up window, click the
Close
icon [2].
Opt Out Permanently or Dismiss Survey
If you selected to opt out of the survey, another window displays.
To opt out the survey permanently, click the
Opt Out Permanently
button [1].
To dismiss the survey until the next year, click the
Close
icon [2].

input: Which Dashboard survey 'Opt-out' link lets eligible institution administrators permanently opt out of the in-app Canvas NPS survey?
expected_output:
1. In your Canvas Dashboard widget, locate the in-app NPS survey window.  
2. Click the “Opt-out” link (labeled [6] in the survey widget).  
3. Confirm by clicking “Opt Out Permanently” in the subsequent pop-up.  
   – You’ll then be removed from all future in-app NPS surveys.
context:

How do I share feedback using Instructure's Net Promoter Score (NPS) survey from the Dashboard?
Eligible users with Instructor or Admin roles can provide feedback for Canvas once a year through the Instructure Net Promoter Score (NPS) survey.
Currently, only Canvas instances linked to a billing address within the United States are eligible for surveys. Additionally, users with multiple roles will receive a survey as long as one of their roles is not Student. Users with only the Student role will not receive a survey.
To learn more about using the in-app NPS survey in Canvas, you can visit the
In-App Canvas NPS Survey FAQ
resource document.
View Survey Window
If you are selected to take the survey, in your Dashboard [1], the survey window displays as a widget [2].
To launch the survey, click the
Take me to survey
button [3].
To skip the current survey, click the
Dismiss
button [4] or the
Close
icon [5].
To
opt out of the survey
, click the
Opt-out
link [6].
Note:
If you opt out of the survey, you will be permanently removed from all future in-app surveys.
Take Survey
To respond to the survey questions, select the number on the scale that best reflects your opinion [1].
Depending on the score you selected, a follow-up question displays. You can add your answer in the text field [2].
To complete the survey, click the
Submit
button [3].
View Submission Confirmation Window
A submission confirmation window displays [1]. To dismiss the pop-up window, click the
Close
icon [2].
Opt Out Permanently or Dismiss Survey
If you selected to opt out of the survey, another window displays.
To opt out the survey permanently, click the
Opt Out Permanently
button [1].
To dismiss the survey until the next year, click the
Close
icon [2].

input: How can I access ePortfolios in my Canvas account, resolve disabled or spam blocker issues, and then create, name, and set visibility for a new ePortfolio?
expected_output:
1. Access ePortfolios  
   - In Global Navigation, click Account > ePortfolios.  
   - Ensure you’re enrolled in at least one course (required to create an ePortfolio).

2. Troubleshoot access issues  
   - No ePortfolios link? Your institution may have disabled the feature—contact your Canvas administrator.  
   - No Create an ePortfolio button? You may have an existing ePortfolio marked as spam—contact your Canvas administrator.

3. Create a new ePortfolio  
   - Click Create an ePortfolio.  
   - In the ePortfolio Name field, type your portfolio’s name.  
   - Choose visibility (Public or Private).  
   - Click Make ePortfolio.

4. Next steps (optional)  
   - Add sections: click Add Section.  
   - Rename, move, or delete sections: click the options button beside each section.  
   - Add pages: click Add Page.  
   - Update settings: click Settings to edit name or visibility, then click Save.
context:
Document Title: How do I create a new ePortfolio

How do I create a new ePortfolio? You can create a new ePortfolio in your user settings. You must be enrolled in a course to create an ePortfolio. Notes: If you cannot view the ePortfolio link in your User Account, your institution has disabled this feature. If you do not see the Create an ePortfolio button, you may have an ePortfolio that has been marked as spam. Contact your Canvas administrator for further assistance. This lesson covers how to use Canvas ePortfolios in your user account. If ePortfolios in your user account display differently than the images in this lesson, learn how to use Canvas Student ePortfolios .  Open ePortfolios In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the ePortfolios link . Create an ePortfolio Click the Create an ePortfolio button. Notes: You must be enrolled in a course to create a new ePortfolio. If the Create an ePortfolio button does not display, you may have an ePortfolio that has been marked as spam. Contact your Canvas administrator for further assistance. Create ePortfolio Name your ePortfolio by typing in the ePortfolio Name field . Decide if your ePortfolio will be public  ( you can change this setting later ) and then click the Make ePortfolio button . View ePortfolio Once the ePortfolio is created, there are several options for creating content for your portfolio, including a wizard that will walk you through your creation , step by step. To rename, move, or delete a section, click the options button . To add a section to a portfolio, click the Add Section button . Click the Settings button  to update the profile settings. To return to the User Profile, click the User Profile button . Click the Add Page button  to create a new page. Edit ePortfolio To edit your ePortfolio settings, click the Settings link. Update Settings Edit the Portfolio name or visibility option . Click the Save button .

input: Why is the "Create EP" button missing in my Canvas user settings? Could it be because the feature is disabled, I’m unenrolled, or I’ve been flagged as spam?
expected_output:
1. Feature Disabled  
   • If you don’t see any ePortfolios link under Account, your institution has turned off ePortfolios.  
   • Contact your Canvas administrator to confirm and request re-enabling.

2. Not Enrolled in a Course  
   • Canvas only lets you create an ePortfolio when you’re enrolled in at least one course.  
   • Verify your course enrollments in Global Navigation > Courses.

3. Portfolio Marked as Spam  
   • If you once created an ePortfolio that an admin flagged as spam, the “Create an ePortfolio” button will be hidden.  
   • Reach out to your Canvas administrator to clear the flag or restore your portfolio.

input: How can I use the Gradebook Setup Wizard in Canvas to navigate the introduction, move between sections and pages, add subsections, change settings, and close and reopen the wizard?
expected_output:
1. Open the Gradebook Setup Wizard  
   a. In your course navigation, click Grades.  
   b. Click the Setup Wizard button (usually in the top right of the Gradebook).

2. View the Introduction  
   – A pop-up will display an overview of the wizard and its purpose.  
   – Click Next to proceed.

3. Move Between Sections and Pages  
   – Use the “Back” and “Next” arrows at the bottom of the wizard.  
   – If a sidebar or progress bar appears, click any section title to jump directly to it.

4. Add Subsections (e.g., Assignment Groups or Categories)  
   – When you reach the “Organize Your Gradebook” section, click Add Group (or Add Category).  
   – Enter the group name and weighting (if using weighted grades), then click Save.  
   – Rearrange groups by dragging them up or down in the list.

5. Change Gradebook Settings  
   – In the “Settings” or “Options” section of the wizard, adjust:  
     • Grade display (percentage, points, letter)  
     • Grading periods or terms  
     • Late-submission policies or display options  
   – Click Save Settings to apply your changes.

6. Close and Reopen the Wizard  
   – To close, click the X in the upper-right corner of the wizard.  
   – To reopen at any time, return to your Gradebook and click the Setup Wizard button again (or click “Help How do I…?” and select the wizard).
context:
Document Title: How do I use the ePortfolio Getting Started Wizard

How do I use the ePortfolio Getting Started Wizard? The ePortfolio Getting Started Wizard will guide you during the process of creating your ePortfolio. Note: This lesson displays how to use Canvas ePortfolios in your user account. If ePortfolios in your user account displays differently than the images in this lesson, learn how to use Canvas Student Pathways and ePortfolios .  Open ePortfolios In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the ePortfolios link . Open ePortfolio Click the name of an ePortfolio. Open Getting Started Wizard Click the Getting Started Wizard link. View Getting Started Wizard The Getting Started Wizard will pop up to show you the basics of your ePortfolio. You can read about the Introduction, Portfolio Sections, Section Pages, Adding Submissions, ePortfolio Settings, and Let's Do It. To close the Getting Started Wizard, click the close icon. View Introduction Your ePortfolio is a way to show off your work to your peers, instructors, and possible employers. They are made of sections and pages that are customizable and you are able to add and remove different types of information. View Portfolio Sections The portfolio sections are your navigation links for your portfolio. Each section can have multiple pages inside of it. You can organize the sections by clicking the Organize Sections link. You can also rename a section by clicking the pencil icon , rearrange sections by clicking and dragging, or delete sections by clicking the x icon . View Section Pages The section pages are part of the section links. To organize or add pages, click on the Organize/Manage Pages link. You can also rename a page by clicking the pencil icon , rearrange sections by clicking and dragging, or delete sections by clicking the x icon . View Adding Submissions You can add assignments to your portfolio from classes you are taking and classes you have taken. You may have noticed at the bottom of this page is a list of recent submissions from your classes. You can quickly add submissions to new pages in your portfolio from this page. Just click the submission you want to add and a simple dialog will pop up. View ePortfolio Settings To change the settings for your ePortfolio, click the ePortfolio Settings link. You can rename the portfolio and also change whether it is public or private. Private portfolios are only visible to those to whom you grant access. View Let's Do It Ready to get started? You can always get back to this wizard from any page by clicking the "Help How Do I...?" link.

input: How do I launch the ePortfolio Wizard from the global navigation or Help menu, customize its sections and pages, import submissions, and set privacy options?
expected_output:
1. Launch the Wizard  
   - Global Navigation: Account > ePortfolios > [Your ePortfolio] > Getting Started Wizard  
   - Anywhere in Canvas: click Help > “Help How Do I...?” > Getting Started Wizard  

2. Customize Portfolio Sections  
   - Click Organize Sections  
   - Rename: click pencil icon  
   - Reorder: drag sections up or down  
   - Delete: click “×” icon  

3. Customize Section Pages  
   - Click Organize/Manage Pages  
   - Rename pages with the pencil icon  
   - Reorder by dragging  
   - Delete with the “×” icon  

4. Import Class Submissions  
   - In the Wizard (or on your ePortfolio page), scroll to Recent Submissions  
   - Click a submission to open the Add Submission dialog  
   - Choose a target section/page and confirm  

5. Set Privacy and Rename Portfolio  
   - Click ePortfolio Settings  
   - Edit the title  
   - Toggle visibility: Public (anyone with link) or Private (invite-only)  

6. Exit or Reopen Wizard  
   - Click the close (×) icon to exit  
   - To revisit, click Help > “Help How Do I...?” any time

input: Once I’ve opened an ePortfolio via GN > Account > ePortfolios, how do I rename a section using the Organize Sections or Settings menu?
expected_output:
1. Open your ePortfolio: In Global Navigation, click Account > ePortfolios, then click your ePortfolio’s title.  
2. Access section tools: Click Organize Sections or click the Settings (gear) icon next to any section.  
3. Rename via Organize Sections:  
   a. Click the section’s name in the list.  
   b. Type the new name.  
   c. Press Enter.  
4. Rename via Settings menu:  
   a. Click the Settings icon for the section.  
   b. Select Rename.  
   c. Enter the new name and click Save.  
5. Finish: Click Done Editing.
context:
Document Title: How do I organize my ePortfolio

How do I organize my ePortfolio? You can organize your ePortfolio by renaming, reordering, or moving sections.  Open ePortfolios In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the ePortfolios link . Open ePortfolio Click the title of the ePortfolio. Organize Sections Click the Organize Sections link. Manage Sections You can organize your ePortfolio sections in the menu. To rename a section, click the name of the section and type the new name in the field . To reorder a section, hover over the section name and wait for the cross arrows to appear . Click and drag the page to the new location in your ePortfolio organization. View Section Settings You can also use the Settings icon to organize ePortfolio sections. To view your options, click the Settings icon . To rename a section, click the Rename link . To delete a section, click the Delete link . To move a section, click the Move To... link . Move Section In the section drop-down menu , select the section that should come after the section you are moving. Click the Move button . Save Changes Click the Done Editing button.

input: How do I rename, reorder, or move sections in my Canvas ePortfolio? What steps should I follow under Account > ePortfolios, Organize Sections, and Settings?
expected_output:
1. Navigate to Account > ePortfolios.  
2. Click your ePortfolio’s title.  
3. Click Organize Sections.  

To rename a section:  
• Click the section name, enter the new name, and press Enter.  

To reorder a section:  
• Hover until the four-arrow icon appears, then drag the section to its new position.  

To move or delete via Settings:  
1. Click the Settings icon next to a section.  
2. Choose Rename, Delete, or Move To…  
3. If moving, select the section that should precede it, then click Move.  

4. When finished, click Done Editing.

input: How do I open the Organize Sections tool, add and name a section, and then finish editing in an ePortfolio under Account > ePortfolios in Canvas?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Account then ePortfolios.  
2. Click the title of the ePortfolio you want to edit.  
3. Click Organize Sections.  
4. Click Add Section.  
5. Type your new section name and press Return (Mac) or Enter (PC).  
6. When you’re done, click Done Editing.

Document Title: How do I create a new ePortfolio section

How do I create a new ePortfolio section? You can organize your ePortfolio by creating multiple sections.  Open ePortfolios In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the ePortfolios link . Open ePortfolio Click the title of the ePortfolio. Open Sections Click the Organize Sections link. Add Section To create a new ePortfolio section, click the Add Section link. Add Section Name Type your new section name in the section name field. Press Return (on a Mac keyboard ) or Enter (on a PC keyboard). Manage Sections To edit any section, click the Settings menu. To rename a section, click the Rename link . To delete a section, click the Delete link . To move a section, click the Move to... link . You can also rearrange sections by clicking and dragging them. Save Section When you are finished adding and/or editing your new ePortfolio sections, click the Done Editing button.

input: How can I rename ePortfolio sections, for example changing “Work Exp” to “Prof Bgnd” and “Edu” to “Acad Bgnd,” and reorder the sections to display “Prof Bgnd,” “Acad Bgnd,” and “Skills”?
expected_output:
1. Open ePortfolios  
   - In Global Navigation, click Account, then ePortfolios.  
   - Click your ePortfolio’s title.  

2. Open Sections  
   - Click Organize Sections.  

3. Rename Sections  
   - For “Work Exp”: click its Settings menu > Rename, enter Prof Bgnd, press Return/Enter.  
   - For “Edu”: click its Settings menu > Rename, enter Acad Bgnd, press Return/Enter.  

4. Reorder Sections  
   - Drag “Prof Bgnd,” “Acad Bgnd,” and “Skills” into the desired order  
     OR use each section’s Settings menu > Move to… and select its new position.  

5. Save Changes  
   - Click Done Editing.

input: After I navigate to Account > ePortfolios and open Pages or Settings, how do I rename and save a page?
expected_output:
1. After opening your ePortfolio, click either the Organize/Manage Pages link or the Settings icon next to the page you want to rename.  
2. To rename via Organize/Manage Pages:  
   - Click the current page title in the menu.  
   - Type your new page name and press Enter.  
3. To rename via Settings:  
   - Click the Settings icon next to the page.  
   - Select Rename, type the new name, and press Enter.  
4. To finalize your changes, click the Done Editing button.

input: In the Organize/Manage Pages section under Account > ePortfolios, how does the Move To dropdown reposition a page and save my changes?
expected_output:
1. In your ePortfolio’s Organize/Manage Pages view, click the Settings icon next to the page you want to move and choose Move To…  
2. In the Move To drop-down menu, select the page that should appear immediately after the page you’re relocating.  
3. Click the Move button.  
4. When you’ve finished rearranging pages, click Done Editing to save all changes.

input: How do I open and launch my ePortfolio from Global Navigation > Account > ePortfolios, edit the page to add rich text or HTML, and then save and view my changes?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Account, then click ePortfolios.  
2. Click the title of the ePortfolio you want to open.  
3. Click Go to the Actual ePortfolio to launch it.  
4. Click Edit This Page.  
5. Click Add Content, then choose Rich Text Content or HTML/Embedded Content.  
6. Enter or paste your content.  
7. Click Save Page.  
8. Review your ePortfolio to confirm your changes.

Document Title: How do I edit the default page in my ePortfolio section

How do I edit the default page in my ePortfolio section? The default page in an ePortfolio can be a page that explains what it is included in the ePortfolio.  Open ePortfolios In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the ePortfolios link . Open ePortfolio Click the title of the ePortfolio. Go to ePortfolio Click the Go to the Actual ePortfolio link to open your ePortfolio. The ePortfolio will open to the default page. Edit Page Click the Edit This Page button to add or change content on the default page. Add Content Content can be edited by using the Add Content links. You can add Rich Text Content , HTML/Embedded Content , Course Submissions , or Image/File Uploads . Save Page Click the Save Page button. View Page View your changes to the default page.

input: How do I edit the default page of my ePortfolio in Canvas, add rich text and images, then save and view my changes?
expected_output:
1. Open ePortfolios  
   - In Canvas Global Navigation, click Account, then click ePortfolios.  
2. Select your ePortfolio  
   - Click the title of the ePortfolio you want to edit.  
3. Go to the actual ePortfolio  
   - Click Go to the Actual ePortfolio to open the default page.  
4. Enter edit mode  
   - Click the Edit This Page button.  
5. Add rich text and images  
   - To add text: click Add Content > Rich Text Content, enter or format your text.  
   - To add images: click Add Content > Image/File Uploads, then upload or select your images.  
6. Save your changes  
   - Click the Save Page button.  
7. View your updated page  
   - Review the default page to confirm your text and images appear correctly.

Document Title: How do I create a new page in my ePortfolio section

How do I create a new page in my ePortfolio section? Within an ePortfolio section, you can create pages to add to the section. You can also add content to each page in the section. Please note that any content added to an ePortfolio can only be viewed by users who have permission in Canvas to view it, even if your ePortfolio is made public. For instance, if you add a quiz submission to your ePortfolio, your instructor can view the submission, but you do not have permission to view other student submissions.  Open ePortfolios In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the ePortfolios link . Open ePortfolio Click the title of the ePortfolio. Organize/Manage Pages Click the Organize/Manage Pages link. Add Another Page Click the Add Another Page link. Add Page Type the name of the new page in the page name field and press Return (on a Mac keyboard) or Enter (on a PC keyboard). Manage Page You can edit your ePortfolio pages in the menu. To rename a page, click the name of the page and type the new name in the field . To reorder a page, hover over the page name and wait for the cross arrows to appear . Click and drag the page to the new location. View Page Settings You can also edit your ePortfolio pages through the Settings menu . To rename a page, click the Rename link . To delete a page, click the Delete link . To move a page, click the Move to... link . Save Page Click the Done Editing button. Add Page Content To add content to your page, click the name of the page. Edit Page Click the Edit This Page button. Add Content You can add content to your ePortfolio in several different ways. You can add Rich Text Content , HTML/Embedded Content , Course Submissions , or Image/File Uploads . Save Page Click the Save Page button.

input: In Canvas, under Account > ePortfolios > Organize/Manage Pages, how can I rename a page and drag it to reorder?
expected_output:
1. Navigate to Account > ePortfolios, then click your ePortfolio title.  
2. Click Organize/Manage Pages.  
3. To rename a page, click its current name, type the new name, and press Return/Enter.  
4. To reorder, hover over the page name until the cross-arrows appear, then click and drag the page to your desired position.  
5. When finished, click Done Editing.
context:
Document Title: How do I create a new page in my ePortfolio section

How do I create a new page in my ePortfolio section? Within an ePortfolio section, you can create pages to add to the section. You can also add content to each page in the section. Please note that any content added to an ePortfolio can only be viewed by users who have permission in Canvas to view it, even if your ePortfolio is made public. For instance, if you add a quiz submission to your ePortfolio, your instructor can view the submission, but you do not have permission to view other student submissions.  Open ePortfolios In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the ePortfolios link . Open ePortfolio Click the title of the ePortfolio. Organize/Manage Pages Click the Organize/Manage Pages link. Add Another Page Click the Add Another Page link. Add Page Type the name of the new page in the page name field and press Return (on a Mac keyboard) or Enter (on a PC keyboard). Manage Page You can edit your ePortfolio pages in the menu. To rename a page, click the name of the page and type the new name in the field . To reorder a page, hover over the page name and wait for the cross arrows to appear . Click and drag the page to the new location. View Page Settings You can also edit your ePortfolio pages through the Settings menu . To rename a page, click the Rename link . To delete a page, click the Delete link . To move a page, click the Move to... link . Save Page Click the Done Editing button. Add Page Content To add content to your page, click the name of the page. Edit Page Click the Edit This Page button. Add Content You can add content to your ePortfolio in several different ways. You can add Rich Text Content , HTML/Embedded Content , Course Submissions , or Image/File Uploads . Save Page Click the Save Page button.

input: After I navigate to Account > ePortfolios in Canvas, how do I format content using the Rich Content Editor (toolbar, Math Editor, word count), save my work, and view the page?

3. Format your content

input: After editing my ePortfolio page in Canvas, how can I retrieve my past submissions, organize them in chronological order, and save them?
expected_output:
1. Open your ePortfolio  
   • In Global Navigation, click Account, then click ePortfolios.  
   • Click the title of your ePortfolio.  
2. Open and edit your page  
   • Click the page title, then click Edit This Page.  
3. Retrieve past submissions  
   • Click the Course Submission link.  
   • All your Canvas submissions display in reverse-chronological order (newest first).  
   • Click one submission to add it.  
   • (To add more, repeat this step for each submission.)  
   • Click Select Submission.  
4. Save and view  
   • Click Save Page.  
   • Your submissions now appear on the page; click any file name to download.
context:
Document Title: How do I retrieve assignments from previous courses in my

How do I retrieve assignments from previous courses in my ePortfolio? You can add assignments you have submitted in Canvas to your courses to your ePortfolio. Note : Users without access to a concluded course may not be able to access Assignments in your ePortfolio from that course. Links to deleted courses will not remain active.  Open ePortfolios In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the ePortfolios link . Open ePortfolio Click the title of the ePortfolio. Open Page Click the title of the page. Edit Page Click the Edit This Page button. Open Course Submission Click the Course Submission link to retrieve assignments from previous courses. Select Assignment Click the assignment  to add it to the page. You can only select one assignment submission at a time, but you can choose to add more than one submission to the page. All assignments you have ever submitted will be listed in chronological order with the newer assignments appearing at the top and the older assignments appearing near the bottom. Click the Select Submission button . Save Page Click the Save Page button. View Page The assignment submissions can now be viewed on your page. Assignments that were submitted as a file can be downloaded by clicking the file name.

input: What navigation and editing steps do I use in Canvas to select a past assignment, submit it, and save it to my ePortfolio?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click the Account icon and select ePortfolios.  
2. Click the title of the ePortfolio you want to edit.  
3. On the ePortfolio overview, click the title of the page where you want to add the assignment.  
4. Click Edit This Page.  
5. Click the Course Submission link.  
6. In the submission list (newest first), click the past assignment you want to add.  
7. Click Select Submission.  
8. Click Save Page.  

Your selected assignment now appears on the page and can be viewed or downloaded.

input: How do I insert a personal file into my ePortfolio using the My Files icon in the Global Navigation? What are the steps for uploading, editing, and saving it?
expected_output:
Step-by-step instructions:

1. Navigate to your ePortfolio  
   - In Global Navigation, click Account > ePortfolios.  
2. Open and edit the page  
   - Click your ePortfolio title.  
   - Click the page title you want to edit.  
   - Click Edit This Page.  
3. Insert a personal file  
   - Click the Image/File Upload link.  
   - In the file dialog, click the My Files icon.  
   - (If needed) Click Upload a File to add a new file to My Files, then select it.  
4. Upload and place the file  
   - Select your personal file and click Select/Upload File.  
5. Save and view  
   - Click Save Page.  
   - Review your page to confirm the file appears (as an image or download link).

Document Title: How do I upload a file or image to my ePortfolio page

How do I upload a file or image to my ePortfolio page? You can upload files or images and use previously uploaded files or images from your personal files in your ePortfolio. You can upload any file type to your ePortfolio. Files uploaded to your ePortfolio count against your user storage quota set by your institution. Image files uploaded to your ePortfolio will render as an image on the ePortfolio page; all other file types will display a download link for the file.  Open ePortfolios In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the ePortfolios link . Open ePortfolio Click the title of the ePortfolio. Select Page Click the title of the page you wish to edit. Edit Page Click the Edit This Page button. Add Image or File Click on the Image/File Upload link. Choose File Click the Choose File button. Select File Locate the file  and click the Open button . Upload File Click the Select/Upload File button  to upload the file. Notes : You can also use the files you have previously uploaded to your personal files by clicking on the my files icon . Multiple files and different file types can be uploaded to the same ePortfolio page. Delete File You can delete a file or image by selecting the Delete icon. Save Changes Click the Save Page button to save the changes you made. View Page View the changes you made to the page.

input: What are the login requirements, and how can I navigate in Canvas to Global Navigation > Account > ePortfolios, open my ePortfolio, select a page, enable public comments, and save my changes?
expected_output:
1. Log in to Canvas   
   - You must be signed in with the same Canvas account you used to create the ePortfolio.

2. Navigate to ePortfolios   
   1. In the Global Navigation menu (left sidebar), click Account.  
   2. Click ePortfolios.

3. Open your ePortfolio  
   - Click the title of the ePortfolio you want to edit.

4. Select the page  
   - Click the title of the specific page where you want to enable comments.

5. Edit the page  
   - Click the Edit This Page button at the top.

6. Enable and make comments public  
   - Check Allow Comments on this Page.  
   - Check Make Comments Public (so others can view comments).

7. Save your changes  
   - Click the Save Page button.
context:
Document Title: How do I enable comments in my ePortfolio

How do I enable comments in my ePortfolio? Enable comments to allow others to add comments to your ePortfolio pages. Comments will only be visible to the ePortfolio owner. To allow others to view comments, you will need to make comments public. Note : Users must be logged in to the same Canvas account to make comments regardless of your ePortfolio visibility setting.  Open ePortfolios In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the ePortfolios link . Open ePortfolio Click the title of the ePortfolio. Select Page Click the title of the page you want to enable comments on. Edit Page Click the Edit This Page button. Enable Comments Click the Allow Comments on this Page checkbox. You can also make comments public by clicking the Make Comments Public checkbox. Save Page Click the Save Page button. Add Comment Below the content of the page, there is a place for comments. You can add a comment by typing in the text box  and clicking the Add Comment button . Note : Users must be logged in to the same Canvas account to make comments regardless of your ePortfolio visibility setting. View Comment You can view the comment at the bottom of the page . Delete a comment by clicking the Delete icon . Note: Comments will only be visible to the ePortfolio owner. To allow others to view comments, you will need to make comments public.

input: In the Global Navigation Account > ePortfolios settings, which page edit checkboxes allow comments and public comments?
expected_output:
• Allow Comments on this Page – enables comments on the selected ePortfolio page  
• Make Comments Public – makes those comments visible to others (beyond the ePortfolio owner)

input: How can I download my ePortfolio as a zip file in Canvas? I’ve navigated to Global Nav > Account > ePortfolios > [portfolio title], but I’m not sure what to click next or how to view the download progress bar.

Note: ePortfolio downloads don’t include comments.

input: How can I copy and externally share my private ePortfolio’s Canvas share link via Global Navigation?
expected_output:
1. In Canvas Global Navigation, click Account and select ePortfolios.  
2. Click the title of the private ePortfolio you want to share.  
3. Click the Share link (usually a chain-link or “Share” button).  
4. To copy the URL:  
   • Right-click the share link and choose Copy link   
   • OR click the share link, let the URL appear in your browser’s address bar, highlight it, right-click, and choose Copy.  
5. Paste the copied link into an email or any external sharing tool.

How can I share a private ePortfolio? Sharing a private ePortfolio link will give others access to viewing your ePortfolio without having to log into Canvas.  Open ePortfolios In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the ePortfolios link . Open ePortfolio Click the title of the ePortfolio. Share ePortfolio All ePortfolios are, by default, private. This means that only you can see the contents of the portfolio. To share your ePortfolio, you will need to copy and paste the link into an email or other sharing utility. Copy ePortfolio Link To copy the ePortfolio link, right click the share link and select the Copy link. You can also click the share link and the URL will appear in your address bar. Highlight the link, right click, and select the Copy link.

input: How can instructors upload one or multiple files to Course Files in Canvas, assign usage rights, and publish them?
expected_output:
1. In your course, click Files in the course navigation.  
2. (Optional) Click Add Folder to organize your uploads.  
3. Click Upload (or drag-and-drop) and select one or multiple files from your computer.  
4. For each uploaded file, click the File Options ⋮ icon and choose Manage Usage Rights.  
5. Select the appropriate copyright/license and click Save.  
6. To publish files individually, click the cloud icon next to each file (gray = unpublished; green = published).  
   • To publish in bulk, select file checkboxes, then click the Publish icon in the toolbar.
context:
Document Title: How do I use Files

How do I use Files? The Files feature in Canvas allows you to store files and assignments within Canvas. You can upload one or multiple files, view all details about your files, preview files, publish and unpublish files, set usage rights, and restrict access to files. Depending on your role, you have access to files (documents, images, media, etc.) in three different feature areas: User files , located in your user profile Course files , located in each course where you are enrolled Group files , located in each group where you are a member Note: Some files count against file quotas and affect the amount of available storage used by files.  View All Files The basic functionality within Files is the same within each location, but some features may differ according to feature area. In the All My Files page, all folders for your own files and course files display . Some folders may be housed within other folders. To view the contents of a folder, click the folder name . To switch to the old view, click the Switch to Old Files Page button . View File Folder Within a folder, you can view the name of each file or folder , the date it was created , the date it was modified , the name of the person who modified the file or folder , and the file size . Courses and groups may display a column for usage rights . If enabled, the column displays the user right (copyright) for the file . You can also view or change the published status of files or folders . If you are viewing course or group files and you want to view all files you have access to, click the All My Files link . To switch to the old view, click the Switch to Old Files Page button . Files are sorted alphabetically. To sort files, click the name of any column heading. Manage Files or Folders Depending on the file area, there may be several options to manage files: Search for files by file name . Add a folder . Folders can also house other folders . Upload a file . Set usage rights (copyright) for a file . For courses and groups using usage rights, you must set usage rights for a file before it can be published. Files that do not contain a usage right display as a warning icon. Change the state of the file . Files can be published, unpublished, or include a restricted status . Manage Individual File or Folder To manage an individual file or folder, click the File Options icon . You can rename , download , move , or delete  the file or folder. You can also edit permissions  or manage usage rights . Bulk Manage Files or Folders You can select multiple files or folders at the same time by clicking the checkboxes next to the file or folder names . Alternatively, you can use the following keyboard shortcuts: To select all rows, press the Control + A (PC) or Command + A (Mac) keys simultaneously. To select individual rows, press the Control + Click (PC) or Command + Click keys simultaneously. To select a range of rows, press Shift + Click simultaneously. To deselect all, press the Control + Shift + A (PC) or Command + Shift + A (Mac) keys simultaneously. From the toolbar, you can download  or delete  the files or folders. To view more settings, click the Options icon . You can bulk edit the permissions  or manage the usage rights  of the files or folders you selected. To move the files or folders , select the Move To... option . Note: When selecting more than one file, the option appears to download as a zip file. View Blueprint Course If you are an instructor and your course includes Blueprint icons, your course is associated with a blueprint course. Blueprint Courses are courses managed as a template and may contain locked objects managed by a Canvas admin, course designer, or other instructor. The Course Details tab in Course Settings will tell you if your course is a blueprint course. Most commonly, your course will not be a blueprint course and you can only manage unlocked content in your course . If your course is a blueprint course, you can lock and sync course content to associated courses.

input: How can I select multiple files in Canvas to download them as a ZIP file?
expected_output:
1. Navigate to the Files area in your course, group, or user account.  
2. Select the files you want to download:  
   - Click each file’s checkbox, or  
   - Use keyboard shortcuts:  
     • PC: Ctrl + Click to pick individual files, Shift + Click for a range, or Ctrl + A to select all  
     • Mac: Cmd + Click, Shift + Click, or Cmd + A  
3. In the toolbar above the file list, click the Download icon.  
4. Canvas will bundle the selected files into a ZIP archive and prompt you to save it.
