input: How do I enable the OpenDyslexic typeface in Canvas using the Dyslexia-Friendly Font toggle in the Account menu?
expected_output:
1. Log in to Canvas and open the Global Navigation Menu.  
2. Click Account.  
3. In the Account menu tray, find the Dyslexia-Friendly Font toggle.  
4. Click the toggle to turn it on.  
5. Canvas will switch its interface font to OpenDyslexic.
context:
Document Title: How do I use the Global Navigation Menu

How do I use the Global Navigation Menu? The Global Navigation Menu is located on the left side of every page in Canvas. Global Navigation links provide quick access to frequently used Canvas features. These links provide access to all your courses collectively. Default links include Account, Dashboard, Courses, Groups, Calendar, Inbox, History, and Help. Depending on your institution account settings, other links may display in the Global Navigation Menu. Note: Depending on course settings, the Global Navigation Menu may use a different font for one or more of your courses. For example, Canvas uses a different font when displaying courses that use the Canvas Elementary Theme .  View Global Navigation Menu After logging into Canvas, view the Global Navigation Menu. View Account To view your user information, click the Account link . A menu tray expands and displays links to access your user settings , notification settings , personal files , and ePortfolios (if enabled) . If your institution has enabled Profiles, you can access your profile . You can access additional feature options  and can also use the Account link to log out of Canvas. Note: You can enable the high contrast user interface feature option. Enable Dyslexia-friendly Font To enable dyslexia-friendly font, click the Dyslexia-Friendly Font toggle on. View Dyslexia Font Set The Canvas interface displays the OpenDyslexic font. Note: You can also enable the Use a dyslexia friendly font feature option in User Settings . View Dashboard The Dashboard is the landing page after you log in to Canvas. You may be able to view the Dashboard in a course view, list view, or recent activity view. Learn more about using the Dashboard as a student , as an instructor , or as an observer/parent . View Courses To view your courses, click the Courses link . The Courses menu displays a list of your favorite courses , or, if you haven't selected any favorite courses, the menu displays current courses where you are enrolled. If you are an instructor, the Courses menu is organized by published courses and unpublished courses. For each course, you can view the course name, term details, associated Student Information System ID (SIS ID), and section enrollment details . To view a course, click the course name link. To customize your cour≤ses list or view all your Canvas courses , click the All Courses link . View Groups If you are enrolled in Groups, view your groups in the Groups link . A menu will expand and display all groups in current courses where you are enrolled as a member. To view a group, click the name of the group . To view all your groups, click the All Groups link . As a student, you can learn more about viewing student groups and using groups . As an instructor, you can learn more about viewing instructor groups as an instructor and viewing course groups . View Calendar To view your Calendar , click the Calendar link. View Inbox To view your Conversations Inbox , click the Inbox link. Conversations is the Canvas messaging system where you can communicate with other users in your courses. The number of new messages are shown as part of the Inbox icon. View History To view your recent Canvas course page view history , click the History link. Recent History displays up to three weeks of your Canvas course page view history. View Help To get help with Canvas , click the Help link. Select the help option that is relevant to your needs. Note: Depending on your institution settings, the Help menu may display different options. Collapse Global Navigation Menu To expand or collapse the Global Navigation menu, click the arrow icon. The Global Navigation Menu automatically collapses for tablet screens.

input: How do I use the left-side Global Nav to open Courses, view my enrollments in All Courses, and access my favorite courses?
expected_output:
1. Log in to Canvas and locate the Global Navigation Menu on the left side of the screen.  
2. Click the “Courses” link. A drop-down menu opens.  
3. To open a favorite course, simply click its name under “Courses.”  
4. To see every course you’re enrolled in, scroll to the bottom of the menu and click “All Courses.”  
5. (Optional) To mark or unmark a course as a favorite, click the star icon next to the course name in “All Courses.” Favorited courses will then appear at the top of your “Courses” menu.
context:
Document Title: How do I use the Global Navigation Menu

How do I use the Global Navigation Menu? The Global Navigation Menu is located on the left side of every page in Canvas. Global Navigation links provide quick access to frequently used Canvas features. These links provide access to all your courses collectively. Default links include Account, Dashboard, Courses, Groups, Calendar, Inbox, History, and Help. Depending on your institution account settings, other links may display in the Global Navigation Menu. Note: Depending on course settings, the Global Navigation Menu may use a different font for one or more of your courses. For example, Canvas uses a different font when displaying courses that use the Canvas Elementary Theme .  View Global Navigation Menu After logging into Canvas, view the Global Navigation Menu. View Account To view your user information, click the Account link . A menu tray expands and displays links to access your user settings , notification settings , personal files , and ePortfolios (if enabled) . If your institution has enabled Profiles, you can access your profile . You can access additional feature options  and can also use the Account link to log out of Canvas. Note: You can enable the high contrast user interface feature option. Enable Dyslexia-friendly Font To enable dyslexia-friendly font, click the Dyslexia-Friendly Font toggle on. View Dyslexia Font Set The Canvas interface displays the OpenDyslexic font. Note: You can also enable the Use a dyslexia friendly font feature option in User Settings . View Dashboard The Dashboard is the landing page after you log in to Canvas. You may be able to view the Dashboard in a course view, list view, or recent activity view. Learn more about using the Dashboard as a student , as an instructor , or as an observer/parent . View Courses To view your courses, click the Courses link . The Courses menu displays a list of your favorite courses , or, if you haven't selected any favorite courses, the menu displays current courses where you are enrolled. If you are an instructor, the Courses menu is organized by published courses and unpublished courses. For each course, you can view the course name, term details, associated Student Information System ID (SIS ID), and section enrollment details . To view a course, click the course name link. To customize your cour≤ses list or view all your Canvas courses , click the All Courses link . View Groups If you are enrolled in Groups, view your groups in the Groups link . A menu will expand and display all groups in current courses where you are enrolled as a member. To view a group, click the name of the group . To view all your groups, click the All Groups link . As a student, you can learn more about viewing student groups and using groups . As an instructor, you can learn more about viewing instructor groups as an instructor and viewing course groups . View Calendar To view your Calendar , click the Calendar link. View Inbox To view your Conversations Inbox , click the Inbox link. Conversations is the Canvas messaging system where you can communicate with other users in your courses. The number of new messages are shown as part of the Inbox icon. View History To view your recent Canvas course page view history , click the History link. Recent History displays up to three weeks of your Canvas course page view history. View Help To get help with Canvas , click the Help link. Select the help option that is relevant to your needs. Note: Depending on your institution settings, the Help menu may display different options. Collapse Global Navigation Menu To expand or collapse the Global Navigation menu, click the arrow icon. The Global Navigation Menu automatically collapses for tablet screens.

input: How do I open the Global Announcements page from the Account menu in Canvas and view current, recent, and dismissed announcements?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Account, then select Global Announcements.  
2. To see active announcements, click the Current tab.  
3. To see announcements from the past four months, click the Recent tab.  
4. To reopen any announcement you’ve dismissed, click its View button.
context:
Document Title: How do I view the Global Announcements page

How do I view the Global Announcements page? You can view current and recent global announcements on the Global Announcements page. Global announcements are announcements created by an admin user at your institution and display on the Dashboard to all applicable user roles. The Global Announcements page displays global announcements that are currently active, announcements that you dismissed from the dashboard, and announcements from the past four months.  Open Global Announcements In the Global Navigation menu, click the Account link , then click the Global Announcements link . View Current Announcements To view currently active announcements, click the Current tab. There are five announcement types for global announcements: A blue announcement with an i icon indicates an information announcement type. A red announcement with an exclamation icon indicates an error announcement type. An orange announcement with an exclamation icon indicates a warning announcement type. A blue announcement with a question icon indicates a question announcement type. A blue announcement with a calendar icon indicates a calendar announcement type. View Recent Announcements To view announcements from the past four months, click the Recent tab. View Dismissed Announcement When you dismiss a global announcement, Canvas displays a message notifying you that you can view the announcement on the Global Announcements page. To view the announcement, click the View button.

input: How do I display dismissed announcements with their icons using the View button on the Global Announcements page in Canvas?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Account and select Global Announcements.  
2. On the Global Announcements page, click the Recent tab (where dismissed items appear).  
3. Find the announcement you previously dismissed.  
4. Click its View button. The announcement opens showing its full content along with the type icon (information, error, warning, question, or calendar).

input: Which icon in the Global Navigation menu lets me view my recent Canvas course page history from the last 30 days?
expected_output: Use the History (clock) icon in Global Navigation – clicking this opens your Recent History list, showing all course page views from the past 30 days.
context:
Document Title: How do I view my recent page view history in Canvas

How do I view my recent page view history in Canvas? As a student, you can view a list of your recent Canvas course page views from the History link in Global Navigation. The Recent History list displays your page view activity from the last 30 days. Notes: If you are an instructor and you remove a page from a course, Recent History displays the page view, but the link is no longer valid. Course content should be completed and verified before the course is published for students. If you are an admin, your Recent History displays a list of pages you have viewed for yourself directly in Canvas courses. Additionally, acting as a user displays the recent history for the user, not the page views you create. Page history displayed in Recent History is the same as what's found in a user's page views or the user access report. Recent History is not available in the Canvas Beta or Test environments. If accessed in those environments, the page will instead link to the Canvas Guides article about using Beta or Test instances.  Open History In Global Navigation, click the History link. View Recent History Recent History displays your page view activity from the last 30 days.Page views are shown in chronological order, with the most recent activity listed first. List items display the following information: Activity Icon : the Canvas feature or course activity type Course Link : the name of the course content area or content item name Course Name : the name of the course in which you viewed the item; if set, the course nickname displays Viewed Date : the date and time when you viewed the page; if the page view occurred within the last 24 hours, a time stamp of [n] hours ago displays View Recent History Icons The following icons display in Recent History: Home : viewed a course home page Announcements : viewed a course or group Announcements page or a course or group announcement Assignments : viewed a course Assignments Index page or an assignment Pages/Collaborations : viewed a course or group Pages Index page, Collaborations page, course or group page, or course or group collaboration Conferences : viewed a course or group Conferences page Discussions : viewed a course or group Discussions page or a course or group discussion Files : viewed a course, group, or user Files page or a course, group, or user file Grades : viewed a course grades page Modules : viewed a course Modules page Outcomes : viewed a course Outcomes page People : viewed a course People page Quizzes : viewed a course Quizzes page or a quiz External Tools (LTI) : viewed an external tool from Course Navigation or opened an LTI in the course

input: How do I access the Recent History in Canvas Global Navigation to see page view activity for the last 30 days?
expected_output:
1. Log in to Canvas and locate the Global Navigation menu (left-hand sidebar).  
2. Click the History link (clock icon).  
3. Review your Recent History list—Canvas displays all page views from the past 30 days in reverse chronological order.  
   - Each entry shows an activity icon (e.g., Pages, Quizzes), the content item name, course name, and the date/time viewed.

input: Upon exiting Canvas, how do I use the Global Navigation Account link to log out?
expected_output:
1. In the left-hand Global Navigation menu, click the **Account** link (your profile icon).  
2. In the Account menu, click the **Logout** button.
context:
Document Title: How do I log out of Canvas

How do I log out of Canvas? When you are finished accessing Canvas, you can log out of your account.  Log Out In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Logout button .

input: Which two items in the Global Navigation menu do I need to click in sequence to log out of Canvas?
expected_output:
1. Click the **Account** link in Global Navigation  
2. Click the **Logout** button
context:
Document Title: How do I log out of Canvas

How do I log out of Canvas? When you are finished accessing Canvas, you can log out of your account.  Log Out In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Logout button .

input: Why does right-clicking or option-clicking the Inbox link in the Canvas Global Navigation open a new tab and clear the unread message count?
expected_output: Right- or Option-clicking the Inbox link uses your browser’s “Open in New Tab” command, which immediately loads (and thus “opens”) your Inbox. Canvas treats that load as viewing your messages, so any unread count is cleared as soon as the Inbox page appears in the new tab.
context:
Document Title: How do I use the Inbox

How do I use the Inbox? The Canvas Inbox is split into two panels and displays messages chronologically. You can view and reply to conversations and sort them by course or inbox type. The Inbox itself does not have any file size limits; however, attachments added to a conversation are included in the sender's personal files. Learn more about the Inbox. Notes: If you right-click or option-click on the Inbox link, you can open your Inbox in a new browser tab to keep it handy while you are doing other tasks in Canvas. Users display in conversations once they have an active enrollment in the course, and users cannot join a course unless it is published. Once a course has concluded, you cannot message users in that course.  Open Inbox In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link. If the Inbox link includes a numbered indicator, the indicator shows how many unread messages you have in your Inbox. Once you read the new messages, the indicator will disappear. View Inbox Toolbar The toolbar includes global message options. To load conversations, filter your messages by course or group  and type . Filtering by type lets you filter messages by Inbox, Unread, Starred, Sent, Archived, and Submission Comments. You can search for conversations by user in the Search by user field . To compose a message , click the Compose icon . View Optional Toolbar If your admin has enabled Inbox settings, the toolbar displays a Settings icon and a Compose button. Inbox settings allow you to generate automatic replies or add a signature. To manage Inbox settings , click the Settings icon . To compose a message, click the Compose button . Manage Conversations Once you have selected a conversation, you can use the other options in the toolbar to: Reply to a conversation  Reply-all to a conversation  Archive a conversation  Delete a conversation  To forward a conversation, mark a conversation as read or unread, and star conversations, click the More Options icon . View Inbox Panels Conversations for your selected course and Inbox filter appear in the left Inbox panel. View Conversations The Inbox is organized chronologically from newest to oldest with the newest conversations appearing on top  and the older conversations at the bottom. You can manually mark a conversation as read or unread by hovering over the conversation and clicking the circle to the left of the conversation . To star a conversation, hover over the conversation and click the star to the right of the conversation . View Conversation Thread When you select a conversation , all messages in the conversations thread display in the right Inbox panel . View Message Details The conversation thread displays the title of the conversation . Each message within a conversation displays the names of the message participants, with the name of the sender in bold . You can view the course name, the author's personal pronouns (if enabled), and the date and time the message was sent . You can also view the message content . To de-select a conversation, click the Return icon . Manage Conversation Thread Within each conversation thread, you can reply, reply-all, forward, archive, star, or delete the entire conversation thread. To reply to the latest message in a conversation, click the Reply icon . To reply-all, forward, archive, star, or delete the entire conversation thread, click the More Options icon . Then click one of the options . Manage Individual Message You can manage an individual message within a conversation. To reply to a message within a conversation, click the Reply icon . To reply-all, forward, or delete a message within a conversation thread, click the More Options icon . Then click one of the options . Select Multiple Conversations To select multiple message conversations to archive, delete, mark as read, mark as unread, or star, click the checkbox for each message . Then click the Inbox toolbar More Options icon , and select an option. Note: To select or deselect conversations, you can also press the command key (Mac) or the control key (Windows) while clicking each message you want to select or deselect.

input: Where is the Compose button within Canvas Global Navigation’s Inbox link and optional Inbox toolbar?
expected_output:
• In the global Inbox toolbar  
  1. Click the Inbox link in Global Navigation.  
  2. In the top toolbar (next to the “Search by user” field), click the pencil-shaped Compose icon.  

• In the optional Inbox toolbar (if enabled by your admin)  
  1. Click the Inbox link in Global Navigation.  
  2. In the top toolbar, click the Compose button located immediately beside the Settings (gear) icon.

input: In the Canvas Inbox Compose panel, how can I send individual messages to students who have differentiation tags?
expected_output:
1. Open the Canvas Inbox and click the Compose icon.  
2. In the Course drop-down, select your course.  
3. In the To field, click the Course Roster (Address Book) icon.  
4. From the Roles/Tags menu, choose your differentiation tag.  
   – When you select a tag, the “Send an individual message to each recipient” checkbox is automatically disabled (Canvas will send each student in that tag an individual message).  
5. Enter a subject and your message.  
6. Click Send.
context:
Document Title: How do I send a message to a user in a course in the Inbox

How do I send a message to a user in a course in the Inbox? In the Inbox, you can send a message to one user or multiple users in a course. If enabled by your institution, you can send a message to users with differentiation tags . If your recipient list contains more than 100 users, your message will automatically be sent as individual messages to each user. As the sender, you will also be included in the total recipient count. Learn more about the Inbox. Notes: Currently you cannot message users in multiple courses. You can also send a message to yourself, but messages can only be viewed in the Sent messages folder. Users display in the Inbox once they have an active enrollment in the course, and users cannot join a course unless it is published. You cannot send messages to users in concluded courses.  Open Inbox In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link. Compose Message Click the Compose icon. Note: The toolbar may appear different if your admin has enabled settings that allow the auto-response or signature. For more information, visit How do I manage my Inbox settings? Select Course In the Course drop-down menu , select the course where you want to send your message . Add User Search for the user in the To field . Alternatively, you can locate and select a user by clicking the Course Roster button  or you can send messages to specific tag groups . If enabled by your institution, you can send a message to users with differentiation tags . Note: When sending a message to students with differentiation tags, the Send an individual message checkbox is disabled. This prevents accidental exposure of which students are associated with a tag. Search for User To search for a user, type the user's name in the To field . Select the user's name from the list . Add Multiple Users To send a message to multiple users, add names of the users in the To field . You can send an individual message to each recipient by clicking the Send an individual message to each recipient checkbox . Use Address Book To add a user from the course roster, click the Address Book button . Select the role of the user you'd like to add . Then select the user's name . Names are listed in alphabetical order by last name. To add multiple users to your message, press the command key (Mac) or the control key (Windows) and click the name of the applicable users. To navigate back to the course roster, click the Back option . Send Message In the subject line field , enter a subject line for your message. If you are sending your message to multiple users, but you do not want each user to see who else was included in the message, click the Send an individual message to each recipient checkbox . If your message includes over 100 recipients (including you as the sender), this checkbox will be selected by default. In the message field , type your message. All content is sent in plain text. URLs included in a message automatically become clickable links after the message is sent. To include an attachment or media file, click the Attachment or Media File buttons . When you are finished, click the Send button .

input: In the Canvas Inbox course Address Book, after choosing a role, how do I select multiple users at once? Do I need to hold the Control key on Windows or the Command key on Mac while clicking?
expected_output:
1. In the Address Book, choose the role whose users you want to message.  
2. To select more than one name, hold down Control (Windows) or Command (Mac) and click each user’s name.  
3. After selecting all users, click Back to return to your message draft.

input: In Canvas Inbox, how do I open the Address Book, choose 'All in [Course]', and send a message?
expected_output:
1. Open the Address Book  
   – In your Inbox message draft, click the Address Book icon next to the “To” field.  

2. Choose All in [Course]  
   – In the Address Book pane, select All in [Your Course Name].  

3. Compose and Send  
   a. Enter a Subject.  
   b. (Optional) Check Send an individual message to each recipient to hide other recipients.  
   c. Type your message in the body (plain text; URLs auto–link).  
   d. (Optional) Attach files via the Attachment or Media File buttons.  
   e. Click Send.
context:
Document Title: How do I send a message to all course users in the Inbox

How do I send a message to all course users in the Inbox? You may be able to use the Inbox to send a message to all users in a course, all users in a specific role, or all users in a group. If your recipient list contains more than 100 users, your message will automatically be sent as individual messages to each user. As the sender, you will also be included in the total recipient count. Learn more about the Inbox. Notes: Messaging all users is a course permission. If you cannot send a message to all users, your institution has restricted this feature. Once your course has concluded, you cannot send a message to all users. Users display in the Inbox once they have an active enrollment in the course, and users cannot join a course unless it is published.  Open Inbox In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link. Compose Message Click the Compose icon. Note: The toolbar may appear different if your admin has enabled the auto-response or signature. For more information, visit How do I manage my Inbox settings as a student? Select Course In the Course drop-down menu , select the course where you want to send a message . Open Address Book Click the Address Book button. Select All Users in Course To send a message to all users in the course, select the All in [course name] option. Select User Role To send a message to all members with a specific user role, click the name of that role  and then click the link for all users with that role . Select Group To send a message to all members with a specific group, click the Student Groups option , click the name of the group , and then click the All in [group] option . Send Message In the subject line field , enter a subject line for your message. If you are sending your message to multiple users, but you do not want each user to see who else was included in the message, click the Send an individual message to each recipient checkbox . If your message includes over 100 recipients (including you as the sender), this checkbox is selected by default. In the message field , type your message. All content is sent in plain text. URLs included in a message automatically become clickable links after the message is sent. If you want to include an attachment or media file, click the Attachment or Media File buttons . When you are finished, click the Send button . View Message Your message will appear at the top of your Sent folder. When someone replies to your message, the message will be shown in the Inbox. Note: You can reply to the recipient or reply-all to everyone in the class.

input: After opening the Inbox, selecting your course and recipients, which checkbox enforces individual messaging?
expected_output: The “Send an individual message to each recipient” checkbox enforces individual messaging. Just select that option before clicking Send.
context:
Document Title: How do I send a message to all course users in the Inbox

How do I send a message to all course users in the Inbox? You may be able to use the Inbox to send a message to all users in a course, all users in a specific role, or all users in a group. If your recipient list contains more than 100 users, your message will automatically be sent as individual messages to each user. As the sender, you will also be included in the total recipient count. Learn more about the Inbox. Notes: Messaging all users is a course permission. If you cannot send a message to all users, your institution has restricted this feature. Once your course has concluded, you cannot send a message to all users. Users display in the Inbox once they have an active enrollment in the course, and users cannot join a course unless it is published.  Open Inbox In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link. Compose Message Click the Compose icon. Note: The toolbar may appear different if your admin has enabled the auto-response or signature. For more information, visit How do I manage my Inbox settings as a student? Select Course In the Course drop-down menu , select the course where you want to send a message . Open Address Book Click the Address Book button. Select All Users in Course To send a message to all users in the course, select the All in [course name] option. Select User Role To send a message to all members with a specific user role, click the name of that role  and then click the link for all users with that role . Select Group To send a message to all members with a specific group, click the Student Groups option , click the name of the group , and then click the All in [group] option . Send Message In the subject line field , enter a subject line for your message. If you are sending your message to multiple users, but you do not want each user to see who else was included in the message, click the Send an individual message to each recipient checkbox . If your message includes over 100 recipients (including you as the sender), this checkbox is selected by default. In the message field , type your message. All content is sent in plain text. URLs included in a message automatically become clickable links after the message is sent. If you want to include an attachment or media file, click the Attachment or Media File buttons . When you are finished, click the Send button . View Message Your message will appear at the top of your Sent folder. When someone replies to your message, the message will be shown in the Inbox. Note: You can reply to the recipient or reply-all to everyone in the class.

input: After opening the Inbox via Global Navigation, which drop-down menu filters to show only conversations marked with a blue dot?
expected_output:
1. Open the Inbox via Global Navigation.  
2. Click the Inbox drop-down menu.  
3. Select Unread to filter conversations marked with a blue dot.
context:
Document Title: How do I find my unread messages in the Inbox

How do I find my unread messages in the Inbox? You can view all unread messages in your Inbox. You can also filter messages to show only unread messages.  Open Inbox In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link. View Unread Message All unread messages have an indicator next to the message. Once a Conversation has been read, the blue dot changes to a gray circle. Mark as Unread If you want to mark a conversation as unread, click the read indicator . The message will now show the unread indicator . Mark Multiple Messages You can mark multiple conversations as unread or read by pressing the command key (Mac) or the control key (Windows) while clicking multiple messages, or by selecting the message checkbox . Click the More Options icon  and select the Mark all as unread link . To mark unread conversations as read, select the Mark all as read link . Select Unread Conversations To view only unread messages, open the the Inbox drop-down menu . Select the Unread link .

input: How do I multi-select conversations in the Canvas Inbox using Ctrl (or Cmd on a Mac) and restore the unread indicator from the More Options menu?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link.  
2. Hold Ctrl (Windows) or Cmd (Mac) and click each conversation you want to select.  
3. Click the More Options icon (⋯) above your conversation list.  
4. Choose Mark all as unread to restore the unread (blue dot) indicator.

input: How do I open the Canvas Inbox, compose a message, select a course, use the Address Book to choose a student group, select members, and send to more than 100 students with attachments?
expected_output:
1. Open Inbox  
   - In Global Navigation, click Inbox.  

2. Compose a new message  
   - Click the Compose (pencil) icon.  

3. Select your course  
   - Click the Course drop-down menu and choose the desired course.  

4. Open the Address Book  
   - Click Address Book (link icon), then select Student Groups.  

5. Choose your group and members  
   - Click the group name to view its members.  
   - Click each student’s name to add them to the To: field.  

6. Prepare message for 100+ recipients  
   - In the Subject field, enter your subject.  
   - Canvas auto-checks “Send an individual message to each recipient” when you exceed 100 recipients (including yourself).  

7. Add attachments  
   - Click Attachment to upload files or Media File to insert multimedia.  

8. Send your message  
   - Type your message in the body field.  
   - Click Send.
context:
Document Title: How do I send a message to a user in a student group in the

How do I send a message to a user in a student group in the Inbox? In the Inbox, you can send a message to one user or multiple users in a group. If your recipient list contains more than 100 users, your message will automatically be sent as individual messages to each user. As the sender, you will also be included in the total recipient count. Learn more about the Inbox. Notes: Currently you cannot message users in multiple groups. Once a course has concluded, you cannot message groups in that course.  Open Inbox In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link. Compose Message Click the Compose icon. Note: The toolbar may appear different if your admin has enabled the auto-response or signature. For more information, visit How do I manage my Inbox settings as a student? Select Course Click the Course drop-down menu , then select the course name . Add Users To add a user, you can search for the user in the To field  or use the Address Book . Search for Users To search for a user, type the user's name in the To field . Canvas automatically populates matching names. Select the user's name . To send a message to multiple users, type the names of additional users in the To field. View Student Groups To view and add a user in a student group, click the Address Book button , then the Student Groups option . Select the group name . Add Group Member Group members' names display in alphabetical order by last name. Select the user's name which you would like to add to the message . To send a message to multiple users, navigate back to the group member list by clicking the Address Book button . Send Message In the Subject field , enter a subject line for your message. If you are sending your message to multiple users, but you do not want each user to see who else was included in the message, click the Send an individual message to each recipient checkbox .  If your message includes over 100 recipients (including you as the sender), this checkbox is selected by default. In the message field , type your message. All content is sent in plain text. URLs included in a message automatically become clickable links after the message is sent. If you want to include an attachment or media file, click the Attachment or Media File buttons . When you are finished, click the Send button . Note: When the Inbox AI Translation feature option is enabled at the account level, users can access AI-supported translations for Inbox messages . To learn more about the feature preview, ask questions, or comment on functionality, navigate to the Discussion/Inbox AI Translation user group .

input: How can I message a Canvas student group in the Inbox? Should I use the course Address Book, and what steps do I follow to select the group, compose, and send the message?
expected_output:
1. Open the Inbox  
   - In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link.  
   - Click the Compose icon.  

2. Select your course  
   - Click the Course drop-down menu and choose the course containing the student group.  

3. Choose the student group  
   - Click the Address Book button.  
   - Select the Student Groups tab.  
   - Click the group name to view its members.  

4. Add group members to your message  
   - Click each student’s name to add them to the To field.  

5. Enter your subject and message  
   - In the Subject field, type a clear subject line.  
   - In the message field, compose your message (plain text).  

6. (Optional) Send individual messages  
   - If you don’t want recipients to see each other or you have over 100 recipients, check “Send an individual message to each recipient.”  

7. Attach files or media (if needed)  
   - Click Attachment or Media File and upload your content.  

8. Send your message  
   - When ready, click the Send button.

input: In Canvas Conversations, which icons or buttons do I use to compose a message, add or remove attachments, and view attachments?
expected_output:
1. To compose a message: click the Compose icon in the Inbox toolbar.  
2. To add an attachment: click the Attachment (paperclip) icon and select your file(s).  
3. To remove an attachment: click the Remove (x) icon next to the unwanted file.  
4. To view attachments: click the file link displayed below your sent or received message.
context:
Document Title: How do I attach a file to a message in the Inbox

How do I attach a file to a message in the Inbox? You can upload supplemental files as part of your Inbox messages. Note : Attachments appear in your user files in the Conversation Attachments folder and count against the files limit for your account.  Open Inbox In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link. Compose Message To start a new message, click the Compose icon. Note: The toolbar may appear different if your admin has enabled the auto-response or signature. For more information, visit How do I manage my Inbox settings as a student? Browse for Attachment To attach a file, click the Attachment icon. Select File(s) Select the file and click the Open button. Select Multiple Files You can upload additional files by clicking the Attachment icon . If you accidentally select the wrong file, click the Remove icon to remove it , or click the Attachment icon, or double click the file to select a different file. When you are finished, click the Send button . View Attachment(s) The attachments display below the message. To view the file, click the link.

input: How do I remove an attached file from a message in the Canvas Inbox before sending it?
expected_output:
1. Open the Inbox and compose or reply to a message.  
2. In the attachment area below your message, locate the file you want to remove.  
3. Click the Remove icon (trash can) next to the file name.  
4. Verify the file no longer appears under Attachments.  
5. Finish your message and click Send.

input: How do I grant webcam access, record a video message in Canvas Inbox, preview it, name the file, save it, and send it?
expected_output:
1. Open your Canvas Inbox and click the Compose icon.  
2. Click the Media icon in the message toolbar.  
3. In the pop-up window, when prompted by instructure.com, click Allow to grant webcam access.  
4. Select the Record tab, then choose the webcam icon.  
5. Click Start Recording to begin and Finish when you’re done.  
6. Review your recording in the preview pane.  
7. In the File name field, enter a name for your video.  
8. If needed, click Start Over to re-record; otherwise, click Save Media.  
9. Your video appears in the message—click Send to deliver it.
context:
Document Title: How do I record or upload media to a message in the Inbox

How do I record or upload media to a message in the Inbox? You can record or upload video and audio files as part of your Inbox messages. For more information about supported media types, please see the Canvas Media Files lesson . Notes: Attachments appear in your user files in the Conversation Attachments folder and count against the files limit for your account. You can also learn how to attach files to messages .  Open Inbox In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link. Compose Message To start a new message, click the Compose icon. Note: The toolbar may appear different if your admin has enabled settings for auto-response or signature. For more information, visit How do I manage my Inbox settings? Open Media To record or upload a media comment or file, click the Media icon. Record Media Comment A pop-up window appears in your browser. If you see a message from instructure.com requesting access, click the Allow button. Click the Record tab . Select your preferred media method: record with microphone  or record with webcam . When you're ready to record, click the Start Recording button . Create Recording The timer with the dot indicates you are recording your media comment, as well as the length of the comment . Once you are finished recording, click the Finish button . Save Recording Before you attach the media comment, you have the chance to review it. The length of your recording displays . In the File name field, enter a name for your media comment . If you want to re-record the recording, click the Start Over button . If you are happy with the result, click the Save Media button . Upload Media Comment If you have a previously recorded media file, you can upload it as part of your message. Click the Computer tab . Click or drag and drop a media file to media uploader to upload a file from your computer . Upload Media File Locate the media file on your computer. Click the Open button. Send Message Your media comment displays in your message . If you want to remove the comment, click the Remove icon  to remove it from the message. When you are finished, click the Send button . View Media Comment The media comment displays below the message.

input: What are the steps for attaching audio to a message in the Canvas Inbox?
expected_output:
1. Open Inbox  
   - In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link.  
2. Compose a New Message  
   - Click the Compose icon.  
3. Open the Media Uploader  
   - Click the Media icon in the toolbar.  
4. Record Audio  
   a. In the pop-up, click the Record tab.  
   b. Select record with microphone.  
   c. Click Start Recording; when finished, click Finish.  
   d. (Optional) Click Start Over to re‐record.  
   e. Enter a file name and click Save Media.  
5. (Alternative) Upload an Existing Audio File  
   a. Click the Computer tab.  
   b. Drag-and-drop or click to select your audio file.  
   c. Click Open to upload.  
6. Insert and Send  
   - Confirm the audio appears in your message.  
   - Click Send.

input: In the Canvas Global Navigation Inbox, when I’m in a message thread with more than one person, how can I reply to everyone at once? Which reply icon should I click?
expected_output:
1. Open your Inbox and select the conversation with multiple recipients.  
2. Click the Reply icon in the toolbar at the top of the thread (the left‐pointing arrow).  
3. Canvas detects all recipients and sends your response to everyone in the thread.
context:
Document Title: How do I reply to a message in the Inbox

How do I reply to a message in the Inbox? Canvas makes it easy to reply to messages from other users in your Inbox. If your recipient list contains more than 100 users, your message will automatically be sent as individual messages to each user. As the sender, you will also be included in the total recipient count. If you want to reply to a submission comment, you can reply using submission comments in your Inbox or directly from your assignment or quiz. Note: When the Inbox AI Translation feature option is enabled at the account level, users can access AI-supported translations for Inbox messages . To learn more about the feature preview, ask questions, or comment on functionality, navigate to the Discussion/Inbox AI Translation user group .  Open Inbox In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link. Select Conversation Click the Conversation you want to respond to . Click the Reply icon in the message header, or hover over the timestamp and click the Reply icon within the message . You can also click the Reply icon in the toolbar . Note : If there is more than one recipient, you can reply-all to the conversation and everyone included will see your reply. Reply to Message Type your reply in the message field . You can attach a file or media . When you are ready, click the Send button . View Sent Message Your message appears in the preview text of the conversation  and at the top of the individual thread .

input: How do I attach files or media when using the Canvas Inbox Reply icon or toolbar?
expected_output:
1. Open Inbox and select the conversation you want to reply to.  
2. Click the Reply icon (either in the header, over the timestamp, or in the toolbar).  
3. In the message toolbar, click the paper-clip icon to attach a file or the media icon (camera/play button) to embed audio, video, or images.  
4. For files: browse your computer or choose from Course Files, select your file, and click Open.  
5. For media: select from your Canvas Media library or upload/record new media.  
6. Verify your attachment appears below the message field, then click Send.

input: In Canvas LMS, after opening the Inbox, selecting a conversation, and hovering over the timestamp, how can I send a private reply?
expected_output:
1. Click the Reply icon that appears when you hover under the message timestamp.  
2. In the To field, confirm only the intended recipient is listed.  
3. Type your message in the message field.  
4. Click Send – your reply will go only to that individual.
context:
Document Title: How do I privately reply to one individual in a group message in

How do I privately reply to one individual in a group message in the Inbox? Even when you are part of a group conversation, you can privately respond to another individual.  Open Inbox In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link. Select Conversation Select the conversation. Locate Message Locate the individual you want to send a private message to. Hover your mouse under the timestamp until you see the Reply icon. Compose Message Type a message in the message field . When you are finished, click the Send button . The message will send to the person in the To field and not to everyone else. If you want to reply to everyone, click the settings icon and select reply-all. Or use the reply-all button in the toolbar.

input: What steps do I follow to privately reply to a message in the Canvas Inbox by hovering over the message timestamp and clicking the reply icon?

   - Type your message in the field.

input: How do I filter my Canvas Inbox to view comments for a specific course assignment, select a comment, click the Reply icon, and send my response?
expected_output:
1. Open the Inbox  
   – In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link.  

2. Filter for Submission Comments  
   – Click the filter (Inbox filter) icon and select “Submission Comments.”  

3. Narrow to your course and assignment  
   – In the same filter menu, choose your course name (and if available, the specific assignment) so only those comments appear.  

4. Select a comment  
   – In the list of Submission Comments, click the message that shows your course and the assignment name.  

5. Click the Reply icon  
   – In the toolbar above the conversation or next to the individual message, click the reply (speech-bubble) icon.  

6. Write and send your response  
   – Type your comment in the text window, then click Send.  

7. Confirm your reply  
   – Your message appears in the conversation thread and is also posted back to the assignment submission and Grades page.
context:
Document Title: How do I reply to submission comments in the Inbox

How do I reply to submission comments in the Inbox? Submission Comments allows users to view all assignment submission comments sent and received within the last four weeks. You can reply to submission comments directly from the Inbox. You can also reply to comments directly from assignment submissions. Learn how to view assignment comments from your instructor. Note : For muted assignments, submission comments are not displayed until the assignment is unmuted.  Open Inbox In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link. Open Submission Comments Click the Inbox filter  and select the Submission Comments option . Select Submission Comment Each message contains the name of the course and the name of the submission. Click the submission comment where you want to reply. Reply to Comments In the toolbar, click the Reply icon . You can also click the reply icon in the conversation thread . Note : In Submission Comments, the name of the course assignment links to the assignment . This link allows you to access the assignment submission and view any associated attachments that may be part of the submission comment. Write Comment In the text window, type your comment for the submission . Click the Send button . View Comment View your reply in the conversation thread. Replies are also posted back to the assignment and can be viewed in the Grades page and the assignment submissions page.

input: How do I use the Global Navigation Inbox filter in Canvas to unmute conversations, select a submission comment to reply to, and view attachments?
expected_output:
1. Unmute the assignment (if needed)  
   a. In your course, click Assignments or Grades.  
   b. Find the muted assignment and click the bell icon to unmute.  

2. Open the Inbox  
   In Global Navigation, click Inbox.  

3. Filter for Submission Comments  
   a. Click the filter icon in the Inbox toolbar.  
   b. Select Submission Comments.  

4. Select a comment thread  
   Scroll the list to find the course and assignment name, then click the comment you want to reply to.  

5. View attachments  
   Click the linked assignment name in the comment header to open the submission page, where any attached files appear.  

6. Reply to the comment  
   a. In the Inbox toolbar (or next to any message), click the Reply icon.  
   b. Type your response in the text box.  
   c. Click Send.  

7. Verify your reply  
   Your message appears in the conversation thread and is also visible on the Grades page and the assignment submissions page.
context:
Document Title: How do I reply to submission comments in the Inbox

How do I reply to submission comments in the Inbox? Submission Comments allows users to view all assignment submission comments sent and received within the last four weeks. You can reply to submission comments directly from the Inbox. You can also reply to comments directly from assignment submissions. Learn how to view assignment comments from your instructor. Note : For muted assignments, submission comments are not displayed until the assignment is unmuted.  Open Inbox In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link. Open Submission Comments Click the Inbox filter  and select the Submission Comments option . Select Submission Comment Each message contains the name of the course and the name of the submission. Click the submission comment where you want to reply. Reply to Comments In the toolbar, click the Reply icon . You can also click the reply icon in the conversation thread . Note : In Submission Comments, the name of the course assignment links to the assignment . This link allows you to access the assignment submission and view any associated attachments that may be part of the submission comment. Write Comment In the text window, type your comment for the submission . Click the Send button . View Comment View your reply in the conversation thread. Replies are also posted back to the assignment and can be viewed in the Grades page and the assignment submissions page.

input: In Canvas Inbox, after clicking Options > Forward, how do I add recipients and attachments and send to more than 100 users without changing the subject or course?
expected_output:
1. Open the forward window  
   – In Inbox, select your conversation, click the Options icon, and choose Forward.  

2. Add recipients  
   – In the “To” field, type or select up to 100+ users, sections, or groups. (Canvas will automatically send individual messages if your list exceeds 100 recipients.)  

3. Attach files or media  
   – Click the paper-clip (Attach) or media icon, browse to your file, and upload.  

4. Send the message  
   – Confirm your recipients and attachments, then click Send.  

Note: The course and subject line remain locked when forwarding.

Select Conversation Select the conversation. Select Message Click the Options icon  and then click the Forward option . Note : You can only forward one message at a time. View Compose Window In the compose message window, you can: Add recipients  Type a message  Attach files or media  Click the Send button  Note : You cannot change the course or the subject line if you are forwarding a message.

input: What are the forwarding limits in Canvas Inbox? For example, only being able to forward one message at a time, issues with large recipient lists, and not being able to edit the course or subject line.
expected_output:
Here are the key forwarding limits in Canvas Inbox:

• One message at a time  
  – You cannot bulk-forward; each message must be forwarded individually.  

• Large recipient lists  
  – If you include more than 100 users, Canvas sends each recipient an individual message rather than a single group message.  

• Fixed course and subject  
  – When forwarding, you cannot change the associated course or edit the subject line.

input: How can I delete a single message in the Canvas Inbox, and what are the recipient visibility limitations when doing so?
expected_output:
1. Open Inbox  
   - In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link.  

2. Select the Conversation  
   - Click the conversation containing the message you want to delete.  

3. Delete the Single Message  
   a. Hover over or open the specific message.  
   b. Click the Options icon (⋮) for that message.  
   c. Click Delete.  
   d. Click OK to confirm.  
   • You can only delete one message at a time.  
   • You can only delete your copy—you cannot remove the message from other participants’ Inboxes.  

Recipient Visibility Limitations  
- When you delete a message in a multi-recipient conversation, you’re removed as a recipient on that specific message.  
- If another participant replies-all to the deleted message, you will not receive that reply.  
- Your Inbox still shows all messages sent before the deletion.  
- Any messages you originally sent remain visible to the other participants.
context:
Document Title: How do I delete a message from a conversation in the Inbox

How do I delete a message from a conversation in the Inbox? You can delete individual messages within a conversation in Canvas. You can also delete an entire conversation . Note: When you delete a message from a conversation involving multiple participants, you are removed as a recipient on that message within the conversation. If another recipient replies to all through the deleted message, you will not receive the reply. However, your Inbox continues to display messages within the conversation prior to the deletion. Additionally, any messages you sent within the conversation remain visible to other participants in the conversation.  Open Inbox In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link. Select Conversation Select the conversation. Select Message Click the Options icon  and then click the Delete option . Note : You can only select one message to delete at a time. Confirm Deletion Click the OK button to delete the message. Note : You can only delete your copy of the message. You cannot delete the message for all recipients.

3. On the specific message, click the Options icon ( ⋮ ).  
4. Click Delete.  
5. Click OK to confirm.  

This sequence deletes only your copy of that single message.

3. Click the Archive icon to archive all selected messages at once.

input: What are the steps to add users to an Inbox thread in Canvas LMS? Is there a limit of 100 recipients? Can I keep the same subject and course, and will all added participants be able to see the conversation?
expected_output:
Step-by-Step: Adding Users to an Inbox Thread in Canvas LMS  
1. Open Inbox  
   • In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link.  
2. Select an Existing Conversation  
   • Use the Inbox filter to choose the thread you want to update.  
3. Reply to the Conversation  
   • Find the thread, then click the Reply icon.  
4. Add Recipients  
   • In the “To” field, start typing a name or click the Address Book icon to browse users and course groups.  
   • Select each person; names are sorted by last name.  
5. Verify Recipients  
   • Confirm you’ve added the correct users.  
6. Send Your Message  
   • Enter your reply and click Send.  
7. Confirm Addition  
   • The conversation header updates to show the new total participants.  

FAQs  
• Is there a 100-recipient limit?  
  – If your recipient list exceeds 100 users, Canvas will deliver your message as individual messages to each user.  
• Can I change the subject or course?  
  – No. When adding users, you cannot modify the subject line or course.  
• Will new participants see the full conversation?  
  – Yes. Newly added users can read and comment on all prior and future messages in the thread.
context:
Document Title: How do I add new people to an existing conversation in the Inbox

How do I add new people to an existing conversation in the Inbox? You can add people to an existing thread in the Inbox. If your recipient list contains more than 100 users, your message will automatically be sent as individual messages to each user. Note : When adding users to an existing conversation, you cannot change the course or the subject line.  Open Inbox In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link. Select Conversation In the Inbox filter, select an existing conversation. Reply to Conversation Locate the message thread and click the Reply icon. Add Recipients Start to type a name in the text field , or click the Address Book icon  to filter by users or course groups. Use Address Book Locate the individual and select his or her name . Names are sorted by last name. To navigate back to the address book, click the Address Book button . To exit the course roster menu, press Return (on a MAC keyboard) or Enter (on a PC keyboard). Verify Recipient Verify you added the correct person. Send Message Enter a reply in the text field . Then click the Send button . View Message The link will update the total number of people involved in the conversation. Newly added participants will be able to read and comment on the entire conversation, even the messages that were posted before they were added.

input: How do I use the Inbox in Canvas to filter conversations, reply to a message, sort my address book by last name, exit the roster view, verify the recipients, and send the message?
expected_output:

   – Press Return (Mac) or Enter (Windows) to close the course roster menu.  

6. Verify recipients  
   – Check the To: field to confirm each added user is correct.  

7. Send your message  
   – Type your reply in the text field.  
   – Click the Send button.  

Newly added participants can read and comment on the entire conversation, including prior messages.

input: How can I delete multiple conversations in Canvas LMS? I went to the Inbox, selected messages with Cmd/Ctrl-click, clicked the delete icon, and confirmed. What exactly happens when I do this—does it remove the conversation for everyone or just from my Inbox?
expected_output:
Here’s what happens when you delete multiple conversations in Canvas:  
1. You select one or more conversations in your Inbox (Cmd/Ctrl-click)  
2. You click the Delete icon and confirm  
3. Canvas removes only your copy of each selected conversation—other participants still retain their threads and can continue messaging  
4. Any messages you sent remain visible to other recipients; you simply stop seeing the conversation in your Inbox

You can also delete individual messages from a conversation instead of deleting the entire thread. Note: If you delete an entire conversation involving multiple participants, you are removed from the conversation thread as a recipient and will not receive any further messages sent within the conversation. However, any messages you sent within the conversation remain.  Open Inbox In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link. Select Conversation Select the conversation. Select Multiple Conversations To select multiple messages to delete, click the message checkbox or press the command key (Mac) or the control key (Windows) while clicking each message you want to select. You cannot delete the conversation for all recipients. Delete Multiple Conversations To delete multiple conversations, select the message checkbox or press the command key (Mac) or control key (Windows) while clicking each message you want to delete . Then click the Delete icon . Confirm Deletion Select the OK button. All messages from that conversation are deleted.

input: How do I delete messages in the Canvas Inbox? Should I select threads or individual messages using CMD/CTRL, click the Delete icon, and confirm by clicking OK? Will this only delete my copy?

Note: This only deletes your copy of the conversation or messages; other recipients still retain their copies.

input: How do I filter my GN Inbox in Canvas to show only unread conversations for a specific course and user?
expected_output:
1. Open your Inbox  
   In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link.  

2. Filter by course  
    • Click the course drop-down at the top of the Inbox.  
    • Select the specific course you want.  

3. Filter by unread conversations  
    • Click the Inbox filter (usually set to “All”).  
    • Choose “Unread” to display only unread messages.  

4. Filter by user  
    • Click the Address Book icon next to the search field.  
    • Type or select the user’s name.  

Now your Inbox shows only unread conversations for that specific course and user.
context:
Document Title: How do I filter conversations in the Inbox

How do I filter conversations in the Inbox? You can filter the conversations in your Inbox for easier organization, especially if you are enrolled in multiple courses. Filtering conversations allows you to selectively view conversation messages by course, inbox, or user.  Open Inbox In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link. Filter by Course You can filter your inbox by types of courses. Your Inbox may contain the following options: Current courses in your Favorites menu Other courses that you haven't favorited Concluded courses Current or concluded groups Note: You cannot send messages to users in concluded courses. Filter by Inbox You can also filter by Inbox type. By default, the Inbox displays all messages. View Unread Messages The Unread filter displays all unread conversations in your Inbox. Learn how to view and manage unread messages . View Starred Messages The Starred filter displays all starred messages in your Inbox. Starred messages are marked as important so you can locate them later. Learn how to star a message . View Sent Messages The Sent filter displays all your sent messages, both to individual users or multiple users. Note: The Sent filter only includes sent messages from the first user to send a message in a conversation thread. Replies from recipients of the original message will appear in their Inboxes, but not in their Sent filters. View Archived Conversations The Archived filter displays all archived conversations. Learn how to archive a conversation . Note: Sent messages cannot be archived. Additionally, archived messages do not include deleted messages , which are completely removed from the Inbox. View Submission Comments The Submission Comments filter displays all comments associated with course assignments and feedback. Learn how to reply to submission comments . Filter by User To filter by user, type the name of a user in the search field , or browse for the course, group, or user by selecting the Address Book icon .

input: How can I filter my Canvas Inbox by course (favorites, others, concluded, groups), then by message status (unread, starred, sent, archived, comments), and finally by a specific user?
expected_output:
1. Open your Inbox  
   – In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link.  

2. Filter by Course  
   – Click the course-filter dropdown.  
   – Select one or more of:  
     • Favorites (current courses you’ve favorited)  
     • Other Courses (current courses not favorited)  
     • Concluded Courses (note: you cannot message users in concluded courses)  
     • Groups (current or concluded)  

3. Filter by Message Status  
   – Click the Inbox-type dropdown.  
   – Choose one of:  
     • Unread  
     • Starred  
     • Sent (only includes threads you started)  
     • Archived (does not include deleted messages)  
     • Submission Comments  

4. Filter by User  
   – In the search field, type the user’s name, or click the Address Book icon to browse courses, groups, or users.  

The Inbox will now display conversations matching your course selection, message status, and specific user.

input: Can I enable an account lock and different tags, define up to 40 tags with up to 10 variants, tag students, and send group messages in the Canvas Inbox while disabling individual messaging?
expected_output:
Yes. To use Differentiated Tags and send group messages in the Canvas Inbox with individual messaging disabled, follow these steps:

1. Enable & lock the feature  
  • As a Canvas admin, turn on the Differentiation Tags Feature Option and Account Setting at the root (and/or sub-account) level. Lock the setting if you want it enforced for sub-accounts.

2. Create your tag sets  
  • Go to your course’s People page.  
  • Click + Differentiation Tag to add tags (up to 40 total per course).  
  • Within each tag set, define up to 10 variants.

3. Assign tags to students  
  • On the People page, click the “···” menu next to a student’s name.  
  • Select the appropriate tag variant (each student may have only one variant per tag set).

4. Send a group message to a tag group  
  • Open Inbox from Global Navigation and click Compose.  
  • In the To field, select the Differentiation Tag you want to target.  
  • Note: “Send an individual message” is automatically disabled when targeting tag groups, so students won’t see who else has that tag.
context:
Document Title: How do I use Differentiated Tags in the Inbox as an instructor

How do I use Differentiated Tags in the Inbox as an instructor?
This guide applies to institutions who have opted-in to the Differentiation Tags feature preview. If your user interface displays differently, the feature has not been enabled at your institution. To learn more about the feature preview, ask questions, or comment on functionality, navigate to the
Differentiation Tags user group
.
A Canvas administrator
will need to enable Differentiation Tags setting
at the account level or sub-account level. This setting can also be locked for sub-accounts.
You can use differentiation tags to assign specific content to customized sets of students. These sets are not visible to students. Additionally, admins can access differentiation tags through Canvas Data for reporting and analysis.
As an instructor, you can
create and manage Differentiation Tags
from the People page.
Notes:
If the Differentiation Tags feature option is enabled and locked at the root account, the sub-account setting will display. However, if the feature option is enabled and unlocked at the root account but disabled in the sub-account, the sub-account setting will not be displayed.
Both the Differentiation Tags Feature Option and Account setting must be enabled.
Differentiation tags are not retained during course exports or imports.
Each course is limited to 40 tags total and 10 variants per tag set.
There is no limit to the total number of tags a student can have; however, a student can only be assigned one tag per tag set.
Open Inbox
In Global Navigation, click the
Inbox
link. To compose a message, click the
Compose
button [2].
View Inbox
In the Inbox, you can
send messages
to specific tag groups.
Note:
When sending a message to students with differentiation tags, the Send an individual message checkbox is disabled. This prevents accidental exposure of which students are associated with a tag.

input: Which account settings and Inbox steps allow instructors to message differentiation tag groups anonymously?
expected_output:
1. Enable Differentiation Tags at the account level  
   • In Admin → Account Settings, turn on the Differentiation Tags Feature Option.  
   • Also enable the Differentiation Tags setting at the root or sub-account (and lock it if desired).  

2. Message a tag group anonymously in the Inbox  
   a. In Global Navigation, click Inbox and then Compose.  
   b. In the Recipients field, choose the desired Differentiation Tag group.  
   c. Note that the “Send an individual message” checkbox is disabled—this ensures students’ tag membership remains hidden.  
   d. Compose and send your message.
context:
Document Title: How do I use Differentiated Tags in the Inbox as an instructor

How do I use Differentiated Tags in the Inbox as an instructor?
This guide applies to institutions who have opted-in to the Differentiation Tags feature preview. If your user interface displays differently, the feature has not been enabled at your institution. To learn more about the feature preview, ask questions, or comment on functionality, navigate to the
Differentiation Tags user group
.
A Canvas administrator
will need to enable Differentiation Tags setting
at the account level or sub-account level. This setting can also be locked for sub-accounts.
You can use differentiation tags to assign specific content to customized sets of students. These sets are not visible to students. Additionally, admins can access differentiation tags through Canvas Data for reporting and analysis.
As an instructor, you can
create and manage Differentiation Tags
from the People page.
Notes:
If the Differentiation Tags feature option is enabled and locked at the root account, the sub-account setting will display. However, if the feature option is enabled and unlocked at the root account but disabled in the sub-account, the sub-account setting will not be displayed.
Both the Differentiation Tags Feature Option and Account setting must be enabled.
Differentiation tags are not retained during course exports or imports.
Each course is limited to 40 tags total and 10 variants per tag set.
There is no limit to the total number of tags a student can have; however, a student can only be assigned one tag per tag set.
Open Inbox
In Global Navigation, click the
Inbox
link. To compose a message, click the
Compose
button [2].
View Inbox
In the Inbox, you can
send messages
to specific tag groups.
Note:
When sending a message to students with differentiation tags, the Send an individual message checkbox is disabled. This prevents accidental exposure of which students are associated with a tag.

input: How do I navigate the Canvas Inbox to view document titles, manage AI translation groups and language status, use translate toggles, and see recipient views?
expected_output:
1. Open the Inbox  
   • In Global Navigation, click Inbox to see your message list and document titles.  

2. Manage AI Translation settings  
   • Confirm your institution has enabled the AI Translation feature preview.  
   • To ask questions or request new languages, go to the Discussion/Inbox AI Translation user group in the Canvas Community.  
   • Review supported languages (e.g., English, Spanish, Chinese, German, etc.) and watch for new additions.  

3. Compose a message with translations  
   1. Click Compose a new message.  
   2. Toggle on Include translated version of this message.  
   3. Select your target language from the dropdown.  
   4. Click Translate.  
   5. Choose whether the translated text appears before or after the original.  

4. View the recipient’s inbox  
   • The recipient sees both the original text and the translated text side by side in the message field.

input: In the Canvas Inbox, after enabling Spanish AI translation, how can I choose which text appears first and view both the original and translated versions?
expected_output:
Step-by-Step: Choosing Text Order & Viewing Both Versions in Canvas Inbox

1. Open the Inbox  
   – In Global Navigation, click the Inbox link.

2. Enable AI Translation  
   – In your message compose window, toggle on Include translated version of this message.

3. Select Language & Translate  
   – From the language menu, choose Spanish.  
   – Click the Translate button.

4. Choose Text Order  
   – Under translation options, select either “Display translation first” or “Display translation second.”

5. Send & View  
   – Send your message. The recipient’s view will show both the original text and the translated Spanish text in the order you selected.

input: How can I upload, choose, crop, recenter, and save my profile picture in Canvas account settings?
expected_output:
1. Open User Settings  
   - In Global Navigation, click Account, then click Settings.  

2. Open Profile Picture  
   - Click the placeholder profile-picture icon.  

3. Upload and Choose Picture  
   - Click the Picture Options menu and select Upload a Picture.  
   - Click “choose a picture” or drag-and-drop your image into the window.  
   - In the file browser, select your image and click Open.  

4. Crop and Recenter  
   - Drag the corner handles to crop the image.  
   - Hover over the image until the circular cursor appears, then click and drag to recenter.  

5. Save  
   - When you’re happy with the framing, click Save.  

Your new profile picture is now stored in your personal files and displayed throughout Canvas.
context:
Document Title: How do I add a profile picture in my user account

How do I add a profile picture in my user account? If your institution has enabled profile pictures, you can add and change profile pictures in your account. If you do not see a placeholder picture in your user settings, your institution has not enabled this feature. There are three ways you can select a profile picture to use throughout Canvas: Upload a Picture from your computer Take a Picture using your computer's camera (not supported when using Safari or Internet Explorer) Import from an existing Gravatar account (this feature may be restricted by your institution and only G-rated images are supported) Tips for profile pictures: Choose an appropriate picture to represent yourself. Your institution has the right to remove pictures that are not appropriate for a classroom setting. Images should be square in size to prevent your picture from being resized or distorted. Files can be any type (.jpg, .png, .gif) or size as long as you have room in your user files to store the file. Canvas recommends that your profile picture be as small as possible. Your personal files quota is enforced when uploading a profile picture. If you do not have enough storage space in your personal files, you will not be able to upload your profile picture. Create more space by removing some files in your personal files.  Open User Settings In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Settings link . Open Profile Picture Click the profile picture icon. Note : If you don't see a placeholder profile picture icon, your institution does not allow you to add or change your profile picture. Upload Picture To upload a new profile picture file, click the Picture Options drop-down menu and select the Upload a Picture option . Then click the choose a picture link . You can also drag a picture from your desktop and drop it into the window. Choose Profile Picture Find the image you want to upload and click the Open or Browse button. Crop or Resize Picture To crop your image, use the selection handles . To recenter the image, hover the cursor over the image, then click and drag the circle selector to a new location . When you are finished, click the Save button . Note: Canvas automatically stores a copy of the saved profile picture in your personal user files . When you save a new picture in your profile, the new picture overrides the existing picture file in your personal files. Take Picture To take a picture to use as your profile picture, click the Picture Options drop-down menu and select the Take a Picture option . Then click the Take Picture button . Note : Depending on your browser, you may need to allow Canvas to access your camera. The Take a Picture option is not supported when using Safari or Internet Explorer. Save Picture To take another picture, click the Retry button . When you are finished, click the Save button . Import from Gravatar If your institution allows Gravatars and you have a Gravatar account, you can import an existing Gravatar to use as your profile picture. Click the Picture Options drop-down menu and select the From Gravatar option . Enter your Gravatar email address in the field provided . Click the Preview button to view your Gravatar . When you are finished, click the Save button . Note: Before adding a photo in your Gravatar account, you must rate the photo. Please note that you can use only a G-rated Gravatar photo as a Canvas profile picture. View Profile Picture The profile picture you selected displays instead of the placeholder profile picture. Delete Profile Picture Profile pictures are linked to your personal files, so you can easily delete them to remove old profile pictures. Note: Gravatar images cannot be deleted from your account through your personal files. However, Gravatar images may be replaced with an uploaded image or with a captured image using the Take a Picture option. Open Files To delete a profile picture, click the Files link. Open Profile Pictures Click the profile pictures folder. Delete Profile Picture Next to the file you want to delete , click the Options icon  then click the Delete link .

input: In Canvas LMS, how do I enable the placeholder icon for a profile picture in the User Settings?
expected_output:
1. Verify feature availability  
   - If you don’t see a placeholder image in **Account > Settings**, your institution hasn’t enabled profile pictures.

2. If you’re a Canvas admin  
   - Go to **Admin > Settings**  
   - Select the **Feature Options** tab  
   - Locate **Profile Pictures** (or similar) and switch it to **On**  
   - Save your changes

3. If you’re not an admin  
   - Contact your institution’s Canvas administrator or IT help desk and request that they enable the profile-picture feature in Feature Options.
