input: How can I, via Settings > Contact & Web Services in Canvas, add Slack, manage bounces, confirm the setup, and view the integration?
expected_output:
1. Open User Settings  
   • In Global Navigation, click Account, then click Settings.  
2. Access Contact & Web Services  
   • On your Settings page, locate the “Ways to Contact” (Contact Methods) and “Web Services” sections.  
3. Add Slack as a Contact Method  
   • Under Ways to Contact, click Add Contact Method.  
   • Select Slack and follow the prompts to authorize your workspace.  
4. Confirm Slack Setup  
   • In Slack, accept the Canvas notification request.  
   • Back in Canvas, a check-mark icon will indicate your Slack contact is confirmed.  
5. Manage Bounced Channels  
   • A warning icon next to a contact method means it has bounced.  
   • To fix it, click the Delete icon, then re-add the contact method.  
6. View the Integration  
   • Scroll to the Approved Integrations section (or Registered Services under Web Services) to see Slack listed with its name, purpose, last-used date, and expiration details.
context:
Document Title: How do I add contact methods to receive Canvas notifications

How do I add contact methods to receive Canvas notifications? In Canvas you can add contact methods to receive notifications. Contact methods allow you to select how you want to be notified when various events occur within a course. Notifications are applied to all courses in Canvas. Canvas supports notification through email, Slack, and various web services. Once you add contact methods, you can set your own Notification Settings to select how often you want to be notified of course events. View a video about Notification Settings .  Open User Settings In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Settings link . Add Ways to Contact In the Ways to Contact sidebar, your account displays the default email associated with your account, if any. However, if you want to add an additional email address , click the Add Email Address link . If you have multiple Canvas accounts, you can view the Add icon , which allows you to merge the address with another Canvas account that uses the same email address. If you want to add Slack as a contact method, click the Add Contact Method link . View Communication Warnings Canvas does not send notifications to communication channels that have bounced, which means the channel can no longer attempt to generate or send a notification. Bounces can occur from invalid addresses (caused by address typos, changed addresses, etc.) or blocked servers. In User Settings, Canvas may display the following icons to indicate a contact method's status: Warning : indicates a bounced contact method. To correct the error, you can remove then re-add the contact method to your profile. Check Mark : notifies you of an unconfirmed email address. To delete a contact method, click the Delete icon . Link to Web Services The Web Services portion on your settings page is divided into two columns. Services you have already registered, such as through the Ways to Contact section of your settings, or through course Collaborations and assignments, appear in the left column under the Registered Services heading . Other services that are available for registration appear in the right column under the Other Services heading . Learn how to add web services in Canvas. View Approved Integrations When you allow third-party integrations to access your account, the Approved Integrations section will appear and display the authorized integrations. Each integration will show you the name of the app, the purpose (if one is noted), the date the app was last used, the date the app expires, and a link to view further details.

input: In Canvas settings, how do I add, verify, or merge extra email addresses? How can I register services, review integrations, and fix bounced emails?
expected_output:
1. Open User Settings  
   - In Global Navigation, click Account, then Settings.

2. Add an Extra Email Address  
   - In Ways to Contact, click Add Email Address.  
   - Enter and submit your new address.  
   - Canvas sends a confirmation link—click it to verify.

3. Merge the Address with Another Canvas Account  
   - If you have multiple Canvas accounts using the same email, click the Add icon next to that address to merge accounts.

4. Fix a Bounced Email  
   - Look for a Warning icon next to any contact method—this means Canvas can’t deliver to that address.  
   - Click the Delete icon to remove it, then re-add the correct address and verify.

5. Register or Remove Web Services  
   - Scroll to the Web Services section in Settings.  
   - Under Other Services, click Register for any new service.  
   - Registered services appear under Registered Services; click Delete to unregister.

6. Review Approved Integrations  
   - In Settings, locate the Approved Integrations section.  
   - View each app’s name, purpose, last-used date, expiration, and details link.

input: Which steps in Canvas Account Settings—Add Email Address, Register Email, Confirm Email—enable an extra notification address?
expected_output:
1. Navigate to Account > Settings and scroll to Email Addresses.  
2. Click Add Email Address, enter your new address, and click Register Email.  
3. Open the confirmation message sent to that address and click its link (or use Re-Send Confirmation if you don’t see it).  

Once confirmed, the new email is available as an additional notification address in your Notification Settings.
context:
Document Title: How do I add an additional email address as a contact method in

How do I add an additional email address as a contact method in Canvas? When you create a contact method in Canvas, you can use that contact method as a way to receive Canvas notifications. By default, notifications are sent to the email address used to create your Canvas account. However, you can add an additional email address if you do not want to use your existing email address or want to use an additional email for notifications. Learn how to set notification settings .  Open User Settings In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Settings link . Add Email Address In the Email Addresses section, click the Add Email Address link. Register Email Enter the email address you want to add in the Email Address field . When you are finished, click the Register Email button . Confirm Email Address Open your email account you just added. Click the link that is in the email to finish registering the additional email address. You may have to check your junk mail folder. If you need to resend the confirmation, click the Re-Send Confirmation link. Not receiving a confirmation email in Canvas? Try the following steps to resolve the issue: Check your email folders. Look in your inbox, spam, and junk folders for an email from Canvas asking you to confirm your email address. The subject line often includes Confirm Email: Canvas on the subject. Re-add your email address in Canvas. If you do not see the confirmation email, log in to Canvas, go to Account > Settings , and remove the unconfirmed email address. Then add it again to trigger a new confirmation email. Resend the confirmation manually. If the unconfirmed email still appears under your profile, click it to bring up the option to resend the confirmation email. Try resetting your password. Go to the Canvas login page, click Forgot Password , and enter your email. This can sometimes trigger a confirmation or reset email if your address is linked to an account. Contact Canvas Support or your IT team if none of the above works. The email may be on a bounce or suppression list, which Canvas Support can resolve, or it may be blocked by an email filter or firewall, which your IT team can address. If you're a Canvas admin, check the delivery status. You can verify whether the confirmation email was sent and whether it bounced using the following guides: How do I see which notifications have been sent to a user in an account? How do I view bounced email notifications for users in an account? Delete Email Address To delete the email address, click the Delete icon. Confirm Delete Click the OK button.

input: How can I resolve a missing Canvas confirmation email? Should I check my spam or junk folder, re-add my email address, resend the confirmation email, or contact support?
expected_output:
1. Check your email folders  
   - Look in your inbox, spam, and junk for a message from Canvas (subject includes “Confirm Email: Canvas”).  

2. Re-add your unconfirmed address  
   - In Canvas, go to Account > Settings  
   - Under Email Addresses, delete the unconfirmed address  
   - Click Add Email Address and register it again  

3. Resend the confirmation  
   - In Account > Settings, click the unconfirmed email  
   - Select Re-Send Confirmation  

4. Trigger an alternate Canvas email  
   - On the Canvas login page, click Forgot Password and enter your address  
   - This can sometimes prompt a confirmation/reset message  

5. Contact support if needed  
   - If you still don’t receive the email, ask your IT team to check filters/firewalls  
   - Or contact Canvas Support to investigate bounces or suppression lists  

(If you’re a Canvas admin, you can also review sent and bounced notifications under your account’s notification reports.)

input: How do I use Global Navigation → Account → Settings → Other Contacts → Add Contact Method in Canvas to register and confirm a US SMS MFA number?
expected_output:
1. In Canvas, open the Global Navigation menu.  
2. Click Account, then click Settings.  
3. Under Other Contacts, click Add Contact Method.  
4. In the Register SMS: United States section, enter your 10-digit cell phone number.  
5. Click Register SMS.  
6. Check your phone for the Canvas confirmation code.  
7. Enter the code in the confirmation field and click Confirm.  
8. (Optional) To delete the SMS contact later, click its Delete icon and confirm.
context:
Document Title: How do I add a text SMS contact method in Canvas

How do I add a text (SMS) contact method in Canvas? If your institution allows you to add other communication channels, you may be able to add a text or Short Message Service (SMS) communication channel to receive Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) codes (if enabled for your account) on your cellular device. Text or SMS channels appear under the Other Contacts sidebar heading. Notes: Standard text message rates may apply. SMS is only used for Multi-Factor Authentication (if enabled for your account). If notifications are not enabled by your institution or are not available in your country, you can use the Canvas Student app or Canvas Teacher app and receive push notifications. When you log into the mobile app, a push notification channel is automatically created. If the ability to receive push notifications has been enabled by your institution, a push notification column displays when you log into the mobile app. MFA is exclusively available for users in the United States.  Open User Settings In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Settings link . Add Contact Method In the Other Contacts section, click the Add Contact Method link. Register SMS: United States If you are in the United States, enter your 10-digit cell phone number , and click the Register SMS button . Note: SMS is only used for Multi-Factor Authentication (if enabled for your account). Confirm SMS Number Check your cell phone for a confirmation code from canvas. Enter the code into the text field . To resend the confirmation again, click the Re-Send Confirmation link . Click the Confirm button . Delete SMS To delete the contact method, click the Delete icon. Confirm Deletion Click the OK button.

input: How do I remove the SMS notification channel in my Canvas account settings?
expected_output:
1. Open User Settings  
   - In Global Navigation, click Account, then click Settings.  

2. Locate Other Contacts  
   - Scroll to the Other Contacts section.  

3. Delete SMS Channel  
   - Find your SMS entry and click its Delete icon.  

4. Confirm Deletion  
   - In the confirmation dialog, click OK.

Register SMS: United States If you are in the United States, enter your 10-digit cell phone number , and click the Register SMS button . Note: SMS is only used for Multi-Factor Authentication (if enabled for your account). Confirm SMS Number Check your cell phone for a confirmation code from canvas. Enter the code into the text field . To resend the confirmation again, click the Re-Send Confirmation link . Click the Confirm button . Delete SMS To delete the contact method, click the Delete icon. Confirm Deletion Click the OK button.

input: In Canvas, under Account > Settings > Ways to Contact, how do I hover over and click the star icon next to an added email address?
expected_output:
1. In Canvas, click Account in the Global Navigation sidebar, then select Settings.  
2. In the Settings page’s Ways to Contact panel, find the email you’ve already added.  
3. Move your mouse pointer over that email entry—when you hover, a faint star icon appears to the right.  
4. Click the star icon. The star will turn solid, marking that address as your new default.
context:
Document Title: How do I change my default email address in my user account

How do I change my default email address in my user account? Your default email address is used as your main contact method in Canvas and is added when creating your Canvas account. Email addresses are used to create Canvas notifications ; they are not used as a contact method for other Canvas users. If you add another email address as a contact method, you can change your default email address in Canvas. Note: If you do not see the Profiles tab in your user navigation menu, this feature has not been enabled for your institution.  Open User Settings In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Settings link . View Email Addresses In the Ways to Contact sidebar, under Email Addresses, you can tell what email address is your default by the star icon next to the email address. Choose Default Email Address To choose a new default email address, hover over the email address and a faint star icon will appear. Click the Star icon.

input: In my Canvas account, under Settings > Ways to Contact, how do I make an email address my default contact method by clicking the star icon?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Account, then click Settings.  
2. In the Ways to Contact sidebar, find Email Addresses.  
3. Hover over the email you want as your default – a faint star icon appears.  
4. Click the star icon. The email is now your default contact method.

input: How do I change my Canvas password using the Global Navigation → Account → Settings menu? What are the password strength guidelines, how often can I reset it, and who should I contact at my institution if I need help?
expected_output:
1. Open User Settings  
   - In Global Navigation, click Account → Settings.  

2. Edit your password  
   - Click Edit Settings.  
   - Check Change Password.  
   - Enter your old password, then your new password twice (New Password and Confirm Password).  
   - Click Update Settings.  

3. Password strength guidelines  
   - Minimum 8 characters (up to ~15 for memorability)  
   - Mix upper- and lower-case letters, numbers, punctuation, spaces, and symbols  
   - Avoid dictionary words in any language  

4. Reset frequency  
   - No forced intervals—you may change your password as often or as little as you’d like  

5. Need help?  
   - If you can’t change your password yourself or forget it, contact your institution’s IT help desk or Canvas support team.
context:
Document Title: How do I change my login password in my user account

How do I change my login password in my user account? You may be able to change your password in your user settings. If you do not have access to change your password, your password is controlled through your institution. Contact your institution to learn how to change your password. If you can change your password, there are no password reset intervals, so you can change your password as little or as often as you want. However, you can keep strong passwords effective by changing them often. Here are some good password guidelines: Use at least eight characters (the more the better), but most people will find anything more than about 15 characters difficult to remember. Use a random mixture of characters, upper and lower case, numbers, punctuation, spaces and symbols. Don't use a word found in a dictionary, English or foreign. Note: If you forget your password, you may be able to reset it. Learn how to reset your password .  Open User Settings In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Settings link . Edit Settings Click the Edit Settings button. Change Password Click the Change Password checkbox  to create a new password. Type your old password in the Old Password field . Type your new password in the New Password field . Type your new password again in the Confirm Password field . Note: If you do not have access to change your password, please contact your institution. Your institution will help you change your password. Update Settings Click the Update Settings button.

input: How do I change my Canvas password in Account Settings if my institution controls the login, and what are the password requirements?
expected_output:
1. Verify access  
   • In Global Navigation, click Account > Settings.  
   • If you don’t see the “Change Password” option, your institution controls your login.  

2. Contact your institution  
   • Reach out to your school or company IT/help desk to request a password change.  

3. Password requirements  
   • Minimum of 8 characters (longer is better; 15+ can be hard to remember)  
   • Mix upper- and lower-case letters, numbers, punctuation, spaces, and symbols  
   • Avoid any single dictionary word (in any language)

Type your new password in the New Password field . Type your new password again in the Confirm Password field . input: How can I navigate in Canvas from the Global Navigation menu to my Account Settings, edit my default email, and update the settings?
expected_output:
1. In Canvas, open the Global Navigation menu and click Account, then click Settings.  
2. Click Edit Settings.  
3. Locate the Default Email field, choose or enter the email address you want as your primary contact.  
4. Scroll down and click Update Settings to save your changes.
context:
Document Title: How do I change the settings in my user account

How do I change the settings in my user account? Depending on how your Canvas account was created, you may be able to make changes to your name, pronouns , default email, language , time zone , and password . Setting a chosen language will override any default language settings across your institution; however, any language set in a course will override your user language. Your institution may take care of updating or changing your password by using the password associated with your login credentials for Canvas. Users associated with a SIS ID cannot delete their own account. Learn more about your profile and user settings . Note: Some settings may not be available to you. If you are not able to edit your user settings, you will need to contact your institution to change this information.  Open User Settings In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Settings link . Edit Settings Click the Edit Settings button. Change Settings If enabled, edit the appropriate settings: Full Name  is used for the Gradebook and Grades pages, Chat, People, and SIS imports. Display Name  is how other users will see your name in Announcements, Conferences, Conversations, and Discussions. Sortable Name  defaults to your last name, first name and appears in sorted lists so admins can search for it. Pronouns  display after your name in various areas throughout Canvas. Default Email  can be set when you have multiple Notification email addresses associated with your account. Language  can be set to your native language and is the language you want to use in Canvas (does not apply if an instructor sets a specific language for a course). Time Zone  can be set to where you are located and displays assignments in your local time. Password  is the combination of characters you choose to use to log in to your Canvas account. Note: Some settings may not be available to you. If you are not able to edit your user settings, you will need to contact your institution to change this information. Update Settings Click the Update Settings button.

input: In Canvas, how do I open my Account Settings to edit my Display Name and Pronouns, and then save the changes?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click **Account**, then select **Settings**.  
2. Click the **Edit Settings** button.  
3. In the form that appears, update your **Display Name** and **Pronouns** fields.  
4. Scroll down and click **Update Settings** to save your changes.

input: In Account > Profile, which avatar icon option uploads, captures, or syncs my picture with Gravatar?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Account, then click Profile.  
2. Click the profile picture icon (the avatar silhouette next to your name).  
3. Choose one of the options:  
   • Upload a file  
   • Take a picture  
   • Sync with Gravatar  
4. After selecting or syncing your image, click Save Profile.
context:
Document Title: How do I edit my profile in my user account

How do I edit my profile in my user account? Some institutions may enable a feature in Canvas called Profiles . Profiles allows you to update your name, preferred contact methods, and any personal links for your account. Your profile information can be viewed by all users in your courses. Note: If you do not see the Profiles tab in your user navigation menu, this feature has not been enabled for your institution.  Open Profile In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Profile link . Edit Profile Click the Edit Profile button. Note: If you can't edit your profile or communication channels, it's been disabled by your institution. Edit Profile Picture To add a profile picture , click the profile picture icon. You can add a profile picture by uploading a file, taking a picture, or uploading a Gravatar image. Note: Profile pictures are a separate permission from Profiles . If you do not see a placeholder picture, your institution has not enabled this feature. Edit Name and Title If you are allowed to change your name, type your name in the Name field . If enabled by your admin, you can add a name pronunciation to your profile. To add a pronunciation, type your pronunciation in the Name Pronunciation field . Type your title in the Title field . Add Contact Methods If you have been connected to any web services , click the checkbox underneath the web service to indicate how you wish to be contacted via that service . To add additional services , click the Manage Registered Services link. Please note that any selected services will not be shared with other course/group members unless you have previously selected the sharing checkbox in the Manage Registered Services page. The Discussion icon automatically appears as a contact method for admins so users can contact them through Canvas Conversations . It cannot be selected by any other users. Note: As created in your user profile, email addresses do not appear as a contact method and are only used for Canvas notifications. Canvas users should contact each other via Conversations. Edit Bio In the Biography field, add hobbies, interesting facts, and any other items about yourself. Edit Links You can add personal links to your profile, such as personal websites, blogs, or portfolios. In the Title field, enter the link title . In the URL field, enter the URL . To delete the link, click the remove icon . To add another link, click the Add another link button . Save Profile Click the Save Profile button.

input: Which admin-set permissions disable Canvas Profile editing, picture uploads, contact methods, and links?
expected_output:
1. Profiles feature disabled  
   – If your admin turns off the “Profiles” feature in Feature Options, the entire Profile tab and Edit Profile button are removed.

2. Profile picture uploads disabled  
   – If the “Profile Pictures” feature is disabled, the profile-picture icon/placeholder will not appear and you cannot upload or change an avatar.

3. Communication channels disabled  
   – If your institution disables the communication-channels permission, you cannot add, edit, or remove contact methods under Manage Registered Services.

4. Profile links disabled  
   – If the profile-links feature is turned off, the Add another link button and link-management (create/update/delete) options won’t be available.

input: How do the Account > Settings > Edit Settings > Language > Update Settings options and course language overrides affect the Canvas interface language and the start day of the week?
expected_output:
• To change your Canvas interface language and calendar start day:  
  1. In Global Navigation, click Account > Settings.  
  2. Click Edit Settings.  
  3. In the Language drop-down, select your preferred language and locale.  
  4. Click Update Settings.  
  – The Canvas UI will now display in your chosen language.  
  – Your Calendar week start day may shift (for example, many locales switch to Monday).  

• Course-level language overrides:  
  – If an instructor sets a different language for a course, that course’s interface language will override your user preference.  
  – The Calendar in that specific course will also follow the locale’s week-start conventions.
context:
Document Title: How do I change the language preference in my user account

How do I change the language preference in my user account? English is Canvas' language default, but you can choose to view the Canvas interface in another language. Notes: Instructors have the option to change the language preference for their courses. If you enroll in a course where the instructor has made this change (most often for a foreign language course), the course language will override the language in your user settings. If you change your language or locale preferences, the Calendar week start date may also change. Certain languages or locales change the Calendar week start date to Monday.  Open User Settings In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Settings link . Edit Settings Click the Edit Settings button. Select Language In the Language drop-down menu, choose your preferred language. Update Settings Click the Update Settings button. View Preferred Language View Canvas in your preferred language.

input: How do I change the Canvas interface language to French using the Account > Settings > Edit Settings > Language navigation path?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Account, then click Settings.  
2. Click Edit Settings.  
3. In the Language drop-down menu, select French.  
4. Click Update Settings.  
You’ll now see the Canvas interface in French.

input: In Canvas, via Account > Notifications, how do I set per-course email, push, and Slack notification frequencies and overrides? Are there any notification types Canvas doesn’t support?
expected_output:
1. Open Notifications  
   a. In Global Navigation, click Account > Notifications.  
   b. In the “Settings for” drop-down (top-left), select the specific course you want to override.

2. Set per-course Email Frequencies  
   a. Under each category (e.g., Course Activities, Discussions), find the notification row.  
   b. In the Email column, click the icon and choose:  
      – Notify immediately  
      – Daily summary  
      – Weekly summary  
      – Notifications off  

3. Set per-course Push Notifications  
   a. Ensure you’ve enabled push in the Canvas Student mobile app.  
   b. In the Push column, click the icon and choose:  
      – Notify right away  
      – Notifications off  

4. Set per-course Slack Notifications  
   a. Add Slack as a contact method (Account > Settings > + Contact Method).  
   b. In Notifications, select the course, then in the Slack column click the icon and choose your frequency.

5. Note Unsupported Types  
   – Any notification type showing the Unsupported icon cannot be managed.  

6. Save & Propagate  
   – Changes apply immediately to the selected course.  
   – Account-level settings remain in effect for courses without overrides.
context:
Document Title: How do I manage my Canvas notification settings

How do I manage my Canvas notification settings? Canvas includes a set of default notification settings you can receive for your courses. However, you can change the default settings by setting your own notification settings. These settings only apply to you; they are not used to control how course updates are sent to other users. To learn more about each notification, default settings, and notification triggers, view the Canvas Notifications resource document . Notifications are sent as one of four delivery types: Notify immediately Daily summary Weekly summary Notifications off If you change a setting, the change is made immediately to your account. Notification settings apply to all of your courses unless you set notification settings for individual courses . You may be able to reply directly to email notifications outside of Canvas. Replies are updated in the Canvas Inbox . However, attachments added as part of an external reply are not included with the message shown in Canvas. Notes: Canvas sends notifications using your confirmed contact methods. You cannot receive notifications if your contact methods are unconfirmed. If you are not receiving Canvas notifications, please confirm your Canvas contact methods . You can also manage notifications settings in the Canvas Student app on an Android device or on an iOS device . However, managing settings inside the app will override settings in the browser version of Canvas. You may be able to select notification settings for an individual course. Learn more about managing notifications for a single course . Some notifications may not apply to the observer role. To learn more about each notification, default settings, and notification triggers, view the Canvas Notifications resource document .  Open Notifications In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Notifications link . View Account Notification Settings On the Notification Settings page, you can manage how you receive notifications for your Canvas account and/or manage how you receive notifications for individual courses . A banner describes the settings you are managing . Another banner indicates the times when daily and weekly notifications will be delivered . To dismiss a banner message, click the Close icon . By default, the Settings for drop-down menu displays the Account option . Account-level notification settings apply to all of your Canvas courses, however, any course-specific notification settings override account notification settings. You can view your current account-level settings . View Notification Types and Methods Account-level notification types are listed by category . There are notifications for course activities, discussions, conversations, groups, scheduling, and conferences. You can also view your contact methods such as email addresses and push notifications for mobile devices . Each notification has a default delivery frequency setting. To view the current notification delivery frequency for a notification type and contact method, hover over the notification icon . View Notification Details Review the description provided for each notification type. Manage Email Notification Frequency Each notification is set to a default setting. To change a notification for a contact method, locate the notification and click the icon for the contact method . To receive a notification right away, select the Notify immediately option . These notifications may be delayed by up to one hour in case an instructor makes additional changes, which prevents you from being spammed by multiple notifications in a short amount of time. To receive a daily notification, select the Daily summary option . The date and time of your daily notifications are posted in a banner at the top of the Notification Settings page. To receive a weekly notification, select the Weekly summary option . The date and time of your weekly notifications are posted in a banner at the top of the Notification Settings page. If you do not want to receive a notification, select the Notifications off option . Unsupported notification types display the Unsupported icon . You cannot manage unsupported notifications. Notes: Each set|Document Title: How do I manage my Canvas notification settings

do not want to receive a notification, select the Notifications off option . Unsupported notification types display the Unsupported icon . You cannot manage unsupported notifications. Notes: Each set notification setting automatically applies to all of your courses. However, if you manage notification settings for a single course, notifications for that course must continue to be managed in the course. Although unregistered contact methods display in notification settings, they will not receive notifications until you confirm the registration. View Privacy Notice If you've set a notification setting for an email address that is outside your institution, you may see a privacy warning. You can close the warning by clicking the Ok button. Once the warning has been displayed, it will not display again. Set Push Notifications If you have enabled push notifications in the Canvas Student mobile app on an Android device or on an iOS device , you can manage your settings in the Push Notification column. Push notifications can only be sent to your mobile device right away or not at all. Daily and weekly notification options are not supported. Some categories include limited availability for push notifications. For full details about supported notifications for push notifications, refer to the Canvas Notifications resource document . Notes: Managing notification settings inside the Canvas Student mobile app will override settings selected in the Notification Settings page of the browser version of Canvas. When you log into the mobile app, a push notification channel is automatically created. If the ability to receive push notifications has been enabled by your institution, a push notification column displays when you log into the mobile app. Set Slack Notifications If your institution uses a third-party messaging application called Slack and has enabled Slack as a contact method, you can add Slack as a contact method and receive direct message notifications from Canvas in Slack. Slack notifications may vary depending on your Slack notification settings.

input: How do I turn off all email notifications in my Canvas account using Notification Settings?
expected_output:
1. In Canvas Global Navigation, click Account, then click Notifications.  
2. Ensure the Settings for drop-down is set to Account (so changes apply to all courses).  
3. In the list of notification categories, locate the Email column.  
4. For each notification type (Assignments, Discussions, Conversations, etc.), click its current icon under Email and select Notifications off.  
5. Repeat step 4 until every email notification shows the Notifications off icon.  
6. Changes save immediately—no additional confirmation is needed.

Some categories include limited availability for push notifications. For full details about supported notifications for push notifications, refer to the Canvas Notifications resource document . Notes: Managing notification settings inside the Canvas Student mobile app will override settings selected in the Notification Settings page of the browser version of Canvas. When you log into the mobile app, a push notification channel is automatically created. If the ability to receive push notifications has been enabled by your institution, a push notification column displays when you log into the mobile app. Set Slack Notifications If your institution uses a third-party messaging application called Slack and has enabled Slack as a contact method, you can add Slack as a contact method and receive direct message notifications from Canvas in Slack. Slack notifications may vary depending on your Slack notification settings.

input: In Canvas Settings under Download Course Content, how do I generate and download an ePub (including associated files) so I can open it offline?
expected_output:
1. In Canvas, click Account in Global Navigation, then select Settings.  
2. Click the Download Course Content button.  
3. Find your course in the ePub exports list and click Generate ePub.  
4. Wait for the export to complete, then click Download ePub to save the file.  
5. If your course has unsupported files (PDFs, Office docs, media), click Download Associated Files to get a ZIP of those items.  
6. Open the ePub in your preferred eReader (e.g., iBooks, Azardi) and unzip the associated files to view them in their native apps.
context:
Document Title: How do I view course content offline as an ePub file

How do I view course content offline as an ePub file? If one or more of your courses have enabled ePub exports, you can view your course offline as an ePub file. You can download the ePub file and upload it into any eReader software for viewing, such as iBooks or Azardi. ePub content is for offline viewing only; you cannot interact with course content directly, such as completing an assignment or viewing any submissions. In an ePub file, you can view assignment details, availability dates, and point values. Discussions include the discussion topic. All discussion replies (graded or ungraded) are considered submissions and must be viewed online. Additionally, you can view any embedded media files in the ePub. Any files that aren't supported in the ePub format, such as file attachments or PDFs, can be downloaded to be viewed in the file's native environment. Currently ePub files and any associated files can only be generated in the browser version of Canvas, but the files can be transferred for viewing on any supported device. Depending on the course setup, the ePub may be organized by modules or content type (assignments, discussions, quizzes, etc.). When viewing by module, only items you have access to view in each module will be included in the ePub file. Locked modules list either their prerequisites or the unlock date, as well as the items that are contained within that module (though not the actual content of those items themselves). Notes: You cannot generate ePub files for concluded courses, however, previously generated ePub files for concluded courses are available to download. If you can view the Download Course Content button but cannot download an ePub file for a specific course, the feature has not been enabled for that course. If your account does not display the Download Course Content button, your institution may only allow you to export content offline as an HTML file in Modules.  Open User Settings In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Settings link . Download Course Content Click the Download Course Content button. Generate ePub View the courses available as ePub exports. To generate an ePub, locate the course and click the Generate ePub link. Download ePub Once the export has completed, download the ePub by clicking the Download ePub link . You can upload the ePub file into any eReader for viewing. If the course includes files that aren't supported in the ePub, click the Download Associated Files link . Associated files download in a ZIP file and contain all unsupported files, such as media files and Microsoft Office documents. To regenerate the ePub file, click the Regnerate ePub link .

input: In Canvas LMS, how do I generate and download an EPUB and associated files from the Account > Settings page in my browser?
expected_output:
1. Open Canvas in your browser and go to Global Navigation.  
2. Click Account, then click Settings.  
3. In Settings, click the Download Course Content button.  
4. Find the course you want and click Generate ePub.  
5. When the export finishes, click Download ePub to save the file.  
6. To get unsupported files (PDFs, Office docs, etc.), click Download Associated Files to download a ZIP.  
7. (Optional) To refresh content, click Regenerate ePub.

input: How do I change my timezone in Canvas LMS? I went to Account > Settings > Edit Settings, updated the TZ dropdown, and clicked Update Settings, but how can I hover over dates to verify the change?
expected_output:
1. Open any Canvas page that displays dates (e.g., Calendar, Assignments, Modules).  
2. Hover your cursor over a displayed date/time.  
3. In the tooltip you’ll see:  
   - Your local time (the time zone you set in Settings)  
   - The course’s official time zone  
4. Confirm the “local time” matches the time zone you selected in Account > Settings > Edit Settings > Time Zone > Update Settings.
context:
Document Title: How do I set a time zone in my user account

How do I set a time zone in my user account? All dates and times throughout your Canvas courses are displayed according a course's respective time zone. However, you can set your own time zone for your user account and have your local time zone display throughout Canvas. Displaying dates in your local time may help you stay up to date on assignments and due dates, especially if your course time zone differs significantly from where you reside. Note: If you set a time zone in your user settings, you can always view the course time zone by hovering over any date and time in your course. The text will show both the local time and course time.  Open User Settings In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Settings link . Edit Settings Click the Edit Settings button. Set User Time Zone In the Time Zone drop-down menu, select a time zone for your user account. Update Settings Click the Update Settings button. View Time Zone View the time zone for your user account.

input: How do I change my time zone in my Canvas account settings using the drop-down menu, and enable hover-over timestamps?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Account then Settings.  
2. Click Edit Settings.  
3. In the Time Zone drop-down menu, choose your local time zone.  
4. Click Update Settings.  
5. Hover your cursor over any date or time in Canvas; a tooltip will display both your local time and the course’s time zone.

input: How do I merge two Canvas accounts that share the same registered email address? What steps do I need to follow in Canvas User Settings?
expected_output:
1. Verify prerequisites  
   - Ensure both accounts use the same registered email.  
   - Have usernames and passwords for both accounts.  
   - Confirm your institution has enabled account merging.  

2. Open User Settings  
   - In Global Navigation, click Account, then click Settings.  

3. Initiate the merge  
   - In the Ways to Contact sidebar, click the Merge icon.  

4. Confirm and combine  
   - Click the Combine button.  

5. Enter second account credentials  
   - Provide the email address and password for the other Canvas account.  

6. Verify completion  
   - Look for the confirmation message indicating the accounts have been successfully merged.
context:
Document Title: How do I merge my user account with an account using the same

How do I merge my user account with an account using the same email address?
If you have an email address registered in two Canvas accounts, you can merge these accounts. Merging accounts combines the logins, contact methods, and enrollments for the two accounts.
The icon to complete this process will only appear in User Settings if there are two or more email addresses on the account and the email address that appears on both accounts has been registered.
In order to complete this process, you must have the Canvas username and password for both accounts.
Notes:
If you cannot merge accounts, this option has not been enabled by your institution.
Merging user accounts cannot be undone.
Open User Settings
In Global Navigation, click the
Account
link [1], then click the
Settings
link [2].
Combine User Accounts
To merge user accounts, click the
Merge
icon in the Ways to Contact sidebar.
Confirm Account Merger
To confirm that you would like to merge accounts, click the
Combine
button.
Enter Credentials
Enter the email address and password for the second account.
View Confirmation Message
Confirm the merge was successful.

input: How do I merge two Canvas accounts in User Settings? Are there any prerequisites or irreversible restrictions?
expected_output:
Here’s how to merge two Canvas accounts in User Settings—including prerequisites and irreversible restrictions:

Prerequisites  
1. Both accounts must share the same verified email address.  
2. You must know the Canvas username/email and password for both accounts.  
3. Your institution must have enabled account merging.  

Irreversible Restriction  
• Once merged, you cannot separate the accounts.  

Step-by-Step Instructions  
1. Open User Settings  
   • In Global Navigation, click Account, then Settings.  
2. Locate the Merge Icon  
   • In the “Ways to Contact” sidebar, click the Merge icon.  
3. Confirm Merger  
   • Click Combine to proceed.  
4. Enter Second Account Credentials  
   • Provide the email address and password for the other account.  
5. Verify Success  
   • Look for the confirmation message—your logins, contact methods, and enrollments are now combined.

input: How can I manage access tokens in Canvas account settings? How do I filter and search tokens, expand details, toggle features, and interpret the tags?
expected_output:
1. Open User Settings  
   - In Global Navigation, click Account, then click Settings.  

2. Manage Access Tokens  
   - On the right side of the Settings page, click Manage Access Tokens.  

3. Filter Tokens  
   - Click the Filter drop-down and choose All, Active, or Revoked to narrow your list.  

4. Search Tokens  
   - Enter a token name or keyword in the Search field to locate specific tokens.  

5. Expand Token Details  
   - Click the arrow (▸) next to a token to display its scopes, expiration date, and creation info.  

6. Toggle Token State  
   - Click the State icon for a token and select Revoke (to disable) or Restore (to enable).  
   - Revoked tokens display the “Disabled” icon; active tokens display the “Enabled” icon.  

7. Interpret Token Tags  
   - No tag – the token is stable and fully supported.  
   - “Beta” tag – the token or its functionality is experimental; enabling may produce unexpected results.  
   - “Admin Only” tag – only admins can create or manage this token (controlled by the Admin Manage Access Tokens feature option).
context:
Document Title: How do I manage feature options in my user account

How do I manage feature options in my user account? Some Canvas features are optional or new and can be turned on or off. The majority of improvements will be made available as part of our regular release cycle. However, some features may affect your personal interaction with Canvas. This lesson gives an overview of how to manage user-level feature options for your user account. To view specific user-level feature options available in Canvas, visit the user account features lesson. Note: If you are an admin, you can limit the ability to manage access tokens to admins only. Learn about the Admin Manage Access Tokens account feature option in the Canvas Feature Option Summary resource document.  Open User Settings In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Settings link . View Feature Options Available features display in the Feature Options section. To view specific user-level feature options available in Canvas, visit the user account features lesson. Filter Feature Options To filter by all features, enabled features or disabled features, click the Filter drop-down menu. Search Feature Options To search for a feature option, enter a keyword in the Search field. View Types of Features Each feature includes a feature description. To expand the feature box and display the description, click the Arrow icon. View Feature Tags Feature tags help identify the state of each feature. A feature with no label means the feature is stable and ready for use in your production environment . Features may also include a beta tag , which means the feature is available for use in your production environment but is still being tested for usability and accessibility behavior. Enabling a beta feature may create unintended behavior within your Canvas account. View Feature States You can choose to enable or disable feature options. To enable or disable a feature, click the feature's State icon . To turn the feature on, click the Enabled option . Enabled features display the Enabled icon . To turn the feature off, click the Disabled option . Disabled features display the Disabled icon .

input: How can I disable a beta feature in Canvas by changing its state icon in Settings > Feature Options?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Account and select Settings.  
2. Scroll to the Feature Options section.  
3. (Optional) Use the Filter drop-down to show only Disabled, Enabled, or All features—or enter “beta” in the Search field.  
4. Locate the beta feature you want to turn off and, if needed, click its arrow icon to view the description.  
5. Click the feature’s State icon and select Disabled.  
6. Confirm the feature now displays the Disabled icon.

input: How do I enable automatic closed captions and set the CSV export separator in Canvas?
expected_output:
1. Log in to Canvas and click Account (user avatar) in the global navigation.  
2. Select Settings.  
3. In the Settings page, click the Feature Options tab.  

4. Enable Auto Show Closed Captions  
   a. Scroll to **Auto Show Closed Captions**.  
   b. Click the toggle so it turns **On**.  
   • Videos with Canvas-added captions will now display captions by default.  

5. Configure CSV export separators  
   You have two main options—pick one based on your locale:  
   
   Option A: Use semicolons  
   a. Scroll to **Use semicolons to separate fields in compatible spreadsheet exports**.  
   b. Click the toggle to turn **On**.  
   • All CSV exports will use semicolons as the field separator.  
   
   Option B: Autodetect field separators  
   a. Scroll to **Autodetect field separators in compatible spreadsheet exports**.  
   b. Click the toggle to turn **On** (this setting is disabled if semicolons is enabled).  
   • Canvas will choose commas or semicolons based on your account language.  

6. Close the Settings page—your changes are saved automatically.  

You have now enabled automatic closed captions and set your preferred CSV separator.
context:
Document Title: What feature options can I enable in my user account

What feature options can I enable in my user account? Some Canvas features are optional or new and can be turned on or off. The majority of improvements will be made available as part of our regular release cycle. However, some features may affect your personal interaction with Canvas. Learn more about User Feature Options and how to enable them in the manage feature options lesson. Note: Unless otherwise noted, all users can access the user-level feature options.  Auto Show Closed Captions By default, this feature is set to Off. The Auto Show Closed Captions feature setting allows you to enable captions added to videos by default for your Canvas account. Note: Videos embedded from third-party tools, such as Youtube, are not supported. Additionally, embedded Canvas Studio videos are not yet supported. Course Set-Up Tutorial This feature only displays if your institution has enabled the Canvas course setup tutorial . By default, this feature only displays for new users enrolled as instructors and is set to Off. The Course Set-up Tutorial feature setting allows you to view the course set-up tutorial. When enabled, this feature displays a tutorial in each Course Navigation index page that shows you the purpose of the page and what to do next. The tutorial applies to all of your courses in Canvas where you are enrolled as an instructor. Disable Alert Notification Timeouts By default this feature is set to Off. The Disable Alert Notification Timeouts feature setting prevents alert notification pop-ups from timing out. When this feature setting is enabled, alert notifications in Canvas display until you manually dismiss the alert. Disable Celebration Animations By default this feature is set to Off. The Disable Celebration Animations setting allows you to turn off all celebration animations. The Celebration feature must be enabled by a Canvas admin at your institution. If this feature is not enabled, the Disable Celebration Animations setting will not display in your user Feature Settings. Learn how to manage confetti animations . Notes: If you are a student, celebration animation confetti displays when you submit an assignment on time. If you are an instructor, celebration animation confetti displays when you validate links in a course , if the link validator celebrations feature option is enabled by your institution's Canvas admin. Disable Keyboard Shortcuts By default this feature is set to Off. The Disable Keyboard Shortcuts feature setting allows you to disable keyboard shortcuts in Modules, Discussions, the Gradebook, and SpeedGrader. Other areas of Canvas will be updated at a future date. This setting allows users who rely on screen readers or keyboard navigation to control their experience in Canvas with keyboard shortcuts. High Contrast UI By default this feature is set to Off. The High Contrast UI feature setting allows you to view Canvas using high contrast styles. This feature enhances the color contrast of the user interface (text, buttons, etc.) so they are more distinct and easier to identify in Canvas. However, institutional branding is not supported when this feature is enabled, so you will not be able to view the institution's logo or other elements. You can also enable High Contrast UI from your User Navigation Menu. Microsoft Immersive Reader By default this feature is set to Off. The Microsoft Immersive Reader enhances accessibility and comprehension for any reader. When enabled, the course home page, assignments, pages, and syllabus display an Immersive Reader button. Microsoft Immersive Reader is available for you to enable individually, regardless of the preference set at the account level. However, if the feature is on for the entire account, the account preference overrides your user preference, and your user setting has no effect. To learn more about this feature, see the Microsoft Immersive Reader website . Open To-Do Items in a New Tab By default this feature is set to On. This feature only displays for users enrolled as instructors. The Open to-do items in a new tab feature setting allows you to open Grade Assignment links from your Dashboard To Do list in a new browser tab. Disabling this feature|Document Title: What feature options can I enable in my user account

users enrolled as instructors. The Open to-do items in a new tab feature setting allows you to open Grade Assignment links from your Dashboard To Do list in a new browser tab. Disabling this feature allows you to open Grade Assignment links from your Dashboard To Do list in the existing browser tab. Underline Links By default this feature is set to Off. The Underline Links feature setting allows you to view Canvas interface links as underlined text. When enabled, this feature underlines hyperlinks in navigation menus, the Dashboard, and page sidebars. This feature setting does not apply to user-generated content links in the Rich Content Editor, which always underlines links for all users. CSV Separator Preferences You can set how you want to view separators in CSV export files, depending on your locale or preference. Separator settings are managed through one of three feature settings in User Settings. These settings only apply to compatible spreadsheet exports. Autodetect Field Separators in Compatible Spreadsheet Exports The Autodetect field separators feature settings attempts to determine the appropriate field separator as indicated by the language set in the user’s account. For languages where the decimal separator is a dot, (e.g. 1,234.56), autodetection will choose a comma as the field separator. For languages where the decimal separator is a comma, (e.g. 1.234,56), autodetection will choose a semicolon as the field separator. For all other cases, autodetection will choose a comma as the field separator as a default. Note: This feature is automatically disabled if the Use semicolons to separate fields setting is enabled. Include Byte-Order Mark in Compatible Spreadsheet Exports The Include Byte-Order Mark feature setting generates a specific set of three characters at the beginning of the CSV file. These characters, known as a byte-order mark, help some versions of Microsoft Excel understand that the CSV file is a UTF-8 encoded file. It also tells some localized versions of Excel that they should treat the incoming CSV file as if it were semicolon-separated by default. Because some versions of Excel do not understand or honor the byte-order mark, this feature allows all users to disable generation of this byte-order mark. Use a Dyslexia Friendly Font The Use a dyslexia friendly font feature enables the Canvas interface and the Rich Content Editor to display text using the OpenDyslexic font by default. If the feature is disabled, both OpenDyslexic and OpenDyslexic Mono are available as font options within the Rich Content. Notes: OpenDyslexic font does not include Hebrew or Arabic characters. Additionally, if content is created using the Dyslexia Friendly Font, it will display in the default Canvas font for users who do not have the feature enabled. If this settings is enabled, you can toggle to enable dyslexia-friendly font in your User Navigation Menu. Use Semicolons to Separate Fields in Compatible Spreadsheet Exports The Use semicolons to separate fields feature setting generates CSV files with semicolons as the field separators instead of the default comma. When disabled, this feature falls back to behavior determined by the state of the Autodetect field separators setting. Note: This feature is automatically disabled if the Autodetect Field Separators setting is enabled.

input: Where in User Settings can I disable keyboard shortcuts for Modules, Discussions, Gradebook, and SpeedGrader?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Account, then Settings.  
2. Open the Feature Options tab.  
3. Scroll to **Disable Keyboard Shortcuts**.  
4. Toggle the setting On to disable shortcuts in Modules, Discussions, the Gradebook, and SpeedGrader.

The Underline Links feature setting allows you to view Canvas interface links as underlined text. When enabled, this feature underlines hyperlinks in navigation menus, the Dashboard, and page sidebars. This feature setting does not apply to user-generated content links in the Rich Content Editor, which always underlines links for all users. CSV Separator Preferences You can set how you want to view separators in CSV export files, depending on your locale or preference. Separator settings are managed through one of three feature settings in User Settings. These settings only apply to compatible spreadsheet exports. Autodetect Field Separators in Compatible Spreadsheet Exports The Autodetect field separators feature settings attempts to determine the appropriate field separator as indicated by the language set in the user’s account. For languages where the decimal separator is a dot, (e.g. 1,234.56), autodetection will choose a comma as the field separator. For languages where the decimal separator is a comma, (e.g. 1.234,56), autodetection will choose a semicolon as the field separator. For all other cases, autodetection will choose a comma as the field separator as a default. Note: This feature is automatically disabled if the Use semicolons to separate fields setting is enabled. Include Byte-Order Mark in Compatible Spreadsheet Exports The Include Byte-Order Mark feature setting generates a specific set of three characters at the beginning of the CSV file. These characters, known as a byte-order mark, help some versions of Microsoft Excel understand that the CSV file is a UTF-8 encoded file. It also tells some localized versions of Excel that they should treat the incoming CSV file as if it were semicolon-separated by default. Because some versions of Excel do not understand or honor the byte-order mark, this feature allows all users to disable generation of this byte-order mark. Use a Dyslexia Friendly Font The Use a dyslexia friendly font feature enables the Canvas interface and the Rich Content Editor to display text using the OpenDyslexic font by default. If the feature is disabled, both OpenDyslexic and OpenDyslexic Mono are available as font options within the Rich Content. Notes: OpenDyslexic font does not include Hebrew or Arabic characters. Additionally, if content is created using the Dyslexia Friendly Font, it will display in the default Canvas font for users who do not have the feature enabled. If this settings is enabled, you can toggle to enable dyslexia-friendly font in your User Navigation Menu. Use Semicolons to Separate Fields in Compatible Spreadsheet Exports The Use semicolons to separate fields feature setting generates CSV files with semicolons as the field separators instead of the default comma. When disabled, this feature falls back to behavior determined by the state of the Autodetect field separators setting. Note: This feature is automatically disabled if the Autodetect Field Separators setting is enabled.

input: How do I configure multi-factor authentication in Canvas LMS using an authenticator app, verify and remember my device, and generate backup codes?
expected_output:
1. Open User Settings  
   - In Global Navigation, click Account, then click Settings.  

2. Launch MFA Setup  
   - Click Set Up Multi-Factor Authentication.  

3. Configure Authenticator App  
   - Install a TOTP app (e.g., Google Authenticator) on your smartphone.  
   - Use the app to scan the on-screen QR code (or enter the secret key).  
   - Enter the 6-digit code from the app into the Verification Code field.  

4. Remember Your Device  
   - Check Remember this computer to skip MFA on this browser.  
   - Click Verify.  

5. Generate Backup Codes  
   - Back in User Settings under Multi-Factor Authentication, click Generate Backup Codes.  
   - Save or print the codes in a secure place for emergency access.
context:
Document Title: How do I set up multi factor authentication for my user account

How do I set up multi-factor authentication for my user account? Your institution may enable multi-factor authentication for your user account. Multi-factor authentication adds security to your account by verifying you are the user accessing your account. Multi-factor authentication may be optional or required. You must have a mobile device to set up multi-factor authentication for your user account. Your device must be able to send text (SMS) messages, or if you have a smartphone, you can download the Google Authenticator app for iPhone or Android. Note : This lesson shows how to set up multi-factor authentication if it is an optional setting in your user account. However, if multi-factor authentication is required by your institution, you will be shown the multi-factor authentication page directly after you log in to Canvas.  Open User Settings In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Settings link . Set Up Multi-Factor Authentication Click the Set Up Multi-Factor Authentication button. Verify via Authenticator App To verify multi-factor authentication  a time-based one-time password (TOTP) authenticator app on iPhone or Android (ex: Google Authenticator, Microsoft Authenticator, Authy), download the app for your device. Use the app to scan and generate the QR code . Enter the code in the Verification Code field . If you want multi-factor authentication to remember the computer you are using to log in to Canvas, click the Remember this computer checkbox . Click the Verify button . Verify via Text Message To verify multi-factor authentication via text message, enter your phone number  and select your carrier .  This is the number where your multi-factor verification code will be sent. Once you have set up your new phone number, or selected an existing phone number, click the Send button . Your mobile device will receive a verification code. Enter the code in the Verification Code field . If you want multi-factor authentication to remember the computer you are using to log in to Canvas, click the Remember this computer checkbox . Click the Verify button . Manage Multi-Factor Authentication Once multi-factor authentication is enabled, your User Settings page may display additional options to manage your authentication. You can choose to create multi-factor authentication codes to use as backup in case your authentication device is not available . This option is available to all users with multi-factor authentication. If multi-factor authentication is optional for your account, you can also choose to reconfigure authentication  or disable authentication .

input: In Canvas LMS, is SMS multi-factor authentication optional or required? How do I add my phone number and trust this computer so I don’t have to enter a code every time?
expected_output:
• Is SMS MFA optional or required? It depends on your institution’s policy—some schools require multi-factor authentication, while others make it optional.  
• To add your phone number and trust a computer:  
  1. In Canvas, go to Account > Settings.  
  2. Click Set Up Multi-Factor Authentication.  
  3. Under Verify via Text Message, enter your mobile number and select your carrier.  
  4. Click Send, then enter the verification code you receive.  
  5. Check Remember this computer.  
  6. Click Verify.  
Now SMS codes will be sent to your phone, and this computer will be trusted so you won’t need to re-enter a code each time.

input: In Canvas LMS, how can I add a manual token with a specific purpose and expiration date under Account→Settings→Approved Integrations?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click the Account icon, then select Settings.  
2. Scroll to the Approved Integrations section.  
3. Click the Add New Access Token button.  
4. In the Purpose field, enter a description for your token.  
5. Click the Expiration date field (or Calendar icon) to choose your date, then select an Expiration time.  
6. (Optional) Leave both expiration fields blank for a non-expiring token.  
7. Click Generate Token – your new token (with the specified purpose and expiration) will appear in Approved Integrations.
context:
Document Title: How do I manage API access tokens in my user account

How do I manage API access tokens in my user account? You can manage API access tokens from your User Settings. Access tokens provide access to Canvas resources through the Canvas API. Access tokens can be generated automatically for third-party applications or created manually. Using the Canvas API allows the access token holder to access the same Canvas resources that you can access. For example, third-party applications, including devices you have used to open the Canvas Student app, are authorized to access Canvas on your behalf. For more information on using the Canvas API, view the Canvas API documentation . Note: If you are an admin, you can limit the ability to manage access tokens to admins only. Access tokens should be treated with the same level of security as your account password. Never share your access token, and immediately revoke a token if you suspect it has been exposed or compromised. It is a violation of Canvas API policy for a user to generate an access token to insert into an application. Applications must use approved authentication methods instead.  Open User Settings In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Settings link . View Access Tokens Third-party applications with access tokens and user-generated access tokens are listed in the Approved Integrations section . For each access token, you can view the name , purpose , expiration date , and date of last use . Note: Mobile access tokens are generated for you when you log in to a Canvas mobile app and never expire. To remove access for a mobile application, the access token must be deleted. Add Access Token To manually add an access token, click the Add New Access Token button. Note: If the Add Access Token button is unavailable, your institution may allow only admins to generate access tokens. If you are an admin, you can learn more about the Admin Manage Access Tokens account feature option in the Canvas Feature Option Summary resource document. Add Token Details Enter a description for your access token in the Purpose field . You can select an expiration date by clicking the Expiration date field or the Calendar icon . You can also select an expiration time from the Expiration time drop-down menu . To generate a token with no expiration, leave the expiration fields empty. To generate a new access token, click the Generate Token button . Note: An indicator "*" displays to notify users that the field is required. View Access Token View the token description . To view details for the token, click the details link . View Token Details The access token details include a token that can be used to make API calls on your behalf . To regenerate an access token, click the Regenerate Token button . Delete Access Token To delete an access token, click the Delete icon. Confirm Deletion To confirm the deletion, click the OK button.

input: How do I view a Canvas API token’s name, purpose, expiration date, and last use in Settings, and how can I delete a token?
expected_output:
1. Open User Settings  
   - In Global Navigation, click Account, then click Settings.  

2. View Your Tokens  
   - Scroll to the Approved Integrations section.  
   - Each token’s Name, Purpose, Expiration Date, and Date of Last Use is displayed in the list.  

3. Delete a Token  
   - Click the trash-can (Delete) icon next to the token you want to remove.  
   - In the confirmation dialog, click OK to revoke and delete the token.

input: How can I add and confirm my Slack email address in Canvas under Account > Settings > Other Contacts?
expected_output:
1. In Canvas, click Account in Global Navigation, then click Settings.  
2. Scroll to Other Contacts and click Add Contact Method.  
3. Select the Slack Email tab.  
4. Enter your Slack-associated email address and click Register Slack Email.  
5. In Slack, find the message with your four-character confirmation code.  
6. Back in Canvas, enter the code in the confirmation field and click Confirm.
context:
Document Title: How do I add Slack as a contact method in Canvas

How do I add Slack as a contact method in Canvas? If your institution allows, you may be able to add Slack as a contact method in Canvas. Notifications from Canvas are received via message in the Slack app. Slack appears under the Other Contacts sidebar heading. Once you have enabled the contact method, learn how to set notification settings .  Open User Settings In Global Navigation, click the Account link . Then click the Settings link . Add Contact Method In the Other Contacts section, click the Add Contact Method link. Register Slack Email Click the Slack Email tab . Enter the email address associated with your Slack account in the Slack Email field . Click the Register Slack Email button . Confirm Slack Email You will receive a Slack notification with a four-character confirmation code. Enter the code in the confirmation field . To confirm the communication channel, click the Confirm button . Delete Slack To delete Slack as a contact method, click the Delete icon. Confirm Deletion Click the OK button.

input: What steps do I follow in the Canvas global navigation to add and confirm my Slack email under Other Contacts?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Account, then click Settings.  
2. Under Other Contacts, click Add Contact Method.  
3. Select the Slack Email tab, enter your Slack-associated email, and click Register Slack Email.  
4. In Slack, locate the Canvas confirmation message and copy the four-character code.  
5. Back in Canvas, paste the code in the confirmation field and click Confirm.

input: With pronoun display enabled, which Global Nav steps let you choose and save pronouns?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click the Account icon, then select Settings.  
2. Click the Edit Settings button.  
3. In the Pronouns drop-down menu, choose your personal pronouns.  
4. Click Update Settings to save.  
5. Your pronouns will now appear after your name throughout Canvas.
context:
Document Title: How do I select personal pronouns in my user account

How do I select personal pronouns in my user account? If enabled by your institution, you can select personal pronouns to add to your user account. Personal pronouns display after your name in various areas in Canvas, including: Assignment Creation Menu Assignment Peer Review Page Course Sections List Discussions Inbox People Page (Course and Groups) Student Context Card User Navigation Menu User Profile Page User Settings Page Notes: If you cannot view pronouns in your User Settings, your institution has not enabled this feature. LTI tools, such as New Quizzes and Analytics, do not currently support displaying pronouns.  Open User Settings In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Settings link . Edit Settings Click the Edit Settings button. Select Pronouns In the Pronouns drop-down menu, select your personal pronouns. Notes: If the Pronouns drop-down menu does not display in your User Settings, your institution has not enabled this feature. Pronoun options are managed by your institution. You cannot add pronoun options. Update Settings Click the Update Settings button. View Pronouns You can view your personal pronouns in your User Settings . Your personal pronouns will also display after your name in many areas throughout Canvas .

input: How do I enable, choose, and update my pronouns in Canvas LMS, and why don't LTI tools support pronouns?
expected_output:
1. Confirm availability  
   – If you don’t see a Pronouns menu in Settings, your institution hasn’t enabled the feature.  

2. Open User Settings  
   – In Global Navigation, click Account > Settings.  

3. Edit your profile  
   – Click Edit Settings.  

4. Choose pronouns  
   – In the Pronouns drop-down, select your personal pronouns. (Options are managed by your institution; you cannot add new ones.)  

5. Save changes  
   – Click Update Settings.  

6. Verify display  
   – Your pronouns now appear after your name throughout Canvas (e.g., Assignments, Discussions, People, Inbox).  

Why LTI tools don’t show pronouns  
   – Third-party LTI integrations (like New Quizzes or Analytics) don’t currently support Canvas’s pronoun field.

input: Where in the Canvas mobile app can I find or generate a 10-minute login QR code, and how do I scan it and keep it secure?
expected_output:
1. Generate the QR code (on Canvas web)  
   a. Log in to Canvas in a desktop browser.  
   b. In Global Navigation, click Account > QR Code for Mobile Login.  
   c. Click Proceed to display your 10-minute QR code.  

2. Scan the QR code (in the Canvas mobile app)  
   a. Open the Canvas Student, Teacher, or Parent app.  
   b. On the login screen, tap the QR-code icon.  
   c. Point your device’s camera at the code on your computer screen.  

3. Keep your QR code secure  
   • Treat it like a password—do not share it.  
   • Make sure no one else can see or photograph your screen.  
   • Never generate or display the code during a screen-sharing session.  

Note: If you don’t see the QR Code for Mobile Login link, your institution has not enabled this feature.
context:
Document Title: How do I view a QR code to log in to the Canvas mobile apps

How do I view a QR code to log in to the Canvas mobile apps? You can view a Canvas login QR code in your Canvas web browser. You can scan this QR code with your mobile device to log in to the Canvas apps without entering your institution URL and user credentials. You can use the QR code to access the Canvas Student app , Canvas Teacher app , or Canvas Parent app . Notes: If you cannot view QR codes, your institution has not enabled this feature. QR codes should be kept as confidential as passwords. No other users should be in the surrounding area to capture the QR code. Codes should also never be generated while sharing a screen via a screen sharing service.  Open QR Code In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the QR Code for Mobile Login link . Note: If you cannot view the QR for Mobile Login link, your institution has not enabled this feature. Confirm QR Code Display To display your mobile login QR code, click the Proceed button. View QR Code View your QR code. The QR code can be scanned to log into the Canvas apps from an Android device or an iOS device. Note: Mobile login QR codes expire 10 minutes after they are generated.

input: How can I show and protect the Canvas login QR code so it doesn’t expire after 10 minutes and can’t be disabled right away?
expected_output:
1. Verify QR-code login is enabled  
   – In Canvas web, click Account → QR Code for Mobile Login.  
   – If you don’t see the link, contact your Canvas Admin to enable the feature.  

2. Display the QR code  
   – Click “Proceed” to generate your mobile-login QR code.  

3. Protect your QR code  
   – Only display it in a private space—no screen sharing or public viewing.  
   – Physically shield your monitor or use a privacy screen filter.  
   – Treat the code like a password—don’t post or record it.  

4. Manage expiration and re-generation  
   – QR codes automatically expire 10 minutes after generation for security.  
   – You cannot extend this timeout or disable the expiration feature.  
   – If it expires, simply click QR Code for Mobile Login → Proceed again to generate a fresh code.  

5. Prevent immediate disablement  
   – Only Canvas account admins can disable QR-code login at the institution level.  
   – Ensure your admin team understands the importance of keeping the feature active.
context:
