input: How can I access course notifications in Canvas via my Account or Course Home, and how do I enable and set them to immediate, daily, weekly, or turn them off?
expected_output:
1. Access course notifications via your Account  
   a. In Global Navigation, click Account → Notifications.  
   b. In the “Settings for” drop-down, select the course you want.  

2. Access course notifications via the Course Home Page  
   a. Open the course.  
   b. Click the View Course Notifications button.  

3. Enable or disable all course notifications  
   • Click the Enable Notifications toggle at the top of the Notifications page.  

4. Set notification frequency for each notification type  
   a. Locate the notification type and your contact method (e.g., email).  
   b. Click its notification icon to open delivery options.  
   c. Choose one:  
     – Notify immediately  
     – Daily summary  
     – Weekly summary  
     – Notifications off  

Your course-level settings will now override any account-level settings for that course.
context:
Document Title: How do I manage notifications for a single course

How do I manage notifications for a single course? This lesson shows how to manage notification settings from your account Notifications page. You can also access course notifications by clicking the View Course Notifications button from the Course Home Page. Course notification settings only apply to the course in which they are set. To receive course notifications, you must first set your Canvas notification settings . Note: Once a notification setting is changed in your course, the course notification setting will override settings set in your Account Settings. You must continue to manage that notification type within your course.  Open Notifications In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Notifications link . Open Course Notification Settings You can manage notification settings for your Canvas account and/or for individual courses. To manage notification settings for an individual course, click the Settings for drop-down menu . Then click the course name . Open Notifications from Course Home Page Alternatively, you can access course notifications from the Course Home Page by clicking the View Course Notifications button. View Course Notification Settings A banner displays stating course-level notification settings apply override any account-level notifications you may have set . To dismiss the message, click the Close icon . A banner displays noting when daily and weekly messages are delivered . To dismiss the message, click the Close icon . To enable or disable all notifications for the course, click the Enable Notifications toggle . View the course-level notification types  and your listed contact methods . Each notification has a default delivery frequency setting. To view the current notification delivery frequency for a notification type and contact method, hover over the notification icon . Manage Individual Notifications To manage notification frequency for a course notification, locate the notification and contact method. Then click the notification icon . You can select one of four delivery frequency types: Notify immediately : receive these notifications right away for this course. These notifications may be delayed by up to one hour in case an instructor makes additional changes, which prevents you from being spammed by multiple notifications in a short amount of time. Daily summary : receive a daily summary for this notification type. Weekly summary : receive a weekly summary for this notification type. Notifications off : no notifications sent for this notification type. View Course Notifications Status You can view your course notification status on your course home page. The View Course Notifications button icon displays if course notifications are enabled  or disabled .

input: How do I disable weekly summary notifications for a specific course via Account > Notifications and the course’s Settings menu?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Account and select Notifications.  
2. In the Settings for drop-down, choose the specific course.  
3. On the course’s notification page, locate each notification type you no longer want weekly summaries for.  
4. Click the weekly-summary icon (solid calendar-with-W) next to the notification and contact method (e.g., email).  
5. In the pop-up menu, select Notifications off.  
6. Repeat for any other notification types.  
7. No further save is required—your changes take effect immediately.
context:

Manage Individual Notifications To manage notification frequency for a course notification, locate the notification and contact method. Then click the notification icon . You can select one of four delivery frequency types: Notify immediately : receive these notifications right away for this course. These notifications may be delayed by up to one hour in case an instructor makes additional changes, which prevents you from being spammed by multiple notifications in a short amount of time. Daily summary : receive a daily summary for this notification type. Weekly summary : receive a weekly summary for this notification type. Notifications off : no notifications sent for this notification type. View Course Notifications Status You can view your course notification status on your course home page. The View Course Notifications button icon displays if course notifications are enabled  or disabled .

input: How do I enable the Canvas HC UI from the User Navigation > Account menu and then reload the page? Why is there no institutional branding displayed?
expected_output:
1. In Canvas, open the User Navigation menu (your profile icon) and click Account.  
2. On your Account page, click the Use High Contrast UI toggle to enable the high-contrast interface.  
3. Reload the page (or navigate to another page) for the high-contrast UI to take effect.  

Note: Institutional branding (logos, custom colors) isn’t displayed when High Contrast UI is enabled.

The high contrast user interface (UI) enhances the color contrast of text, buttons, and other elements so they are more distinct and easier to identify in Canvas. Note: The High Contrast UI setting does not support Institutional branding.

input: In Canvas LMS, under Account > Settings > Feature Options, which icon do I click to disable the confetti animation after students submit on time?
expected_output:
1. In Global Navigation, click Account, then click Settings.  
2. Scroll to the Feature Settings section.  
3. Click the Disable Celebration Animations icon (the party-popper icon with a slash) to turn off confetti after on-time submissions.
context:
Document Title: How do I manage confetti animations in Canvas

How do I manage confetti animations in Canvas? If enabled by your institution, you can choose to have celebration animation confetti display. If you prefer not to see confetti or would like to re-enable this feature, you can manage the feature option in your user settings. Notes: If you are a student, celebration animation confetti displays when you submit an assignment on time. If you are an instructor, celebration animation confetti displays when you validate links in a course , if the link validator celebrations feature option is enabled by your institution's Canvas admin. Assignments set up with external tools as the submission type do not display confetti animation upon a student's submission.  Open User Settings In Global Navigation, click the Account link , then click the Settings link . Manage Celebration Animations In the Feature Settings section, use the Disable Celebration Animations icon to enable or disable this feature.

input: Within Canvas Global Nav > Account > Settings, how do I disable the celebration confetti animation?
expected_output:
1. In Canvas’s Global Navigation menu, click Account.  
2. Select Settings.  
3. Scroll down to the Feature Settings section.  
4. Click the Disable Celebration Animations icon (it will toggle off the confetti).  
5. Your preference is saved automatically—confetti will no longer appear.

input: How can instructors access and use the Rich Content Editor in Canvas to create and edit announcements, assignments, discussions, pages, quizzes, and the syllabus?
expected_output:
Here’s how instructors can open and use the Rich Content Editor (RCE) across Canvas:

1. Announcements  
   a. Go to Announcements.  
   b. To create: click Add Announcement.  
   c. To edit: open an announcement and click Edit.  
   d. Use the RCE toolbar to format text, embed media, add links, etc.

2. Assignments  
   a. Go to Assignments.  
   b. To create: click Add Assignment.  
   c. To edit: click the assignment’s Options icon and select Edit.  
   d. In the RCE you can insert files, embed media, and apply text styles.

3. Discussions  
   a. Go to Discussions.  
   b. To create: click Add Discussion.  
   c. To edit: open a discussion and click Edit.  
   d. To reply: click Reply on a discussion and use the RCE to format your post.

4. Pages  
   a. Go to Pages (View All Pages).  
   b. To create: click Add Page.  
   c. To edit: click the page’s Options icon and select Edit.  
   d. Use the RCE to structure content, embed media, and add links.

5. Quizzes  
   – Classic Quizzes  
     • To create or edit quiz descriptions: click Add Quiz or use the Options icon > Edit.  
     • To edit questions: open the Questions tab and click the Edit icon by each question.  
   – New Quizzes  
     • To build or edit a quiz: click Add Quiz or Options icon > Build.  
     • To edit questions: click the question’s Edit icon.  
   In both, the RCE lets you format question text, embed images, and add equations.

6. Syllabus  
   a. Go to Syllabus.  
   b. Click Edit.  
   c. Use the RCE to update course overview, embed links, and format your syllabus content.
context:
Document Title: How do I access the Rich Content Editor

How do I access the Rich Content Editor? You can access the Rich Content Editor from Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, Classic Quizzes, New Quizzes, and the Syllabus. This lesson explains how to access the Rich Content Editor from each of those areas. Learn more about the Rich Content Editor . Note: Depending on your user role, you may or may not be able to access the Rich Content Editor in certain areas.  Announcements In Announcements, you can access the Rich Content Editor by creating or editing an announcement. To create an announcement , click the Add Announcement button . To edit an announcement , click the announcement title  then click the Edit button . Assignments In Assignments, as an instructor, you can access the Rich Content Editor by creating or editing an assignment. To create an assignment , click the Add Assignment button . To edit an assignment , click the assignment's Options icon  and click the Edit option . Text Entry Assignment Submission In Assignments, as a student, you can access the Rich Content Editor by submitting a text entry assignment . Discussions In Discussions, as an instructor, you can access the Rich Content Editor by creating, editing or replying to a discussion. To create a discussion , click the Add Discussion button . To edit a discussion , click the discussion title  then click the Edit button . Discussion Reply In Discussions, you can access the Rich Content Editor by adding a discussion reply. To reply to a discussion , click the Reply button. Pages In Pages, you can access the Rich Content Editor by creating or editing a page. To view all pages in a course, click the View All Pages button . To create a new page , click the Add Page button . To edit a page , click the page's Options icon  and click the Edit option . Note: You can only create or edit pages if allowed. Classic Quizzes Quiz Description In Classic Quizzes, as an instructor, you can use the Rich Content Editor to edit the quiz description or quiz questions. You can access the Rich Content Editor to edit a quiz description when adding a new quiz or editing a quiz. To add a new quiz , click the Add Quiz button . To edit a quiz, click the quiz's Options icon  and select the Edit option . Quiz Questions To use the Rich Content Editor to edit a question, click the Questions tab . Then click the Edit icon for the question you want to edit . Essay Classic Quiz Question In Classic Quizzes, as a student, you can use the Rich Content Editor when answering essay questions. You can use the editor to format your content. New Quizzes Build Quiz In New Quizzes, as an instructor, you can use the Rich Content Editor to edit the quiz description or quiz questions. To add a new quiz , click the Add Quiz button . To edit a quiz, click the quiz's Options icon  and select the Build option . Quiz Question To use the Rich Content Editor to edit a question, click the Edit icon for the question you want to edit. Essay New Quiz Question In New Quizzes, as a student, you can use the Rich Content Editor when answering essay questions. To answer an Essay question, click the text box and enter your content . Content can be formatted through the Rich Content Editor . Syllabus In the Syllabus, as an instructor, you can use the Rich Content Editor to edit your course syllabus. To edit the syllabus , click the Edit button. View Rich Content Editor View the Rich Content Editor . Learn how to add and modify text in the Rich Content Editor .

input: Which areas in a Canvas course open the Rich Content Editor when I create, edit, or reply to content?
expected_output:
You can open the Rich Content Editor whenever you create, edit, or reply in these Canvas course areas:

  • Announcements  
    – Add or edit an announcement  
  • Assignments  
    – Instructors: add/edit an assignment  
    – Students: submit a text‐entry assignment  
  • Discussions  
    – Instructors: add or edit a discussion  
    – All users: reply to a discussion  
  • Pages  
    – Add or edit a course page (if allowed)  
  • Classic Quizzes  
    – Instructors: add/edit quiz descriptions and questions  
    – Students: answer essay questions  
  • New Quizzes  
    – Instructors: build/edit quiz descriptions and questions  
    – Students: answer essay questions  
  • Syllabus  
    – Instructors: click Edit to modify the syllabus

input: In the Canvas Rich Content Editor, what keystroke reveals the keyboard shortcut list, and what copy and paste shortcuts can I use on PC and Mac?
expected_output:
1. To view the full list of Rich Content Editor keyboard shortcuts:  
   - On PC: press Alt + F8  
   - On Mac: press Option + F8  

2. Copy and paste shortcuts:  
   - PC  
     • Copy: Ctrl + C  
     • Paste: Ctrl + V  
     • Paste without formatting: Ctrl + Shift + V  
   - Mac  
     • Copy: ⌘ + C  
     • Paste: ⌘ + V  
     • Paste without formatting: ⌘ + Option + Shift + V
context:
Document Title: How do I add and modify text in the Rich Content Editor

How do I add and modify text in the Rich Content Editor?
Several features in Canvas support the
Rich Content Editor
, including Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes.
You can type text and you can copy and paste text from other sources into the Rich Content Editor. The Rich Content Editor also includes several formatting tools that allow you to modify your text.
The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts for copying and pasting text.
Copy and Paste Using a PC
Copy (Ctrl+C) and Paste (Ctrl+V)
Copy (Ctrl+C) and Paste-without-formatting (Ctrl+Shift+V)
Copy and Paste Using a Mac
Copy (Command+C) and Paste (Command+V)
Copy (Command+C) and Paste-without-formatting (Command+Option+Shift+V)
Note:
Your instructor may choose to display a different font for your course. This font will display when entering text the Rich Content Editor.

05:15:This guide shows how to add and modify text in the Rich Content Editor as a student.
View Rich Content Editor
When creating or editing an announcement, assignment, discussion, or page, the Rich Content Editor opens by default.
You can add and format content using the
menubar
[1] or toolbar [2].
Open Keyboard Shortcuts
The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view a window with a list of keyboard navigation shortcuts, click the
Keyboard
icon or press
Alt+F8
(on a PC keyboard) or
Option+F8
(on a Mac keyboard) simultaneously on your keyboard.
View Word Count
You can view the total word count. To view the total word count, characters, and characters excluding spaces, click the
Word Count
link.
Resize Icons
Click the
Plus
(+) and
Minus
(-) icons to resize the Rich Content Editor.
Resize Editor Window
You can also
resize the editor window or open the editor in fullscreen view
.
Enter Text
Type or paste copied text into the Rich Content Editor.
Remove Text Formatting
To remove text formatting, select the text [1], then click the
Clear Formatting
icon [2].
Note:
To view the Clear Formatting icon, you may have to click the
Options
icon [3].
Change Font Size
Select the text you wish to modify [1]. Then click the
Font Size
drop-down menu [2], and select the font size you want to use [3]. You can choose from 8, 10, 12, 14, 18, 24, or 36pt sized fonts.
Change Text Style
Select the text you wish to modify [1]. Then click the
Paragraph
drop-down menu [2], and select the text style you want to use [3]. Choose from Heading 2, Heading 3, Heading 4, Preformatted, and Paragraph styles.
Note:
By default, the primary heading for the announcement, assignment, discussion, page, or quiz is the same as the title or name you enter when creating the item.
Single Space Text
To create single spacing in the Rich Content Editor, press
Shift+Enter
(on a PC keyboard) or
Shift+Return
(on a Mac keyboard). This creates a line break instead of a paragraph break.
Format Text Emphasis
Select the text you wish to format [1].
To bold the selected text, click the
Bold
icon [2], or press
Command+B
(Mac keyboard) or
Ctrl+B
(PC keyboard).
To italicize the selected text, click the
Italic
icon [3], or press
Command+I
(Mac keyboard) or
Ctrl+I
(PC keyboard).
To underline the selected text, click the
Underline
icon [4], or press
Command+U
(Mac keyboard) or
Ctrl+U
(PC keyboard).
When selected text is formatted, an arrow displays above the selected option [5].
Color and Highlight Text
Select the text you wish to color [1].
To change the color of the text, click the
Text Color
icon [2].
To highlight the text, click the
Background Color
icon [3]
Select a color from the color drop-down menu [4]. You can view the color name by hovering your mouse over the color tile [5].
To remove color formatting, click the
Remove Color
icon [6].
To select a custom color for the text, click the
Custom Color
icon [7].
Select Custom Color|Document Title: How do I add and modify text in the Rich Content Editor

To remove color formatting, click the
Remove Color
icon [6].
To select a custom color for the text, click the
Custom Color
icon [7].
Select Custom Color
Use the color picker palette to select a color tone [1] and hue [2]. You can also enter RGB color codes [3] or enter a HEX color code [4]. View your custom color in the color display window [5].
To apply the color to your text, click the
Save
button [6].
Superscript and Subscript Text
You can format your text to appear as superscript or subscript. Select the text you wish to modify [1].
Click the
Superscript
icon [2]. To format your text as superscript, select the
Superscript
option [3] from the drop-down menu. To format your text as subscript, select the
Subscript
option [4].
Align Text
To align text, place the cursor in front of the text you wish to align [1], then click the
Alignment
icon [2]. From the drop-down menu you can select to align the text to the
Left
[3],
Center
[4],
and
Right
[5].
Note:
To view the Alignment icon, you may have to click the
Options
icon [6].
Increase or Decrease Indent Text
To indent text, click the
Indent
icon [1].
If your text is indented, you can decrease your idented text. To decrease your indented text, click the
Increase Indent
icon [2] and click the
Decrease Ident
option [3].
You can click the Increase Indent and Decrease Ident options multiple times to increase or decrease the text indentation.
Note:
To view the Indent icon, you may have to click the
Options
icon [4].
Align Directional Text
To align the direction of your text, click the
Format
link in the menubar [1], then select the
Directionality
option [2]. You can align your text from Left to Right [3] and from Right to Left [4].
Create Bulleted or Numbered List
Select the text you wish to include in your list [1], then click the
List
icon [2]. You can select a bulleted list style [3], or a numeric or alphabetic list style [4].
Note:
To view the List icon, you may have to click the
Options
icon [5].
View Bulleted List
View the bulleted list.
View Numbered List
View the numbered list.
Find and Replace Content
In the
Tools
menu [2], click the
Find and Replace
option [2]. You can also press
Command+F
(on a Mac keyboard) or
Control+F
(on a PC keyboard).
In the
Find and Replace
modal, enter the content to replace in the
Find
field [1]. In the
Replace with
field [2], enter the desired replacement content.
To replace all content at once, click the
Replace All
button [3].
To replace individual content, click the
Replace
button [4].
If there is multiple content to replace, you can scroll through each individual item by clicking the
Previous
button
[5] and
Next
button [6].
View Auto-Saved Content
If you reload or navigate away from a page while editing content in the Rich Content Editor, Canvas automatically saves your content in the browser cache for up to one day. When you reload the page or navigate back to the page you were editing, Canvas displays a message indicating that auto-saved content exists. You can preview the content, discard the content, or load the content into the Rich Content Editor.
Notes:
Autosave works when a user replies to just one thread or comment at a time. If multiple replies are opened at once (with different RCE IDs), autosave may not work.
Auto-saved content is not a guaranteed feature and may not save content in certain situations.
The amount of local storage available may vary depending on which browser you use.
Auto-saved content is only available on pages that only include one Rich Content Editor window.
Auto-saved content is only available in the same browser and computer you were using when you created the original content.
Preview Auto-Saved Content
To preview content auto-saved by Canvas, click the
Preview
button.
Load Auto-Saved Content
To load the auto-saved content into the Rich Content Editor, click the
Yes
button [1]. To discard the auto-saved changes, click the
No
button [2].
Save Changes
Click the
Save
button.
Note:
When using the Rich Content Editor in Discussions, the Save button may appear as the Reply button.
View Content
View the content created in the Rich Content Editor.

input: In the Canvas Rich Content Editor, how do I clear text formatting and then apply a custom RGB or HEX color?
expected_output:
1. Select the text you want to edit.  
2. Click the Clear Formatting icon (or click the Options icon and choose Clear Formatting) to remove all existing styles.  
3. With your text still selected, click the Text Color icon in the toolbar.  
4. In the color picker menu, click the Custom Color icon.  
5. Enter your RGB values or paste your HEX code into the fields provided.  
6. Click Save to apply your custom color.

05:15:This guide shows how to add and modify text in the Rich Content Editor as a student.
View Rich Content Editor
When creating or editing an announcement, assignment, discussion, or page, the Rich Content Editor opens by default.
You can add and format content using the
menubar
[1] or toolbar [2].
Open Keyboard Shortcuts
The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view a window with a list of keyboard navigation shortcuts, click the
Keyboard
icon or press
Alt+F8
(on a PC keyboard) or
Option+F8
(on a Mac keyboard) simultaneously on your keyboard.
View Word Count
You can view the total word count. To view the total word count, characters, and characters excluding spaces, click the
Word Count
link.
Resize Icons
Click the
Plus
(+) and
Minus
(-) icons to resize the Rich Content Editor.
Resize Editor Window
You can also
resize the editor window or open the editor in fullscreen view
.
Enter Text
Type or paste copied text into the Rich Content Editor.
Remove Text Formatting
To remove text formatting, select the text [1], then click the
Clear Formatting
icon [2].
Note:
To view the Clear Formatting icon, you may have to click the
Options
icon [3].
Change Font Size
Select the text you wish to modify [1]. Then click the
Font Size
drop-down menu [2], and select the font size you want to use [3]. You can choose from 8, 10, 12, 14, 18, 24, or 36pt sized fonts.
Change Text Style
Select the text you wish to modify [1]. Then click the
Paragraph
drop-down menu [2], and select the text style you want to use [3]. Choose from Heading 2, Heading 3, Heading 4, Preformatted, and Paragraph styles.
Note:
By default, the primary heading for the announcement, assignment, discussion, page, or quiz is the same as the title or name you enter when creating the item.
Single Space Text
To create single spacing in the Rich Content Editor, press
Shift+Enter
(on a PC keyboard) or
Shift+Return
(on a Mac keyboard). This creates a line break instead of a paragraph break.
Format Text Emphasis
Select the text you wish to format [1].
To bold the selected text, click the
Bold
icon [2], or press
Command+B
(Mac keyboard) or
Ctrl+B
(PC keyboard).
To italicize the selected text, click the
Italic
icon [3], or press
Command+I
(Mac keyboard) or
Ctrl+I
(PC keyboard).
To underline the selected text, click the
Underline
icon [4], or press
Command+U
(Mac keyboard) or
Ctrl+U
(PC keyboard).
When selected text is formatted, an arrow displays above the selected option [5].
Color and Highlight Text
Select the text you wish to color [1].
To change the color of the text, click the
Text Color
icon [2].
To highlight the text, click the
Background Color
icon [3]
Select a color from the color drop-down menu [4]. You can view the color name by hovering your mouse over the color tile [5].
To remove color formatting, click the
Remove Color
icon [6].
To select a custom color for the text, click the
Custom Color
icon [7].
Select Custom Color|Document Title: How do I add and modify text in the Rich Content Editor

To remove color formatting, click the
Remove Color
icon [6].
To select a custom color for the text, click the
Custom Color
icon [7].
Select Custom Color
Use the color picker palette to select a color tone [1] and hue [2]. You can also enter RGB color codes [3] or enter a HEX color code [4]. View your custom color in the color display window [5].
To apply the color to your text, click the
Save
button [6].
Superscript and Subscript Text
You can format your text to appear as superscript or subscript. Select the text you wish to modify [1].
Click the
Superscript
icon [2]. To format your text as superscript, select the
Superscript
option [3] from the drop-down menu. To format your text as subscript, select the
Subscript
option [4].
Align Text
To align text, place the cursor in front of the text you wish to align [1], then click the
Alignment
icon [2]. From the drop-down menu you can select to align the text to the
Left
[3],
Center
[4],
and
Right
[5].
Note:
To view the Alignment icon, you may have to click the
Options
icon [6].
Increase or Decrease Indent Text
To indent text, click the
Indent
icon [1].
If your text is indented, you can decrease your idented text. To decrease your indented text, click the
Increase Indent
icon [2] and click the
Decrease Ident
option [3].
You can click the Increase Indent and Decrease Ident options multiple times to increase or decrease the text indentation.
Note:
To view the Indent icon, you may have to click the
Options
icon [4].
Align Directional Text
To align the direction of your text, click the
Format
link in the menubar [1], then select the
Directionality
option [2]. You can align your text from Left to Right [3] and from Right to Left [4].
Create Bulleted or Numbered List
Select the text you wish to include in your list [1], then click the
List
icon [2]. You can select a bulleted list style [3], or a numeric or alphabetic list style [4].
Note:
To view the List icon, you may have to click the
Options
icon [5].
View Bulleted List
View the bulleted list.
View Numbered List
View the numbered list.
Find and Replace Content
In the
Tools
menu [2], click the
Find and Replace
option [2]. You can also press
Command+F
(on a Mac keyboard) or
Control+F
(on a PC keyboard).
In the
Find and Replace
modal, enter the content to replace in the
Find
field [1]. In the
Replace with
field [2], enter the desired replacement content.
To replace all content at once, click the
Replace All
button [3].
To replace individual content, click the
Replace
button [4].
If there is multiple content to replace, you can scroll through each individual item by clicking the
Previous
button
[5] and
Next
button [6].
View Auto-Saved Content
If you reload or navigate away from a page while editing content in the Rich Content Editor, Canvas automatically saves your content in the browser cache for up to one day. When you reload the page or navigate back to the page you were editing, Canvas displays a message indicating that auto-saved content exists. You can preview the content, discard the content, or load the content into the Rich Content Editor.
Notes:
Autosave works when a user replies to just one thread or comment at a time. If multiple replies are opened at once (with different RCE IDs), autosave may not work.
Auto-saved content is not a guaranteed feature and may not save content in certain situations.
The amount of local storage available may vary depending on which browser you use.
Auto-saved content is only available on pages that only include one Rich Content Editor window.
Auto-saved content is only available in the same browser and computer you were using when you created the original content.
Preview Auto-Saved Content
To preview content auto-saved by Canvas, click the
Preview
button.
Load Auto-Saved Content
To load the auto-saved content into the Rich Content Editor, click the
Yes
button [1]. To discard the auto-saved changes, click the
No
button [2].
Save Changes
Click the
Save
button.
Note:
When using the Rich Content Editor in Discussions, the Save button may appear as the Reply button.
View Content
View the content created in the Rich Content Editor.

input: Which PC and Mac keyboard shortcuts open the Rich Content Editor menubar and keyboard navigation list in Canvas LMS?
expected_output:
Here are the keyboard shortcuts in Canvas LMS’s Rich Content Editor:

• Open the menubar  
  – PC: Alt + F9  
  – Mac: Option + Fn + F9  

• Open the keyboard navigation list  
  – PC: Alt + F8  
  – Mac: Option + F8

input: After opening the menu bar with Alt+F9, how do I use the Insert > Image option to add an image to my course content?
expected_output:
1. Press Alt + F9 (PC) or Option + Fn + F9 (Mac) to open the menubar.  
2. Use the arrow keys or mouse to highlight the Insert menu and press Enter or click Insert.  
3. In the Insert menu, select the Image option.  
4. In the Image dialog:  
   a. Choose “Upload a new image” to browse your computer, or  
   b. Choose “Course” or “User Files” to select an existing image.  
5. Select the image file and click Insert.  
6. The image appears in your content—resize or drag as needed.

input: How do I insert a 4×6 table using the Rich Content Editor in Canvas? Which icons should I click and how do I drag the grid to the right size?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor in your Canvas page, announcement, assignment, discussion, or quiz.  
2. If you don’t see the Table icon in the toolbar, click the Options icon (•••) to reveal it.  
3. Click the Table icon, hover over the “Table” menu, and you’ll see a grid.  
4. Starting at the top-left of the grid, drag your cursor to cover 4 columns and 6 rows (4×6).  
5. Release the mouse button—your 4×6 table will be inserted.
context:
Document Title: How do I insert a table using the Rich Content Editor

How do I insert a table using the Rich Content Editor? In the Rich Content Editor, you can use the table editor to insert, format, edit, and delete a table. Several features in Canvas support the Rich Content Editor, including Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes.  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when using one of the Canvas features which support the Editor. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Open Table Editor To use the table editor, click the Table icon . Note: To view the Table icon, you may have to click the Options icon . Insert Table To expand the table creator, hover over the Table option in the drop-down menu . Then, to specify the table dimensions, drag your cursor over the grid . Note: The largest table you can create using the table creator is 10x10. However, additional columns and rows can be added manually. View Table Layout Tools When you click on the table in the Rich Content Editor, the Table Context Menu displays . You can edit the table properties , delete the table , add or delete rows , and add or delete columns . Open Table Properties In the Table Context Menu, click the Table Properties icon . You can also click the toolbar Table icon , and select the Table Properties option . Edit General Table Properties By default, the table properties editor displays the General tab . Type in the appropriate fields to edit these general table properties. Width and Height : enter the width and height of your table (in pixels or percent, e.g. 500px, 50%). Cell Spacing : enter the space between individual cells as well as cells and table borders (in pixels, e.g. 3px). Cell Padding : enter the space between the cell border and its content (in pixels, e.g. 5px). Border : enter the thickness of the table border (in pixels, e.g. 5px). Caption : select to display a caption above the table. Alignment : select the alignment of your table in the Rich Content Editor. To apply edits, click the Save button . Manually Edit Table Size You can also manually adjust the width and height of your table in the Rich Content Editor. When you click the table, adjustment handles appear in each corner . Click and drag the handles to adjust the size . Edit Advanced Table Properties To view additional customization options, click the Advanced tab. Edit Border Style To edit the border line style, click the Border Style drop-down menu . Select a border line style from the displayed options . For your table to display without lines, select the None option . You can also select to hide table lines . To apply the border style, click the Save button . Edit Border and Background Colors You can edit the table colors using the Border Color  and Background Color  options. Enter a color name or HEX code (in #nnnnnn format) in the color field . You can also click the Color Swatch button  and select a color from the color drop-down menu . View the color name by hovering your mouse over the color tile . To remove color formatting, click the Remove Color icon . To select a custom color, click the Custom Color icon . To apply the colors, click the Save button . View Cell Format Options With one or more cells selected within the table, click the Table icon , then hover over the Cell option . To edit the cell properties, click the Cell properties option . To merge cells, click the Merge cells option . To split merged cells, click the Split cell option . Edit General Cell Properties By default, the Cell properties editor displays the General tab . You can edit the following general cell properties: Width and Height : adjust the width and height of your cell or cells (in pixels or percent, e.g. 500px, 50%). Cell Type : select from header cell or general cell options. Scope : select whether the cell or cells is a header for a column, row, or group of columns or rows. H Align : select the horizontal alignment for text in the cell or cells V Align : select the vertical alignment for text in the cell or cells To apply edits, click the Save button . Edit Advanced Cell Properties|Document Title: How do I insert a table using the Rich Content Editor

the horizontal alignment for text in the cell or cells V Align : select the vertical alignment for text in the cell or cells To apply edits, click the Save button . Edit Advanced Cell Properties To view additional customization options, click the Advanced tab . Edit cells using the following options: Border style : select a border line style, or hide or remove cell border lines. Border color : enter a color name or HEX code (in #nnnnnn format), or use the Color swatch to select a border color for the cell or cells. Background color : enter a color name or HEX code (in #nnnnnn format), or use the Color swatch to select a cell background color. To apply edits, click the Save button . Edit Row Options With the table selected or with a specific row selected, use the Table Context Menu row options to add or remove a row . To view more row options, click the Table icon , then hover over the Row option . Edit rows by clicking the appropriate option. Insert row : select to enter a row before (above) or after (below) the selected row Delete row : delete the row and its content Row properties : view options for row type, alignment, height, and colors. Cut row : cut the row and place it in the clipboard, ready to be pasted. Copy row : copy the row and place it in the clipboard, ready to be pasted. Paste row : After cutting or copying a row, select to enter the row before (above) or after (below) the selected row. Edit Column Options With the table selected or with a specific column selected, use the Table Context Menu column options to add or remove a column . Alternatively, you can click the Table icon , then hover over the Column option . Edit columns by clicking the appropriate option. Insert column : select to enter a column before (left) or after (right) the selected column Delete column : delete the column and its content Delete Table With the table selected, click the Table Context Menu Delete icon . You can also click the toolbar Table icon , and then click the Delete table option . Save Changes Click the Save button. Note: When using the Rich Content Editor in Discussions, the Save button may appear as the Reply button.

input: In Canvas, how do I set the width and height of a table in Table Properties, and how can I manually resize a table using drag handles?
expected_output:
1. Open Table Properties  
   a. Click your table in the Rich Content Editor.  
   b. Click the Table icon in the toolbar, then select **Table Properties**.  

2. Set Width and Height  
   a. In the **General** tab, enter your desired **Width** and **Height** (e.g., “500px” or “50%”).  
   b. Click **Save** to apply changes.  

3. Manually Resize with Drag Handles  
   a. Click the table to reveal adjustment handles in each corner.  
   b. Click and drag any handle inward or outward to resize the table.

input: How do I switch between the numbered lines view, syntax-highlighted HTML view, and raw HTML view in the Canvas Rich Content Editor?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor in any Canvas tool (Announcements, Pages, Quizzes, etc.).  
2. Click the HTML Editor icon (</>) to enter HTML view. By default you’ll see the pretty HTML editor with numbered lines and syntax highlighting.  
3. To switch to plain‐text HTML (no line numbers or highlighting), click **Switch to raw HTML Editor**.  
4. To return to the numbered, syntax-highlighted view, click **Switch to pretty HTML Editor**.  
5. When finished editing, click **Save** (or **Reply** in Discussions).
context:
Document Title: How do I use the HTML view in the Rich Content Editor

How do I use the HTML view in the Rich Content Editor? You can embed HTML in the Rich Content Editor. When creating custom HTML coding in Canvas, you may discover that certain HTML codes do not work upon saving. This is because Canvas only supports certain HTML elements for security reasons. This also applies to content copied and pasted from an external source. Below is a link to a list of HTML tags that are permissible in Canvas. HTML tags that are not on this list may be stripped out of the Rich Content Editor when you save your work. For more information, view the Canvas HTML Editor Allowlist resource document . The HTML Editor in the Rich Content Editor can display HTML in either a pretty HTML editor with numbered lines and syntax highlighting or a raw HTML editor that displays HTML as raw text. Several features in Canvas support the Rich Content Editor, including Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes. Note: The Rich Content Editor saves the last used HTML editor state (raw or pretty). This persists across browser tabs and windows.  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when using one of the Canvas features which support the Editor. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Open HTML Editor Click the HTML Editor icon. Note: When in HTML view, you can click the HTML Editor icon to return to the Rich Content Editor. Edit MathML You can use MathML code by switching the Rich Content Editor to HTML for the question stem. Edit HTML Content The HTML editor displays the pretty HTML editor by default. The pretty HTML editor displays line numbers and syntax highlighting. Enter content in the HTML editor or edit existing content using HTML. View Raw HTML Editor To switch to the Raw HTML Editor and edit your HTML in plain text, click the Switch to raw HTML Editor button. Edit Raw HTML Edit your HTML in plain text without line numbers or syntax highlighting. To switch back to the Pretty HTML Editor, click the Switch to pretty HTML Editor button. Save Changes Click the Save button. Note: When using the Rich Content Editor in Discussions, the Save button may appear as the Reply button.

input: How can I open the list of supported HTML tags for the Canvas Rich Content Editor?
expected_output:
1. Open any Canvas feature that uses the Rich Content Editor (e.g., Page, Assignment, Discussion).  
2. Click the HTML Editor icon (<>).  
3. Below the editor, click the “Canvas HTML Editor Allowlist” link (sometimes labeled “list of HTML tags”).  
4. The allowlist document will open, showing all HTML elements supported in Canvas.

input: How do I resize content in the Rich Content Editor when creating announcements, assignments, discussions, pages, or quizzes? Can I drag to resize, use the plus/minus icons, or use the fullscreen toggle?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor in an Announcement, Assignment, Discussion, Page, or Quiz.  
2. To manually resize the editor window:  
   - Click and hold the resize handle (lower-right corner) and drag to your desired size.  
3. To fine-tune size:  
   - Click the plus (+) icon to enlarge.  
   - Click the minus (–) icon to shrink.  
4. To enter fullscreen mode:  
   - Click the Fullscreen icon in the toolbar, or  
   - Select View → Fullscreen.  
5. To exit fullscreen:  
   - Press Esc, or  
   - Select View → Exit Fullscreen.
context:
Document Title: How do I resize the Rich Content Editor

How do I resize the Rich Content Editor? When using the Rich Content Editor, you can resize the window manually or expand the entire Rich Content Editor to fullscreen view.  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor. You may view the Rich Content Editor in Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, or Quizzes. Resize Window To resize the window manually, click and hold the Resize icon . Then drag the Rich Content Editor window to the desired size . View in Fullscreen To expand the Rich Content Editor to fullscreen view, click the Fullscreen icon . You can also click the View menu  and select the Fullscreen option . Exit Fullscreen To exit fullscreen view, click the View menu  and select the Exit Fullscreen option . You can also exit fullscreen by pressing the Esc key on your keyboard. Resize Icons Click the Plus (+) and Minus (-) icons to resize the Rich Content Editor.

input: Which control in the Rich Content Editor do I use to switch to fullscreen: the toolbar’s Fullscreen icon or the View menu’s Fullscreen option?
expected_output:
You can use either control to switch to fullscreen:

• Toolbar icon: Click the Fullscreen button in the editor’s toolbar.  
• View menu: Open View and select Fullscreen.

Resize Window To resize the window manually, click and hold the Resize icon . Then drag the Rich Content Editor window to the desired size . View in Fullscreen To expand the Rich Content Editor to fullscreen view, click the Fullscreen icon . You can also click the View menu  and select the Fullscreen option . Exit Fullscreen To exit fullscreen view, click the View menu  and select the Exit Fullscreen option . You can also exit fullscreen by pressing the Esc key on your keyboard. Resize Icons Click the Plus (+) and Minus (-) icons to resize the Rich Content Editor.

input: How do I use the toolbar, menu bar, or the Ctrl/Cmd+K shortcut in the Rich Content Editor to insert and save external URLs in Canvas LMS?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor  
   – Available in Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, Quizzes, etc.  

2. Insert an external link  
   a. Toolbar method  
      • (If hidden) click the Options icon (…)  
      • Click the Link icon → select External Link  
   b. Menubar method  
      • Click Insert → External Link  
   c. Keyboard shortcut  
      • Highlight your text → press Ctrl + K (PC) or Cmd + K (Mac)  

3. Configure the link  
   – In the dialog, enter your display text in the Text field  
   – Paste or type the URL in the Link field  
   – Click Done (the text will flash and become a hyperlink)  

4. Save your work  
   – Click Save (or Reply in Discussions)  

5. Verify  
   – The link appears in your content and opens in a new browser tab when clicked.
context:
Document Title: How do I create hyperlinks to external URLs in the Rich Content

How do I create hyperlinks to external URLs in the Rich Content Editor? Using the Rich Content Editor, you can create hyperlinks to external resources. Several features in Canvas support the Rich Content Editor, including Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes.  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when using one of the Canvas features which support the Editor. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Create Hyperlink from Toolbar To insert a link from the toolbar, click the Link icon . From the drop-down menu, select the External Link option . Note: To view the Link icon, you may have to click the Options icon . Create Hyperlink from Menubar Click the Insert link . Navigate to view the Link options , and select the External Link option . Insert Link Enter the text for your hyperlink in the Text field . Paste or type the URL for your hyperlink in the Link field . Click the Done button . Notes : The text will flash before turning into the hyperlink. When clicked, external hyperlinks automatically open in a new browser tab. Create Link Using Keyboard Shortcut Alternatively, you can create external hyperlinks using keyboard shortcuts. After adding content in the Rich Content Editor, select the text for your hyperlink. Then press Cmd+K (Mac keyboard) or Ctrl+K (PC Keyboard). View Hyperlink View the hyperlink in the Rich Content Editor. Save Changes Click the Save button. Note: When using the Rich Content Editor in Discussions, the Save button may appear as the Reply button. View Content View the hyperlink in your content. Note: When clicked, external hyperlinks automatically open in a new browser tab.

input: What steps do I need to follow to add and save external links in the Canvas editor using the toolbar or the Ctrl+K (Command+K) shortcut?
expected_output:
Here’s how to add and save an external link in Canvas’s Rich Content Editor:

1. Open the Rich Content Editor in Announcements, Pages, Assignments, Discussions, or Quizzes.  
2. Using the toolbar:  
   a. Click the Link icon (you may first need to click the Options icon).  
   b. From the dropdown, choose External Link.  
3. Using the keyboard shortcut:  
   a. Highlight the text you want to hyperlink.  
   b. Press Ctrl + K (Windows) or ⌘ + K (Mac).  
4. In the dialog that appears:  
   a. Enter your display text in the Text field.  
   b. Paste or type the URL in the Link field.  
   c. Click Done.  
5. Click Save (or Reply in Discussions) to apply your changes.  

Your external link will now appear in your content and will open in a new tab when clicked.

input: In the Rich Content Editor, how do I open Course Links, sort or search Files, create a hyperlink in a document, and save my changes?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor in your course.  
2. (If needed) Click the Options ⋯ icon, then click the Link icon and choose Course Links.  
3. In the Add menu:  
    • To filter by file type, use the Type drop-down.  
    • To reorder, use the Sort by drop-down.  
    • To search, enter at least three characters in the Search field.  
4. Select the text you want hyperlinked (or click where you want the file name displayed).  
5. Click the desired file name in the list (text will flash into a hyperlink).  
6. Click Save (or Reply in Discussions) to apply your changes.
context:
Document Title: How do I create hyperlinks to user group or course files in the

How do I create hyperlinks to user, group, or course files in the Rich Content Editor? You can use the Rich Content Editor to insert hyperlinks to document, image, and media files stored in your course, group, or user files. If you are using the Rich Content Editor in a group, you can access files in the Group Files and User Files folders. If you are using the Rich Content Editor in a course, you can access files in the Course Files and User Files folders. Notes: To create hyperlinks to group files, you must open the Rich Content Editor within a group. If you set a file as restricted and link to that file in the Rich Content Editor in a group, other group members will be able to view that file using the link in the Rich Content Editor. If you set a file as not visible to students in Course Files and link to that file in the Rich Content Editor, students will be able to view that file using the link in the Rich Content Editor.  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when using one of the Canvas features which support the Editor. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Select Link Location To insert a hyperlink to a user or group content item, select the text for your hyperlink . If you want to insert a link to a document and display the name of the file, click to place your cursor in the location in the Rich Content Editor where you want the link to appear . This method only applies when inserting a user or group document and will not work for images or multimedia files. Open User Links To link to an image, media, or document in your User Files, click either the Images icon , Record/Upload Media icon , or the Documents icon  and select the User option for the desired file type . The option name will display as User Images, User Media, or User Documents. Note: To view these icons, you may have to click the Options icon . Open Links Menu To view all links and files available in course and user files, click the Link Options icon  and select the Course Links option . If you are accessing the Rich Content Editor from within a group, select the Group Links option . Note: To view the Links icon, you may have to click the Options icon . Open Insert Menu In the menubar, click the Insert link . You can navigate to view the Link, Image, Media, and Document options . View and Sort Files By default, the Add menu displays all files in your selected file source . To sort the displayed files by image, document, or media file type, click the Type drop-down menu . To sort the displayed files by date added, date published, or alphabetically, click the Sort by drop-down menu . To search for a file, enter the file name in the Search field . You must enter at least three characters for search results to display. Select File Click the name of the file you want to link in the Rich Content Editor. Note: The text will flash before turning into a hyperlink. View Link View the link displaying the hyperlinked text  or the name of the file . Save Changes Click the Save button. Note: When using the Rich Content Editor in Discussions, the Save button may appear as the Reply button. View Content View the content. To view the linked file, click the link . To download the file, click the Download icon . Note: Links to external URLs display an Open icon .

input: In the Rich Content Editor’s Group Links under Options, how can I sort links by type, date, or name, search with at least three characters, and insert a link?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor and click the Options icon, then select Group Links.  
2. Click the Type drop-down to filter by image, document, or media.  
3. Click the Sort by drop-down to order files by date added, date published, or alphabetically.  
4. In the Search field, type at least three characters to locate a file.  
5. Click the file name; the text will flash and turn into a hyperlink.  
6. Click Save (or Reply in Discussions) to insert the link.

To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Select Link Location To insert a hyperlink to a user or group content item, select the text for your hyperlink . If you want to insert a link to a document and display the name of the file, click to place your cursor in the location in the Rich Content Editor where you want the link to appear . This method only applies when inserting a user or group document and will not work for images or multimedia files. Open User Links To link to an image, media, or document in your User Files, click either the Images icon , Record/Upload Media icon , or the Documents icon  and select the User option for the desired file type . The option name will display as User Images, User Media, or User Documents. Note: To view these icons, you may have to click the Options icon . Open Links Menu To view all links and files available in course and user files, click the Link Options icon  and select the Course Links option . If you are accessing the Rich Content Editor from within a group, select the Group Links option . Note: To view the Links icon, you may have to click the Options icon . Open Insert Menu In the menubar, click the Insert link . You can navigate to view the Link, Image, Media, and Document options . View and Sort Files By default, the Add menu displays all files in your selected file source . To sort the displayed files by image, document, or media file type, click the Type drop-down menu . To sort the displayed files by date added, date published, or alphabetically, click the Sort by drop-down menu . To search for a file, enter the file name in the Search field . You must enter at least three characters for search results to display. Select File Click the name of the file you want to link in the Rich Content Editor. Note: The text will flash before turning into a hyperlink. View Link View the link displaying the hyperlinked text  or the name of the file . Save Changes Click the Save button. Note: When using the Rich Content Editor in Discussions, the Save button may appear as the Reply button. View Content View the content. To view the linked file, click the link . To download the file, click the Download icon . Note: Links to external URLs display an Open icon .

input: How do I open the Rich Content Editor, highlight some text, click the Course Link button, type at least three characters to find my quiz, select the quiz from the list, and save my changes?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor by creating or editing a Page, Discussion, Announcement, or other supported item.  
2. Highlight the text you want to turn into a link.  
3. In the editor toolbar, click the Links icon and choose Course Link.  
4. In the Add menu’s Search field, type at least three characters of your quiz name.  
5. From the search results, click the quiz you want to link.  
6. Click Save (or Save & Publish/Update Syllabus/Reply) to apply your changes.
context:
Document Title: How do I create hyperlinks to course or group content in the

How do I create hyperlinks to course or group content in the Rich Content Editor? When using the Rich Content Editor, you can insert links to course or group content. You may be able to link to content in Pages, Assignments, Quizzes, Announcements, Discussions and Modules. You can also insert links that, when clicked, act like Navigation links. To create links to documents, images, or media files, learn about adding document , image , and media file links. Note: To create hyperlinks to group content or Group Navigation links, you must open the Rich Content Editor within a group.  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when creating or editing an announcement, discussion, or page. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Select Link Location To insert a link displaying the name of a course or group content item, click to place your cursor in the location in the Rich Content Editor where you want the link to appear . To insert a hyperlink on text to a content item, select the text for the hyperlink . Open Course Link In the toolbar, click the Links icon  and select the Course Link option . Notes: You can also link to course files such as images , media files , and documents . To view the Links icon, you may have to click the Options icon . Open Group Link When using the Rich Content Editor within groups , you can create a link to group content. In the toolbar, click the Link icon  and select the Group Link option . Notes: You can also link to group files such as group images , group media files , and group documents . To view the Links icon, you may have to click the Options icon . Select Course or Group Content Use the Add menu to select the linked content. By default, the Add drop-down menu displays Links for content . You can also add document, image, and media file links . To search for course or group content, type at least three characters in the Search field . Content items are grouped by content type. To view a list of group content items, click the arrow icon next to the content type . Then click the name of the item you want to link in the Rich Content Editor . Notes : The text flashes before turning into the hyperlink. You may be able to link to course or group content in Pages, Assignments, Quizzes, Announcements, Discussions, Modules, and Navigation items. Add Course or Group Content To add a content item, open the group content section  and click the Add one! link . Insert Navigation Link You can also insert Navigation links from the Add menu. To insert a Navigation link, click the Group Navigation or Course Navigation drop-down menu . Then select the navigation link . When a user clicks on an inserted Navigation link, Canvas navigates them to that feature area page. Drag and Drop Content Links You can also choose to drag and drop content links from the Add menu by selecting the item  and dragging and dropping it to the desired location in the Rich Content Editor . View Link View the link displaying the name of the content item  or the hyperlinked text . Edit Hyperlink To edit a content link, hover over the text for your hyperlink and click the Link Options link . View the current linked course or group content . To replace the course or group content link, enter at least three characters in the Search field . Or you can use the feature area sections to find and replace the content . Click the Replace button . Save Changes Click the Save button. Notes: The assignment, discussion, pages, and quizzes details pages display a Save & Publish button. The Syllabus page displays an Update Syllabus button. Discussion replies display a Reply button. View Content Link View the content. To view the linked course content, click the inserted link . Note: Links to external URLs display an Open icon .

input: How do I replace a course link to one assignment with a link to a different assignment in Canvas's Rich Content Editor?
expected_output:
1. Open the page, announcement, discussion, or other item containing the existing assignment link in the Rich Content Editor.  
2. Hover over the linked text and click the Link Options (chain) icon.  
3. In the dialog’s Search field, type at least three characters of the new assignment’s name—or expand the Assignments section—to locate the desired assignment.  
4. Click the assignment name to select it, then click Replace.  
5. Click Save (or Save & Publish, Update Syllabus, or Reply as appropriate) to apply your change.

input: In Canvas, after opening the Rich Content Editor, how do I select a link, edit its display text and URL using the Link Options, and then save my changes?
expected_output:
1. Click the existing link in the Rich Content Editor.  
2. Click the Link Options icon  and choose Edit Link.  
3. In the Link Options menu, update:  
   • Text – the display text for your link  
   • Link – the URL you want to use  
4. Click Done.  
5. Click Save (or Reply in Discussions) to apply your changes.
context:
Document Title: How do I edit or remove hyperlinks in the Rich Content Editor

How do I edit or remove hyperlinks in the Rich Content Editor? After adding a hyperlink to external URLs , group content , course content , or files in the Rich Content Editor, you can edit the link from the Link Options menu. You can also remove hyperlinks.  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when creating or editing a group announcement, discussion, or page, or when completing an assignment or quiz. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Edit Link Click the link in the Rich Content Editor . Then click the Link Options link . You can also click the Link Options icon  and select the Edit Link option . Note: To view the Links icon, you may have to click the Options icon . View Link Options In the Link Options menu, you can edit the hyperlinked text in the Text field . You can edit the URL in the Link field . To save your changes, click the Done button . Note: When clicked, external hyperlinks automatically open in a new browser tab. Remove Link To remove a link, click the Link Options icon  and select the Remove Link option . Remove Multiple Links To remove multiple links, highlight the text that contains the links you want to remove . Then click the Link Options icon  and select the Remove Links option . Save Changes Click the Save button. Note: When using the Rich Content Editor in Discussions, the Save button may appear as the Reply button.

input: In Canvas Rich Content Editor, after highlighting linked text, how can I use the link options to remove the link and save my changes?
expected_output:
1. Highlight the linked text in the Rich Content Editor.  
2. Click the Link Options icon (🔗) and choose Remove Link.  
3. Click Save (or Reply in Discussions) to apply your changes.

input: How do I embed and configure images in the Canvas Rich Content Editor? Can I use drag-and-drop, copy-paste, or the toolbar? Also, how do I add a URL, set alt text, and manage image permissions?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor  
   – Available in Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, Quizzes, etc.

2. Choose an embed method  
   a. Drag-and-drop  
      • Drag image from your computer or a browser into the editor.  
      • (Browser drag-drop auto-fills the source URL.)  
   b. Copy-and-paste  
      • Right-click image → Copy, then right-click editor → Paste (or Ctrl + V/⌘ + V).  
   c. Toolbar or Menubar  
      • Click the Image icon (may be under “Options”), then Upload Image.  
      • Or click Insert → Image → Upload Image.

3. Upload from computer or add via URL  
   a. Computer tab: click or drag file into uploader → select file → Open  
   b. URL tab: paste image link into File URL field

4. (If enabled) Set Usage Rights  
   – Open the Usage Rights drop-down and choose the appropriate option (e.g., “I hold the copyright,” Creative Commons, public domain, etc.).  
   – Enter copyright holder if required.

5. Add Alt Text and display options  
   – In Alt Text field, type a brief description (screen readers use this).  
   – If decorative, check “Decorative Image.”  
   – Choose “Embed Image” (default) or “Display Text Link.”

6. Embed and save  
   – Click Submit (image will flash then appear in the editor).  
   – Click Save (or Reply in Discussions).

7. To update an embedded image  
   – Click the image → Image Options → adjust URL, alt text, size, display options → Done → Save.
context:
Document Title: How do I upload and embed an image in the Rich Content Editor

How do I upload and embed an image in the Rich Content Editor? You can embed images in the Rich Content Editor. Image files can be uploaded from your computer or added using a URL. You can also embed images from your course and user files . Several features in Canvas support the Rich Content Editor, including Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes. Notes: You can embed a variety of image file types (e.g. image formats , video formats , audio formats ). Images uploaded from your computer are added to your course files . If you are using Usage Rights, you must set the file usage rights before the file will be accessible to students.  Open Rich Content Editor Upload Image by Drag and Drop You can upload and embed an image by dragging and dropping from a web browser or a file saved to your computer. If you drag and drop an image from a web browser, the source URL for the image populates in the File URL field in the Image Options. Note: You can upload and embed multiple images by dragging and dropping the files from a web browser or saved to your computer. Upload Image by Copy and Paste You can upload and embed an image by copying and pasting it. To copy an image to your clipboard, right-click the image and select Copy. You can paste it by right-clicking into the Rich Text Editor and selecting Paste or using the keyboard shortcut CTRL + V on a PC or Command + V on a Mac. Note: If you copy and paste images from one course to another, they may not appear for students due to course permissions or usage rights. To ensure images are visible and compliant, upload them directly to the destination course instead of copying and pasting. Upload Images from Toolbar To upload an image from the toolbar, click the Image icon . From the drop-down menu, select the Upload Image option . Note: To view the Image icon, you may have to click the Options icon . Upload Images from Menubar Alternatively, you can embed images from the menubar. Click the Insert link . Navigate to view the Image options , then select the Upload Image option . Upload Image from Computer By default, the Image Uploader displays the Computer tab . Click or drag and drop an image file to the image uploader to upload a file from your computer . Notes: Images uploaded from your computer using the image uploader within a group are added to your group files. Images uploaded from your computer are added to your course files . Select File Select the image file  and click the Open button . Learn about supported image file types . View Selected File The uploader displays the image file name  and an image preview . To remove the image, click the Delete icon . Upload Image from URL To upload an image using a URL, click the URL tab . Enter the URL in the File URL field . Manage Usage Rights If required in your course, you may need to select usage right settings for your image. In the Usage Right drop-down menu , select one of the five usage right options: I hold the copyright: original content created by you I have obtained permission to use this file: authorized permission by the author The material is in the public domain: explicitly assigned to public domain, cannot be copyrighted, or is no longer protected by copyright The material is subject to an exception - e.g. fair use, the right to quote, or others under applicable copyright laws: excerpt or summary used for commentary, news reporting, research, or analysis in education The material is licensed under Creative Commons : this option also requires setting a specific Creative Commons license If known, enter the copyright holder information in the Copyright Holder field . Manage Image Attributes To add Alt Text to your image, type an alternative text description or text tags in the Alt Text field . By default, the Alt Text field displays the image file name. Alt text is read by screen readers, and it displays when an embedded image cannot display. If the image is decorative and does not require alt text, click the Decorative Image checkbox . By default, the Embed Image display option is selected for embedded images . To display the image file link, select the Display Text Link display option . The file link|Document Title: How do I upload and embed an image in the Rich Content Editor

Decorative Image checkbox . By default, the Embed Image display option is selected for embedded images . To display the image file link, select the Display Text Link display option . The file link will replace the image in the Rich Content Editor. Embed Image Upload To embed your selected image, click the Submit button. Note: The image will flash before it embeds in the Rich Content Editor. View Embedded Image View your uploaded image in the Rich Content Editor. You can also add alt text tags and manage the image display options . Update Image Options To manage image options from an embedded image file, click the image , then click the Image Options link . You can manage display options for embedded images in the Image Options menu . You can manage the image Alt Text, the image size, and other display options. To replace or update an image added via URL, enter an updated image URL in the File URL field . Click the Done button . Save Changes Click the Save button. Note: When using the Rich Content Editor in Discussions, the Save button may appear as the Reply button. View Content View the content created in the Rich Content Editor.

input: After setting usage rights for an image in Canvas, how do I update its alt text or mark it as decorative, and how do I choose between embedding the image versus using a text link?
expected_output:
1. Open Image Options  
   - Click the embedded image in the Rich Content Editor.  
   - Click the Image Options link that appears.  

2. Update Alt Text or Mark as Decorative  
   - In the Alt Text field, enter your new description.  
   - To mark the image decorative, select the Decorative Image checkbox (this removes alt text).  

3. Choose Embed vs. Text Link  
   - By default, Embed Image is selected—this displays the image inline.  
   - To display a clickable link instead, select Display Text Link.  

4. Apply Changes  
   - Click Done in the Image Options menu.  
   - Click Save (or Submit/Reply in Discussions) to preserve your edits.

Decorative Image checkbox . By default, the Embed Image display option is selected for embedded images . To display the image file link, select the Display Text Link display option . input: How do I use the Canvas Rich Content Editor image icon to insert a user image, change its source or sort order, search and embed it, add alt text, and save?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor in the Canvas feature you’re using.  
2. Click the Image icon (or click Insert → Image) and choose User Images to view your uploaded files.  
3. To change the file source, click the Source dropdown and select a different location.  
4. To sort files, click the Sort by dropdown and choose Date Added or Alphabetical.  
5. To locate a specific file, enter at least three characters in the Search field.  
6. Click the desired image to embed it—inset will flash before appearing.  
7. Click the embedded image to open display options, resize as needed, and add an alt tag for accessibility.  
8. Click Save (or Reply in Discussions) to apply your changes.

input: How do I add alt text to images I upload using the Rich Content Editor in Canvas?
expected_output:
1. In the Rich Content Editor, embed or upload your image.  
2. Click the image to select it (you’ll see a blue outline).  
3. Click the Image Options (gear) icon in the floating toolbar.  
4. In the Image Options panel, locate the Alt Text field.

6. Click Done to close the panel.  
7. Click Save (or Reply in Discussions) to apply your changes.
