input: How can I embed files up to 500MB in Canvas using drag-and-drop, copy-and-paste, the toolbar, or the menu bar?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor in Canvas (e.g., in an Announcement, Page, Assignment, Discussion, or Quiz).  
2. Drag-and-Drop  
   • Locate your media file (≤500 MB) on your computer.  
   • Drag it directly into the editor canvas.  
3. Copy-and-Paste (images only)  
   • Right-click the image and choose Copy.  
   • In the editor, right-click and select Paste or use Ctrl+V (PC) / ⌘+V (Mac).  
4. Toolbar Upload  
   • Click the Media icon (you may first click Options ⋯).  
   • Select “Upload/Record Media.”  
5. Menubar Upload  
   • Click the Insert icon.  
   • Under Media, select “Record/Upload Media.”  
6. In the Media Uploader (Computer tab):  
   • Drag your file in or click to browse and select it.  
   • (Optional) Edit the filename (it becomes alt text) or click Add CC/Subtitles.  
   • Click Submit.  
7. Once embedded, click Save (or Reply in Discussions) to finalize your changes.
context:
Document Title: How do I upload and embed a media file from my computer in the

How do I upload and embed a media file from my computer in the Rich Content Editor? Using the Rich Content Editor, you can upload and embed media files from your computer. Several features in Canvas support the Rich Content Editor, including Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes. Canvas allows you to upload supported media types . Canvas converts files up to 500 MB. If a file exceeds the 500 MB limit, you can host the file through an external source such as YouTube and embed it using the Rich Content Editor. To learn more about available options for using media files in Canvas, view the Canvas Media Comparison PDF . Canvas videos also support caption files. Once you upload a video, learn how to add captions to a video . Notes: Media uploaded in the Rich Content Editor is saved in the Uploaded Media folder in your User Files or Group Files, depending on where it is recorded. If media is uploaded for an assignment submission, the media file is stored in your User Files. If you are using Usage Rights, you must set the file usage rights before the file will be accessible to students. Students cannot view media files uploaded to the Rich Content Editor which have an unpublished restriction setting or are outside of the file's visibility dates. View file restriction settings .  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when using one of the Canvas features which support the Editor. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Upload Image by Drag and Drop You can upload and embed media by dragging and dropping a media file saved to your computer. Note: You can upload and embed multiple media files by dragging and dropping the files saved to your computer Upload Image by Copy and Paste You can upload and embed an image by copying and pasting it. To copy an image to your clipboard, right-click the image and select Copy.  You can paste it by right-clicking into the Rich Text Editor and selecting Paste or using the keyboard shortcut CTRL+V on a PC or Command+V on a Mac. Record Media from Toolbar To upload media from the toolbar, click the Media icon . From the dropdown menu, select the Upload/Record Media option . To view the Media icon, you may have to click the Options icon . Note: If the Media icon does not display in the toolbar, media uploads have been disabled by your institution. Record Media from Menubar Alternatively, you can open the media recorder from the menubar. Click the Insert icon . Navigate to view the Media options , and select the Record/Upload Media option . Upload Media from Computer By default, the Media Uploader displays the Computer tab . To upload a file, click or drag and drop a media file to media uploader to upload a file from your computer . Select File Select the media file  and click the Open button . View Selected File The uploader displays a file preview . The uploader also displays the media file name . To change the file name, type a new file name in the media file name field. The name of the file also acts as the alt text for the media file. To remove the file, click the Delete icon . To add a caption file, click the Add CC/Subtitles checkbox . Submit Media File Upload To upload your selected media file, click the Submit button. Note: The file will flash before it embeds in the Rich Content Editor. View Embedded Media View your uploaded media file in the Rich Content Editor. Save Changes Click the Save button. Note: When using the Rich Content Editor in Discussions, the Save button may appear as the Reply button. View Content View the content created in the Rich Content Editor.

input: How does uploading large videos (over 500 MB) directly to Canvas compare to hosting them externally when it comes to where the files are stored, who can access them, adding captions, and how they appear to students?
expected_output:
1. File storage  
   • Canvas upload (≤500 MB): media files live in your course’s Uploaded Media folder under User Files (or Group Files).  
   • External host (>500 MB): files reside on the external platform (e.g., YouTube, Vimeo), not in Canvas.  

2. Access control  
   • Canvas upload: governed by Canvas file restrictions (publish status, availability dates, usage rights). Students can only view when the course/content is published and within visibility windows.  
   • External host: controlled by the host’s privacy settings (public, unlisted, private). Embedded videos respect both the host’s and Canvas’s access controls.  

3. Adding captions  
   • Canvas upload: you can upload a caption or subtitle file (.vtt, .srt) directly in the Media Uploader (check “Add CC/Subtitles”).  
   • External host: you add captions via the host’s captioning tools (e.g., YouTube’s subtitle upload or auto-caption features).  

4. Student view  
   • Canvas upload: video embeds inline in the Rich Content Editor with Canvas’s native player, captions toggle directly in Canvas.  
   • External host: video embeds via an iframe or LTI tool; students use the host’s player UI (branding, player controls, and caption toggle depend on the external service).

input: How do I open image options, update the file URL, add alt text, and save changes in the Canvas Rich Content Editor?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor in your Canvas feature (e.g., Page, Assignment).  
2. Click the embedded image, then click the Options link.  
3. In the Image Options menu, update the File URL field to point to your new image.  
4. In the Alt Text field, type an alternative description (or check Decorative Image if no alt text is needed).  
5. Click Done to save your changes.
context:
Document Title: How do I manage alt text and display options for images embedded

How do I manage alt text and display options for images embedded in the Rich Content Editor? The Rich Content Editor allows you to add alt text tags to embedded images . You can also manage image display options and resize the image. Alt text is read by screen readers, and it displays when an embedded image cannot display. Several features in Canvas support the Rich Content Editor, including Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes.  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when using one of the Canvas features which support the Editor. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view a window with a list of keyboard navigation shortcuts, click the Keyboard icon or press Alt+F8 (on a PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (on a Mac keyboard) simultaneously on your keyboard. Open Image Options Click the image , then click the Options link . You can manage display options for embedded images in the Image Options menu . Update File URL If an image is added to the Rich Content Editor via URL, the Image Options menu includes the File URL field. The URL can be updated to change the image displayed in the editor. Add Alt Text Enter an alternative text description or text tags in the Alt Text field . By default, the Alt Text field displays the image file name. If the image is decorative and does not require alt text, select the Decorative Image option . Select Display Options By default, the Embed Image display option is selected for embedded images . To display the image file link, select the Display Text Link display option . The file link will replace the image in the Rich Content Editor. Select Image Size Click the Size drop-down menu . You can select a small, medium, large, or extra large image size , or you can select to enter custom dimensions . To customize the size of your image, enter the custom height or width dimension in one of the two dimension fields .  As you enter a value in one field, the other field's value changes in order to retain the image aspect ratio. Note: Custom image size must be at least 10x10px. Manually Adjust Image Size You can also manually adjust the image size in the Rich Content Editor. When you click the image, adjustment handles appear in each corner . Click and drag the handles to adjust the image size . Select Dimension Type If you select a custom image size, you can change the size selecting the Pixels dimension type radio button and changing one of the two dimension type fields . You can also change the custom image size by selecting the Percentage dimension type radio button and changing the percentage field . Save Changes Click the Done button. View Embedded Image View the image embedded in the Rich Content Editor.

input: In Canvas RCE image options, how do I set the image size to 150×150 pixels and display it as a text link?
expected_output:
1. In the Rich Content Editor, click your embedded image and then click Options.  
2. Under Display Options, select Display Text Link.  
3. Click the Size drop-down and choose Custom.  
4. Select the Pixels dimension type, then enter 150 for Width and 150 for Height.  
5. Click Done to save your changes.

input: How do I use drag-and-drop and copy-paste in the Canvas Rich Content Editor? Also, how can I upload or embed content using the toolbar or Insert menu, and how do I manage permissions for those items?
expected_output:
Step-by-Step: Uploading and Embedding Documents in the Rich Content Editor

1. Open the Rich Content Editor  
   – Use any Canvas feature that supports the editor (Announcements, Pages, Discussions, etc.).

2. Place Your Cursor  
   – Click where you want the document link or embed to appear.

3. Drag-and-Drop Upload  
   – Drag one or multiple files from your computer into the editor.  
   – The files automatically upload and embed.

4. Copy-and-Paste Upload  
   – In your file browser, select the file and copy it (CTRL+C on PC or ⌘+C on Mac).  
   – Click in the Rich Content Editor and paste (CTRL+V or ⌘+V).  
   – The file uploads and embeds where you pasted.

5. Upload from the Toolbar  
   – If needed, click the Options (⋯) icon to reveal more tools.  
   – Click the Document icon and choose Upload Document.

6. Upload from the Menubar  
   – Click Insert > Document > Upload Document.

7. Select or Drag Your File  
   – In the media uploader, click “Browse” to choose a file or drag-and-drop into the uploader.  
   – Confirm by clicking Open (or dropping the file).

8. Manage Usage Rights (Instructors Only)  
   – In the Usage Rights drop-down, select one of the five options:  
     • I hold the copyright  
     • I have permission to use the file  
     • Public domain  
     • Exception (e.g., fair use)  
     • Creative Commons (choose specific license)  
   – Optionally enter the Copyright Holder.  
   – Click Submit to finalize upload.

9. Finish and Save  
   – After the file flashes into the editor, click Save (or Reply in Discussions).  
   – Your document link is now embedded, with permissions set per your usage-rights selection.
context:
Document Title: How do I upload a document in the Rich Content Editor

How do I upload a document in the Rich Content Editor? You can upload files from your computer to link in the Rich Content Editor. Several features in Canvas support the Rich Content Editor, including Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes. By default, embedded document links display an icon that allows users to preview the document in the Rich Content Editor. You can disable the in-line preview or open the in-line preview automatically. Notes for Instructors: If you are using Usage Rights, you must set the file usage rights before the file is accessible to students. When a document is uploaded to the Rich Content Editor, the file is saved to the Uploaded Media folder in Course Files and defaults to the same visibility status as the folder.  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when using one of the Canvas features that supports the Editor. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Select Link Location In the Rich Content Editor, place your cursor where you wish to insert the document. Upload Document by Drag and Drop You can upload and embed a document by dragging and dropping the file saved to your computer. Note: You can upload and embed multiple documents by dragging and dropping the files saved to your computer. Upload Document by Copy and Paste You can upload and embed a document by copying and pasting a file located on your computer. To copy a file to your clipboard, open the file location. Right-click the file and select the Copy option or click the file and use the keyboard shortcut CTRL+C on a PC or Command+C on a Mac. Then, paste the file by right-clicking into the Rich Content Editor and selecting the Paste option or using the keyboard shortcut CTRL+V on a PC or Command+V on a Mac. Upload Document from Toolbar To upload a document from the toolbar, click the Document icon . From the drop-down menu, select the Upload Document option . To view the Document icon, you may have to click the Options icon . Upload Document from Menubar Click the Insert link . Navigate to view the Document options , and select the Upload Document option . Note: You can also link to documents you already uploaded to Canvas. Upload File Click to browse your files  or drag and drop a media file to the media uploader  to upload a file from your computer. Select File Select the document file  and click the Open button . View Selected File The uploader displays the document file name . To remove the file, click the Delete icon . Manage Usage Rights If required by your institution, you will need to select usage right settings for your document. In the Usage Right drop-down menu , select one of the five usage right options: I hold the copyright: original content created by you I have obtained permission to use the file: authorized permission by the author The material is in the public domain: explicitly assigned to public domain, cannot be copyrighted, or is no longer protected by copyright The material is subject to an exception - e.g. fair use, the right to quote, or others under applicable copyright laws: excerpt or summary used for commentary, news reporting, research, or analysis in education The material is licensed under Creative Commons: this option also requires setting a specific Creative Commons license If known, enter the copyright holder information in the Copyright Holder field . Note: If you are an instructor and are not sure which usage right applies to your document, please consult your institutional admin for guidance. Submit Upload To upload your selected document, click the Submit button. Note: The file flashes before it embeds into the Rich Content Editor. View Document Link View a link to your uploaded file in the Rich Content Editor . To manage options for the link, click the link title and click the Link Options link . View Link Options You can edit the link text in the Text field  or link URL in the Link field . To disable users from seeing a file preview, select Disable Preview option . You can choose to display a file preview in a pop-up window|Document Title: How do I upload a document in the Rich Content Editor

link text in the Text field  or link URL in the Link field . To disable users from seeing a file preview, select Disable Preview option . You can choose to display a file preview in a pop-up window or in-line preview when the link is clicked. You can also choose to expand an in-line preview by default. To allow users to view a file preview in a pop-up window when the link is clicked, select the Preview in overlay option . To allow users to view an in-line preview when the link is clicked, click the Preview inline option . To expand the in-line preview by default, click the Expand preview by Default checkbox . To save link options, click the Done button . Notes: Inline preview is not supported in the Canvas beta environment. Inline preview does not display in Edit mode. Save Changes Click the Save button. Note: When using the Rich Content Editor in Discussions, the Save button may appear as the Reply button. View Content View the content created in the Rich Content Editor. To preview the file, click the file link . To download the linked document, click the Download icon .

input: How do I disable the inline preview option in the Rich Content Editor’s link settings after I’ve uploaded a file and assigned usage rights in Canvas?
expected_output:
1. In the Rich Content Editor, click the file link you’ve already uploaded.  
2. Click the “Link Options” button that appears.  
3. In the Link Options dialog, select “Disable Preview” (or uncheck “Preview inline”).  
4. Click “Done” to confirm your link settings.  
5. Click “Save” (or “Update/Reply” in Discussions) to apply your changes.

input: How can I use the Rich Content Editor in Canvas to open Google Drive through the Apps/Tools menu, select a file, and attach it to my content?
expected_output:
1. In your Canvas course, open the Rich Content Editor (e.g., in an Assignment, Page, Discussion, etc.).  
2. Click the Tools link in the menubar, choose Apps → View All (or click the App icon in the toolbar—may be under the Options icon).  
3. In the app list, select Google Drive (LTI 1.3).  
4. In the Google Drive dialog, click Select file, browse to your document/slide/sheet, then click Add.  
5. Back in the Rich Content Editor, click the Attach link below the embedded file.  
6. Click Save (or Save & Publish/Submit depending on your Canvas feature) to insert the live Google file.
context:
Document Title: How do I embed a file from Google Drive into the Rich Content

How do I embed a file from Google Drive into the Rich Content Editor? If your course has enabled Google Apps, you can create a document, slide presentation, or spreadsheet using Google Drive and then embed that document anywhere you can use the Rich Content Editor in Canvas. Several features in Canvas support the Rich Content Editor, including Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes. When embedded, Google slide presentations default to presentation mode. In Google, you can embed files. Any time you edit the Google file, the edits also display in Canvas. Note: If you cannot view the Google Drive option in the Rich Content Editor LTI Tools menu, you can still include your file by creating a hyperlink or publishing your Google content to the web and pasting the embed code in the HTML editor .  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when using one of the Canvas features which support the Editor. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Open Apps You can view a list of external tools from the menubar. Click the Tools link . Navigate to the Apps option , then select the View All option . Alternatively, you can view your apps from the toolbar. In the toolbar, click the App icon . Note: To view the App icon, you may have to click the Options icon . View Recently Used Apps If you have previously used an external app from the Rich Content Editor, you can quickly open recently used apps. To view recently used apps, click the App icon . Then select the app you want to open . To view all apps, click the View All link . Open Google Click the Google Drive (LTI 1.3) link . You can also filter menu options using the Search field . Note: If the Google link does not display, the LTI may not be enabled in your course. You can still include your file by creating a hyperlink or publishing your Google content to the web and pasting the embed code in the HTML editor . Select File Click the Select file button. Locate and select the file you want to embed . Click the Add button . Attach File Click the Attach link. View Embedded File View the embedded Google file in the Rich Content Editor. Save Changes Click the Save button. Notes: The assignment, discussion, pages, and quizzes details pages may display a Save & Publish button or a Submit Assignment button. The Syllabus page displays an Update Syllabus button. Discussion replies display a Reply button.

input: How can I add Google Drive to the tools menu in the Rich Content Editor in my Canvas course?
expected_output:
1. Verify Google Apps Is Enabled  
   • If you don’t see Google Drive in the RCE Tools menu, ask your Canvas admin to enable the Google Drive (LTI 1.3) integration at the account or sub‐account level.

2. Add Google Drive to Your Course  
   a. In your course, click Settings (bottom of the course navigation).  
   b. Select the Apps tab.  
   c. Click View App Configurations.  
   d. In the search box, type “Google Drive (LTI 1.3)”.  
   e. When it appears, click + App or Add App.  

3. Confirm Configuration  
   • If prompted, enter any required credentials (Client ID, Public Key, etc.) provided by your institution.  
   • Click Submit (or Done) to finish adding the app.

4. Use Google Drive in the Rich Content Editor  
   a. Open the Rich Content Editor (Announcements, Pages, Assignments, etc.).  
   b. Click the Apps icon (or Tools > Apps > View All).  
   c. Select Google Drive (LTI 1.3) to browse and embed your files.

input: How do I link a OneDrive file in Canvas using the Rich Content Editor? I see options under Tools > Apps > Microsoft Office 365, but I’m not sure how to attach the file and save it. Can you guide me through the steps?
expected_output:
1. In your Canvas course, open any feature that supports the Rich Content Editor (Announcements, Pages, Assignments, Discussions, or Quizzes).  
2. Click the Apps icon (you may need to click the Options icon first) or select Tools > Apps > View All.  
3. In the Apps menu, click Microsoft Office 365.  
4. Browse your OneDrive files, check the box next to the file you want to link, then click Attach File.  
5. Verify the file name appears as a hyperlink in the Rich Content Editor.  
6. Click Save (or Save & Publish, Update Syllabus, or Reply, depending on context) to finalize.  
7. View your page or item to confirm the OneDrive file link is working.

Document Title: How do I create a hyperlink from Microsoft Office 365 in the

How do I create a hyperlink from Microsoft Office 365 in the Rich Content Editor? If your course has enabled Microsoft Office 365, you can create a document, slide presentation, or spreadsheet in your OneDrive and then create a hyperlink to that document anywhere you can use the Rich Content Editor in Canvas. Several features in Canvas support the Rich Content Editor, including Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes. When files are linked in the Rich Content Editor, the link displays the exact name of the file. Please ensure your file names are correct before linking a file. Notes: If you cannot view the Microsoft Office 365 option in the Rich Content Editor LTI Tools menu, you can still include your file by creating a hyperlink or publishing your Microsoft Office 365 content to the web and pasting the embed code in the HTML editor . PDF files added through Microsoft Office 365 that cannot be previewed in Sharepoint are not supported to preview in Canvas. To preview the PDF files, you will need to add them to course files and link to them in the Rich Content Editor.  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when using one of the Canvas features which support the Editor. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Open Apps You can view a list of external tools from the menubar. Click the Tools link . Navigate to the Apps option , then select the View All option . Alternatively, you can view your apps from the toolbar. In the toolbar, click the App icon . Note: To view the App icon, you may have to click the Options icon . View Recently Used Apps If you have previously used an external app from the Rich Content Editor, you can quickly open recently used apps. To view recently used apps, click the App icon . Then select the app you want to open . To view all apps, click the View All link . Open Microsoft Office 365 Click the Microsoft Office 365 link . You can also filter menu options using the Search field . Note: If the Microsoft Office 365 link does not display, the LTI may not be enabled in your course. You can still include your file by creating a hyperlink or publishing your content to the web and pasting the embed code in the HTML editor . Attach File Locate the file you want to link and click the checkbox next to the file name . Click the Attach File button . View File Link View the file link in the Rich Content Editor Save Changes Click the Save button. Notes: The assignment, discussion, pages, and quizzes details pages may display a Save & Publish button. The Syllabus page displays an Update Syllabus button. Discussion replies display a Reply button. View Content View the content.

input: Should I link a PDF using Canvas’s Office 365 integration or by adding HTML code in Course Files to enable inline preview?
expected_output:
Use Course Files and the Rich Content Editor link for inline PDF preview.  
1. Office 365 links don’t support in-Canvas PDF previews (SharePoint-unsupported PDFs won’t display).  
2. Instead, upload your PDF to Course Files.  
3. In the Rich Content Editor, click the Files icon, select your PDF, and Insert Link.  
4. Save your content—students can now preview the PDF inline.

input: How do I insert a YouTube URL or an LTI app video into the Canvas Rich Content Editor, choose small, medium, or large embed size, and save it?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor in your assignment, discussion, page, or quiz.  
2. To insert a YouTube URL:  
   a. Click the Link icon and choose External Link.  
   b. Paste the YouTube video URL in the Link field and click Done.  
3. To embed via the YouTube LTI app:  
   a. Click the Apps icon (or Options → Apps) and select YouTube (or View All → YouTube).  
   b. Search for and select your video, then click Embed.  
4. Choose embed size:  
   a. Click the Embed drop-down next to the Embed button.  
   b. Select hyperlink only, Small, Medium, or Large.  
5. Click Save (or Save & Publish/Update Syllabus/Reply as appropriate) to apply your changes.
context:
Document Title: How do I link to or embed a YouTube video in the Rich Content

How do I link to or embed a YouTube video in the Rich Content Editor? In the Rich Content Editor, you can add YouTube videos by inserting a URL or embedding the video using embed code . Additionally, if your course has enabled YouTube as an external app (LTI tool) , you can embed a YouTube video using the LTI Tool. Notes: YouTube videos added to Canvas may display ads. For more information, visit the YouTube Player for Education FAQs resource document . If the YouTube Content Overlay feature option is enabled at your institution, an overlay message displays in Canvas for YouTube videos not hosted in Canvas Studio. This is to alert viewers that ads may appear. The message displays in the browser before the video plays. Instructure is not associated with these ads; they are managed by YouTube. To block unsuitable ads on YouTube used within your Canvas instance, the owner of your institution's domain can tag your institution's URL for child-directed treatment .  Open Rich Content Editor When using one of the Canvas features such as Discussions and Assignments, open the Rich Content Editor . Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Insert External Link To insert a URL, click the Link icon  and select the External Link option . Note: You can also insert a link using the Insert menu options . Insert URL Enter the video link in the Link field . Then, click the Done button . View Video Link View the video link in the Rich Content Editor. Embed External App If your course has enabled YouTube as an external app (LTI tool) , you can add linked YouTube videos in the Rich Content Editor. Click the Tools link . Then, select the Apps option . If you have previously inserted a YouTube video through the apps, you can select the YouTube app option from the Recently Used list . If the YouTube app is not listed, view all apps by clicking the View All link . You can also add a linked YouTube video by clicking the Apps icon , then selecting the YouTube app link  or the View All link . Note: To view the Apps icon, you may have to click the Options icon . Open YouTube Click the YouTube link . You can also filter menu options using the Search field . Note: If the Google link does not display, the LTI may not be enabled in your course. You can still include your file by creating a hyperlink or publishing your Google content to the web and pasting the embed code in the HTML editor . Search Videos Enter a search term in the Search field . Then, press Return (Mac) or Enter (PC) on your keyboard. To view more information about a search option, click the video name . Embed Video To embed the video in the Rich Content Editor, click the Embed button . To manage the video embed options, click the Embed drop-down menu . You can either embed a video hyperlink  or choose to embed a small, medium, or large version of the video in the Rich Content Editor . View Embedded Video View the embedded video in the Rich Content Editor. Save Changes To apply the changes, click the Save button. Notes: The assignment, discussion, pages, and quizzes details pages display a Save & Publish button. The Syllabus page displays an Update Syllabus button. Discussion replies display a Reply button. View Content To view the embedded video, click the Play icon . To view the linked video in a new browser tab, click the video link . To expand the linked video to view in Canvas, click the Play icon .

input: How can I embed a YouTube video in the Canvas Rich Content Editor using a URL, embed code, or the LTI tool?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor  
   • In any Assignment, Discussion, Page, etc., click the Edit icon to launch the editor.  

2. Embed by URL  
   a. Click the Link icon and choose External Link.  
   b. Paste your YouTube video URL into the Link field.  
   c. Click Done.  

3. Embed by embed code  
   a. Click the HTML Editor (< > icon) at the top right of the Rich Content Editor.  
   b. Paste your YouTube iframe embed code where you want the video to appear.  
   c. Click Rich Content Editor to return to the visual view.  

4. Embed via LTI (YouTube app)  
   a. Click the Apps icon (or Tools > Apps).  
   b. Select YouTube (from Recently Used or View All).  
   c. In the YouTube dialog, search or paste a video URL, then click Embed.  
   d. Optionally choose Small, Medium, or Large from the Embed dropdown.  

5. Save your changes  
   • Click Save (or Save & Publish, Update Syllabus, or Reply, as appropriate).  

6. Verify your video  
   • In the editor, click the Play icon to preview the embedded video or click the link to open it in a new tab.

input: How can I insert a user-uploaded video into a Canvas assignment using the Rich Content Editor? I clicked the Insert → User Media icon, selected my video file, and clicked Save, but it won’t insert.
expected_output:
1. Open the Assignment’s Rich Content Editor  
   • In your course, edit (or create) the assignment, then click the Rich Content Editor to open the toolbar.  

2. Verify the Media toolbar is enabled  
   • If you don’t see the Media icon, click the Options menu (⋯) and ensure “Media” or “User Media” is available.  

3. Insert your video  
   • Click the Media icon or go to Insert → User Media.  
   • In the Add menu, set Source to “User Media.”  
   • (Optional) Use Sort by or the Search field (minimum 3 characters) to locate your video.  
   • Click your video— it will flash to confirm embedding.  

4. Check file visibility and restrictions  
   • In Canvas, go to Files → locate your video → click the three dots → View File Restrictions.  
   • Ensure your video is Published and its availability date range includes today.  
   • Students cannot see media with unpublished or expired visibility settings.  

5. Save and verify  
   • In the Rich Content Editor, click Save (or Reply in Discussions).  
   • Preview the assignment as a Student to confirm the video displays.  

6. Troubleshooting (if it still won’t embed)  
   • Clear your browser cache or try a different browser.  
   • Confirm your institution hasn’t disabled media uploads in the Rich Content Editor.
context:
Document Title: How do I embed media files from Canvas into the Rich Content

How do I embed media files from Canvas into the Rich Content Editor? You can embed media files from your user files in Canvas in the Rich Content Editor. Several features in Canvas support the Rich Content Editor, including Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes. Note: Students cannot view media files uploaded to the Rich Content Editor which have an unpublished restriction setting or are outside of the file's visibility dates. View file restriction settings .  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when using one of the Canvas features which support the Editor. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Upload Media from Toolbar You can embed your media files from the toolbar. Click the Media icon . To view images saved in your Canvas user files, click the User Media option . To view the Media icon, you may have to click the Options icon . Note: If the Media options do not display in the toolbar, media uploads have been disabled by your institution. Upload Media from Menubar Click the Insert link . Navigate to view the Media options , and select the User Media option . Select Media File By default, when embedding a media file in the Rich Content Editor, the Add menu displays media files from your selected source . To change the media file source, click the Source drop-down menu . To sort media files by date added or alphabetically, click the Sort by drop-down menu . To search for a media file, enter the file name in the Search field . You must enter at least three characters for search results to display. Click the media file to embed . Note: The file will flash before it embeds in the Rich Content Editor. View Embedded Media View your embedded media file in the Rich Content Editor. Save Changes Click the Save button. Note: When using the Rich Content Editor in Discussions, the Save button may appear as the Reply button. View Content View the content created in the Rich Content Editor.

input: Which toolbar or menu option in the Rich Content Editor do I use to embed a video from my Canvas user media into a discussion post?
expected_output:
1. In the Rich Content Editor toolbar, click the Media icon (you may need to click the Options icon first).  
2. Choose User Media.  
3. Select your uploaded video.  
4. Click Save (or Reply in Discussions).

input: In Canvas RCE Link Options, how do I disable inline file previews using the “Disable Preview” setting?
expected_output:
1. In the Rich Content Editor, click the linked file text, then click Link Options.  
2. In the Link Options panel, check the Disable Preview box.  
3. Click Done to save the link settings.  
4. Click Save (or Reply in Discussions) to apply your changes.
context:
Document Title: How do I link to a document from Canvas in the Rich Content

How do I link to a document from Canvas in the Rich Content Editor? You can link documents from your user files in Canvas in the Rich Content Editor. Several features in Canvas support the Rich Content Editor, including Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes. By default, linked document links display an icon that allows users to preview the document in the Rich Content Editor. You can disable the in-line preview or open the in-line preview automatically. Note: If you set a file as not visible to students in Course Files and link to that file in the Rich Content Editor, students will be able to view that file using the link in the Rich Content Editor.  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when creating or editing an announcement, assignment, discussion, page, quiz, or syllabus. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Select Link Location To insert a link displaying the name of the file, click to place your cursor in the location in the Rich Content Editor where you want the link to appear . To insert a hyperlink to a course content item, select the text for your hyperlink . Insert Documents from Toolbar Alternatively, you can insert documents from the toolbar. Click the Documents icon . To view your user documents, click the User Documents option . Note: To view the Documents icon, you may have to click the Options icon . Insert Documents from Menubar To insert a document from the menubar, click the Insert link . Navigate to view the Document options , then select the Course Documents option  or User Documents . If you are accessing the Rich Content Editor from a group, the Course Documents is replaced by a Group Documents option. View and Sort Files By default, the Add menu displays all files in your selected file source . To sort the displayed files by image, document, or media file type, click the Type drop-down menu . To sort the displayed files by date added or alphabetically, click the Sort by drop-down menu  . To search for a  document, enter the file name in the Search field . You must enter at least three characters for search results to display. Select File Click the name of the file you want to link in the Rich Content Editor. Note: The text will flash before turning into the hyperlink. View Link View the link displaying the name of the file  or the hyperlinked text . To manage options for the link, click the link title  and click the Link Options link . View Link Options You can edit the link text in the Text field  or link URL in the Link field . To disable users from seeing a file preview, select Disable Preview option . You can choose to display a file preview in a pop-up window or in-line preview when the link is clicked. You can also choose to expand an in-line preview by default. To allow users to view a file preview in a pop-up window when the link is clicked, select the Preview in overlay option . To allow users to view an in-line preview when the link is clicked, click the Preview inline option . To expand the in-line preview by default, click the Expand preview by Default checkbox . To save link options, click the Done button . Notes: Inline preview is not supported in the Canvas beta environment. Inline preview is not supported in Edit mode. Save Changes Click the Save button. Note: When using the Rich Content Editor in Discussions, the Save button may appear as the Reply button. View Content View the content. To preview the file, click the file link . Links to external URLs display an Open icon . To download the linked file, click the Download icon .

input: Which dropdown menu in the Rich Content Editor toolbar contains the Documents icon for inserting files?
expected_output:
1. In the Rich Content Editor toolbar, click the Options icon (the three-dots “…” overflow menu).  
2. From that dropdown, select the Documents icon to browse and insert files from your Course or User Documents.

How do I link to a document from Canvas in the Rich Content Editor? You can link documents from your user files in Canvas in the Rich Content Editor. Several features in Canvas support the Rich Content Editor, including Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes. By default, linked document links display an icon that allows users to preview the document in the Rich Content Editor. You can disable the in-line preview or open the in-line preview automatically. Note: If you set a file as not visible to students in Course Files and link to that file in the Rich Content Editor, students will be able to view that file using the link in the Rich Content Editor.  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when creating or editing an announcement, assignment, discussion, page, quiz, or syllabus. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Select Link Location To insert a link displaying the name of the file, click to place your cursor in the location in the Rich Content Editor where you want the link to appear . To insert a hyperlink to a course content item, select the text for your hyperlink . Insert Documents from Toolbar Alternatively, you can insert documents from the toolbar. Click the Documents icon . To view your user documents, click the User Documents option . Note: To view the Documents icon, you may have to click the Options icon . Insert Documents from Menubar To insert a document from the menubar, click the Insert link . Navigate to view the Document options , then select the Course Documents option  or User Documents . If you are accessing the Rich Content Editor from a group, the Course Documents is replaced by a Group Documents option. View and Sort Files By default, the Add menu displays all files in your selected file source . To sort the displayed files by image, document, or media file type, click the Type drop-down menu . To sort the displayed files by date added or alphabetically, click the Sort by drop-down menu  . To search for a  document, enter the file name in the Search field . You must enter at least three characters for search results to display. Select File Click the name of the file you want to link in the Rich Content Editor. Note: The text will flash before turning into the hyperlink. View Link View the link displaying the name of the file  or the hyperlinked text . To manage options for the link, click the link title  and click the Link Options link . View Link Options You can edit the link text in the Text field  or link URL in the Link field . To disable users from seeing a file preview, select Disable Preview option . You can choose to display a file preview in a pop-up window or in-line preview when the link is clicked. You can also choose to expand an in-line preview by default. To allow users to view a file preview in a pop-up window when the link is clicked, select the Preview in overlay option . To allow users to view an in-line preview when the link is clicked, click the Preview inline option . To expand the in-line preview by default, click the Expand preview by Default checkbox . To save link options, click the Done button . Notes: Inline preview is not supported in the Canvas beta environment. Inline preview is not supported in Edit mode. Save Changes Click the Save button. Note: When using the Rich Content Editor in Discussions, the Save button may appear as the Reply button. View Content View the content. To preview the file, click the file link . Links to external URLs display an Open icon . To download the linked file, click the Download icon .

input: How do I open the equation editor in the Canvas Rich Content Editor using the toolbar icon or the Insert menu?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor in your Announcement, Assignment, Discussion, Page, Quiz, or Syllabus.  
2. In the editor toolbar, click the Insert Math Equation icon (√).  
   - If you don’t see the icon, click the Options (•••) icon to reveal it.  
3. Or click the Insert menu in the menubar and select Equation.  
4. The Equation Editor will open, ready for you to build or type your LaTeX expression.
context:
Document Title: How do I use the math Equation Editor in the Rich Content Editor

How do I use the math Equation Editor in the Rich Content Editor? Canvas has an integrated tool for math and science formulas based on LaTeX, the industry standard for academic publication. The LaTeX Equation Editor is built into the Rich Content Editor . Several features in Canvas support the Rich Content Editor, including Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, Quizzes, and Syllabus. You can use the Equation Editor for introductory math courses or for more advanced mathematics for higher-level math courses. To enter mathematical or chemical expressions, you can use the Equation Editor toolbar buttons, or you can enter LaTeX code directly. For more help using LaTeX, view the following resource documents: Canvas Equation Editor Tips: Math Expressions Using LaTeX Canvas Equation Editor Tips: Chemistry Using LaTeX Notes: To have characters #, $, &, ^, and _ appear in the Rich Content Editor when your equation is inserted, you must type a backslash (\) before the character. The ~ character can be inserted by typing \~~. Equation images are stored as absolute (full website) URLs which may affect course copies.  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when creating or editing an announcement, assignment, discussion, page, quiz, or syllabus. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Open Equation Editor To open the Math Editor, click the Insert Math Equation icon . You can also open the Math Editor from the Rich Content Editor menubar. Click the Insert link , then select the Equation option . Note: To view the Insert Math Equation icon, you may need to click the Options icon . View Equation Editor The Equation Editor provides a toolbar for inserting various operators and symbols . You can enter expressions in the equation field . You can view and edit or hide the LaTeX code behind an expression by clicking the Directly Edit LaTeX toggle . View Toolbar Tabs By default, the toolbar displays the Basic tab. To access other operators and symbols, click any of the following tabs: Greek , Operators , Relationships , Arrows , Delimiters , and Misc . Create Math Expression To enter expressions, press keys on your keyboard, click the toolbar buttons, or enter LaTeX code in the equation field. Note: To position the cursor in the correct spot as you enter an expression, you can press the arrow keys on your keyboard. Fill Math Toolbar Placeholders When you click a Math Editor toolbar button , placeholders may display . To fill in a placeholder, click it and enter a value from your keyboard or click a toolbar button. The value overwrites the placeholder . Enter LaTeX Code If you know the LaTeX code of an expression you want to enter, paste it or type it in the equation field. The code is automatically rendered. For example, if you enter \left(-\infty,4\right], the rendered code automatically displays. View LaTeX Code To view or edit the LaTeX code, click the Directly Edit LaTeX toggle on . The LaTeX code displays in the equation field . Edit the code as needed. As you edit, the LaTeX rendering updates automatically . Note: You can learn more about using LaTeX code for advanced math or for chemistry and scientific notation . Insert Expression To add your mathematical expression to the Rich Content Editor, click the Done button. Format You can add text around your math expressions and insert additional math equations. Format them using the options in the Rich Content Editor . Save Changes To save any changes made in the Rich Content Editor, click the Save button. Notes: The assignment, discussion, pages, and quizzes details pages display a Save & Publish button. The Syllabus page displays an Update Syllabus button. Discussion and announcement replies display a Post Reply or Reply button. Edit or Resize Equation To resize or edit a math expression, click it to view the edit controls. Then, to resize the expression, hover the cursor over a resize handle , click, and drag to a new size. To open the Equation Editor and make edits, click the Edit Equation link .

input: How can I show the Insert Math Equation icon in Canvas LMS’s Rich Content Editor using the Options menu or the Insert menu?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor in your announcement, assignment, discussion, page, quiz, or syllabus.  
2. If you don’t see the Insert Math Equation icon (∑) on the toolbar, click the Options icon (three dots) to expand the toolbar and reveal it.  
3. Click the Insert Math Equation icon to open the Equation Editor.  
—or—  
1. In the Rich Content Editor menubar, click Insert.  
2. Select Equation from the dropdown to open the Math Equation Editor.

input: How can I use the media recording feature in the Canvas Rich Content Editor? Specifically, which browsers are supported, how do I access it via the icon or the Insert menu, and how do I record with my microphone and camera, save the recording, manage its storage, and add captions?
expected_output:
Step-by-Step: Recording Media in the Canvas Rich Content Editor

1.  Verify your browser  
    •  Use Chrome or Firefox (Safari does NOT support recording).

2.  Open the Rich Content Editor  
    •  In Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, or Quizzes, click Edit (or Reply).

3.  Access the media recorder  
    a.  Toolbar: click the Media icon  then Upload/Record Media  
    b.  Menubar: click Insert  > Media  > Upload/Record Media  
    (If you don’t see the Media icon, first click the Options icon.)

4.  Launch the recorder  
    •  In the dialog, select the Record tab.

5.  Select your inputs  
    •  Microphone: click Mic  and choose your device  
    •  Webcam: click Webcam  (or choose No Video to record audio only)

6.  Record your media  
    •  Click Start Recording  
    •  To restart: click Start Over  
    •  To end: click Finish

7.  Preview and save  
    •  Watch your clip in the preview window  
    •  Enter a File Name  
    •  Click Save Media to embed it in the editor

8.  Save your content  
    •  Click Save (or Reply in Discussions) to finalize  
    •  Your file is stored in Uploaded Media under User Files (or Group Files). Assignment submissions always go to your User Files.  
    •  If a file is unpublished or outside its visibility dates, students cannot see it—check file restriction settings.

9.  Add captions  
    •  After saving, open the video in Canvas and follow “Add Captions to a Video” to upload your caption file.

Tips  
•  Keep recordings under 15 minutes or use an external tool to avoid long render times or interruptions.
context:
Document Title: How do I record media using the Rich Content Editor

How do I record media using the Rich Content Editor? You can use the Rich Content Editor to record video and audio media. You can record media for any length of time, but shorter media recordings are recommended. If your media is longer than 15 minutes, you may want to consider recording and uploading using an external provider. Longer media recordings require more time to render and may be interrupted without a stable internet connection. Several features in Canvas support the Rich Content Editor, including Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes. Canvas videos also support caption files. Once you record and save your video, learn how to add captions to a video . Notes: The Safari browser does not support recording media. Please use Chrome or Firefox to record media from the Rich Content Editor. Media recorded in the Rich Content Editor is saved in the Uploaded Media folder in your User Files or Group Files , depending on where it is recorded. If media is recorded for an assignment submission, the media file is stored in your User Files. By default, recorded media files added to the Rich Content Editor are visible to students within the announcement, assignment, discussion, page, quiz, or syllabus. However, if recorded file's restriction settings were changed to unpublished or are outside of the file's visibility dates, student will not be able to view the file. View file restriction settings .  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when using one of the Canvas features that support the Editor. Several features in Canvas support the Rich Content Editor, including Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Record Media from Toolbar To upload media from the toolbar, click the Media icon . From the drop-down menu, select the Upload/Record Media option . To view the Media icon, you may have to click the Options icon . Note: If the Media icon does not display in the toolbar, media uploads have been disabled by your institution. Record Media from Menubar Click the Insert link . Navigate to view the Media options , and select the Upload/Record Media option . Open Media Recording Tool Click the Record tab. Select Mic and Webcam Options The media recorder connects to your computer's default microphone and web cam. To change your microphone settings, click the Mic button . Then select from the displayed options . To change your webcam settings, click the Webcam button . To disable video recording, select the No Video option . Record Media Click the Start Recording button. Finish Media Recording The media recorder displays the length of your current recording . To restart your recording, click the Start Over button . To finish your recording, click the Finish button . Preview Recorded Media Preview your recorded media in the media recorder . To title your media, type in the File Name field . To embed your media in the Rich Content Editor, click the Save Media button . View Embedded Media View your uploaded media file in the Rich Content Editor. Save Changes Click the Save button. Note: When using the Rich Content Editor in Discussions, the Save button may appear as the Reply button. View Content View the content created in the Rich Content Editor.

input: How do I reveal the Media icon under the Options dropdown in the Canvas Rich Content Editor toolbar when creating announcements?
expected_output:
1. In the Rich Content Editor toolbar, click the Options icon (three dots).  
2. Look for the Media icon (film strip) in the expanded toolbar.  
3. If the Media icon still doesn’t appear, media upload/recording has been disabled at the account or course level.  
4. Contact your Canvas administrator and ask them to enable “Upload/Record Media” in the Rich Content Editor settings or via the Feature Options for your course.  
5. Once enabled, refresh the page in Chrome or Firefox and repeat steps 1–2.

input: How can I add captions to my videos in Canvas? What tools can I use to generate SRT or VTT files, what steps do I need to follow to upload them in the Rich Content Editor, and are there any format compatibility tips for iOS users?
expected_output:
1. Prepare your caption file  
   - Use an external tool (for example, Amara or YouTube) to create an .SRT or .VTT file.  
   - Check with your institution or administrator about approved tools to ensure copyright and data‐privacy compliance.  

2. Open the Rich Content Editor  
   - Go to any feature that supports it (Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, or Quizzes).  
   - Record a new video or upload an existing one.  

3. Open Video Options  
   - Click the video thumbnail in the editor.  
   - Click the Video Options link that appears.  

4. Specify language and attach the caption file  
   - In the Closed Captions/Subtitles drop-down menu, choose your caption language.  
   - Click Choose caption file, select your .SRT or .VTT file, then click Open.  
   - To add more captions (e.g., for other languages), click Add and repeat.  

5. Finalize and save  
   - Click Done to close the Video Options pane.  
   - Click Save (or Save & Publish / Update Syllabus / Reply, depending on the page).  

6. iOS compatibility tip  
   - If you want captions visible in the Canvas iOS app, upload your captions in WebVTT (.vtt) format, as iOS devices do not display .srt captions.
context:
Document Title: How do I add captions to new or uploaded videos in the Rich

How do I add captions to new or uploaded videos in the Rich Content Editor in Canvas? You can easily create and upload caption files when you record a new video or upload an existing video in Canvas using the Rich Content Editor. The Rich Content Editor is used in features that support the editor (Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes). You can create a SRT or WebVTT caption file using an external captioning tool such as Amara or YouTube . However, it is important to consult with your administrator on the appropriate use of these cloud services or check with your institution/organization for alternative solutions, such as downloadable software, to ensure compliance with copyright policies and protect sensitive or proprietary content. Note: Users can view video captions in the Canvas apps. However, iOS devices can only display captions in WebVTT format. If you use another format besides WebVTT, users on iOS devices will not be able to display the video captions.  Open Video Options Click your newly recorded media or uploaded media . Then click the Video Options link . Select Language and File To specify the language for your captions, click the Closed Captions/Subtitles drop-down menu . To attach your caption file, click the Choose caption file button . You can upload SRT or VTT files. Open File Select your caption file , then click the Open button . View Selected File View your caption file . To attach additional caption files, click the Add button . When finished adding media and caption files, click the Done button . Note: If the video has been copied from another course and includes captions, a tooltip displays noting that inherited captions cannot be edited . Save Changes Click the Save button. Notes: The assignment, discussion, pages, and quizzes details pages display a Save & Publish button. The Syllabus page displays an Update Syllabus button. Discussion replies display a Reply button. View Media with Captions View captions . Note: Videos that are embedded as extra large size or larger with captions display a Captions icon.

input: Can you outline the workflow for adding captions to a video in Canvas? Specifically, how do I open Video Options, set the caption language, upload a WebVTT file, and save the captions?
expected_output:
1. Open Video Options  
   - In the Rich Content Editor, click your newly recorded or uploaded video.  
   - Click the Video Options link.  

2. Set Caption Language  
   - In the Closed Captions/Subtitles dropdown, choose your desired language.  

3. Upload Your WebVTT File  
   - Click Choose caption file.  
   - Select your . vtt file and click Open.  

4. (Optional) Add More Captions  
   - To include additional languages or files, click Add and repeat the upload steps.  

5. Finalize and Save  
   - Click Done to close Video Options.  
   - In the page toolbar, click Save (or Save & Publish / Update Syllabus / Reply, depending on where you’re editing) to apply your captions.
context:

input: How do I use the Canvas Rich Content Editor video settings menu to enable closed captions and select a language?
expected_output:
1. In the Rich Content Editor, locate the embedded video you want to caption.  
2. Click the video’s Settings (gear) icon.  
3. From the menu, select Captions.  
4. In the Captions panel, click the language you’d like to view.  
5. Start playback—the closed captions will display as the video plays.
context:
Document Title: How do I view captions in a video in the Rich Content Editor

How do I view captions in a video in the Rich Content Editor? Some videos within Canvas may contain closed captioning. You can enable captions in the video options menu. Note : If you view a video in a Canvas app, iOS devices can display captions created with WebVTT files. If you cannot view video captions in an iOS device, the caption type is not supported.  View Embedded Video Embedded videos display directly in Canvas. Note: Videos that are embedded as extra large size or larger with captions display a Captions icon. Select Caption Language To view the video captions, click the Settings icon  then select the Captions link . To view captions in an offered language, click the language name . View Captions When closed captioning is enabled, you can view the captions as the video plays.

input: How do I enable and switch captions for embedded videos in Canvas on my iPhone?
expected_output:
1. Open the Canvas Student app on your iPhone.  
2. Navigate to the course page containing the embedded video.  
3. Tap the video to begin playback.  
4. Tap the video again to reveal the controls, then tap the Settings (gear) icon.  
5. Tap Captions.  
6. Select your preferred caption language from the list.  
7. Captions will display as the video plays.  
  
Note: iOS devices in the Canvas app only support WebVTT‐based captions. If captions don’t appear, the video’s caption file type isn’t supported on iOS.
context:
Document Title: How do I view captions in a video in the Rich Content Editor

How do I view captions in a video in the Rich Content Editor? Some videos within Canvas may contain closed captioning. You can enable captions in the video options menu. View Embedded Video Embedded videos display directly in Canvas. Note: Videos that are embedded as extra large size or larger with captions display a Captions icon. Select Caption Language To view the video captions, click the Settings icon  then select the Captions link . To view captions in an offered language, click the language name . View Captions When closed captioning is enabled, you can view the captions as the video plays.

input: How do I resize an embedded video using the Size dropdown in the Canvas Rich Content Editor’s Video Options?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor in your announcement, assignment, discussion, page, quiz, or syllabus.  
2. Click the video you’ve already embedded.  
3. Click the Video Options button (a gear icon) in the toolbar.  
4. Click the Size drop-down.  
5. Select the desired preset size (e.g., Small, Medium, Large) or enter custom dimensions if available.  
6. Click Done to save your changes.
context:
Document Title: How do I manage video options in the Rich Content Editor

How do I manage video options in the Rich Content Editor? You can manage video options for videos previously uploaded in the Rich Content Editor. The Rich Content Editor is used in features that support the editor (Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes). This lesson only applies to videos created in or uploaded into Canvas. If you have not yet created or uploaded your video, learn how to record a new video or upload an existing video .  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when creating or editing an announcement, assignment, discussion, page, quiz, or syllabus. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Open Video Options To manage video options for a video previously uploaded in the Rich Content Editor, select the video , then click the Video Options button . Note: The Video Options button will not display for videos embedded from other websites. Manage Video Options To edit the video title, use the Title field . By default, videos created or uploaded using the Rich Content Editor will display as an embedded video . To display as a text link that will open in a new tab when clicked, select the Display Text Link option . To manage an embedded video's size, select the Size drop-down . Any closed caption or subtitle files that have been added will display in the Closed Captions/Subtitles section . To remove a closed caption or subtitle file, click the Delete icon . To add a closed caption or subtitle file , click the Add icon . Notes: SRT and VTT caption files are supported in the Rich Content Editor. Users can view video captions in the Canvas apps. However, iOS devices can only display captions in WebVTT format. If you use another format besides WebVTT, users on iOS devices will not be able to display the video captions. Save Video Options To save your changes, click the Done button.

input: Do I need to click Done after adjusting the video title, size, link display, and adding WebVTT captions in the Canvas Rich Content Editor?
expected_output: Yes. After you adjust the video title, size, display type, or add WebVTT captions in the Video Options pane, you must click Done to save your changes.
context:
Document Title: How do I manage video options in the Rich Content Editor

How do I manage video options in the Rich Content Editor? You can manage video options for videos previously uploaded in the Rich Content Editor. The Rich Content Editor is used in features that support the editor (Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes). This lesson only applies to videos created in or uploaded into Canvas. If you have not yet created or uploaded your video, learn how to record a new video or upload an existing video .  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when creating or editing an announcement, assignment, discussion, page, quiz, or syllabus. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Open Video Options To manage video options for a video previously uploaded in the Rich Content Editor, select the video , then click the Video Options button . Note: The Video Options button will not display for videos embedded from other websites. Manage Video Options To edit the video title, use the Title field . By default, videos created or uploaded using the Rich Content Editor will display as an embedded video . To display as a text link that will open in a new tab when clicked, select the Display Text Link option . To manage an embedded video's size, select the Size drop-down . Any closed caption or subtitle files that have been added will display in the Closed Captions/Subtitles section . To remove a closed caption or subtitle file, click the Delete icon . To add a closed caption or subtitle file , click the Add icon . Notes: SRT and VTT caption files are supported in the Rich Content Editor. Users can view video captions in the Canvas apps. However, iOS devices can only display captions in WebVTT format. If you use another format besides WebVTT, users on iOS devices will not be able to display the video captions. Save Video Options To save your changes, click the Done button.

input: What steps should I follow in Canvas LMS’s Rich Content Editor to open the editor, place the cursor for an embed, access the Apps menu, and insert app content?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor  
   – In your course, create or edit an Announcement, Assignment, Discussion, Page, or Quiz.  

2. Place your cursor  
   – Click in the editor where you want the external app content to appear.  

3. Open the Apps menu  
   – From the editor menubar, click Tools > Apps > View All.  
   – Or from the toolbar, click the App icon (if hidden, first click the Options icon).  

4. Select your app  
   – Type the app name in the Search field or scroll the list.  
   – Click the app name to launch it (click View description for details).  

5. Insert app content  
   – Use the app’s interface to find and choose the content you want.  
   – Confirm or Insert to embed or link the selected content in your editor.
context:
Document Title: How do I select content from an external app in the Rich Content

How do I select content from an external app in the Rich Content Editor? You can use the Rich Content Editor to embed content and links from external apps that have been set up in your course. Several features in Canvas support the Rich Content Editor, including Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes. Embedding and linking options vary depending on the app you're using. For specific instructions for embedding and linking to external app content, please refer to the app vendor's user guides.  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor when creating or editing an announcement, assignment submission, discussion, page, or quiz response. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Select Embed Location To embed app content in the Rich Content Editor, click to place your cursor in the location in the Rich Content Editor where you want the app content to appear. Open Apps You can view a list of external tools from the menubar. Click the Tools link . Navigate to the Apps option , then select the View All option . Alternatively, you can view your apps from the toolbar. In the toolbar, click the App icon . Note: To view the App icon, you may have to click the Options icon . View Recently Used Apps If you have previously used an external app from the Rich Content Editor, you can quickly open recently used apps. To view recently used apps, click the App icon . Then select the app you want to open . To view all apps, click the View All link . Select App To find an app, type the app name in the Search field . Search results display as you type. To select an app, click the app name . To read a brief explanation of the app, click the View description link . Select App Content Use the app to search for and select content to link to or embed. External app settings and options may vary by app. View Embedded App You can view and interact with the embedded app content or app link depending on your embed or link settings. View Content View your content. You can interact with embedded app content directly in Canvas depending on external app settings.

input: How do I open the Rich Content Editor in Canvas LMS, place my cursor where I want it, and access external apps?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor  
   - While creating or editing an Announcement, Assignment, Discussion, Page, or Quiz, click the Rich Content Editor field.

2. Place your cursor  
   - Click in the editor where you want your external app content to appear.

3. Access external apps  
   a. From the menubar:  
      - Click Tools → Apps → View All  
   b. From the toolbar:  
      - Click the App icon (if hidden, click Options first)

4. Select an app  
   - In the View All window, type the app name in Search or scroll the list, then click the app to launch it.

input: How do I embed external media in the Canvas Rich Content Editor? Should I use the Embed icon or the Insert menu, and what steps do I follow to paste the embed code and save it?
expected_output:
1. Open the Rich Content Editor  
   • In any Canvas area that supports it (Announcements, Pages, Assignments, Discussions, Quizzes).  

2. Open the Embed tool  
   • Toolbar: click the Embed icon (or click the Options icon if Embed isn’t visible).  
   • Menubar (keyboard-friendly): click Insert → Embed.  

3. Paste your embed code  
   • In the Embed Code field, paste your HTML/iframe snippet.  
   • Click Submit.  

4. Preview your media  
   • Confirm the video or audio appears correctly in the editor.  

5. Save your changes  
   • Click Save (or Reply in Discussions) to finalize embedding.
context:
Document Title: How do I embed media from an external source in the Rich Content

How do I embed media from an external source in the Rich Content Editor? You can use the Rich Content Editor to embed video and audio media from external resources. It is your responsibility to ensure your content is secure before you embed it in Canvas. Several Canvas features support the Rich Content Editor, including Announcements, Assignments, Discussions, Pages, and Quizzes. Notes: YouTube videos added to Canvas may display ads. For more information, visit the YouTube Player for Education FAQs resource document . If the YouTube Content Overlay feature option is enabled at your institution, an overlay message displays in Canvas for YouTube videos not hosted in Canvas Studio. This is to alert viewers that ads may appear. The message displays in the browser before the video plays. Instructure is not associated with these ads; they are managed by YouTube. To block unsuitable ads on YouTube used within your Canvas instance, the owner of your institution's domain can tag your institution's URL for child-directed treatment .  Open Rich Content Editor Open the Rich Content Editor using one of the Canvas features which support the Editor. Note: The Rich Content Editor supports keyboard shortcuts. To view the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, click the Keyboard icon or press ALT+F8 (PC keyboard) or Option+F8 (Mac keyboard). Open Embed Tool from Toolbar To embed media from the toolbar, click the Embed icon . If the icon is not visible, click the Options icon . Open Embed Tool from Menubar You can also embed media using the menubar in the Rich Content Editor. The menubar displays the title of Rich Content Editor tools and may be preferable for those using keyboard navigation. To embed media using the menubar, click the Insert menu and select the Embed option . Embed Media Paste the code in the Embed Code field . Then, click the Submit button . Preview Embedded Media Preview your embedded media in the Rich Content Editor. Save Changes Click the Save button. Note: When using the Rich Content Editor in Discussions, the Save button may appear as the Reply button. View Content View the content created in the Rich Content Editor.

input: How can I use the Rich Content Editor toolbar – specifically the Insert menu – to paste YouTube embed code into Announcements?
expected_output:
1. In your course, go to Announcements and click + Announcement (or edit an existing announcement).  
2. In the Rich Content Editor, click the Insert menu on the menubar.  
3. Select Embed from the drop-down.  
4. In the Embed Code field, paste your YouTube embed code.  
5. Click Submit to insert the media.  
6. Preview the embedded video in the editor, then click Save (or Post Announcement) to publish.
